job_title: Junior Data Business Analyst | Commodities and Global Markets
job_description: We are a dynamic change team who works collaboratively within the team and with our stakeholders to implement the global data strategy of Macquarie’s markets business.  At Macquarie, we are working to create lasting value for our communities, our clients and our people. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 54 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drive outcomes.  What role will you play?  You will support the implementation of the global data strategy across various financial products and platforms and work closely with business and technical stakeholders to identify and document data requirements. You will collaborate with business users to specify business rules to manage data quality and resolve issues according to agreed principles and governance frameworks.  What you offer  At least 2 years experience in the financial services industry or a role involving data management An interest in data and its use across the organisation Excellent analytical capacity supported by clear and concise written and verbal communication skills Focus on high quality and timely delivery, with the ability to manage multiple parallel tasks and deliverables Ability to work collaboratively within and across teams. Thrive in an environment with evolving priorities and changing needs of the business.  We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.  Benefits  Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria and location, include:  Hybrid and flexible working arrangements Wellbeing and service bonus leave Up to 20 weeks paid parental leave as well as benefits to support you as you transition to life as a working parent Paid volunteer leave and donation matching Range of benefits to support your physical, psychological and financial wellbeing  About Commodities and Global Markets  In Commodities and Global Markets you will be part of a global business offering capital and financing, risk management, market access, physical execution and logistics solutions to its diverse client base.  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion  The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.   About Macquarie A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future. Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.  Job no: CGM-975172 Work type: Permanent - Full time Location: Sydney Category: Mid-level, Junior, Data & Analytics Group: Commodities and Global Markets Division: Central Recruiter: Badrul Alam Opening Date: 09/11/2023Show moreReport

Data Governance Experience: Understanding data governance principles. Relevant Certifications: CAP or CDMP certifications. Deep Financial Industry Knowledge. Strong Problem-Solving Skills. Advanced Degree in Data Science, Economics, or Finance. Familiarity with Hamilton Lane private markets administrative tools and Data platform. ***this will be a 6month contract with the option to extend and has a daily rate of $300-$450pd incl sup and aligned to the level of experience***Show moreReport

Exciting time to join a top 100 ASX listed business with big goals Hybrid working arrangement, mix of working from home and the office Awesome company culture and benefits This opportunity The Data & Reporting Analyst role is a critical role in the Customer Lifecycle Management team for delivering data analytics and comprehensive reporting services. As a Data & Reporting Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, building and maintaining reports, analysing data, and providing insights to improve customer lifecycle management, achieve commercial targets and identify growth opportunities, while strengthening customer relationship and growing lifetime value. You will work closely with the Product Owners and Campaign Managers to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and ensure they are tracked and reported accurately. You will have strong Power BI and analytical skills and who is adept in pulling together and consolidating information from various sources to develop fit-for-purpose reporting solutions with a strong focus on data accuracy and storytelling. Responsibilities Extract and integrate data from a range of sources and maintain, update and enhance a range of established to meet the business needs Examine and evaluate the purpose and content of existing reports to improve existing or developing new robust dashboards and visualisation that support self-serve and provide insights that are relevant, timely and accurate Develop and maintain tailored data models for input data/metrics through Dataset relationship mapping Support key projects including process and workflow simplification, reporting automation Collaborate with internal stakeholders to align reporting to ensue consistency of metrics reported across broader functional teams Knowledge and experience Strong reporting, modelling, and scenario analysis Proven experience in developing, delivering and maintaining business intelligence reports and dashboards Advanced Power BI experience (Power BI Certificate is a bonus) Working knowledge of campaign systems such as SAS is highly regarded Competency working in a SQL-based environment and data platform such as Teradata, AWS (or similar) cloud-based data platform Proficiency in Microsoft Excel – pivot tables, index and lookup functionality, data ranging Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving skills Highly developed written and communication skills with the ability to present information visually via the use of charts, maps, scorecards and interactive dashboards Self-motivated to work independently and deliver your best work in a fast-paced environment Bolder and better together! We’re all about enabling every individual to be their authentic selves and creating a place where everybody belongs. Highly developed communication skills, both written and verbal and the ability to effectively communicate with Sydney Water personnel at all levels. Demonstrated self-motivation and willingness to accept challenges and deliver assigned projects as part of a team or as an individual. Proven experience with Data Visualisation tools such as Power BI Demonstrated experience in manipulating and cleaning large datasets Ability to translate data into meaningful stories and reports to help drive business process improvements. Knowledge of Water and Waste-water networks and / or managing service faults is highly desirable. Nurture. Grow. Thrive. Accepting a role with Elders means you will be joining a team ready to support and grow your career. Be part of a culture that has been in the making for more than 180 years, a culture so strong it is almost tangible. Much like the farmers and communities we work with, you will experience, passion, dedication and resilience across all parts of the business. With such an iconic, essential business in the Australian landscape we are confident that you too will be proud to grow your career at Elders and wear the pink shirt. About the role We are looking for a Supply Chain Data Analyst to join the growing team on a permanent, full-time basis with location flexible for the right candidate. As a Supply Chain Data Analyst, you will harness your expertise in reporting and analytics (using PowerBI) to establish high calibre and meaningful insights for the Supply Chain function at Elders. This is an exciting opportunity to make a real impact in the way Elders operates, enabling the Rural Products business to make key, data driven insights. In return you will have the backing of a longstanding, Australian company genuinely invested in your growth and development. Responsibilities  Establishing and driving Supply & Demand process development Preparing and leading the implementation of D365 Demand planning process Overall reporting and business analysis to drive smart business decisions Using data to support recommendations for optimizing current processes in the supply chain Interacting with sales, marketing, and finance to understand demand forecast drivers; Providing input to the Supply Planning function in developing inventory strategies on existing items, new products, and product phase-outs; About you  Strong Microsoft Power BI skills and experience Experience with Microsoft SQL Server 2012 (or later) SSRS, RDBMS and/or Azure Data Lake Experience in a demand planning/forecasting role, preferably in a retail or agricultural inputs environment. Experience/knowledge of Microsoft D365 Solid understanding of inventory management practices and procedures. Strong mathematical and statistical knowledge. Capability to multitask in a fast-paced environment. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Agricultural or related industry experience (desirable) About Elders Elders is proud to be the last Australian-listed major agribusiness. The most trusted agribusiness brand in Australia. We’re part of the landscape, part of the local communities, part of Australia’s history and we are entrenched in Australian agriculture. The brand is more than a company, more than a logo - it’s part of Australia. And, with an authentic drive to create a sustainable future for farming and the farmers of Australia, Elders is... for Australian agriculture. We are now looking for the next generation to be part of something big and drive the future of Elders. If you are ready to grow your career with Elders, please today. For more information call Matthew Sargent on 0419 881 432 or visit our careers page. Please note, applications may be shortlisted as they are received.  At Elders, we strive to create a safe environment where everyone can thrive. We aspire to do this by recognising talent, promoting inclusion and celebrating diversity. A new adventure awaits…  At Zurich we’re on a journey, even though we are 100 years young in ANZ, we are lighting the way to a brighter future. A brighter future for you – focused on your career, your wellbeing and your community – as well as our customers and the planet.  Zurich’s General Insurance business in Australia & New Zealand works with companies of all sizes and across all segments SME, Mid-Market and Corporate to provide coverage such as Business Insurance, Motor Insurance, Workers Compensation, and more. From SMEs to Tradesmen, small yachts to large fleets through to large businesses, our General Insurance solutions are designed to suit organisations of all shapes and sizes. Whether our customers are just starting out or have been in the business sector for years, our customer-first approach helps protect their businesses with confidence  Let’s create a brighter future together, let’s make a difference A great opportunity exists as a Data Analyst responsible for supporting General Insurance to deliver and create data solutions and reporting within the Partnership Crew. This role will work closely with Zurich’s MGA partners and well as a large number of internal stakeholders.  Co-ordinate the management and oversight of bordereaux files; track the delivery and processing of files received from our MGA / Claims TPA partners Perform data-related functions including: analysis, cleansing, mapping, and visualization Identify business requirements to support data initiatives. Support data focused initiatives and implementations. Working with our Partners to identify and resolve data issues. Look for continuous improvement and innovation in processes and insights driven by business need and advancements in technology. Collaborate with data stakeholders to understand and translate business requirement into data management initiatives to achieve business goals. take ownership and be able to drive solutions with stakeholders to ensure each data management initiative delivers intended business value Contribute to new regulatory and market driven requirements related to data Important to your success - let's grow together Bachelors degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science or Business related field and multiple years of experience in related field Demonstrated experience in Influencing - The job’s core deliverables rely on influencing or negotiating with a range of internal clients, usually at the line manager or employee level and external partners, usually MGAs Experience in a similar analytical role, ideally with a focus on supporting a financial services business (Insurance industry experience would be a bonus) Demonstrated ability in data reconciliation and data management Demonstrated ability to perform data analysis, requirements gathering, workshop facilitation. Good relationship skills promoting cooperation, collaboration or acceptance. Be empowered. Make your impact  We achieve amazing things together by:  thinking differently, making iterative change, simplifying, finding efficiencies and improving how we do things. We are always testing and learning setting up our business units with the right resources, pointed at the right things having a clear and visible set of objectives that each one of us can help form, rally behind, and deliver.  We’re all moving towards the same destination and encourage everyone to be curious, courageous and responsible as we seek out new opportunities to delight our customers and ensuring this is a great place for us to be together.   Belong. Zurich is here to support you  There are many reasons why Zurich is the right choice for you, but here are just a few – grow, and thrive in your career (we support and encourage it); work with global, diverse, and inclusive teams; explore your passions, fuel innovation, drive equity, collaborate and make a positive difference beyond your role; access programs to stay healthy and feel healthier; Flexwork@Zurich; become an activist in your community with the support of Z Zurich Foundation; award winning training programs; state-of-the-art Green Star rated office in North Sydney; we plant a tree for every new employee – one of many local initiatives driving our contribution to ambitious global sustainability targets.  We could go on, but the main point is that Zurich is a place that you can truly belong and thrive!  Zurich is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to ensuring that our recruitment process is fair and accessible for all candidates. If you require any special accommodations to participate in our recruitment process, we encourage you to let us know at the time of your application.  So, if you want to come on an adventure that will build a brighter future together, and feel a sense of togetherness, then please apply today to start your adventure!Show moreReport

The area comprises of several functions and to support the goals of Group priorities. Full time permanent opportunity within an industry leading organisation Great career opportunity to develop & learn Sydney based  Delivering good energy starts from within  It’s an exciting time to join Origin. Creating a great place to work means together we’re progressing our ambition to lead the energy transition through cleaner energy and customer solutions. We’re always looking for better ways to deliver for our customers – and for our people.   The Role Reporting directly to the Risk Analytics Manager, this role is responsible for identifying, modelling and quantifying commodity risks in relation to Origin energy market trading and operations. It will also be responsible for working senior analysts to identify and mitigate the drivers of market risk. Responsibilities & Duties Understand Origin's commodity exposures. Follow existing business processes and procedures to help gather inputs and assumptions, run and maintain models, reconcile results, write report sections and share results with stakeholders. Check compliance against CRMS policies and risk limits. Work across teams to share and monitor Origin's overall risk with respect to budget and Long-Term Financial Plan benchmarks. Assist the market risk team to deliver common portfolio knowledge with other teams via monthly assumptions meetings for each commodity. Compile/review QA packs each month. Maintain analyst procedures, report archiving and assist with Audit. Assist to test and promote trusted models, reporting tools, dashboards, and key charts. About you You are looking to grow your career as a business analyst. You have a continuous growth and learning mindset and take it upon yourself to work on personal projects that you are passionate about sharing. Analytical and numerate. Qualification in a relevant quantitative discipline e.g. finance, accounting, engineering, mathematics, computer science etc. 1 year of work experience in any field. Strong communication skills and the ability to build and maintain professional relationships. Skilled in Excel/Tableau or other data manipulation tools. Ability to problem solve with excellent attention to detail. Self-starter with an interest in the energy sector and a desire to prove analytical abilities in a professional setting. Ability to work to tight deadlines.  Origin - Where good change happens.  At Origin, we’re powered by people who believe in creating change. We are committed to fostering a diverse, gender equitable workforce, where everyone is welcome, and all applications are evaluated on merit and potential. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, people living with disabilities, culturally diverse people, any stage in life, people with intersex variations and people within LGBTQ+ communities, including trans and gender diverse.  Enjoy a challenging career in an exciting industry where you can grow and explore your potential. If you think you have transferable skills, an appetite to learn and would be a great fit, we’d love to hear from you.  Origin recognises Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples as the Traditional Custodians of country throughout Australia, and we pay our respects to Elders past, present and future.Show moreReport

WiseTech Global is a world-leading software company building software for the global logistics industry. We are united in our mission to create breakthrough products that enable and empower those who own and operate the world's supply chains. More than 18,000 logistics organizations use our software solutions, including 24 of the top 25 global freight forwarders and 41 of the top 50 global third-party logistics providers. We’re an engineer-led company focusing on building secure, scalable products. Therefore, data analytics is critical to the function of the international supply chain. As a Sydney-based data analyst, you will be responsible for designing and building data models to enhance analytics and performance reporting and optimizing data flow and collection for cross-functional teams. About the role By joining the team, you will be responsible for analyzing available data sources and giving recommendations on data integration and processing, building data models for predictive and prescriptive analytics, investigating, and interpreting data, and building prototypes for analytics reports. If you are self-directed and are comfortable supporting the data needs of the business, systems, and products - this role is for you! Key responsibilities Statistical analysis of data in multiple data sources, creating data profiles Identifying and implementing data quality control processes that prompt correction in the source systems where required Developing data models, flows, datasets, and views that are efficient and meaningful representations of data Designing reporting solutions and building prototypes Communicating and coordinating effectively with data owners, product people, and other stakeholders to ensure models and results are well understood and incorporated into their business processes Developing and implementing testing plans for data transformations, maintaining data definition and technical documentation Driving awareness and providing expertise on the use of analytics tools and concepts, providing training and effectively communicating with multiple stakeholders Analysing existing data governance and privacy requirements and identifying areas for improvement To be successful in this role, you will have: 2-6 years of commercial experience in a similar role Strong understanding of business analysis methodologies and techniques, including requirements gathering, process modelling, and documentation Experience of working with notebooks Deep understanding of databases Experience in Data Design work Expertise in Microsoft BI stack (MS SQL, SSIS, SSAS, Power BI, OLAP) Experience working with SQL and visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI, Basic Python skills Experience with Statistical Modelling Practical knowledge of data warehousing concepts Knowledge of Data Governance concepts, industry best practices, and principles Solid SQL experience, authoring complex queries and DDL, working with execution plans Basic knowledge of machine learning (E.g. Experience Hybrid. Work from the office or home in a rhythm that suits you Permanent role based in Sydney or Melbourne. We're REA REA Group is not your average digital business. From humble beginnings in a garage in Melbourne’s east in 1995, we have grown into a leading global digital business, specialising in property.  With bold and ambitious goals, we are changing the way the world experiences property. No matter where you're at on your property journey, we're here to help with every step - whether that's finding or financing your next home.  Our people are the key to our success. At the heart of everything we do, is a thriving culture centred around high performance and care. We are purpose driven and collaborative, which drives innovation and our ability to make a real impact. As such, we’re proud to be named in Australia’s “Top 5” Best Workplaces two years in a row, as well as being recognised as a Best Workplace for Women. Where the team fits in REA is evolving how it leverages data and technology to deliver benefits for customers. After the acquisition of Hometrack Australia in May-18 (recently re-branded into PropTrack). Since this time the business has continued to grow, underpinned by an expanding set of services and capabilities we bring to our customers. PropTrack’s commercial team is the face of the PropTrack business with its customers. The Data Analyst role sits within the Client Analytics function within the commercial team. The Client analytics team has become an important, unique and in demand offering of PropTrack in market, as a result we are now looking for an experienced data & analytics professional who can interface with our customers to help consult and solve analytical problems. What the role is all about Liaising and working collaboratively with PropTrack’s customers to help solve analytical business problems. Working with customers on tasks from a wide breadth of analytical domains including modelling, data mining/analysis, reporting and data visualisation. Presenting complex analytical outputs and results to all levels of an organisation. Working with commercial leads and account managers to support client requests and working across a wide range of teams within REA to service these requests. Bringing domain expertise to help in the design and build of new products and solutions to support PropTrack’s property analytics products, platforms and custom solutions in line with the growth strategy Building a deep understanding of PropTrack’s products and enabling clients to optimise and make the best use of PropTrack’s current data analytics products and platforms (eg AVM, HTV, HPB). Building deep relationship with key stakeholders within the Financial Services clients (Senior Management to analyst levels) Who we’re looking for Technical knowledge- Understanding of common analytical techniques such as sampling and experience of working in a data-rich environment with data mining techniques and predictive analytics, with use of tools such as SQL, R, Python. Knowledge in common data visualisation tools such as tableau is also high desirable. Domain Knowledge - A deep understanding of several or all of the following: data analytics, the property market, property data, property valuations, home lending and retail banking. Commercial orientation – Commercially savvy, able to bring the best outcomes for the benefit of PropTrack business and clients alike. Creative and analytical thinker - An ability to work through complex problems collaboratively, and to find practical and viable solutions to meet client needs and wants. Client Focus - A mind-set that is always client first, and a proven track record in managing customer experience initiatives. Relationship Influencer – the ability to build strong relationships with peers within in organisations, to solve problems and perspective of clients for mutually beneficial outcomes. The REA experience The physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our people is something we’ll never stop caring about. This is a place to learn and grow. We’re committed to your development – both professionally and personally. Your experience with us is something we take seriously. We offer: A hybrid and flexible approach to working - https://rea.to/hybrid-working Flexible parental leave offering for primary and secondary carers Programs to support mental, emotional, financial and physical health & wellbeing Our Because We Care program offers employees volunteering leave, community grants, matched payroll giving and our Community Café donates 100% of revenue to charity. company: The Garvan Institute of Medical Research3.6 ★
job_description: The Foundation is in a growth phase with a multi-year data strategy in place to support The Garvan Institute’s vision to see a future where everyone lives a longer, heathier life. Central to the Foundation’s multi-year strategic plan is the Data and Business Insights team ('data team’) where the Foundation uses data to identify opportunities that will improve operational efficiencies and grow fundraising. THE OPPORTUNITY The Data & Business Insights team is responsible for management of the Foundation’s CRM, data integrations, reporting and analytics and overall strategic use of the Foundation’s donor and donations data. This role is the next stage of development for the data team and is instrumental in realising the ambition of providing individual donor experiences that maximise lifetime value for the organisation. As an experienced data analyst, you will interrogate vast and extensive datasets such as donor donation history, marketing activities and operations to play a crucial role in driving data-driven decision-making and actionable insights to support the Foundation’s strategic goals. Salary: Up to $98,500 + 11% superannuation + salary packaging (dependent on experience) Employment Type: Full time permanent opportunity SNAPSHOT OF BENEFITS Generous salary packaging increased monthly take home pay via income tax savings. Salary above equivalent to standard Adjust Taxable Income = $111,450 + 11% superannuation Opportunity to contribute to the transformation of the Foundation's data capabilities. We are in a growth phase and have an ambitious data strategy in place, where your expertise will be influential Unlimited learning and development opportunities via partnerships with data professionals and other partners, conferences, access to UNSW Employee Education Discount initiative (pending eligibility) and a regular seminar series Strong culture and appetite for growth and innovation Flexible work arrangements Wellbeing is prioritized with access to resources and support to maintain optimal wellbeing Inclusive leave options, including 18 weeks paid parental leave, regardless of primary or secondary carer status Stimulating, diverse, international research environment WHAT YOU WILL DO Key responsibilities: Data Processes & Systems Understand and maintain existing data processes and systems, with an ability to find areas for optimization. Existing systems encompasses the CRM, data warehouse and various digital platforms/tools Conceptualise, map, propose and implement data pipelines to connect various systems Scope and validate potential new technology applications to automate or streamline data processes Reporting & Analytics Review and input into segmentation within programs and at the broader unified database level Deliver targeted data for fundraising campaigns using SQL and python to prepare data Work collaboratively with data contractors, as well as independently, on the delivery of reporting and analytics. Projects include lifetime value calculations, program analysis, channel analysis, RFV and attrition/churn analysis Maintain and update existing dashboards in PowerBI Data Management Support excellent data integrity and data management processes, within and across the CRM and other platforms Advise on use of the digital marketing tools to create efficiencies and effective donor journeys both within platforms and throughout their journey across channels Governance Ensure all relevant data processes are PCI and Privacy compliant Focus on mitigating risk by supporting, establishing and abiding by data procedures ABOUT YOU Minimum three years’ experience in a similar role Intermediate experience in SQL Experience with working with Power BI dashboards or equivalent tools such as Tableau Excellent project management skills Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities Ability to distil information from multiple sources and stakeholders, while understanding various business objectives Ability to translate requests into data requirements and communicate back in lay language Talent for analysing and improving processes and procedures Absolute commitment to accuracy and a high attention to detail KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS BENEFICAL Intermediate experience in python preferable, or willingness to learn and up skill Experience in not for profit or with loyalty programs desirable, but not required Experience with digital activity as part of customer/donor journeys Garvan promotes a diverse workplace and is committed to the principles of equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging. We are always looking for culture ‘add’, not culture ‘fit’ and are building diverse teams with great sets of complementary styles and skills to help deliver our important work effectively. HOW TO APPLY To apply for this position, please submit your application with a CV and cover letter as one document, stating why you are interested in this role. If you think you’re the right person for this role, we’d love to hear how your capabilities, achievements and experience set you apart. Only applicants with full working rights in Australia are eligible to apply for this role.Show moreReport

Join the Infrastructure and Personal Technology team within our Technology Group at Macquarie and be involved in major IT projects within a dynamic and fast paced environment. This is a Sydney based role.  What role will you play?  In this role you will serve as a key contributor to our data-driven decision-making processes. Your focus will be on collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large datasets to provide actionable insights that support our business objectives. You'll be responsible for querying databases to extract the data needed for various business initiatives and working cross-functionally to provide recommendations that contribute to operational excellence. About the Corporate Operations Group  In our Corporate Operations Group, you will work at the heart of Macquarie. Join a collaborative team who accelerate digitalisation, sustainability and social impact for the benefit of our people, customers, shareholders and communities. Our teams include technology, digital transformation and data, operations, human resources, business services, corporate strategy and solutions and the Macquarie Group Foundation.  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. As the Senior Analyst, Data & Insights, you will be an integral part of the Commercial function and utilise data to support strategic decision making across multiple divisions across the label.  You will report to the Senior Director, Streaming Strategy & Commercial Partnerships and serve as the primary data expert responsible for evaluating track, album and artist performance, informing release strategies, assessing the performance of sales and digital marketing campaigns, drawing insights from market, competitor, partner and consumer research, identifying and validating new commercial opportunities for the label, developing new reports, dashboards and methodologies, and delivering the data needs of the label. This is a unique opportunity to be part of a growing data journey at one of the most storied major labels that represents some of the most important artists today.   What you'll do: Serve as a thought leader evolving the way data is utilised to make strategic decisions across the label. Evaluate the performance of releases by digging into detailed consumption and audience data to inform decision making for future releases. Utilise internal and external business intelligence and data analytics tools to create new reports, dashboards, analysis and methods for evaluating releases, understanding artist audiences and uncovering actionable insights. Present data stories and actionable insights in compelling, digestible formats to internal and external stakeholders with varying levels of data literacy. Support and educate the team on utilising self-serve analytics resources for streaming, audience and market data to allow them to create data-led, long term strategies and make real time decisions. Perform deep dive research to understand the latest trends across the music industry, competitors, digital streaming partners, social media platforms, and consumer behaviour to inform decision making, raise the overall data knowledge at the label and stay ahead of the competition. Lead efforts to collect valuable external data points through public API's and web scraping as needed to supplement existing internal data. Collaborate with multiple business divisions to identify, quantify, validate and measure areas of commercial growth. Serve as the primary data expert for the label, understanding data sources and systems to ensure data integrity and report accuracy, working with technology teams to resolve technical data issues and implement enhancements to data systems, and championing data education across the label.  Who you are: 5+ years' experience working with data within the music, entertainment and consumer brands industry. Expertise working with relational databases and writing complex SQL. Experience with Alteryx, Python, JavaScript or other analytical programming languages. Advanced knowledge of data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Data Studio. Advanced knowledge of Excel, Powerpoint, Keynote. Strong analytical and quantitative skills – ability to identify trends in large datasets, display creativity in problem-solving, and generate new ideas. Strong ability to communicate insights to label executives and key stakeholders – orally, in writing, and in presentations. A collaborative and communicative person who possesses a "customer service" mentality to ensure the needs of labels and senior management are met in a timely and satisfactory manner. Be proactive, self-motivated with a desire to self-educate and push-boundaries in how data can be utilised. A knowledge of how the music industry operates and it's constantly evolving landscape. Passion for music and desire to build a career in the industry.  What we give you: You join an inclusive, collaborative and global community where you have the opportunity to fuel the creative journey and make a difference Great, fun and energetic office, fueled with collaboration, teamwork, passion and energy Flexible/Hybrid working (in-office & from home), with our offices always open to you balancing flexibility, and connection Company paid Private Health Insurance and Income protection/TPD cover through superannuation Fantastic employee resource groups Generous Sony discounts across the Sony Group of families Parental leave benefits, Inclusive and supportive to all parents and carers throughout their parenting and caring journey, Including up to 18 weeks paid time off Additional benefits to support caring responsibilities thereafter, Including emergency back-up child care options Virtual and In-office wellness benefits Including fitness and meditation classes Partnership with Unmind to support your mindfulness and wellbeing LinkedIn Learning membership for all team members Novated car leasing options Employee Assistance Program for all team members and family Continually investing and fostering your professional growth & development  Equal Opportunities  As an active part of a culturally and socially diverse society, Sony Music's aim is that our workforce is diverse and inclusive. PERSOLKELLY is seeking Data Analyst to join one of their Key Government Client based in Sydney.  PERSOLKELLY brings together the legacy and experience of four organisation that shaped the staffing landscape over the past century: Kelly Services, who pioneered the modern temporary help industry in 1946; SKILLED, who crafted the staffing industry in Australia in 1964; Programmed, the leading provider of operations and maintenance services across Australia and New Zealand; and PERSOLKELLY, the largest workforce solutions provider in APAC.  PERSOLKELLY is seeking Data Analyst to join one of their Key Government Client based in Sydney.  The Reporting and Data Analyst produces datasets, analyses, charts and/or dashboards (reports) to support research, and system monitoring and performance reporting activities to inform decision making, and support achievement . They contribute to the development, implementation and maintenance of data assets, reports and reporting systems.  Responsibilities  In collaboration with other teams across the division, the Reporting and Data Analyst contributes to the ongoing development and maintenance of the Institute's datasets, analyses, reports and reporting systems Perform data validation and quality control activities on various data, analyses and reports to ensure they are accurate and 'fit for purpose'. Contribute to the development and maintenance of standardised code and templates, ensure programmes used to produce report outputs use efficient, automated, and repeatable code and functions that are stored in repositories with secure version control. Provide input into the development and maintenance of metadata and supporting documentation such as data dictionaries, data quality statements, usage notes and caveats, as well as technical documents to support greater understanding and use of the Institutes' data assets and products. Undertake analyses in response to data queries from researchers, local health districts, clinicians, and the general public. Contribute to the development and maintenance of standard operating procedures, to ensure consistent and replicable methods of preparing, analysing and reporting on data are used.  WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?  Demonstrated experience managing, analysing, and summarising data and the production of charts, tables, and dashboards. Strong skills and experience in R and SQL programming languages. Experience in Power BI and building Shiny applications will be highly regarded. Tertiary qualifications in public health, computer science, data science, statistics, information management or other relevant discipline.  HOW TO APPLY If interested in this role please apply today or alternatively send your resume to Neema Mehra, neema.mehra@persolkelly.com.au . Please note that due to the high volume of applicants only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Who are we  At PERSOLKELLY, our passion is - and always has been - putting you first.  We propel our people forward by supporting their careers in fresh ways, backed by our expertise and capability.  We're committed to creating a safe and inclusive environment which values and respects diverse styles, backgrounds, experience and perspectives.  We welcome and encourage women, people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent and people from diverse backgrounds to apply.  So it's over to you. If you would like to join our team, please APPLY now.  To learn more about working with PERSOLKELLY, we encourage you to visit our website.Show moreReport

Work type: Permanent Full time Region: NSW- Sydney CBD  Further your career as a quant analyst within a cutting-edge front office team that cares about culture  It’s more than a career at NAB. It’s about more opportunity, more moments to make a difference and more focus on you.  You make NAB. You get it done for our customers and our communities. You’re laying the foundations for NAB’s future success. Together we’ll grow, excel for our customers, and make this a workplace to be proud of.  It’s a good time to see what more you can find at NAB as a Quantitative Analyst  A new opportunity has become available within NAB’s highly respected front office Quant Research Analytics team, within our Markets business. The role exists in a dynamic and collegiate team of quant analysts, engineers and developers engaged in researching, designing, building, and supporting core infrastructure that is utilised globally and extensively by the bank across Trading, Sales and Structuring activities.  The roles and responsibilities of the team have recently expanded, resulting in a new position created to assist with the delivery of new initiatives, coupled with the ongoing development and support of existing projects. This is a rare opportunity to learn and grow in an exciting front office trading environment.  You will be enabled and empowered to be your best self with long term opportunities for further growth and development to strengthen your expertise within a team that cares about culture and excellence, and who are ready to celebrate your growth and achievements.  DESIREABLE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS  Quantitative skills:  Financial Markets knowledge and experience working with one or more asset class (Rates, FX, XVA etc) Derivative pricing and risk management models Exposure to stochastic processes and associated techniques A drive to learn new concepts, develop original ideas and adapt these to practical applications.  Coding skills:  C# coding development experience (ideally 3+ years) Exposure to professional coding practices (source control, unit testing, peer review, JIRA etc) A passion for good clean design with a disciplined and careful approach to software development An appreciation for the importance of quality dialog with stakeholders and colleagues during the coding process  Excellent interpersonal and communication skills:  Clarity in both written and spoken communication Ability to listen Ability to process complexity and boil down to simple, clear terms Enjoys working in a team environment – collaboratively, respectfully, sharing of ideas, effort and success  Other useful skills but not required:  Python Data science  Experience and Education:  3+ years’ experience, ideally within financial markets, as part of a Quantitative Analytics team Experience delivering and supporting high-quality tools and applications in continuing consultation with stakeholders A work history that demonstrates the ability to work constructively and collaboratively within a larger inter-disciplinary team Undergraduate degree level or above in a numerate discipline (Maths, Physics, Engineering etc.)  A diverse and inclusive workplace works better for everyone. At NAB, we’re intent on building a culture we can all be proud of. One based on trust and respect. An uplifting environment where every single one of us feels appreciated and empowered to be our true, authentic selves. A diverse and inclusive workplace where our differences are celebrated, and our contributions are valued. It’s a huge part of what makes NAB such a special place to be.  Choose NAB to accelerate your Quant career:  If you think this role is the right fit for you, we invite you to apply.  To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or Australian permanent residency or independent residency status. job_title: Project Management Office and Change Analyst | Operational Risk
job_description: Join the Risk Management Groups Operations Risk team an be a part of a program responsible for delivering organisation-wide change across frameworks, processes, people, technology and data.  At Macquarie, we are working to create lasting value for our communities, our clients and our people. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 54 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drive outcomes.  What role will you play?  You will be responsible for the day-to-day project management office and change management operations and will support the program’s leadership team. This includes managing project schedules and sprint plans, risk, assumption, issue and dependency tracking, project governance, assurance, and managing budgets and forecasts to ensure project outcomes are achieved.  You will assist with change impact assessments and plans, stakeholder engagement plans and tracking, and support the development of communication materials. When required, you will also provide general support across workstreams, including preparation of subject matter material.  What you offer  Highly-organised and flexible self-starter, keen to continue to grow your experience and knowledge in projects, change and risk management Some experience in Project Management Office and Change Management knowledge is nice to have Good understanding and experience in operational risk and resilience Extensive experience using Microsoft PowerPoint, Word and relevant project management tools (e.g. Excel, JIRA, Microsoft Project etc) Financial services or consulting experience is highly desirable.  We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.  Benefits  Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria and location, include:  Hybrid and flexible working arrangements Wellbeing and service bonus leave Up to 20 weeks paid parental leave as well as benefits to support you as you transition to life as a working parent Paid volunteer leave and donation matching Range of benefits to support your physical, psychological and financial wellbeing  About the Risk Management Group  In our Risk Management Group, you will be part of an independent, and centralised function, responsible for independent and objective review and challenge, oversight, monitoring and reporting in relation to Macquarie’s material risks. Our divisions include behavioural risk, compliance, credit, financial crime risk, internal audit, market risk, operational risk and governance, prudential risk, and Risk Management Group central.  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for a role regardless of their identity, including gender, race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status, marital or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disabilities, or socio-economic background.  If you require adjustments to your working arrangements or the recruitment process, please let us know when applying.   About Macquarie A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future. Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.  Job no: RMG-974973 Work type: Permanent - Full time Location: Sydney Category: Junior, Compliance, Legal & Regulatory, Projects, Improvements & Change, Risk Management Group: Risk Management Group Division: Operational Risk Recruiter: Annaleise Hudson Opening Date: 15/10/2023Show moreReport

A new adventure awaits…  At Zurich we’re on a journey to lighting the way to a brighter future… a brighter future for you – focused on your career, your wellbeing, and your community – as well as our customers and the planet.  We take pride in uniting our people within an energized culture that empowers everyone to focus on what matters most to our customers and each other. This is an exciting time to be at Zurich as we empower our people to fuel innovation and collaborate across diverse teams. At Zurich we encourage everyone to be curious, courageous, and responsible as we seek out new opportunities to delight our customers. We know we can achieve great things when we put our mind to it.   Let’s create a brighter future together, let’s make a difference Work is something you do, not only somewhere you go. The way we work continues to evolve and at Zurich we are committed to creating ways of working that ensure you are helping to create a brighter future.  As the Actuarial Analyst within our General Insurance Pricing & Analytics team, you will help to improve the underwriting profit and growth objectives of Zurich's Motor Fleet. You will do this by assisting in the provision of pricing and underwriting advice, as well as providing management information on portfolio performance.  You will carry out detailed pricing investigations on our motor fleet products and produce and distribute detailed monitoring of the claims experience, to help identify more profitable segments of each portfolio. You will identify poor data quality and reconciliation issues and assist in the continuous improvement of our systems to improve the quality of data.  Please note this is a 12-month contract opportunity.   Important to your success – let’s grow together Experience within a pricing role, ideally within General Insurance. Degree qualified in Actuarial Studies, or other related degree. High analytical skills, with the ability to gather and interpret information from different sources. Strong excel skills and familiarity with analytics software such as SAS, Radar, or R. You will be an excellent communicator, both written and verbal, and have the ability to build relationships with peers and stakeholders.  Belong. Zurich is here to support you There are many reasons why Zurich is the right choice for you, but here are just a few – grow, and thrive in your career (we support and encourage it); work with global, diverse, and inclusive teams; explore your passions, fuel innovation, drive equity, collaborate and make a positive difference beyond your role; access programs to stay healthy and feel healthier; Flexwork@Zurich; become an activist in your community with the support of Z Zurich Foundation; award winning training programs; state-of-the-art Green Star rated office in North Sydney; we plant a tree for every new employee – one of many local initiatives driving our contribution to ambitious global sustainability targets.  We could go on, but the main point is that Zurich is a place that you can truly belong and thrive!  Zurich is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to ensuring that our recruitment process is fair and accessible for all candidates. If you require any special accommodations to participate in our recruitment process, we encourage you to let us know at the time of your application.  So, if you want to come on an adventure that will build a brighter future together, and feel a sense of togetherness, then please apply today to start your adventure!Show moreReport

Volkswagen Group is one of the world's leading automobile manufacturers, employing more than 600,000 people globally and selling its vehicles in more than 150 countries. The wholly-owned subsidiary has its National Sales Centre based in Sydney home to some of Australia's most recognisable brands which include Audi, CUPRA, Skoda and Volkswagen.  About your new Role Your main responsibilities will include: Simplify and standardise data flows and rationalise the data repositories across the organisation and deliver results through seizing opportunities with an outcome and customer focus. Lead business users with developing new operative innovations to transform business units into the modern era, utilising technology and adoption of an Automation mindset relating to data and reporting management. Gain a deep understanding of business processes, data sources and structures to development of new connected and automated solutions that contains life cycle management. Working closely with the VGA Business to design, develop comprehensive and user friendly reports, dashboards and data visualisations using reporting tools Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business requirements, develop data-driven solutions, innovate and improve data analysis methodologies and reporting techniques. Manage the dealer incentive process and internal auditing of incentive payments from end-to-end with the relevant stakeholders from each Sales brand.  About you To succeed in this role, you will need to possess the following: Extensive experience in data management and analysis for corporate applications and systems or similar Qualifications in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Information systems design, Mathetmatics or similar preferred Proficiency in analytics and reporting tools, preferably Qlik. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities using quantitative and qualitative data. Professionalism and ability to handle multiple priorities, demonstrating sound judgment. Business process mapping and improvement experience. Intermediate to advanced MS Office skills, especially MS Excel.  Why Volkswagen? This is a fantastic opportunity to join VGA, based in our stunning Zetland head office. Working at Volkswagen provides opportunities for growth, personal development, and career opportunities, we also champion a workplace culture that thrives on passion, collaboration, efficiency, mindfulness, authenticity, and innovation. Our Benefits, Rewards and Recognition include: A culture of continuous learning, growth and development. You will receive access to LinkedIn Learning, Australian Institute of Management courses and Future Women training and personal development opportunities which is why over 25% of our vacancies are filled by internal candidates! Flexible working arrangements with our hybrid work model balance office and home for ways of working along with remote location working arrangements for up to 10 days anywhere outside Australia Additional leave including VGA Day paid leave day and paid parental leave of 18 weeks Annual fitness and wellbeing subsidy towards a facility of your choice Access to the VGA Car Lease Program Free entry to Dubbo and Taronga Zoo for you and your family Work in an award winning state of the art newly refurbished building recognised by Master Builders Association Australia – our offices include onsite parking and a convenient location with close proximity to a train station  If this sounds like the role and place for you to drive your career to great heights with a world-class organisation, APPLY NOW! Volkswagen Group Australia is an equal opportunity employer in each jurisdiction that it operates. We encourage and value applications from all diverse perspectives, experience and backgrounds. Successful applicants will be required to complete background checks through our external provider as a condition of employment. Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us achieve our mission.  Microsoft Advertising (MSA) is on the cutting edge of the digital marketing industry and empowers the largest advertisers around the world to reach their maximum potential through paid search engine marketing, native and retail solutions on the Microsoft Advertising platform. We are seeking a top performing Business Analyst who is passionate about combining analytical acumen, strategic planning, and operational execution to maximize the effectiveness of our Advertising Sales team. Sitting within the Sales Operations organization and playing the role of trusted advisor to our sales leadership team, the individual in this role provides sales leaders and partners with analytical tools and insights that serve as a competitive differentiator and driver of growth. This role will deliver a balance of leading, doing, and influencing, in close partnership with Sales and Operations teams as well as various partners across MSA such as Data Science, Marketing, and Engineering. If you enjoy solving complex problems in a collaborative cross-team environment, this role and this team may be just what you’re looking for! Responsibilities Contributing to a shared culture of diversity and respect: Create deep connections within our communities, while fostering awareness and growth through an inclusive environment. Accelerating business performance with analytical insights: Contribute to recurring business reviews in partnership with Sales and Operations partners, including measurement of Sales performance/execution, generation and delivery of analytical insights, and recommendations for strategy refinement. Developing sales strategy: Leverage advanced analytical methods to uncover opportunities to better service customers and grow revenue. Partner closely with Sales leaders and cross-functional teams to drive and inform the development and deployment of data-driven strategic initiatives. Revenue forecasting and target setting: In partnership with Sales Leadership, Finance, and Operations teams, develop forecasts which assist in the setting of sales targets, and coordinate the distribution of sales targets from the market level down to individual books of business. Enabling scale and efficiency via tools: Drive process improvements and scaled tooling that enables easy access to critical business insights. Seek and activate on feedback from sales leaders and peers to continually improve tools and reporting capabilities, influencing upstream data and reporting partners as needed. Continuous learning and professional growth: Continually strengthen your industry and analytics expertise and contribute to the success of others by promoting mutual learning and sharing of best practices. Some travel may be required. Qualifications Required/Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Engineering, Computer Science, Marketing, Business, Economics or related field AND proven experience in data analysis and reporting, business intelligence, or business and financial analysis  OR Master's Degree in Mathematics, Analytics, Engineering, Computer Science, Marketing, Business, Economics or related field OR equivalent experience. Experience extracting and manipulating data using SQL Experience creating data visualization solutions with Power BI, Tableau, and/or similar technologies Working knowledge of predictive modeling and data clustering/classification techniques Intermediate Excel skills (pivot tables, vlookups, etc.) Passion for continual learning, seeking solutions to new challenges, contributing to others’ success, and raising the collective capabilities of the team Commitment to upholding and advancing diversity, inclusion, and equity principles Additional or Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Engineering, Computer Science, Marketing, Business, Economics or related field AND 3+ years experience in data analysis and reporting, business intelligence, or business and financial analysis  OR Master's Degree in Mathematics, Analytics, Engineering, Computer Science, Marketing, Business, Economics or related field AND 1+ year(s) experience in data analysis and reporting, business intelligence, or business and financial analysis OR equivalent experience. Experience in sales and/or partnering with sales Experience extracting data from large/complex databases using SQL Experience manipulating data and building data solutions using Python or a similar programming language Experience partnering with executive leaders to drive organization-wide strategies  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. job_title: Platform Investment Analyst - Managed Portfolios Reporting
job_description: If you live in Australia or New Zealand, you’ve likely heard of AMP. But at a time when society is changing, we are too. We’re now a nimbler business with new leadership and thinking. For us, these are exciting times. There’s a real potential for big thinkers to help us redefine what financial services could be. And turn our legacy into something even more positive and powerful for the future. Help people create their tomorrow, while you create yours We help people with their banking, super, retirement and finances. Through upturns, downturns, recessions, and major life transitions. Every day, we help people see and make more of their financial potential, so that they can create their tomorrow. And we’ve been doing it for over 170 years. If we do our job well, we genuinely add to the prosperity of our country and its people. How you’ll make an impact The primary focus of the role is to own and deliver reporting, dashboards and data analytics as it relates to managed portfolios. This role requires the applicant to be able to manage time and deliver to tight deadlines while collating content and data via various sources, managing internal and external stakeholders including senior management. This role will specifically focus on areas to ensure a contemporary, competitive platform and managed portfolio menu including; Own and deliver weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting on managed portfolios for investment managers, advisers and other key stakeholders Provide project management support as it relates to managed portfolios Support in the development of disclosure documents as it relates to managed portfolios Support managed portfolio investment operations with questions regarding appropriate management of managed portfolios Support changes and setup of managed portfolios (manage questionnaires, fund fee analysis, portfolio setup in systems and downstream tools etc.) Support in responding to queries from advice practices on partnered managed portfolios Support performance calculations and data analytics for managed portfolios Troubleshooting of queries related to managed portfolio performance calculation and the North system What you will bring to the team Ideally, you will bring the following experiences to this role: Demonstrated experience in the Australian Wealth Management market (2+ years) across Platforms, Investments, managed portfolios and/or advice Experience in stakeholder management including Fund Managers and internal; project teams Strong understanding of data, analytics and reporting requirements Ability to work with complex spreadsheets and SQL to deliver enhanced dashboards and reports Experience with managed portfolios or extensive reporting is favourable Sound understanding/ knowledge of financial instruments and products Advanced excel skills including Power BI Strong database (SQL), data mining and data analysis experience Good understanding of the competitive market for investments offered by other Platforms You’ll thrive here if… If you can adapt from BAU to the ambiguous with ease, you’ll do well here. Change is never easy, so bring your commitment, grit and growth mindset. Because we run lean, you’ll be expected to jump in and deliver across a variety of areas. Meaning, you’ll be closer to the action and executive decisions that influence where we go next. If you’re someone that can hold their own, you’ll find AMP quite liberating. Why we think you’ll love working at AMP Doing what we’ve always done is not an option, so your clever ideas will get airtime here. You’ll be encouraged to speak up and try new things. If they don’t work, we move on – better for it. We know there’s no one way of doing things. So, you won’t have to sacrifice who you are or how you work to fit in here. We’re inclusive and flexible in many of the ways you’d expect. And in some of the ways you wouldn’t. As long as your health and wellbeing come first - at home and at work. In fact, most of what makes AMP such a welcoming, enjoyable place to work are our people. Wherever you go, you’ll find moments to connect, feel valued and do meaningful work. Whether it’s through our first-class leaders who are invested in you and your success. Through year-round opportunities to volunteer, fundraise and give back to the community. Or in the everyday challenges you face as we work together to strengthen this great organisation. Challenges that will stretch you, amplify your potential and compound the impact you have.  We believe in the power of inclusion and diversity We’re dedicated to fostering inclusion, diversity, and a warm feeling of belonging at AMP. It sparks creativity, ignites innovation, and turns up the dial on the quality of our decisions and performance. This not only makes our workplace more engaged, but also leads to better connections with our customers. We're your allies in the search for the perfect fit - when you apply, let us know how we can support you to put your best self forward during our selection process. We're also committed to enhancing employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, so we enthusiastically encourage candidates from these backgrounds to apply and explore our Reconciliation Plan on our website> (insert link) Ready to create your tomorrow? If you’re someone who sees opportunity where others see challenge, come and work with us in smart, progressive ways as we transform an iconic Australian brand for the future. And, through a series of career-defining moments, create your own tomorrow. Don’t procrastinate! We review applications when we get them, and if we discover the ideal candidate, we may close the role earlier than the advertised close date. Looking forward to meeting you.Show moreReport

Network Operations Analyst - HomeRun Opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest and best minds in Australia An exciting career - as our business grows, so do the opportunities for our Team Members Surry Hills (Sydney) based with flexible and remote working arrangements  HomeRun is a brand new business inside the Woolworths group. We aspire to create Australia’s leading Last Mile Business, powering the eCommerce growth of all Woolworths Group brands through an exceptional last mile customer experience at competitive economics. HomeRun provides an end-to-end Last Mile solution with the team, technology and operations to offer differentiated customer experiences at scale across Australia and New Zealand. We use the strength and scale of our amazing retail brands, supply chain, fulfilment centres and edge network of more than 1,200 stores (located within 10 min of 90% of Australians) to deliver leading reliability, coverage and efficiency. Sustainability & driver experience are core to our purpose. We want to lead the way to a green last mile with a commitment to a 100% electric fleet by 2030 and becoming the driver employer of choice through ease of pickup, earning potential & focus on safety. We are not a boring logistics department inside a large retailer. We are a nimble, entrepreneurial, technology & data led team passionate about driving the growth of eCommerce by step changing the quality of last mile customer experience in Australia. We are building best-in-class last-mile optimization technologies today and are exploring the solutions of tomorrow by investing in autonomous drones and other emerging technologies. What you’ll do  As the Network Operations Analyst your primary goal is to deliver exceptional customer experiences by enhancing our logistics operations through data-driven insights. We are seeking a talented Insights Analyst to join our team and contribute to our success by assisting in designing operational experiments, tracking KPIs, building internal reporting and dashboards, and improving our day-to-day routing operations. Your work will directly impact our ability to optimise operations, enhance efficiency, and improve customer satisfaction.  You will also: Analyse results of experiments to identify opportunities for improvement in our logistics operations. Suggest insights and innovative solutions to address routing challenges, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to plan and execute experiments aimed at optimising routing strategies. Design and implement dashboards and visualisations to track and monitor KPIs during operational trial periods, offering real-time insights into performance metrics and provide visibility into routing performance. Analyse and interpret analysis results to provide actionable insights to logistics and operations teams, aiding in decision-making and strategic planning. Work closely with routing and logistics teams to understand their needs and challenges and support by developing tools, algorithms, and models to enhance routing decision-making. Present findings, reports, and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, tailoring communication to both technical and non-technical audiences.  What you’ll bring  Our new Network Operations Analyst will be driven and passionate, keen to get things done and able to make an impact in a fast-paced environment. We’re looking for a team player with: You will also have: Proven experience (3 years) working in business operations and/or business analytics, specifically in Supply Chain, Logistics, eCommerce Operations or other related Fast Moving Consumer Goods business. Proficiency in Google Sheets or MS Excel Proficient with analytical techniques and able to provide insights through data - additional experience working with Google Apps Script (Javascript) and/or Python preferred. Familiar with data manipulation working with SQL and cloud based platforms (such as GCP) Experience with data visualisation and dashboard creation, specifically Tableau or PowerBI Excellent problem-solving abilities and a passion for process optimization. Effective communication skills to present findings, collaborate with multidisciplinary teams, and convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.  What you’ll experience  Our Team Members are at the heart of everything we do and we’re always looking for ways to support your career journey and reward great work: A progressive and flexible ‘work from anywhere’ policy that gives you more control over your work, life and wellbeing Team discounts across our range of Woolworths Group brands you know and love and a robust rewards program that celebrates and incentivises purpose-driven work As a leader in a crucial growth-focused role you will have regular exposure to our most senior business leaders in WooliesX and the broader Woolworths group and accumulate valuable experience to grow your career in surprising ways A range of programs to help you prioritise and manage your wellbeing, including 24/7 access to the Sonder app. A progressive and competitive leave policy that gives you more space for what matters to you   Everyone belongs at Woolworths Group  Creating better experiences begins with creating inclusive and safe environments where everyone is valued, supported and empowered to bring their whole self to work and do the best work of their careers. We believe that all team members should feel valued, respected and safe irrespective of your gender, race, culture, religious beliefs, education, age, disability, family responsibilities, sexual orientation and gender identity and we encourage applications from all candidates. Together starts with you and we believe that everyone should have the opportunity to be their best, when applying for a role. Please let us know about any workplace adjustments or support that you may need. Platinum Tier Employer - Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion Employer of Choice for Gender Equality - Workplace Gender Equality Agency. Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Woolworths Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. See how we’re creating better experiences together, for a better tomorrow. Discover more opportunities with Woolworths Group. Grow with the Group  As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do. We are currently recruiting for a Business Analyst to complement our external program delivery team. We are unique We are a regional business that thinks on a global level. We work with determined, passionate and curious people to empower communities to share and use energy for a better tomorrow. With a network that powers 95% of NSW and parts of Southern Queensland, we ensure homes, hospitals, schools, businesses, and services stay connected. We are currently recruiting for a Business Analyst to complement our external program delivery team. This role will be a fixed term contract for 24 months. This role will be based within the Essential Energy footprint with the ability to work from home in a hybrid work environment. About the role As a Business Analyst at Essential Energy, you will play a crucial role in supporting contracted program delivery and enhancing our operational and financial performance. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional skills in Excel and have a proven ability to build Business Intelligence (BI) reporting systems. Your primary responsibilities will include analysing data, identifying trends, and developing insights to drive informed decision-making. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to improve processes and elevate program reporting capabilities. Key Responsibilities: Data Analysis and Interpretation: Utilize advanced Excel functions to analyze large datasets and extract meaningful insights. Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies to provide valuable business intelligence.  BI Reporting: Develop and maintain BI reporting systems to enhance program reporting for financial and operational performance. Create visually appealing and user-friendly dashboards for key stakeholders.  Process Improvement: Collaborate with teams to identify areas for process improvement and efficiency gains. Propose and implement solutions to streamline workflows and enhance overall effectiveness.  Program Support: Provide analytical support for external program delivery, ensuring alignment with organisational goals. Work closely with project teams to understand requirements and deliver actionable insights . To be successful you will have demonstrated skills to document current and proposed business processing using relevant tools, along with excellent organisational skills to manage and implement large, complex and varying workloads. You will have strong presentation skills with the ability to identify data and trends in detailed reports to senior management in order facilitated improved decision making. Your communication, relationship management, negotiation and interpersonal skills will allow for effective communication at all levels, including senior management. Required Qualifications / Experience Diploma in Business or demonstrated capability through past employment experience and/or relevant qualifications Demonstrated experience in a similar/professional role in the Construction or Consulting or Energy/Electrical or Utilities industry Demonstrated experience in business/requirements analysis in a large enterprise Demonstrated reporting and policy/process development experience in order to drive continuous improvement opportunities A thorough knowledge of business/project processes and practices including the identification, analysis, design, documentation and implementation of business processes Good understanding of commercial considerations and risk management principles Knowledge and understanding of project management processes and methodologies.  For further information please contact Jason Bierer, Senior Program Project Manager, on 0408 693 208. Applications close on Sunday 19th November 2023 at 11.55 pm (AEST) Passionate people. Global thinking. Regional heart. Building a better energy future.
