JOB DESCRIPTION As a Data Analyst in the Client Tax team, you will be responsible for supporting the client deliverable process by using data mining and data analysis skills to reconcile accounting data to tax data. We have different data views that we have to maintain for our client investment portfolios that serve different purposes. Our client portfolios may contain hundreds of lines of assets with thousands of lines of transactions going through in any given month for which many pieces of data are collected and / or generated. Different pieces of this data are used for different client requirements, however elements of this data must reconcile each month. Working within the Fund Services division of Investor Services, you’ll work close with the Tax and Accounting teams to understand their data needs and help solve data discrepancies by developing a deep understanding of our core platforms. Our client base includes large industry superannuation funds and managed investment trusts based in Australia. The firm’s Securities Services business has experienced significant growth recently due to a number of major wins and is now Australia’s largest by Assets Under Custody. Job responsibilities Resolve monthly reconciliation breaks between tax and accounting records that involves deep analysis into large data sets, within set SLAs Develop a deep understanding of the key team reporting requirements that help drive their data needs Problem solve the data issues that arise from various processes that are run Understand key processes and their potential impact to our data Develop efficient ways and make use of available tools that enable faster data investigations Establish and evolve the SOPs (standard Operating Procedures) for the reconciliation investigation processes that enable better transfer of knowledge Improve processes and document Build relationships with key internal stakeholders Provide key input into projects as required which could include new technology, enhancements, or new products Pass on knowledge and train others on data analysis Required qualifications, capabilities and skills Some understanding of tax and accounting concepts A minimum of 5 years’ experience in a data analysis role Strong excel skills plus experience with other tools such as Alteryx Preferred qualifications, capabilities and skills Experience in the Funds industry is preferred ABOUT US  J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.  We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.   ABOUT THE TEAM  The Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across investment banking, wholesale payments, markets and securities services. The world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. We provide strategic advice, raise capital, manage risk and extend liquidity in markets around the world.Show moreReport

We have an opportunity for a Sustainability Integration Analyst to join the team at our Sydney Head Office in a full-time permanent position. The Opportunity - About the Role  As the Sustainability Integration Analyst at Stockland you will be an active member of the Sustainability and Delivery Team and will play a key role managing the sustainability data management and reporting platform to help drive the delivery of high impact sustainable outcomes for our business, assets and communities. You will be a strong collaborator, supporting the integration of the ESG Strategy across the business including the performance monitoring of all sustainability targets, while contributing to systems and process enhancements that support our purpose ‘A Better Way to Live’.  Your daily responsibilities will include: Lead the maintenance and data collection process Stockland’s Sustainability Data Management and Reporting Platform Co-ordinate sustainability compliance and voluntary reporting including NGERS, WBGC NZCB and obligations under the CEFC Support and manage the development of tools and processes to integrate, track and report on the performance against Sustainability targets, programs and initiatives Work with key stakeholders, including the Sustainability Business Partners, to integrate sustainability targets, programs and additional requirements into existing business processes to ensure end-to-end delivery of sustainable outcomes Serve as point of contact for the data auditing and assurance process; and liaise with suppliers, project team and contractors Coordinating project teams and third-party data providers, contractors and consultants on ongoing data capture and system-wide improvement opportunities Developing data driven relevant and engaging materials for internal and external reporting requirements and communications Contribute to delivering sustainable outcomes through the provision of data analytics on Sustainability initiatives Contribute to ESG reporting and disclosure including investor surveys, industry benchmarks and Stockland’s Annual Integrated Report and ESG Reporting Suite  About You Appropriate tertiary qualifications and/or extensive relevant experience. Experience preparing and coordinating assurance for environmental datasets for sustainability reporting and mandatory environmental datasets for NGERS (desirable). Demonstrated experience in a similar Analyst role with a strong focus on Sustainability(desirable). Relevant training and qualifications in Environmental Studies, Statistics, Analytics, Mathematics, Information Technology and/or related discipline. Critical thinking and analytical ability to conceptualise, apply, analyse and evaluate data Demonstrated proficiency and experience with the use of PowerBI Skilled using Microsoft Office, particularly MS Excel and other contemporary data analysis tools Strong attention to detail and time management skills  The Stockland Proposition  At Stockland we are a community delivering outcomes that benefit the community at large. We work collaboratively and inclusively, building strong working relationships. Our portfolio is diverse and so are the opportunities for professional and career development. We are committed to providing our people with broad experiences to build a successful career. We recognise the importance of flexibility and work life-quality and over 80% of our employees have informal or formal flexible work arrangements. Additionally, Stockland has a strong commitment to achieving the best outcomes through an inclusive and collaborative culture. Our customers come from diverse backgrounds and we want our teams to reflect this. We offer competitive remuneration and benefits. Benefits include free to access or subsidised lifestyle, health, well-being and financial services products. Due to the permanent nature of this role, we can only accept applications from Australian Citizens, Permanent Residents or Open Work Visa holders with more than 12 months validity from their role start date. Who we are: At Torrens University Australia, making a difference is in our DNA. As a Certified B Corporation, we belong to a global community of future-focused companies using business as a force for good. We believe in the transformative power of education to change lives, families, communities – and the world. That’s why we’re on a mission to increase access to higher education, so learners from all walks of life can chase their dreams.  Just like our students, our employees are a diverse group who want to make an impact. When you join us, we give you the freedom to be bold, creative and courageous – with flexible working arrangements that allow you to bring your best. We’ve built a culture that celebrates community, collaboration and innovation, where people love what they do.  What’s the job? This is an exciting new opportunity within Torrens University Australia, we’re looking to hire a Commercial Data Analyst and Trainer. We are actively seeking a proficient Commercial Data Analyst and Trainer to join our organization. This role holds a critical place within our company, as it primarily involves the analysis of customer service and sales data to identify trends. Subsequently, the role involves leveraging these insights to enhance the skills and knowledge of our customer service and sales teams by providing guidance on both their strengths and areas for performance improvement. What does the ideal candidate look like? You should possess a true passion for data, coupled with a robust foundation in data analytics systems like Power BI. Moreover, your enthusiasm should shine through as you piece together data and other insights to discern areas for enhancement, gauge performance metrics, and uncover potential avenues for development within our CX teams. Whilst the recruitment process will be beginning this year, we would expecting the successful candidates to start in January 2024. Since this position will have a hybrid setup, we are searching for someone that is based in Sydney or Adelaide. Day-to-day accountabilities: Analyse customer service and sales data to identify trends, patterns and opportunities for improvement. Design, develop and update training materials and modules related to customer service & sales techniques, product knowledge and communication skills. Conduct training sessions for customer service and sales teams, both in-person and virtually. Monitor the performance of customer service and sales teams through key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics. Work closely with cross-functional teams to identify process inefficiencies and propose solutions to enhance overall customer service and sales operations. Act in line with Torrens Global Education (TGE)’s Code of Conduct and all policies and procedures, and any relevant external legislative requirements. Who you are: Educational Background: A Bachelor's Degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field (with a Master's degree being a preference) is important as it demonstrates a strong foundation in the relevant disciplines, which can be valuable when analyzing and interpreting business data. Proven Data Analysis Experience: Proven experience in data analysis, especially in the customer service and sales domain, is vital as it ensures that the candidate can dive into our specific data needs and challenges with confidence and competence. Proficiency in Data Analysis Tools: Strong proficiency in data analysis tools like Excel, SQL, or data visualization software (Power Bi) ) is essential as these tools are commonly used for extracting insights from data. Understanding of Sales Processes: Having a deep understanding of the sales processes, customer interactions, challenges and dynamics involved in this field. This knowledge can be highly beneficial when analyzing sales data and identifying opportunities for improvement. Communication and Presentation Skills: Exceptional communication and presentation skills are crucial because the candidate will need to convey complex data-driven information in a clear and concise manner, facilitating understanding and decision-making within the organization. Detail-Oriented and Organized: Being detail-oriented and organized is important as it enables the candidate to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously. Given the multifaceted nature of the role, this skill set ensures efficiency and effectiveness in managing data analysis and training programs. Why join us? Bold, modern and agile, we’re Australia’s fastest-growing university, going from 164 students in 2014 to 40,000+ alumni across 115+ countries and 1900+ staff today. In 2020, Australian Financial Review named us one of the country’s most innovative companies. As we continue to establish ourselves as a truly global university, we never lose sight of our student-centric approach. Supported by teams of passionate people, you’ll find endless opportunities for professional development and career progression. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, age, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples for all positions.  What we offer: We support your personal passions, development and wellbeing, to make your working life a more rewarding experience. At Torrens University Australia , you’ll benefit from: Study free in a course/degree related to your positionFlexible working conditions, allowing you to work remotely and from a campus near you - Access to internal opportunities - Be supported to learn, grow and move across the organisation  Hiring process We aim to provide you with the necessary information you need at each stage of this process to put your best self forward. If you want to know more, or need assistance or accommodation during the recruiting phase, please contact our Recruitment Team at maur.bell@torrens.edu.au  To learn more about what makes Torrens University Australia a great place to work, visit https://www.torrens.edu.au/blog.  We’d love to hear from you. Applications close: 3rd December 2023 Job reference: R22103 If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete our application process, please contact our Human Resources Department at yourcareer@torrens.edu.auShow moreReport

At GenesisCare we want to hear from people who are as passionate as we are about innovation and working together to drive better life outcomes for patients around the world. Your Life’s Best Work An opportunity is now available for an analytical mind to join the consumer experience team as Customer (Patient) Insights Analyst on a 12 month contract. This role will be responsible for collecting, analysing and reporting on customer (patient) feedback and insights and will support the creation of a data- driven and insights led culture. Building a ‘customer first’ mindset and helping the leadership team get ‘closer to the customer’ is a core component of the role, as is supporting the organisation on our digital transformation journey. More specifically, you will: Draft questionnaires, polls, surveys, and other data collection resources. Summarise survey results in PPTs. Support the development of a best-in-class Insights and analytical capability and reporting within the CX team, with a focus on continuous improvement. Draw upon and integrate all available data sources to build a holistic story of the end-to-end customer(patient) journey, from inquiry stage through to advocacy/repeat customer. Support the development and delivery of high-quality reporting via dashboards and/or PPT and excel to advise on customer experience, service performance, sentiment, and brand performance Support the management of ad hoc qualitative and quantitative Insights to support and assess priority initiatives Assist with insights including operational metrics and where possible robust commercially oriented information that enables the team in decision-making and strategic planning. Survey management and troubleshooting (SurveyMonkey & Tableau) Influential storytelling with data A proactive approach to supplying the marketing team with insights to support patient access as well as digital analytics and reporting We're looking for someone who has: Solid analytical experience in a commercial environment Excellent Excel and analytical skills Excellent power point skills Support with report writing and content coordination. A collaborative and curious attitude to customer needs Experience analysing siloed information to support strategic decision making across business units. Knowledge to conduct statistical analysis where relevant, Project management experience e.g., content coordination Experience in survey design and delivery beneficial Reporting and working with CX/marketing to deliver annual reports. Experience with dashboards and turning insights into actionable outcomes. Benefits of joining our team: Work with a vibrant team aligned with providing the best patient experience possible and outcomes. Internal and external training and development opportunities. All employees and their family members have access to free confidential support that is completely external to GenesisCare including financial, nutritional and wellbeing coaching, legal advice & counselling. Enhance your holistic wellbeing with our Full Circle wellbeing program. Learn and grow with our award-winning development programs. Free access to thousands of LinkedIn training courses. Range of benefits available: Qantas membership discount, gym membership discount, 12 weeks paid parental leave, Bupa discount. About GenesisCare We are 1,300+ highly trained healthcare professionals and support staff in Australia designing innovative treatments and care for people with cancer. Our dedicated teams treat more than 30,000 patients annually.  People centricity is at the heart of what we do whether that person is a patient, a referring doctor, a partner or someone in our team. We aim to build culture of care that is patient focused and performance driven. Our people promise is "do your life's best work, by always growing, having a profound human impact and making great things happen together." If you'd like to make a difference, join us at GenesisCare. Covid 19 Vaccination Requirement In line with the Public Health Order, all GenesisCare employees are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. To be eligible for consideration to perform work for GenesisCare, all recruits must provide evidence of vaccination and comply with the requirements of the Public Health Order prior to appointment. GenesisCare is an Equal Opportunity Employer.Show moreReport

You're motivated & always thinking outside of the box We are passionate about offering our staff work life balance Together we place customers at the centre of what we do See yourself in the team The Digital Analytics & Insights team within Analytics, Data & Decision Science (ADDS) make data matter by turning our data into actionable insights, role modelling data management, and creating self-service methods to enable teams across Digital to make data driven decisions. The broader Analytics, Data & Decision Science (ADDS) team is responsible for leading the delivery of world class data, analytics and technology capabilities to improve the financial wellbeing of our business customers and communities. Do work that matters You will work directly with Digital Business Bank product owners and management to provide insights and reporting that will help shape the strategic direction of Digital for our Business Banking customers. Your insights & recommendations will directly contribute to the implementation of new features across our Digital platforms. With the support of senior members in our team, you will: Develop knowledge of the Business Bank and provide analytics guidance to improve the business customer experience across Digital Use data wrangling methods to deliver insights (including analysis on customer journey, segmentation, profiling, etc) and make recommendations Create data visualisations, dashboards and/or reports that provide a unified view across the Digital ecosystem to drive actionable insights for better business outcomes Create visibility of the customer journey including online and offline customer interactions by drawing on existing data sources such as the Group Data Warehouse and Omnia based big data solutions Pull together disparate pieces of information and compile these into a meaningful story that drives change and inform decision makers Communicate effectively and persuasively (verbal and written) to project teams and leaders We're interested in hearing from people who have: Passion for data: You are naturally curious and driven about how data can be used to identify new opportunities and make impactful business decisions. Communication: You are a confident and capable communicator. You welcome the opportunity to present your work to a wider audience, and are willing to put in the work required to explain it clearly and effectively Strong attention to detail Ability to articulate complex analytical requirements and findings in common non-technical terms Knowledge of visualisation best practices for complex data relationships (e.g. in Tableau, R-Shiny) Relevant experience/knowledge around working with digital data favourable If this sounds like you apply today! At Downer, we work with our customers to provide the vital services that connect people and communities. We provide a range of end-to-end services for the utilities sector, encompassing traditional power and gas, renewable energy, water, telecommunications and metering services. Downer is a leading provider of end-to-end telecommunications service solutions and offers integrated civil construction, wireless, electrical, solar, fibre, copper and radio network deployment capability.  ABOUT THE ROLE  Opportunity for a Supply Chain Data Analyst to join our logistics and procurement team supporting the Telecommunications business stream. The role will preferable be based at our North Ryde NSW office. Reporting to the Logistics and Supply Chain Manager, this role you will be responsible for:  creating and maintaining all supply chain reporting through Power BI. reviewing and presenting data to identify key insights into our customers and ways the data can be used for problem resolution. work alongside Downer clients to ensure that data transfers are accurate and reconciled to ensure 100% compliance in data. use data to support recommendations for optimizing the company methods in terms of supplies and transportation.  ABOUT YOU  Advanced Power BI report writing skills. Ability to develop and provide meaningful reports to support the supply chain function. Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of data and inventory models, forecasting methods, and inventory control procedures. Excellent communication skills with the ability to establish relationships at all levels. Ability to work independently and effectively within the team. Capable of performing in a fast-paced environment, within the accuracy requirements of the business. Qualification in Logistics, Warehousing or Supply Chain Management is desirable. CPMO/EPMO Analyst | Sydney NSW – Hybrid working   At Allianz, we’re proud to be one of the world’s leading insurance and asset management brands, with a workforce as diverse as the world around us.  We care about our customers, which is why we hire the very best people to further our commitment to securing the future of our customers, partners, and the community so we’re ready when they need it most. We offer our people a workplace where everyone feels like they belong, while promoting a culture of lifelong learning, development, and global mobility. Join us and share your ideas, be inspired, give back and feel proud to be a part an organisation doing meaningful work that matters like tackling climate change, mental health, and well-being.  Let’s care for tomorrow, so we can create a better future together, for everyone.  You'll be responsible for The primary purpose of the Enterprise PMO Analyst (EPMO) is to provide support for the ongoing success of the AAL Project governance and delivery framework, designed to enable the alignment of programs/projects to Strategic investment priorities, and the delivery of the outcomes to execute the strategy, as part of an enterprise PMO. This role is focused on ensuring our data is managed effectively as well as leading our ongoing reporting capability. Provide support throughout the lifecycle of projects/programs in adhering to the governance framework and supporting the operational activities required to implement the framework. Complete CPMO operational activities including preparation of governance materials, financial analysis and portfolio reports to support various governance forums and other tasks to support the governance framework. Participate in the development and maintenance of the governance model and seek to identify opportunities to enhance the model and deliver efficiencies for all participants. Maintain and develop the CPMO intranet and wiki sites to provide an effective and customer friendly repository of information, tools and templates. Support the tracking of the programs and projects running across the organisation at a portfolio level and assist in producing reporting for senior management and Group. Effective interaction and co-operation between program offices. Ensure appropriate level of communication to each stakeholder group. Assist with the maintenance, development and management of tools utilised within the CPMO to manage the governance framework, e.g. TM1, EPM.  About you The ideal candidate will love working with data, excel and have a strong attention for detail. Experience with VBA/Macros is highly regarded.  Experience in a project environment within a complex corporate environment Demonstrated experience working as a PMO or Data Analyst or similar role Demonstrated high attention to detail by completing tasks with thoroughness and accuracy and has the ability to quickly identify errors or inconsistencies within information. A high standard of inductive reasoning, with demonstrated experience in applying analytical and problem-solving skills. High attention to detail by completing tasks with thoroughness and accuracy and the ability to quickly identify errors or inconsistencies within information. Ability to plan and prioritise effectively, organise tasks and manage competing resources and demands. Demonstrated evidence of technical proficiency with systems, software, databases, reporting and communication tools. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, capable of communicating with clarity, impact and influence.  What's on offer Be part of a team that’s open-minded, supportive, and genuinely focused on customer outcomes. A sense of belonging in the workplace, where you are welcomed and encouraged to bring your most authentic self to work. An employer that is committed to supporting your work/life balance and is always open to conversations about flexible & remote working. Access to over 10,000 on-demand learning resources and programs, to support you in taking control of your career development. Insurance products. Deals and discounts across a great range of retail, tech, and travel brands, and offers for health and well-being. Initiatives to support your financial wellness through selected discounted Allianz insurance products, superannuation matching, salary sacrificing, novated leasing and our referral bonus scheme. The opportunity to take part in our Employee Share Purchase Program- own a piece of your employer.  About Allianz At Allianz, we care about everything that makes you, you. We believe in an equitable workplace that celebrates diversity and inclusion, where people of all genders, ages, religions, sexual orientations, abilities, and work statuses are not only welcomed, but valued for the perspectives and talents they bring to work. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone can thrive, grow, and contribute their unique perspectives to our collective success and reach their fullest potential.  Adjustments and support If you require any support and adjustments to participate equitably in our recruitment process, we encourage you to reach out to careers@allianz.com.au for a confidential conversation. Data driven role in a member support organisation in the Electrical Wholesale industry | Up to $95,000 + Super | Ongoing training  Baulkham Hills location, permanent full time, flexible start time Up to $95,000 + Super, parking onsite, ongoing training & development Friendly, supportive and experienced team   The Company  With a history over 30 years, the organisation supports their members in the Electrical Wholesale industry. This is a key support role providing assistance to the General Manager, Finance, members and suppliers. They are currently pushing more into the Digital Marketing space and this is an exciting time in the organisation.  There is a helpful and friendly culture in the small team. There has been good stability and security throughout the challenges of Covid and the levels of growth look strong in the coming years. You’ll be working alongside team members who know the software and processes well and will be providing ongoing training and support. For this newly created position.   The Role  Reporting to the General Manager, your tasks and duties will include:  Work with Finance to ensure deals are configured correctly in the software application, and processing data files from suppliers into the software system (Excel based) Track and report on monthly data against due dates, ensuring reports are received to deadlines and feedback to customers Exporting final data from the system and populate Excel reports as necessary Use Focus reporting and Excel spreadsheet system to process sales figures reports and ensure all sensitive data is kept confidential. Problem solving data issues and discrepancies   About You  To be successful in this role you will need:  Strong verbal and numerical skills To be comfortable working with large amounts of data – manipulating through Excel and learning custom software (training provided and superusers in the office) The ability to work independently or in a team environment under tight deadlines Excellent organisational skills and time management. A helpful, “can do” attitude. Great attention to detail and intermediate skills in MS Word and Excel   Benefits  Up to $95,000 + Super – potentially negotiable depending upon experience Work with a small team of helpful, supportive people Ability to get support for job related education and professional development Parking onsite, flexible start times Working closely with the GM and the Board members  If this sounds like you or someone you know please click ‘Apply’ or send them this link. Unlock Your Career Potential: Join Link Market Services as a Reporting Analyst! Are you a meticulous professional with a passion for regulatory reporting and a knack for problem-solving? Link Group is on the lookout for a Reporting Analyst to play a key role in meeting regulatory reporting requirements for our clients. About Us: As a Reporting Analyst, you'll be at the forefront of ensuring compliance with regulatory reporting requirements. From facilitating electronic lodgments to managing pre-reporting activities and project management, your role will be dynamic and impactful. Key Responsibilities: Prepare and lodge reports to the ATO and/or other government entities. Implement and maintain validations/reconciliations for accuracy. Collaborate with IT to understand technical aspects and resolve reporting issues. Project manage pre-reporting activities, including EOFY employee statement mailing. Analyze changes to legislation, scoping, and testing system enhancements. Prepare dashboard reporting for senior management. Requirements: Strong organizational and analytical skills. Proficiency in MS Excel or other data analysis tools. Understanding of SDLC; experience with system testing is advantageous. Finance industry experience or familiarity with share registry functions is desirable. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Proactive with strong leadership skills. Problem-solving expertise for complex process-related challenges. Experience & Attributes : Business analyst and/or finance experience is desirable. Understanding of tax legislation and compliance issues. Knowledge of ATO Reporting requirements. Experience in testing methodologies is a plus. Ability to update procedures and improve processes. Joining Link Group means you'll join an employer who fosters pathways for continuous learning and skill development, providing you with the tools you need to focus on career growth and personal development. We are a market leading provider of technology-enabled administration solutions, continually developing our offerings to expand with our clients' needs. Since our inception, Link Group has been entrusted by clients to handle sensitive data in a secure and confidential manner. Our core businesses of fund administration and securities registration are complemented by our expertise in digital solutions and data analytics. Our Corporate Markets division provides clients with a comprehensive corporate market offering that connects issuers to their stakeholders. Our uniquely integrated range of corporate markets capabilities includes shareholder management and analytics, stakeholder engagement, share and unit registry, and employee share plans. We also offer company secretarial support, as well as various specialist offerings such as insolvency solutions. We operate in twelve countries throughout Australasia, Asia, Africa, the Middle East, United Kingdom and Europe. Our teams combine a wealth of industry experience with a rigorous focus on client management to deliver a premium service underpinned by market leading digital technology provided by our Technology division . Link Group is building a dynamic, client focused, caring and inclusive culture that is built on the foundations of an entrepreneurial spirit, effective risk management, empathy and trust, and underpinned by its core values. We are an inclusive employer whose people work collaboratively. We encourage, support and value the various talents and perspectives of our people and promote a flexible and blended work environment where our people can thrive and their wellbeing is supported. We know that diversity drives better client outcomes, continuous improvement, and growth. Be part of the Link Group journey and together we will achieve our full potential. job_title: Reporting and Data Analyst Health Safety and Environment (HSE)
job_description: Rare opportunity to be part of an organisation working as part of nation-building energy projects High performing, diverse, inclusive, and supportive team Working a 9-day fortnight and 15.5% superannuation contribution  We are looking for an experienced, collaborative & driven professional, with a passion for and background in a range of data quality monitoring and reporting services in Health Safety and Environment (HSE) As the subject matter expert in the understanding of the underlying data structures used to manage HSE information, you will identify, and ensure data integrity and accuracy for a range of replicable analytics and dashboard reporting to optimise Transgrid’s use of HSE data to inform critical strategic decisions.With a background in Business intelligence and systems database administration you will have a business reporting analysis background with strong Power BI experience from a user lens. We are looking for someone with exceptional communication skills who has a flair for liaising with different stakeholders at different levels.  Your professional and engaging approach will allow you to play a supporting role in creating strong partnerships with SMEs to provide assistance in reporting enhancements to ensure reporting and data integrity is to the standard required by Transgrid. What are we looking for?  Advanced proficiency in Excel & Power BI (VBA & Power Query) and other business applications of MS Office, and possess strong analytical and data visualisation skills. Knowledge of HSE legislative and regulatory requirements and terminology for reporting and analytics. Strong experience in using data management systems (Camms / InEight / Pegasus would be advantaged) and drawing insights from large data sets. Experience in assisting to develop and deliver HSE & People reporting solutions and providing insightful commentary for business stakeholders. Demonstrated ability to work independently and pragmatically with a structured (yet flexible) approach to solve problems and find outcomes that truly provide value to the customer. Advanced knowledge of reporting and analytical services and data integration and presentation. Ability to draw correlation between data sets, analyse and provide insights and trend statistics. Continuous improvement mindset with a focus on automation. Tertiary level qualifications in Business Reporting & Analytics and looking to build a career in this space. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  Recognition & Reward  In return for your hard work, we have numerous benefits and initiatives to support you personally and professionally including but not limited to private health insurance discount, motor vehicle lease plan, career development support, study assistance program and workplace flexibility.  Join us and make it happen for your career, and for the millions of Australians who rely on our services every day.  Applications close on 26th November 2023  Our vacancy close dates may be subject to change; we will assess applications as they are received.  Transgrid is committed to Health and Safety, the Environment, Equal Employment Opportunity, Diversity and Ethical Practices. All applicants are expected to demonstrate an understanding of and commitment to these areas.Show moreReport

job_title: Data Analyst (Centre for Big Data Research)
job_description: Job no: 519504 Work type: full time Location: Sydney, NSW Categories: Information Technology, Research Administration support  Data Analyst (Centre for Big Data Research)  Employment Type: Full - time (35 hours a week)  Duration: 2 Year Fixed Term contract  Remuneration: $106K - $115K p.a. (+17% super and leave loading)  Location: Kensington, NSW  Why this role matters:  The role of Data Analyst will assist with the data management and analysis of the Australian and New Zealand Neonatal Network (ANZNN) clinical quality registry. This will include using a variety of statistical techniques to generate information on babies who have received neonatal intensive care in Australia and New Zealand.  Who you are:  Post-graduate qualifications (or nearing completion) in epidemiology or biostatistics or comparable experience and qualifications. Advanced skills in statistical software (e.g., R, STATA, SQL) for data management and statistical analysis. Demonstrated ability to independently develop and execute high level statistical analysis and data manipulation plans for reports and projects. Demonstrated ability to manage and analyse large health data collections Demonstrated skills in research design, method investigation and data interpretation. Demonstrated experience in undertaking independent research including the preparation of published peer-reviewed manuscripts for well-respected journals and/or government reports. Excellent attention to detail, commitment to quality and high-level organisational skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.  Benefits and Culture:  UNSW offer a competitive salary and access to a plethora of UNSW-perks including: 17% Superannuation and leave loading Additional 3 days of leave over the Christmas Period Access to lifelong learning and career development Progressive HR practices More information on the great staff benefits and culture can be found here.  How to apply:  Please click to submit your application online. Applications should not be sent to the contact listed below. Please provide a resume and a cover letter addressing the criteria listed in the position description.  A copy of the Position Description can be found on JOBS@UNSW.  Contact for role specific questions:  Sharon Chow – ANZNN Operations Manager sharon.chow@unsw.edu.au  Applications close: Sunday 19th November 2023, before 11.30pm  UNSW is committed to equity diversity and inclusion. Applications from women, people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, those living with disabilities, members of the LGBTIQ+ community; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged. UNSW provides workplace adjustments for people with disability, and access to flexible work options for eligible staff.  The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment.  Position Description  Advertised: 06 Nov 2023 AUS Eastern Daylight Time Applications close: 19 Nov 2023 AUS Eastern Daylight TimeShow moreReport

About the job   At Visagio, you have the opportunity to be part of something bigger. Recognised as a Great Place to Work®, we pride ourselves on being a people platform, where you are what makes us Visagio. Here you are supported by a global network of equally passionate and welcoming team members, ready to guide, teach, and grow with you.   About the role   We currently have opportunities for passionate individuals who want to make a significant difference by delivering value to our clients through a range of projects.   Your responsibilities as a Visagio Technology Consultant will include, but are not limited to:   Delivering comprehensive business solutions through the ability to combine a strategic overview with a concise and pragmatic approach. Performing data analysis and gathering insights for clients' recommendations. Bringing an innovative and problem-solving approach to all challenges faced by our clients. Integration and contribution to support a fast-growth company to continue to achieve the extraordinary.   About you (Key skills and competencies)   A degree in Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Actuarial Science or related disciplines is preferred. Strong work ethic and commitment to achieving the desired goals, considering changes in deadlines and scope of activities. Excellent oral and written communication skills, being able to engage with diverse audiences within both the project team and the client. Demonstrable experience in data analysis and gathering of insights for project recommendations. Ability to illustrate a very robust fact-based approach to problem-solving. Passion for working with data and learning new methodologies, applications and skills for analysis. Desired proficiency in a range of software tools and techniques such as Excel Modelling, R Programming, VBA, SQL, Python, Data Visualisation, Machine Learning, and Microsoft Power Platform, knowing that intensive training will be provided to expand your skill set. Understanding of mining operations and practices is highly desirable but not required.   More information   Visagio offers extensive learning opportunities for technical and personal development, career guidance, and a highly competitive remuneration package. All candidates are considered, including international students with full-time working rights.   About Visagio   Founded in 2003, Visagio has evolved to become a business transformation and people-platform that helps organisations worldwide achieve their goals through projects that range from diagnosis and strategic recommendation to solution implementation in a practical, agile, and sustainable manner. With offices located in Australia, Europe, and Latin America, our area of expertise extends to over 40 countries.   Through advisory services, management, and project delivery, we pride ourselves on our excellence in delivery for our clients and partners, from diagnosis and design to implementation. Some of our domains of expertise are:   Business Transformation; Digital Transformation; Analytics-oriented decision-making (simulation, optimisation, AI/ML); Solutions Development   We are a certified Great Place to Work™ in Australia, and we are among the two best companies to work for in Latin America and Brazil, reinforcing our purpose of being an excellent platform for good-hearted and talented people to achieve the extraordinary. Since our establishment, entrepreneurship and innovation have been at the core of our DNA and are fostered in our employees.   Our culture   By being part of our team, you will have the opportunity to integrate into an excellent organisational climate. From day one, we are all encouraged to collaborate by sharing experiences and working closely with all consultants, strengthening our network.   UniVisagio (our corporate university) supports our value of continuous learning and development, and all team members are paired with a buddy to help navigate through any questions they may have and a partner who will provide long-term career guidance.   Our purpose is to be a platform that enables growth in each member of our group so that everyone can make a real difference together.   Diversity and inclusion   At Visagio, it is our priority to ensure an equitable environment where everyone feels free to exercise their full potential. Through numerous initiatives, our Diversity and Inclusion team promotes topics relevant to our society and future generations.   Visagio is an equal-opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion.   Visagio acknowledges the Australian Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples as the first inhabitants of the nation and the traditional custodians of the lands where we live, learn and work. We acknowledge the Noongar people as the custodians and guardians of the boodja (land) on which our company is located and where we conduct our business.Show moreReport

Sales Data Analyst Salt have partnered with a global financial software company that is on the lookout for a Sales Data Analyst to join their team on a 12 month contract.  This role will play a critical role in providing insights to sales leaders in the organisation so as to optimise sales performance and positively impact small to medium businesses.  What’s in it for you? Work for an established global business that is publicly listed and recognised by leading publications as a great place to work Opportunity to work in a high growth sales operations function with experienced sales leaders Hybrid working environment out of a beautiful Sydney office location Join a passionate and high performing team utilising the latest analytical technologies Play a key role in driving sales performance and creating real business impact $550-700 including super per day  What you’ll bring? 5+ years of professional experience as a Data Analyst Experience working with sales teams and providing data, reporting, analytics and insights to help optimise sales performance Experience with Excel and Salesforce Experience with BI tools like Qlik Sense and Tableau Strong stakeholder management skills and ability to manage projects end-to-end You’re a data storyteller with the ability to break down complex problems and turn them into actionable insights that can be communicated concisely to both technical and non-technical stakeholders Bachelors Degree in Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics or related field  What you’ll be doing? Utilising multiple analytical tools to capture data and help deliver reports and insights to sales leaders Communicating with various stakeholders across the business and delivering on key analytics initiatives Helping to tell stories through the use of data and help educate various decision makers in the organisation Collaborating with others to help maximise sales operations and product capabilities Innovating and finding new and improved ways to extract data and deliver key business insights  How to Apply?  To apply online, please click on the link below!  Alternatively, for a confidential discussion or to discuss other tech roles in Melbourne or tech roles in Sydney, please contact Jimmy Flynn on 0488 732 269. Salt is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.  Job Information Job Reference: JO-2311-339193 Salary: AU$550.00 - AU$700.00 per day Salary per: day Job Duration: 12 Months Job Start Date: 27/11/2023 Job Industries: Technology Job Locations: Sydney CBD Job Types: ContractShow moreReport

Our world is rapidly changing and the greatest challenge for our country, industry, and community is the transition to a low-carbon economy. Ampcontrol want to be at the forefront of this transition, create change and support our customers, all by tackling the challenges they will face so that they can remain competitive and prosper. To achieve our new vision, we are realistic that we also need to transform our business and the way we work. By doing so we will accelerate transformational activities so that Ampcontrol is positioned to support our customers in the global energy transition as rapidly as possible and at scale. EMPLOYEE BENEFITS: Flexible work arrangements; WFH, compressed work week or 9-day Fortnight Paid parental leave. Salary packaging. Purchased leave. Private Health Care discounts. Wellbeing programs and discounts. Education assistance and personal career development. ABOUT THE ROLE: Ampcontrol is embarking on an exciting journey to enhance our existing data analytics and reporting platform to better serve our business. Joining as a part of an established, high-performing Digital team, you will have the opportunity to help shape the future of our data analytics and reporting function. This is a permanent full-time opportunity based in Tomago, NSW. We are looking for a motivated Data Analyst to support Ampcontrol in harnessing our data to drive informed decision-making. Working within our Digital team as an integral part of our existing analytics and reporting function, you will be responsible for creating and maintaining management dashboards and ad hoc reports for the wider Ampcontrol group. This role will see you use your data analysis skills to drive improvements and efficiencies in our reporting capabilities and contribute to overall data governance for our solutions. ABOUT YOU: Our ideal candidate will be able to interpret business requirements and develop technical specifications to contribute to overall deliverables. You will be excited by the design and development of high-end reporting solutions, with a passion for connecting the dots between data and end-user requirements. If you have any of the following skills or experience, we encourage you to apply: Experience with developing technical BI solutions, preferably Power BI Python/R for data analysis/wrangling (e.g. pandas or tidyverse packages) SQL database management experience/training Data warehousing – including transformation and modelling of data at enterprise scale Visualisation and interaction design experience Experience managing the report development lifecycle, from requirements gathering to development, testing and maintenance Development of reporting solutions technical design documentation  WHY AMPCONTROL? For over 50 years Ampcontrol has achieved and celebrated a growing workforce across the world. Amongst the technological firsts, awards, impressive growth and global reach, our focus on our customers and a philosophy of solving problems that others can’t, has meant our solutions redefine industry expectations. At Ampcontrol, we are united by the principles of safety, people, innovation, customer and performance. Our people and values make our business better and are at the heart of everything we do. We are committed to investing in our people and provide a supportive, healthy and safe working environment for all our employees. If you believe you have the right skills, experience and passion for succeeding in this role, please submit your cover letter and resume for consideration via the link. VideoShow moreReport

Join our Global Market Risk team based in Sydney who play a key role in building and maintaining models covering all asset classes across the group.  At Macquarie, we are working to create lasting value for our communities, our clients and our people. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 54 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drive outcomes.  What role will you play?  As a Quantitative Market Risk Analyst/Associate, you will be responsible for building and maintaining Market Risk models including but not limited to, Value at Risk (VaR) models for Traded Market Risk (such as regulatory VaR used for capital under APS 116, and the Fundamental Review of the Trading Book) and Non-Traded Market Risk (e.g. Interest Rate Risk in the Banking Book). You will engage with various stakeholders, build out new models, and enhance existing models to meet the dynamic requirements of Market Risk.  What you offer  Proficient programming skills and ability to traverse various programming languages (such as Python, R, and C++) Strong understanding of fundamental quantitative/computational finance principles and techniques and excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to communicate effectively with key stakeholders, both verbally and in writing Tertiary qualification in finance, mathematics, statistics, engineering or a related quantitative discipline Ability to balance being immersed in detailed day-to-day activities whilst managing longer term activities and objectives Keen interest in financial markets.  We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.  Benefits  Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria and location, include:  Hybrid and flexible working arrangements Wellbeing and service bonus leave Up to 20 weeks paid parental leave as well as benefits to support you as you transition to life as a working parent Paid volunteer leave and donation matching Range of benefits to support your physical, psychological and financial wellbeing  About the Risk Management Group  In our Risk Management Group, you will be part of an independent, and centralised function, responsible for independent and objective review and challenge, oversight, monitoring and reporting in relation to Macquarie’s material risks. Our divisions include behavioural risk, compliance, credit, financial crime risk, internal audit, market risk, operational risk and governance, prudential risk, and Risk Management Group central.  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for a role regardless of their identity, including gender, race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status, marital or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disabilities, or socio-economic background.  If you require adjustments to your working arrangements or the recruitment process, please let us know when applying.   About Macquarie A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future. Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.  Job no: RMG-974799 Work type: Permanent - Full time Location: Sydney Category: Junior, Quantitative Analytics, Risk Management Group: Risk Management Group Division: Market Risk Recruiter: Owen Fox Opening Date: 22/10/2023Show moreReport

If you live in Australia or New Zealand, you’ve likely heard of AMP. But at a time when society is changing, we are too. We’re now a nimbler business with new leadership and thinking. For us, these are exciting times. There’s a real potential for big thinkers to help us redefine what financial services could be. And turn our legacy into something even more positive and powerful for the future. Help people create their tomorrow, while you create yours We help people with their banking, super, retirement and finances. Through upturns, downturns, recessions, and major life transitions. Every day, we help people see and make more of their financial potential, so that they can create their tomorrow. And we’ve been doing it for over 170 years. If we do our job well, we genuinely add to the prosperity of our country and its people. How you’ll make an impact The Credit Risk Analyst and Insights supports the Bank management in (i) providing specialised and aggregated reporting on the Bank’s credit risk (internal and regulatory reporting), with continual emphasis on automation, self-service and interactive and real-time reporting, (ii) providing actionable insights into new business inflow, client payment, repayment and discharge behaviour, arrears, cure and losses, and (iii) working with business and finance teams on loan loss provisioning processes. Credit Risk Analyst provides the following core deliverables: Undertake analysis, modelling and reporting on mortgage credit risk as directed Take ownership of data and reporting by providing meaningful insights in line with credit risk events and emerging trends. Discuss these issues with Credit Insights and Analytics team, and with relevant people in Home Lending ‘tribe’ to assess, quantify, and manage credit risk Utilise analytics techniques – using Excel, coding, automation, and visualisation tools – as directed to assess future risk, opportunities, and translate results into meaningful solutions to enhance decision making. Prepare key reporting for Bank Credit Risk Committee Group, Board updates, and regulatory reporting Liaise with stakeholders to prepare the Bank Credit Risk Committee pack and take minutes in the meeting as the secretary What you will bring to the team Ideally, you will bring the following experiences to this role: A bachelor’s degree (or higher) in a quantitative discipline like finance, economics, mathematics, statistics Relevant experience (at least two years’ experience) in a financial risk management context Proficiency in Excel and Power BI. Some coding experience (Python or R) preferred Ability to maintain stakeholder relationships at a range of levels Understanding of the financial services industry In addition to the above capabilities, the successful candidate should also be able to demonstrate the following: Analytical skills and the ability to think laterally and strategically. Attention to detail and the ability to take ownership of reporting and projects from start to finish Understanding of Banking functions and associated risks such as capital, liquidity and market risks Ability to constructively challenge, consult and advise, whilst maintaining excellent relationships and the respect of teammates and stakeholder Strong organisational skills with the zeal to automate and enhance reporting to real-time, interactive and self-service, and reduce key-person dependencies in key processes Strong communication and interpersonal skills, to inform or influence audiences You’ll thrive here if… If you can adapt from BAU to the ambiguous with ease, you’ll do well here. Change is never easy, so bring your commitment, grit and growth mindset. Because we run lean, you’ll be expected to jump in and deliver across a variety of areas. Meaning, you’ll be closer to the action and executive decisions that influence where we go next. If you’re someone that can hold their own, you’ll find AMP quite liberating. Why we think you’ll love working at AMP Doing what we’ve always done is not an option, so your clever ideas will get airtime here. You’ll be encouraged to speak up and try new things. If they don’t work, we move on – better for it. We know there’s no one way of doing things. So, you won’t have to sacrifice who you are or how you work to fit in here. We’re inclusive and flexible in many of the ways you’d expect. And in some of the ways you wouldn’t. As long as your health and wellbeing come first - at home and at work. In fact, most of what makes AMP such a welcoming, enjoyable place to work are our people. Wherever you go, you’ll find moments to connect, feel valued and do meaningful work.Show moreReport

Date: 9 Nov 2023 Location: Sydney, NSW, AU, 2000 Brisbane, QLD, AU, 4000 Melbourne, VIC, AU, 3000 Employment Type: Permanent Full Time Permanent full-time position Location agnostic hybrid working arrangements Use your analytical skills and Investment knowledge to champion change initiatives  The Role As an Investment Governance and Reporting Analyst, you will support the timely and accurate production of investment reporting, and the design, co-ordination and delivery of initiatives and improvements to systems and processes, to improve member and investor outcomes and ensure compliance with investment governance policy, service standards, and regulatory requirements.  Key Responsibilities: Prepare and deliver accurate and timely periodic reporting Ensure integrity in information reported and liaise as needed with other team members to resolve data quality issues Perform calculations and run system queries relevant to the accurate provision of performance reporting or forecasts Maintain market information, data, and statistics for Wealth Management Products Respond to and resolve enquiries from stakeholders in relation to reports and data supplied by the team Implement business simplification where consistent with business strategy Meet with stakeholders to gather and analyse change requirements Support and champion change initiatives and projects utilising analytical skills and Investment knowledge  To be successful in this role you will possess: Proven relevant industry experience Tertiary qualification in a relevant business discipline Working knowledge of the Australian superannuation industry including applicable regulation Knowledge and direct experience in investment product management or governance roles advantageous Ability to deliver operational excellence in a complex organization Demonstrated stakeholder management, analysis, reporting and documentation skills Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Word and strong attention to detail Excellent communication skills to articulate complex legislative requirement framework to stakeholders  Benefits Development opportunities at an ASX top 200 company A professional, supportive and friendly culture A range of corporate and lifestyle benefits  The Business MLC Australia is part of the Insignia Financial group, one of Australia’s leading wealth management organisations, undertaking a rapid and exciting transformation. The Insignia Financial group has been helping Australians secure their future since 1846. Over the decades, we have grown substantially to become a leading provider of quality financial services and are listed on the Australian Securities Exchange in the ASX top 200 (ASX: IFL).  To Apply  Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.  Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time.  At Insignia Financial, we have a culture of belonging. We are an ‘every person’ organisation that welcomes and appreciates everyone for who they are. If you need assistance or an adjustment during the application process because of your personal circumstances, please reach out and let us know. We recognise and celebrate the value of individual difference.Show moreReport

Responsibilities TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.  Why Join Us Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. Join us.  Team Introduction Popular products of TikTok are all empowered by our cutting-edge cloud technologies. As data analyst in this team, you will have the opportunity to tackle challenges by analyzing and mining the huge amount of data to understand and improve the video streaming experience of billions of users around the world while leveraging your experience and expertise in data analysis and data mining.  Responsibilities  Be responsible for the data analysis related to our live streaming/RTC product Provide the solution to serve our business partners from the data perspective Independently design and implement the data model to solve practical business problems and be able to drive execution with stakeholders Collaborate with other teams(such as:PM、RD、TS) to discover and solve online issues, and be able to improve service quality by improving the system and solutions  Qualifications Requirements  Truly passionate about working on large and complex data sets to unravel actionable insights, drive discussions and solve challenging problems in a new and rapidly growing space. Bachelor's degree in Math, Statistics, or Computer Science related major Skilled in data manipulation with SQL, Python, R or other programming languages/tools. Experience in building dashboards and conducting quantitative analysis, visualization, and reporting. Experience with data analysis, if Experience in livestream/RTC area is a plus. Experience in root cause analysis is a plus. Experience in mentoring and developing people is a plus.  TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.  In the spirit of reconciliation, TikTok acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of country throughout Australia and their connections to land, sea and community. We pay our respect to their Elders past and present and extend that respect to all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples today.  #LI-HybridShow moreReport

job_title: Risk Analyst - Governance, Risk and Compliance
job_description: Join our team as a risk analyst at PKF Sydney We are seeking a talented individual with strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills to join the Workplace Assurance arm of our Governance, Risk and Compliance Team at PKF. The opportunity We are offering an exciting opportunity to an outstanding candidate to work in one of the fastest growing and most dynamic teams within PKF.  This is not your traditional accounting role!  We are seeking a talented individual with strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills to join the Workplace Assurance arm of our Governance, Risk and Compliance Team at PKF.  Our team supports our clients in ensuring they comply with complex wage, industrial, workplace and culture obligations. Our team represents an impressive suite of blue chip national and international corporations. You will have the opportunity to work directly with senior members of these major corporations. About PKF PKF is an award winning leader in the provision of these services, and we are growing. More employees and companies want to work with us because of our values, culture and ability to make it happen. We make a dedicated investment commitment to our people and clients.  Our Governance, Risk and Compliance Team is made up of highly motivated and dedicated individuals that are committed to giving a first-class service to our clients. We will provide a challenging but supportive environment, with exposure to a diverse cross section of businesses, or the opportunity to specialise, if preferred.  At PKF, we create a positive environment that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential.  We offer: Competitive remuneration package, including 5 weeks of annual leave, 2 additional long weekends, and the day of your birthday off. Exceptional opportunity for career development and progression. Opportunity for secondment in PKF offices overseas. Work/Life balance encouraged. Friendly culture and team events. Study support and training. Collaborative and inclusive working environment. Fitness passport available. Well-being initiatives. Employee referral cash bonuses. Key responsibilities An opportunity also exists to broaden your skills through working on a diverse range of governance and risk assignments including internal audit projects, fraud and regulatory investigations, and modern slavery reviews.  This is a rare opportunity to join a market leading team and work directly on complex and interesting engagements with some of Australia's most well-known brands and organisations. What you need to apply About You: Bachelor's degree in accounting, business, commerce, economics, law, or similar field. A strong willingness to learn and the ability to solve complex problems. Highly value communications and client experience. Do your best work in a fast paced, agile, and dynamic team. Previous experience working in audit, risk or compliance would be beneficial but not essential. Strong Microsoft Excel skills. Data analytics experience (IDEA, Power BI, Tableau, etc.) would also be highly regarded. Are keen to take your career to the next level supported by a team and firm that will consistently back you.  Are you up for the challenge? Apply now.Show moreReport

Why join Stryker?  We are proud to be named one the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine! Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com  Our total rewards package offering includes bonuses, healthcare, insurance benefits, retirement programs, wellness programs, as well as service and performance awards – not to mention various social and recreational activities, all of which are location specific.  Know someone at Stryker?  Be sure to have them submit you as a referrral prior to applying for this position. Learn more about our employee referral program About Stryker Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better. The company offers innovative products and services in Medical and Surgical, Neurotechnology, Orthopedics, and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 100 million patients annually. About this role  We are looking for an Analyst - Data Quality to help drive the optimal utilization of data as a strategic asset. This pivotal role entails analyzing data quality, identifying root causes of issues, and crafting innovative solutions. You'll ensure ongoing data quality reporting, collaborate with data owners for swift issue resolution, and establish and enforce data standards and policies. Your expertise will provide invaluable support to projects and change initiatives, contributing to Stryker's Data and Analytics strategy. Who We Want Collaborative partners. People who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas, information, use cases, and industry analyses to develop best practices. Dedicated achievers. People who thrive in a fast-paced environment and will stop at nothing to ensure a project is complete and meets regulations and expectations. Self-starters. People who take ownership of their work and need no prompting to drive productivity, change, and outcomes. Analytical problem solvers. People who go beyond just fixing to identify root causes, evaluate optimal solutions, and recommend comprehensive upgrades to prevent future issues. What You Will Do Proficient in observing, managing, and rectifying master data inconsistencies within two JDE instances across three regions. Utilize data expertise to develop and execute monitoring reports, ensuring masters' integrity and fulfilling specific business needs beyond standard reporting capabilities. Demonstrate advanced understanding of information flow and its correlation with divisional software applications. Capable of addressing complex data structure and governance inquiries while prioritizing positive stakeholder experiences. Analyze, investigate, and independently resolve broad-scoped data matching issues using sound judgment. Establish strong working relationships with internal and external customers and colleagues to gather necessary data for assigned tasks. Exhibit competence in system navigation and processes to research and resolve processing issues, contributing to the testing of new processes. Collaborate effectively with local and global divisional functional teams, acting as a subject matter expert and interdivisional resource to ensure project success and meet short and long-term goals. Provide support for stakeholder Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and deliver Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), maintaining up-to-date and reflective dashboards of completed work. What You Will Need Strong understanding of quality management systems and experience in navigating complex interdivisional procedures and policies. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across all organizational levels. Demonstrated excellence in time management, coupled with the capacity to make independent judgments. Proficiency in business process improvement and implementing systematic enhancements using LEAN and Six Sigma methodologies. Demonstrated creative problem-solving skills, providing innovative solutions to complex challenges with no clear-cut answers. Meticulous attention to detail and adeptness in conveying intricate issues in a clear and concise manner. Proficient record-keeping skills, ensuring accuracy and precision. Preferred tertiary qualifications in statistics, mathematics, computer science, information management, or related fields. Excellent team culture – we have fun whilst we work!
