At Slyp we are in the business of customer experience. We think it's crazy that you pay with a smartphone but still receive a centuries old paper receipt. Traditional receipts are nothing but a burden to customers and outside of a proof of purchase, they provide no value to retailers or consumers. We are dedicated to creating world-class technology and helping the environment, one receipt at a time. That's why we have invented the Slyp Smart Receipt. Why is Slyp a great place to work? Slyp Village attracts top-notch talent from around the globe. Our inclusive environment allows Slypsters to unleash their creativity and drive, all while being part of a movement that's shaking things up for the better.  Here are some of our benefits:  Employee Stock Ownership Program (ESOP) Generous L&D program - $1500 budget per anniversary for you to use towards honing your craft Slyp Gives - we run 2 community give back days each year Competitive leave policies including parental leave Flexible work and the option to work from anywhere in the world for a period of time Sweet pet friendly office, monthly (sometimes random) lunch and learns and always on team fun and experience program  What we are looking for You should have strong mathematical and numeracy skills and a good understanding of SQL, ETL frameworks, and website scripts. You will explore and analyse data to forecast and optimise capabilities, build data-driven products, and design and maintain key data assets. You will help with designing, implementing, and optimising data pipelines. Your activities will include prototyping new algorithms, presenting and visualising data, consulting with strategic partners, performing statistical analysis, forecasting trends, and completing ad-hoc analysis. You will also provide mathematical modelling and analysis capabilities to support other business teams.  What does a normal day look like? Data Modelling and Analysis: Utilise statistical analysis to extract valuable insights Develop predictive models to improve business processes and decision-making. Exploration in machine learning is a plus Reporting and Visualisation: Create and maintain dashboards and reports for internal and external stakeholders Communicate findings effectively to help guide business strategies Performance Optimisation: Continuously optimise data pipelines for efficiency, scalability and cost Work on data engineering best practices to ensure the infrastructure is robust and reliable Data Quality Assurance: Implement data quality checks and monitoring to ensure accuracy and consistency of the data Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues as they arise Data Integration: Develop and maintain data pipelines to collect, cleanse, and organise data from various sources Data Security: Ensure data privacy and security standards are adhered to and implement necessary safeguards What experience or knowledge you will bring to the team Bachelor's or higher degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Systems, Economics or a related field. Familiarity with AWS data services (e.g., Glue, Redshift, Quicksight, Athena, S3, Sagemaker). Familiarity with other AWS services is a plus (e.g., Lambda, Kinesis, DMS, IAM, KMS). Proven experience in data engineering, including SQL, Python, ETL processes and data modelling. Experience in working with large datasets and data warehousing solutions. Familiarity with machine learning techniques and tools is a plus.  And what other experience or knowledge would help, if you have it!! Previous experience in a similar role in the tech or fintech industry is a plus. Previous experience in data analytics for the retail industry is highly desirable. Our recruitment process 1. Screening phone call with our People Partner 2. Technical Interview with Senior Engineering Manager 3. Interview with Engineering and Data Leads 4. Final Interview with CTO and Co-Founder Requirements Due to our hybrid working model, we are currently unable to accept applications for remote work. We will only be considering candidates based in Sydney, NSW.Show moreReport

About the Company TradeMax is a leading global multi-asset financial service provider. We provide clearing and broking services with more than 30,000 tradeable products such as Forex, CFDs, equities, and bonds. We strive to streamline and simplify our processes ensuring that all our clients' needs are met efficiently. Our vision is to build a financial ecosystem that allows every participant in the world to have a better trading experience. With a great event, we’ll be part of just behind the corner, this is your chance to join the fastest-growing CFD provider in Australia, make a significant contribution to its success, and enjoy being part of something special. This is also a great opportunity to gain knowledge and experience that is impossible to obtain in other industries. If you’re looking for a fast-paced environment and an exciting opportunity, then we are the company for you. Your Role Possessing exceptional analytical and statistical skills and a deep understanding of trading strategies and financial markets, to consistently achieve outstanding results and performance targets as required by the clients. Using statistical skills to make sense of market data and identify patterns, trends, and relationships. Monitoring market trends, developing trading strategies, and executing trades across a range of financial instruments, including forex, commodities, and indices. Using statistical techniques, including Excel, MATLAB, Python, and R, to analyse market data, such as price movements, trading volumes, and market indicators, to develop trading strategies and make informed decisions. Evaluating the performance of trading strategies and make adjustments based on the data analysis results. Demonstrating great attention to detail and was able to quickly identify trading opportunities while mitigating potential risks. Implementing insights and market analysis with colleagues, contributing to the overall success of our trading team. Developing and implementing statistical models to perform risk management. Using techniques such as value-at-risk (VaR) analysis and Monte Carlo simulations to model potential scenarios and estimate the likelihood of different outcomes. Using statistical analysis of market sentiment data, such as news articles, social media posts, and economic indicators, to gauge the mood of the market and identify potential price movements. Keeping strong work ethics and collaborating with clients about products selection. Requirements At least a minimum 2 years’ full-time experience in performing the above tasks in financial service company must have a tertiary qualification in a related field Proficiency in financial modelling, data analysis etc. Strong analytical mindset with the ability to interpret complex financial data have excellent communication and influencing skillsShow moreReport

Working with NRAR provides a chance to make sure water is used lawfully so that all communities and the environment get a fair share.   The Data Analyst Software Engineer provides advice on software/technological/data designs, builds software/data solutions, provides statistical information and analysis to support evidence-based decision making in regulation and compliance.   About You   As our Data Analyst Software Engineer, you will provide advice and guidance to internal clients on programmatical, statistical and intelligence matters in support of the agency’s role as Natural Resources Access Regulator to enable better, faster, automated data and software for informed decision making for our customers.  You will design statistical outputs to contribute to the production of regular statistical and reporting products for public dissemination and provide data and analysis to support intelligence team performance and workflow management.  You will have experience with full stack development, design, unit test and maintenance of high volume, highly scalable software, the analyst will work extensively with SQL Server and Oracle databases, including an understanding of Time Based and SQL Database design and operation in Oracle. Proficiency in programming languages including: Python; Javascript; HTML; SQL etc.   Want to know more about us? Watch what we do via our YouTube Channel Natural Resources Access Regulator (NRAR) - YouTube   For more information read the full Role Description: Data Analyst Software Engineer   For more information hit Apply to visit the iworkfor.nsw.gov.au website.   About Us  The Department of Planning and Environment’s (DPE) vision is to create thriving environments, communities and economies for the people of New South Wales. We strive to be a high-performing, world-class public service organisation that celebrates and reflects the full diversity of the community we serve and seeks to embed Aboriginal cultural awareness and knowledge throughout the department.  The Natural Resources Access Regulator (NRAR) Act 2017 enacted by the NSW Parliament in November 2017 provides for the establishment of a new independent water regulator in NSW focused on establishing best practice water regulation underpinned by ethics, good governance and stakeholder engagement to deliver effective and reliable water regulation for the people of NSW.   To Apply  If excited by the information above, we look forward to receiving your application, including a copy of your resume and cover letter expressing your interest and suitability for the role.   DPE strongly recommends all applicants who can be safely vaccinated for COVID-19, to be so.   Appointment is subject to the satisfactory participation in mandatory pre-employment probity screening.   Applications close Sunday 19 November 2023 at 11:55PM.   Should you require further information about the role please contact Martin Stuart via martin.stuart@nrar.nsw.gov.au.   A recruitment pool may be created for ongoing and temporary opportunities of the same role or role type that may become available over the next 18 months.   Looking for more information or assistance in applying?  Our Diversity team can assist to:  provide alternative formats to apply make adjustments to the recruitment process offer information about workplace adjustments and support networks  We encourage people with disability to apply. If you have disability and require more information on adjustments and assistance to apply, contact the Diversity team on Diversity@DPIE.nsw.gov.au (please include reference number).   If you are an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander check out Our Mob on Country https://www.dpie.nsw.gov.au/premiers-priorities/our-mob-on-country to see the work we do and get assistance in applying. About the job Established in 2002, SuperRatings is Australia’s first and most respected Superannuation research company. We exist to give Funds, members, the superannuation industry, journalists and commentators a deeper understanding of how the industry is tracking and why and how individual funds and products perform the way they do. We have the most in-depth data in the industry and we can say with confidence, there is no other provider that delivers the same depth of information that we do.  We are currently seeking an Insights Analyst to join our SuperRatings team on a Permanent, full-time basis. As a member of the SuperRatings Insights team, the role is structured to provide a range of in-depth insights to SuperRatings clients and the industry more broadly.  Responsibilities Responsibility for the coordination and delivery of in-depth analysis of SuperRatings existing data (whilst also considering opportunities for new data sets) in order to prepare reports, media releases and assist with the preparation and delivery of accumulation and pension benchmark reports on an annual basis. Specifically, in consultation with the Insights Manager, the role is expected to undertake the following:  Data Analysis and Insights: Review and synthesise data collected by SuperRatings to identify key trends across the industry in order to provide in-depth insights that can be delivered to both clients and the broader market. This may include, but is not limited to, market reviews, overall opinion and outlook, and analysis of investment structures and performance. Analyse relevant data and prepare monthly media releases for each key audience for distribution to clients and media outlets to build SuperRatings brand as a thought leader. Identify key industry trends emanating from SuperRatings data gathering to draft ‘Top 3’s’ for both the accumulation and pension benchmark reports, which are prepared on an annual basis. Support SuperRatings’ focus on driving deeper and faster insights into our data, to make it easier for our clients to engage with us and our research. Assist in the preparation and analysis of data to support any retainer activity that SuperRatings may undertake with clients. Use a variety of sources including PDS, Annual Reports, ARFI and internal data systems to deliver key reports for distribution to clients. Manage, coordinate and produce ad-hoc reports and data requests. Prepare presentations and papers to the Trustee Boards and Steering Committees in respect of our superannuation clients. Analyse data to ascertain appropriateness, testing assumptions, identifying trends and abnormalities. Investigate the impact of changes to legislation/regulation on the functioning of existing products   Communication: Be responsible for managing and prioritising own workflow and multi-tasking deliverables, including that of more junior staff, to ensure more senior members of the team have appropriate time to review prior to the final delivery to the client. Support delivery of key market trends and high-quality strategic insights to superannuation clients. Provide ideas and solutions into the overall process for each engagement and research project. Where appropriate, present the outcomes of any analysis of key trends to the broader SuperRatings clients and team to assist them in understanding the key concepts of the research undertaken. Prepare meeting papers/agendas/action items for internal and external meetings. Attend, contribute to and record key points from internal and external meetings, particularly annual rating review meetings with superannuation funds. Be aware of and communicate to other employees and to the business, opportunities for improvement in processes, practices and procedures.   Support broader business objectives: Suggest and assess the viability of potential new products in line with business growth objectives. Assist with the design and development of new products approved by the business. Assist with testing of new products/enhanced functionality to ensure they are meeting product requirements. Provide training and support to internal staff on new products and enhancements to existing products where appropriate. Research and conduct at least one internal technical training session each year. Be actively involved in team meetings and company activities. Provide appropriate support for other team members and other company employees to achieve the team business goals.   Skills and Experience: 3-5 years’ experience in the superannuation industry. Broad understanding of all areas of superannuation, encompassing compliance with relevant legislation (SIS Act, SG Act, Corporations Act and the Income Tax Legislation), Regulator views (APRA, ASIC) and market practice. Specialist knowledge and experience in a number of areas. Demonstrated high level of problem solving and analytical skills with a positive ‘can do’ attitude. Proven ability to grasp technical concepts and translate these for our clients and as part of our service offering. Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with a variety of people as well as build strong working relationships. Excellent communication skills, both oral and written and an ability to work under pressure. An ability to work independently and understand appropriate accountability. Strong attention to detail. Demonstration of initiative, creativity and follow-through. Strong time management and prioritisation skills to meet deadlines and coordinate responsibilities. High level of energy and enthusiasm.   Essential qualifications: An under-graduate degree in business or finance discipline. MS Word (intermediate). MS PowerPoint (intermediate). MS Excel (intermediate to advanced). MS Outlook   Highly regarded qualifications: RG146 compliant. Post graduate qualifications such as FINSIA, DFP, CIMA, MBA.   To apply - Aus Citizens & Permanent residents only If you are interested in this exciting opportunity with SuperRatings, please click apply and upload your CV. All applications are strictly confidential.Show moreReport

Opportunity to be part of an enterprise-wide data program Develop your career in a collaborative environment Do work that makes a difference. This is an opportunity to work with the Financial Stability Department at the Reserve Bank of Australia to consolidate and accommodate new and evolving existing regulatory data which will be core to the Bank’s regulatory oversight, research and reporting functions. Working collaboratively with analyst and project teams, you will drive technical uplift in data. You will also articulate the product vision for the team and guide them in executing to that vision within establish project timeframes while being embedded in those teams. The data being collected and analysed is of a regulatory nature and you may be required to work on multiple datasets at any given time. The initial datasets will be from the Bank’s Financial Stability department. Therefore, experience in a variety of data-focussed subject matter domains and an ability to quickly learn new subject matter is a mandatory requirement for this role. You will also maintain and develop processes, tools and technology solutions that enable effective and efficient data and information management. This role will also contribute to, promote and comply with the bank-wide data management policy, guidelines and practices to support the Bank's data and information management objectives and operations. Under tech capabilities: Additional responsibilities of the role are: Deliver the business improvement changes into the business teams and support their self-service adoption of new analytical tools and capabilities. Support and implement data analysis and modelling to provide evidence-based insights that will inform policy development, evaluation and decision-making. Support good governance and contribute to inhouse training as well as support for key publications process. Make product-related decisions on key features and capabilities in line with the product vision set by senior business stakeholders. Work with the project teams and stakeholders to prioritise and plan for delivery while championing continuous improvements and incremental delivery of business value. Own and manage the Product Backlog. Serve as the liaison between the business, IT, Enterprise Data Office and external reporting entities to deliver a successful solution. Assist senior management in maintaining program-focussed relationships with external stakeholders which have interdependencies with Financial Stability data. Ensure integrity and quality of delivery that meets reporting and data analytics requirements to an agreed ‘definition of done’. As this a project-related role, there may be a requirement to work overtime, including weekends to support implementations or if a deadline needs to be met. Your team Reporting to the Manager, Enterprise Data and Analytics, you will also be embedded in the Financial Stability department and be the voice of the business. You will work closely with the Enterprise Data & Analytics team as well as key Financial Stability teams. Your background We are looking for business-focussed Senior Data Analyst/ Product Owner with substantial technical experience working in Agile teams focussing on data warehousing and data analytics contexts related to regulation and compliance. Please only apply if you have this experience. This will be a hands on role so technical experience, including some understanding of technology is highly desirable. Additionally, to be successful in this role you will possess: Experience designing, developing code/scripts that leverage structured data from multiple sources using statistical tools (e.g. R, Git) In-depth knowledge of the R programming language and associated packages (e.g. the Tidyverse) Demonstrated experience taking responsibility for meeting required outcomes with excellent attention to detail Knowledge of databases, data modelling concepts and tools (i.e. SQL) is highly desirable Developing and maintaining processes, tools and technology solutions that enable effective and efficient data and Information management. Knowledge of econometrics applied statistics or data analysis is highly desirable. Present insights from analysis and recommendations in a clear way that the business can action. Use innovative approaches to discover new insights in existing data and incorporate new data for additional insight. Experience with Metadata Management solutions, preferably Infosphere/IGC Hands-on experience with manipulating data with BI tools is desirable Ability to seek out and drive processes improvements Experience working in Agile teams Excellent stakeholder management and influencing skills Be More Working for an organisation that truly makes a difference to the people of Australia, we can offer development and career opportunities in a collaborative environment that supports your growth, wellbeing and promotes flexibility. Your individual growth and success drives the Bank forward as an organisation. Be more means you can do more, for yourself and for Australia. Why RBA? Through the pursuit of national economic policy objectives and associated activities in financial markets and banking, the RBA makes an important contribution to the Australian economy. We also issue Australia's banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments system, all of which contribute to the welfare of the Australian people. Made up of specialists across a wide range of fields, our people have a critical role to play in achieving these objectives, whether directly or in a supporting capacity. As a values driven organisation, our people conduct themselves with a high degree of integrity, while striving for excellence in the work they perform and the outcomes they achieve. We encourage intelligent inquiry and we treat one another with respect, while promoting the public interest through our efforts. Your application should include a resume detailing your experience and qualifications. The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility. Few places give you the balance of professional challenge and a management culture that not only supports but encourages you to live a full life outside of work and be more. Application Close : November 30, 2023 .Show moreReport

Established Australian designer and manufacturer of furniture Collaborative & inclusive working environment based in Turrella Global business with growth opportunities   Since 1977, King Living has pioneered quality Australian design, continually pushing the boundaries of what furniture can achieve. Designed to adapt to our changing lives and last for generations, our furniture marries the power of innovation with traditional handcrafted methods.  King Living has expanded from a homegrown business into a global brand. A family owned and run Australian company headquartered from our Support Centre in Sydney, our Showrooms and manufacturing centres span Australia, New Zealand, United Kingdom, Canada, Singapore, Malaysia, China, and Thailand.  At King Living, we are dedicated to creating simplicity and balance in both our living spaces and our work environment. The role is the key reference of various stake holders regarding cost of finished goods and inventory valuation. This role will also be actively involved in projects that refine inventory process of King entities.  The Role: Complete monthly payables reconciliations and analyse billing variances of our production plants abroad Maintain YTD Invoice list and weekly EDI process for global King entities. Control the financial processes of the inventory management to ensure accurate, timely and reconciled stock on hand and goods in transit. Document and train the wider finance team on cost accounting logics and system features. Be the reference for cost accounting topic for both King’s entities.   About You: Accounting qualifications preferred (Bachelor’s degree) Professionally qualified or close to qualification Recent experience in manufacturing environment with solid accounting knowledge e.g. Finished Goods, COGS and Ocean Freight, etc. Intermediate to advanced Excel skills as well as a sound knowledge of Microsoft Office. Australian owned company with a growing global footprint EAP to support your ongoing health and wellbeing. Flexible working program available to eligible staff. Why Join Us Creation is the core of ByteDance's purpose. Our products are built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make our innovations possible. To us, every challenge, no matter how ambiguous, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At ByteDance, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the users we serve. Join us.  About the Team: HR Compliance and Governance focuses on various legal and external regulatory requirements for human resources, such as cross-border travel compliance, cooperation with employee representative bodies, and the setup of new hiring entities. Our main goals are to ensure the company complies with local laws and regulations related to labor and employment during global business development, and to help the company solve compliance and governance issues related to "people and organization."  This role will play a pivotal part in projects related to HR data, with a specific focus on ensuring ByteDance complies with legal and regulatory requirements. You will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting HR data to advise management on decisions that impact external reporting and regulatory compliance. You will partner with functional stakeholders across the company to provide accurate and timely analysis to enable key management decisions and external compliance. You will work with APAC and AMS colleagues on a day-to-day level and engage with stakeholders across the business globally. The role will also intersect with key HR initiatives in APAC, offering significant opportunities for growth.  Responsibilities:  Understand business context deeply through research, interviews, data analysis and other methods to understand and produce feasible recommendations and advisory aligned with HR management principles and external reporting requirements; Investigate and thoroughly understand client needs as a trusted advisor, offering tailored recommendations on the external usage of data; Collect, clean, and analyze HR data, ensuring data accuracy and consistency; Develop and optimize request processes and policies; Collaborate closely with interdepartment stakeholders and cross-functional partners, such as legal, communications, public policy, tax, and data teams to ensure alignment and bring initiatives to completion; Support the development and planning of HR strategies through analysis and research; transform insights into operational initiatives. Advantageous to have 3+ years experience in a top-tier consulting firm, enterprise or internet company; prior experience in a data role tied to people analytics, business analytics, or consulting background preferred; Preferable to major in management, statistics, economics, data science, data analytics, human resource management, industrial psychology, organizational psychology, financial management, accounting, or a related field; Excellent learning capabilities, sound business judgment and a demonstrated, hypothesis-driven problem-solving orientation with an exceptional ability to create clarity; proven capacity to ascertain the nature of problems as well as the reasonings behind them; Outstanding critical thinking and project management skills with a top-notch track record of effectively managing expectations across different time zones and cultures; Comfortable working under demanding deadlines and producing key executive deliverables; excellent written and oral communication skills; Strong comfort with ambiguity, and superb adaptability; be willing to work hard and efficiently in a fast-paced, cross-cultural environment.  ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too. We provide you with everything you need to develop at an unprecedented pace. An opportunity to make a significant contribution to the global media buying landscape and work with some of the largest advertisers in the world Hybrid working model with WFH and office days each week Office located in the heart of Sydney’s CBD with Wynard, Martin Place and Town Hall train stations just moments away Friendly colleagues who are always willing to help And more! job_description: BI Reporting Developer Full time role with a hybrid working model Join a high performing, collaborative and friendly team Located in the heart of Sydney's CBD (Martin Place) The Law Society of NSW is Australia's largest and most influential membership association for solicitors. We're not all lawyers, but we work together to support the legal profession and ensure a just society for all.  We are currently looking for a BI Reporting Developer to join our Information Management team.  About the role  The Business Intelligence (BI) Reporting Developer focuses on understanding business data, analysing data and generating reports and dashboards, performing quality assurance testing to ensure the data presented is correct as well as providing technical support and assistance to the business users where required.  The primary responsibility of the role is to support various reporting initiatives. You will analyse, design and implement quality reports and dashboards for the business.  As the BI Reporting Developer, you are expected to not only be a capable analyst of raw data, but are able to derive meaning from the data, relate it back to the source and work with the business to derive valuable context required for daily tasks and make decisions. You are a champion for data innovation and can use your creativity to find solutions for teams at every level of their data journey.  About the team  You will be joining the Information Management Team that help deliver data analysis services to the business. The Information Management Team covers a wide area of data analysis and application code development and key application foundation services.  What you'll be doing  Data Reporting â€“ Technical  Create, update, and upgrade end user reports in Power BI. Create and update T-SQL queries, stored procedures and views using the Law Society code standard to obtain the data required for reports. Where data is not available from a database, extract data from a variety of sources and transform it for use with a Power BI data model. Create and update Power BI data models for use with both single reports and reports using shared datasets. Be competent in DAX and Power M to meet end user requirements. Determine a reporting structure to ensure that increased usability is available for reports shared between departments. Identify potential faults and optimization opportunities within the Reporting suite and other related reports and dashboards. Monitor availability and provide recommendations on performance, capacity, data integrity and quality for the BI reports. Ensure all report access is secured and audited. Highlight any data issues and work with the data architects to continue to develop the data warehouse as a source of truth in the business. Design aesthetically pleasing and functional reports that meet the LSNSW branding guidelines/ templates but where required able to use the guidelines to make appropriate design choices.  Data Reporting â€“ Non-Technical  Develop/document high quality and well-written user guides, business rules, processes, data flows and other documentation for use by the Information Management team and business users. Provide feedback to the Information Management Data Architect on data requirements (historical snapshots, data requirements) for integration later. Involved in Project Team as a SME and key member on determining reporting needs and providing data requirements at the start of a project. Promote the Reporting function for operational as well as strategic needs. Develop and maintain reporting standards, policies and guidelines and ensure they applied to all reports developed. With the team develop policies and procedures for the collection and analysis of data. Populate User Acceptance forms and ensure all required approvals exist before deployment of the reports.  Team Support Support a collaborative and progressive team environment. Standardise and highlight improvements to services. Provide and maintain troubleshooting support and knowledge sharing across IT.  About you  Significant and relevant experience in requirements gathering, research and analysis, solution discovery, training, and other general Business Analysis capability is required. Tertiary qualifications in Information Systems, Computing Science or similar. 5+ years’ experience as a BI Developer (Preferably Power BI). 5+ years’ experience with SQL/T-SQL. Strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Strong discovery, analytical and problem-solving skills.  Desirable  Tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or equivalent. Working knowledge of relational and non-relational databases. Familiarity with Data Warehouses and Data Lakes. Background in project management or business analysis. Competency in using Azure and other tools in the Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate). Competency in using Canva design software.  More about you  Strong interpersonal skills for conduct in a client facing role, and ability to adapt to communicating with users from a variety of professional backgrounds and technical abilities. Willingness and ability to continuously learn and be able to pick up new technical skills as well as business knowledge on a regular basis. Keen attention to detail, both in testing and validation of data, and in design skills. Able to work independently, and can appropriately assess, analyse, and verify task requirements prior to actioning reporting tasks. Can cooperate and collaborate with a team to learn and share knowledge. A knowledge seeker who is able to challenge requirements, and utilise technical skills, internal understanding and practices as well as external understanding and experiences to continuously improve skills and reporting services provided. Demonstrates the tendency to contribute ideas and initiate new ways of working, shows enthusiasm for project work and special assignments. Proven consistency in making sound decisions. Ability to use information, knowledge, and experience to analyse and form judgements. Ability to comprehend the wider contexts, developments long term goals and determines strategies and actions required to achieve such goals. Able to maintain sustained level of concentration in a volume processing activity to ensure accuracy and identify errors to be addressed. Displays a commitment to quality client service, values the supplying of accurate and timely information and relates to people from diverse backgrounds.   To apply  The Law Society of New South Wales is committed to building and maintaining a respectful and inclusive workplace, appointing the best person for the role and supporting diversity.  Applications should contain a CV and cover letter that outlines your key experience and motivations for this role.Show moreReport

Job Description BlueScope is an Australian-born, global success story, spanning 18 countries, with a team of over 15,000 people. We’re driven by innovation and are proud that the technologies in our products and brands, like COLORBOND® steel, inspire and protect everything from hospitals and bridges to stadiums and homes. The Opportunity Come and discover the opportunity to join our Energy Sourcing & Utilisation (ESU) team at our Port Kembla Manufacturing facility as an Energy Systems and Data Analyst. As a part of the broader Australian Steel Products (ASP) portfolio, we have six major manufacturing sites at Port Kembla that deliver a variety of products, innovative solutions and services to our export and domestic customers. The ESU team provides the business with commercial and technical expertise to navigate the constantly evolving energy and climate landscape now and into the future. They are responsible for managing BlueScope’s electricity, gas and utilities requirements across key manufacturing facilities in the ASP portfolio. This role will see you drawing on your experience and critical thinking to provide reliable energy and utility insights and data to stakeholders. It is an exciting time to be part of the ESU team. With a willingness to learn and develop, you will bring an innovative and process focused approach to data management systems. We will provide you with the necessary support to be successful in your role as you showcase your eye for detail and a drive for process and system transformation. This role can also offer flexibility with a hybrid arrangement – as well as our option for 14% superannuation plus a company incentive program. Get access to our Employee Well-Being Program and App, plus other Company perks and discounts. What Will You Do? Working in a collaborative team, you’ll manage key energy and utility data systems used by the ESU team and provide data-led insights and solutions related to our energy, utility and carbon requirements. You will also: drive reporting systems resiliency and enhance data sourcing process efficiency and quality ensure that the energy and utility data housed in these systems is accurate and available for various key activities including month end processing facilitate the interfaces between operational processes and the commercial energy and carbon systems and processes strive to continuously adapt and improve the systems and processes used for energy and utility monitoring and reporting to manage changing technology, business models and policy develop a deep understanding of how energy and utilities are used across BlueScope’s Port Kembla manufacturing footprint More About You With an eagerness to learn and develop, you are passionate about energy, systems, improvement initiatives, and problem-solving. You will also bring: an ability to communicate effectively and build constructive relationships and broad networks proactive, forward thinking as you apply your strong analytical skills and maintain a high attention to detail a genuine interest to further grow and develop a balance of technical, commercial and problem-solving skills to meet the needs of key stakeholders and emerging activities of the ESU team though not essential, experience in data management and/or reporting systems development will be highly valued Why BlueScope As BlueScope continues to go from strength to strength, a career with us provides you with the opportunity to grow and be rewarded. At BlueScope, you will: create and deliver innovative solutions that drive transformation in our business make an impact that really does shape the world we live in keep growing through continuous learning and development opportunities enjoy the sense of belonging that comes from working with people who genuinely look out for one another At BlueScope, our people are our strength, and we don’t say that lightly. We want our people to be successful, and to be safe. We offer work-life flexibility through our B-flex program and make sure our inclusive work environment welcomes people of all backgrounds. We’re passionate about driving sustainability outcomes that matter to our communities, including action on climate and our 2050 net zero goal. And we’ll do this through Our Purpose: We create and inspire smart solutions in steel, to strengthen our communities for the future. Come and discover us at bluescope.com/life-at-bluescope/careers. At Circana, we are fuelled by our passion for continuous learning and growth, we seek and share feedback freely, and we celebrate victories both big and small in an environment that is flexible and accommodating to our work and personal lives. More about our benefits Flexible hybrid workplace Competitive remuneration with excellent bonus scheme Generous Reward and Recognition programs Access to ongoing training and career development programs Access to free Mental Health programs Birthday and Anniversary day off Convenient location with onsite parking Modern onsite gym Employee discounts on full product range Opportunity to participate in community welfare and charity initiatives More about what you'll do Due to continued growth, we are seeking a Pricing Analyst Team Leader for new business to join our team. This role will have you working closely on pricing & commercial terms for tenders and ensure commercial viability of tenders and re-signs. Operating within a highly dynamic commercial team, opportunities for long term career are plentiful. Job no: 496674 Work type: Full-time Location: Sydney Categories: Finance  The Role  We are recruiting a financial analyst to be based at our Smithfield office in NSW. This role entails the responsibility of conducting financial forecasts and analysing financial data to aid the decision-making process. The analyst collects, scrutinizes, and interprets financial information to contribute to well-informed business decisions, providing support to our branches in Australia and New Zealand.  Key Responsibilities:  Perform in-depth financial analysis to evaluate the financial performance, trends, and variances. Develop and maintain financial models to support budgeting, forecasting, and decision-making processes. Create ad-hoc reports and analyses as requested by management to support strategic decisions. Assemble the monthly report Ensure accuracy and integrity of financial data and reporting systems. Support long-term financial planning initiatives, such as scenario analysis and capital budgeting. Contribute to the development of financial strategies and tactics to achieve company goals. Maintain and update financial databases, ensuring data accuracy and completeness. Implement best practices for data collection, storage, and retrieval to streamline financial analysis. Assist with regulatory compliance, financial audits, and internal control testing. Ensure adherence to accounting principles and company policies. Here's what you will be doing day-to-day;  Managing data analytics projects independently, from understanding the brief, supporting the proposal and delivering the results Leading brainstorming analysis sessions, formulating hypothesis and opinions Interpreting and analysing data to formulate appropriate conclusions for clients Effectively contributing to client presentations with findings and recommendations Participating in ongoing skills development both inside and outside of the business Gaining a strategic understanding of the client's business needs and objectives and are offering solutions  Essential skills and experience: University qualification in Applied Statistics 6+ years in a market research role A demonstrated ability to build and maintain strong networks and relationships Experience in developing clients and technical service capability Strong written and verbal communication skills A team player  On offer is the opportunity to work with a close-knit, experienced team on an exciting and diverse client portfolio. We have a state of the art office space which allows for collaboration and creativity but we also adopt a flexible work approach and can tailor the role around what works best for you. We have a strong focus on learning and development and an internal team dedicated to helping you grow and progress in your role.  If this sounds like the role for your then please apply today, we're looking forward to hearing from you.  A little about us:  The Leading Edge is an insight and strategy consultancy with over 25 years' experience specialising in solving brand, innovation and retail problems. Created with a simple promise to do things differently and to do things better, The Leading Edge believes it's not just about what clients don't know, it's about focusing on what they can do to get better.  The Leading Edge partners with clients to help unleash their hidden potential and give them an edge, ultimately delivering focus, inspiration and guidance for an achievable and commercially focused plan.  Doing things differently means we attract a certain kind of person. Employment Type: Permanent Full Time Position Classification: Health Manager Level 3 Remuneration: $119,348 - $136,057, plus Superannuation Location: 1 Reserve Road, St Leonards, in a hybrid working environment Hours Per Week: 38 Requisition ID: REQ427954 Closing Date: 10 September 2023 (11:59PM)  Start your journey with us You will be working with a diverse and dynamic team within the Corporate Services and Business Improvement team as part of Health System Support Group (HSSG) based at 1 Reserve Road, St Leonards, NSW 2065. HSSG is a unit of the Public Health System Support Division of the Health Administration Corporation to provide services to support the public health system in implementing Government targets and programs.  For more information visit www.health.nsw.gov.au  What you'll be doing Lead and manage the review and analysis of the organisation's business intentions, services, processes and information needs to identify changes that lead to business improvements. This role involves collaboration with internal subject matter experts and other NSW Government agencies.  The Business Analyst will provide leadership in the development of new and innovative ways of driving system-wide improvement through data processes, contemporary analytics methods and systems for improvement. The role will work across the Corporate Services and Business Improvement team to work collaboratively with subject matter experts and across the services of the Ministry of Health (MoH) and other NSW Health Government agencies. The purpose of the position is to build business capability in analytics, collaborate in the development and implementation of new systems and processes, and perform detailed analytical explorations to support the strategic and operational priorities of the organisation.  The position will champion the development of an information culture that drives continuous business improvement across the organisation as an enabler for change. Being responsible for partnering with internal service delivery teams and support services across NSW Health and Health Agencies in using information for business intelligence and data analytics to drive organisational service improvement and efficiencies. The position will collect, map and critically appraise data and information, identifying issues, risks and identify areas for continuous business improvement and system performance improvement projects.  Candidate Assessment You may be asked to undertake further assessments as part of the recruitment process for this position, which may include, but is not limited to, psychometric assessment (e.g. personality and cognitive abilities assessments) and/or particular work tasks.  How to apply Your application to be considered should include:  Responses by addressing the selection criteria below An up-to-date resume of no more than five (5) pages which clearly details your skills and experience as relevant to this role. 2x referees will need to be supplied prior to an offer being made. Application must be lodged electronically. Please go to https://jobs.health.nsw.gov.au/ and search Job Reference Number REQ427954 to submit your application.  Selection Criteria  Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline and/or demonstrated relevant industry experience. Extensive experience in assessing business systems, mapping end-to-end processes and identifying opportunities for improvement. Interpreting business intent and applying to incumbent systems and process design to improve efficiency and availability of information. Excellent analytical skills including the ability to analyse and interpret complex information from numerous sources, prepare and present analysis and reports, deal with challenges creatively and achieve business focused solutions. Advanced level prowess using business analysis and relational database tools such as Microsoft PowerApps, Excel, SQL. Superior organisational skills and experience working in a high volume and demanding professional environment with proven capacity to prioritise, multi-task, achieve business goals, perform and always work with a customer focused approach. Excellent communication, negotiation, decision making and influencing skills including the ability to interact collaboratively with a wide range of stakeholders throughout all organisational levels.   Need more information?   1) Click here for the Position Description   2) Find out more about applying for this position For role related queries or questions contact John Healey on John.Healey@health.nsw.gov.au. COVID-19 Vaccination Compliancy All NSW Health workers are required to have completed a primary course of a COVID-19 vaccine which has been approved or recognised by the Therapeutics Goods Administration (TGA). Additionally, Category A workers are required to receive a booster dose three months after completing the primary course of COVID-19 vaccinations. New applicants must have completed the vaccination course prior to commencement with NSW Health, or provide an approved medical contraindication certificate (IM011 immunisation medical exemption form) certifying the worker cannot have any approved COVID-19 vaccines available in NSW. Acceptable proof of vaccination is the Australian Immunisation Register (AIR) Immunisation History Statement or AIR COVID-19 Digital Certificate. Booster doses are highly recommended for all health care workers who have completed the primary course of COVID-19 vaccinations. Location: Hybrid – World Square, CBD and WFH Commencement Date: Immediate Start (or by negotiation) Closing Date: Monday, 20 November 2023 Capacity: Permanent, Full-time  About Sydney Catholic Schools  In joining Sydney Catholic Schools (SCS), you will be part of the largest Catholic education community in NSW, with a unified vision and shared resources, encompassing over 145 schools and more than 72,000 students.  SCS is recognised for outstanding student achievement, with 9 schools in the top 100 of the HSC rankings and 17 schools placing in the top 150. We focus on enabling a quality preschool to post-school learning journey for every child, supported by a team of dedicated educators and caregivers.  About the role  The Business Intelligence Analyst will primarily be involved in drawing insights on customer journey data, using strong SQL skills to source data from Azure/SQL/EDW/Adobe/Google Analytics and deploy insights for the business using PowerBI, SSRS, and YellowFin reporting services.  The main deliverable for this role is analysing data and looking at business needs as well as insights, and working with stakeholders to support the business.  As a Business Intelligence Analyst, your main responsibilities will include:  building data reporting dashboards and reports collecting and interpreting data, analysing results and reporting the results back to the relevant members of the business collaborating with other teams within the business or the management team to establish business needs ensuring SCS has the data and insights it needs to make informed decisions to address customer and business problems ensuring that insights are built-in to the discovery and delivery of digital products advocating data-driven decision-making to stakeholders across the SCS enterprise working with leadership teams to determine the viability of digital initiatives through data providing insights and recommendations on areas of opportunity for digital initiatives providing recommendations on success criteria for digital initiatives and implementing measures for effective mitigation of risks providing clear, effective and professional best practice level advice and support to SCS Networks, schools, central office and the leadership team being required to be contactable and available to perform work outside normal working hours promoting and implementing Sydney Catholic Schools’ mission and vision To know and love Christ through learning and Thriving Catholic communities through excellent teaching and learning promoting and abiding by Sydney Catholic Schools’ values of empathy, curiosity, excellence, collaboration and truth.  What we offer:  attractive remuneration and salary packaging benefits of up to $15,900 each year generous leave provisions including 17.5% annual leave loading extensive professional and leadership development opportunities student fee discount – up to 25% discount for parents of SCS students health and wellbeing resources, including voice care programs, advice on nutrition and free annual flu shots.  The Person  To be successful, you will have attained;  australian tertiary qualifications equivalent to AQF level 7 (Bachelor’s degree) in Australia Tertiary qualifications equivalent of AQF level 7 (Bachelor degree) in computer science, Business, Digital Marketing, Media or Statistics demonstrated high level of experience with cloud platforms (AWS or Azure) as well as extensive experience working with programming languages such as Python and R previous demonstration of facilitating business solutions using rich datasets confidence in key stakeholder engagement and making informed business decisions demonstrated three years minimum experience in a data analytics related role demonstrated track record in designing and building scalable data models, cleaning and transforming data, and enabling advanced analytic capabilities that provide meaningful business value through easy-to-comprehend data visualizations demonstrated history of collaboration with roles such as data analysts, business intelligence analysts, data scientists or data engineers demonstrated skills as an analytical thinker who can gather data, break problems down into their parts and propose solutions proven ability to build dashboards and reporting tools using PowerBI, Tableau, Yellowfin and Adobe Analytics experienced in data-driven decision making and striving to ensure that it is employed in all stages of the product life cycle demonstrated ability to drive best practice and define new data analysis processes experienced conducting basic modelling to understand patterns, trends, opportunities and risks that can be fed into the product life cycle demonstrated ability to communicate complex ideas in a simple manner demonstrated ability to collaborate, contribute and create effective teamwork across organisational boundaries a current driver’s licence.  Application process   To support your application, you will be required to provide the following:  your current resume cover letter. FP&A Analyst  BRP seeks an FP&A Analyst with strong ISIT skills, including programming, database management, and expertise in SQL to join our APAC division, in our Sydney, Australia headquarters. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in financial planning and analysis, leveraging their ISIT expertise to enhance data management, streamline processes, and support data-driven decision-making.  YOU’LL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO:  Support the marketing department by tracking and analysing investments and costs related to marketing initiatives, campaigns, and projects Lead the Overhead performance analysis of the region, comparing actual results against budgets and forecasts. Identify and analyse variances and provide business explanations. Support the Parts, Accessories & Apparel department across the overall business & financial cycles  Responsibilities:  Contribute actively to the closing process and annual financial planning cycle (Forecasts and Budget) Execute and review financial controls on revenues and discounts Develop Data-Driven Financial Modeling: Build financial models by synthesizing large datasets and produce concise reports & analyses to support management decision-making Utilize modern data visualization tools to communicate complex financial and operational data into intuitive, interactive dashboards and reports. Identify and lead process improvement initiatives trough process redesign, automation (scripting) optimizing the efficiency and accuracy of financial reporting.  YOU’LL THRIVE IN THIS ROLE IF YOU HAVE THE FOLLOWING SKILLS AND QUALITIES:  Previous years of work experience in data analysis & modelling Advanced proficiency in Excel is a must Completed studies in analytical fields (Finance, Engineering, Math, Data analytics) Proficiency in SQL and experience in database management, including data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes. Proficiency in leveraging sophisticated data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau. Strong programming skills, preferably in Python, R, VBA, or similar languages. Experience with data preparation and management software with cutting-edge tools such as Power Query, Knime, DataIku is considered as a plus. Experience with SAP is considered as a plus Curious, self-starter, creative thinking, work independently, deal with ambiguity, and meet tight deadlines An ability to innovate and rationalize both finance and operational processes A strong sense of responsibility and team spirit  Do you have other qualifications? Tell us what is unique about you that is a great addition to the team.  THE ROAD SHOULD BELONG TO EVERYONE.  We still live in a world where many feel the road is for other people. We believe we can make a difference. Moving people goes beyond making innovative products.  We strive to nurture our people’s aspirations, to exceed our riders’ expectations and stand in solidarity with all the communities that ride with us.  Building a more inclusive BRP with no barriers for those who seek to ride starts from within, and we need everyone's commitment, drive and dedication to make it a reality.  AT BRP, WHEN WE TALK ABOUT BENEFITS, WE GO ALL IN.  Let’s start with a strong foundation — You want it, we have it:   Annual bonus: we work hard, and we know it. This yearly thank you is our way to fuel your dreams. Generous paid time away: winding down is as important as creating the future of recreational products. Flexible work schedule/ Hybrid ways of working: balance is key to innovation, and we want to make sure you are at the top of your game with a schedule that will work for you. Additional 3 days paid leave: between Christmas and New Year’s, we close our facilities and refill on good times. Life and Salary Continuous Insurance: this program is here for you, whatever happens, so you can focus on what matters. Employee Purchase Program: what we build is amazing, freeing, revolutionary, and you're first in line for the experience.  What about some feel good extras:  PWC License: BRP paid, yearly PWC license. Ride Days/ Access to PWC Units: unwind and enjoy our Sea-Doo, with the team or with friends and family Social Club: together, we create moments to remember. Wellbeing line of credit: we appreciate your health and well being.  WELCOME TO BRP  We’re a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce made up of close to 20,000 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it’s not about the destination; It’s about the journey.Show moreReport

Join our Group Treasury Transformation Capital Technology team as we deliver our next generation Capital Platform.  At Macquarie, we are working to create lasting value for our communities, our clients and our people. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 54 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drive outcomes.  What role will you play?  As Technical Business Analyst, you will take end-to-end ownership of your products in a modern DevOps culture. You will contribute to architecture, design, development, testing and operations and deliver incrementally in iterative cycles. You will manage deadlines, articulate technical problems and ideas, and help to build better processes and practices. Collaborating closely within a cross functional team you will build solutions and convert business needs and requirements into designs and technical requirements.  What you offer  A solid technical business analyst background in banking or financial services (experience within the Treasury, Capital or Regulatory Reporting domains is a bonus) Strong analytical skills with the ability to review and challenge business requirements, define efficient solutions, and map solutions to business outcomes Proficiency in the use of tools to query and analyse data from various sources Experience working with detailed data requirements and data models Ability to provide the right level of technical specifications to facilitate efficient delivery processes A willingness to get hands on with build and testing activities Familiarity with modern data engineering concepts, technologies and tools (e.g. Big Data Platforms, Spark, Airflow, Dataiku).  We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.  Benefits  Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria and location, include:  Hybrid and flexible working arrangements Range of benefits to support your physical, psychological and financial wellbeing  About the Corporate Operations Group  In our Corporate Operations Group, you will work at the heart of Macquarie. Join a collaborative team who accelerate digitalisation, sustainability and social impact for the benefit of our people, customers, shareholders and communities. Our teams include technology, digital transformation and data, operations, human resources, business services, corporate strategy and solutions and the Macquarie Group Foundation.  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for a role regardless of their identity, including gender, race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status, marital or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disabilities, or socio-economic background.  If you require adjustments to your working arrangements or the recruitment process, please let us know when applying.   About Macquarie A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future. Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment. Job Title Technical Business Analyst Purpose of the Role Think of an e-ticket as a contract across all the stages of your trip: from Ticket creation through boarding and flying... If you change plans, face difficult climatic conditions (or get kicked off the plane ...), refunds or exchanges can also be performed. Behind the scene, the control of your ticket is circulating between different airlines systems and financial transactions are taking place. Amadeus airline customers have a complex system to orchestrate all these transactions: the Amadeus Ticketing Server! Joining Amadeus, you will be working on this mission-critical system, designing innovative solutions for our airline customers. We are a dynamic team mixing Business Analysts, Software Engineers and DevOps and collaborating with an Agile mindset. You will be part of a truly multicultural group and interact with colleagues all around the globe. You will contribute to the platform evolution and stability thanks to your testing and validation skills. You will also have the opportunity to create and develop new features for our customers and help them face the industry challenges such as Cloud-based services and data privacy and security. Main Responsibilities:Product Expertise Participate in building a vision for the product Anticipate future needs and identify risks and opportunities Build and maintain end to end knowledge of our products and their usage Build a relationship with the different stakeholders, including the Ticketing teams in Bangalore and Nice. Take part in feasibility studies and sizing exercisesProduct increment Clarify requirements with customers and the team Build/influence solutions, balancing quality/value and our constraints. Negotiate scope/dates with stakeholders, including customers Interface with relevant departments to identify interactions with other Amadeus packages and ensure functional compatibility. Write/review specifications and APIs Validate deliveriesProject support Provide support on our features (to other teams, PMs, customer, implementation) Analyze issues on existing product reported by customers Relevant Work Experience: Minimum 3 - 5 Years experience in Software Development Life Cycles (SDLC) and Agile Methodology as Business Analyst. Experience working with a customer. Autonomy and proactivity Travel business knowledge is preferred. Diversity & Inclusion We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and seek to hire the best candidate regardless of age, beliefs, disability, ethnicity, gender or sexual orientation.Show moreReport

Roles and duties include:  The ICT Business Analyst will be responsible for defining improvements to business processes, gathering information and analysing the client organization’s business intentions, services, processes and information needs to identify changes that lead to business improvements. Analysing business processes and advising customers (potential or existing) on business process automation and optimization. Identifying and communicating with clients to formulate strategies and produce a requirements specification to create system and software solutions for businesses. Analysing existing systems, application design and functions to ensure strategic ICT objectives are met by adopting contemporary analysis best-practice methodologies and processes including performing gap analysis within a scaled agile framework. Working with clients and users to formulate and document business requirements for workplace systems efficiency. Assisting company to develop functional standards for other system users. Provides and designs, based on pre-defined solution architecture, an integrated high-level solution that fit customer’s business & operational needs. Determining any inefficient business practices and system errors, such as duplicate orders, and double payments, etc, and providing efficient optimal business practice, solutions, and system functionality and behaviours Identifying, investigating, and analysing business processes, procedures and work practices to identify and evaluate inefficiencies, thereby recommending optimal business practices to improve business functionality. Manages the overall IT program scope, maintain its continuous alignment with strategic business objectives and works directly with the customer to clearly articulate and document the business requirements. Taking responsibility for deploying functional solutions, such as creating, adopting and implementing system test plans, which ensure acceptable quality and integrity of the workplace systems. Creating user and training documentation, and conducting formal training classes.   Skills and experience   Analysing and documenting business and technical requirements that best reflect customer needs; Translating the requirements into prioritize epics/features, supporting the release and iteration planning. Developing functional specifications for use by software engineers and developer programmers to create solutions then creating user and training documentation, and conducting formal training classes to train the employees on the new procedures. Using data and process modelling techniques to create clear system specifications for the design and development of system software. Demonstrating experience as an ICT Business Analyst within an agile environment understanding the business and IT requirements of the client. Acting as a central reference and information source, providing guidance and assistance in the system project decision making process by continuous communications with the client and passing on the information and requirements to the system developers. Establish collaborative and influential relationships with stakeholders, customers and colleagues, to ensure easy and effective achievement of team / project / business goals. Overall accountability and responsibility for scope, time, cost, quality, change and integrations within the project. Effectively participates in and/or leads formal and informal reviews with stakeholders, applying knowledge and experience and providing technical perspective and support; Performs demonstrations of solutions to users. Accountable and responsible for development teams during the iterations (provide business clarifications, adjustment to risks, change in scope, reprioritize and approve “done” stories and features during demos). Responsible for communicating the solution to customers’ business and/ or IT personnel, explaining the details of new solutions and their impact on business processes and ensuring that the customer understands the solution. Follows up on solution design issues in his/her domain until solution is signed off and supports the resolution of configuration/ implementation-related issues if and when they arise. Responsible for solution-related documents and functional specifications; May also configure the solution, and create, execute and maintain test plans when applicable.  The successful candidate will have a relevant bachelor degree or higher and at least 10 years of relevant experience. It is preferable if you are a permanent resident or citizen of Australia when applying.  Send your Resume to hr@bar360.com.auShow moreReport

Job description We are looking for a Product Support Analyst to join our growing team in Sydney. Get in on the ground floor at one of Sydney’s top startups, become an expert on Akeneo’s products, and help our clients and partners unlock growth through the power of our Product Experience Management (PXM) solutions. The Sydney members of the Akeneo team like to get together in the office several times a week. The other members of Support are based in Nantes, France, and Boston, USA. We are all part of the Product team. Our squad is filled with dedicated and passionate people who take pride in going the extra mile to deliver the best customer experience. Key Responsibilities  Respond to functional and technical requests from Enterprise edition customers in a considerate, accurate, and timely manner from the Jira Service Desk portal. Coordinate the technical qualification of bugs and questions with our support engineers and the patch releases with our maintenance leaders. Build on customer and partner feedback by improving our functional and technical documentation. Take part in the ongoing learning and success of the Support team with active contributions to help achieve team goals and successes. Collaborate with the rest of the product squads to test new features and bug fixes, and help to surface meaningful customer feedback. On-call duties to best support our clients in their product experience enhancement. Qualifications You have at least 2 years of experience in the SaaS Support field. You naturally look for all resources possible to make a difference and grow our customers' happiness. You love solving puzzles. You can quickly learn and can easily explain technical problems clearly. You may not write and deploy code yourself, but you are not afraid of diving into logs to find the root cause of a behaviour. You know how to communicate effectively with internal/external stakeholders and you do believe cross-continental communication is a fun challenge. You are proactive, autonomous, self-motivated, and resourceful. You love being challenged and you enjoy being involved in multiple tasks. You have experience working with Jira Service Desk, or other ticketing systems, Datadog, and Github. You write and speak English fluently. Having an understanding of French would be a plus. Life at Akeneo Culture Diverse, cross-cultural team. Annual All Staff gathering week, office parties, team offsite Top-notch 8-week onboarding program for new teammates, including live presentations, online courses you can take at your own pace, and an exhaustive checklist with all the resources, calls-to-action and support contacts for a smooth integration into the company General Get the basics right with a competitive package Time off Flexible working hours, hybrid home/office policy Take the time you need to welcome a new family member with 16 weeks of maternity leave (30 days if you are the second parent) Health & Wellness Individual and confidential coaching sessions with a mental health practitioner of your choice Equipment Best-in-class communication and collaboration tools: Slack, Notion, Google Suite, Jira, GitHub... Choose between MacOS or Linux Personal remote allowance to maximize your home office environment Professional Development Participation in in-house events welcoming external guests (ie. Meetups) or industry events ‍ Group and individual training opportunities Corporate Responsibility Employee Volunteering programme: give back to the community with two days per year dedicated to supporting the charities of your choice. ‍‍ Diversity & Inclusion: Akeneo provides and ensures a safe work environment for everyone, regardless of seniority, gender identity, and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, nationality, or other characteristics. Akeneo is deeply anti-racist, anti-homophobic, anti-sexist, anti-ableist, and inclusive. We create the right conditions for you to feel safe and be yourself! Interview process Say hi! If your application has caught our attention, you will receive an invitation to a 30-minute conversation with one of our Talent Acquisition Specialists, where you’ll learn more about the role and about Akeneo. Project yourself into the reality of the position and confirm our company culture fits you with one or two additional interviews with your future colleagues or stakeholders. Sign your offer!
