job_title: POS/CB Analyst for ANZ (New Healthcare Company)
job_description: 3M has a long-standing reputation as a company committed to innovation. We provide the freedom to explore and encourage curiosity and creativity. We gain new insight from diverse thinking, and take risks on new ideas. Here, you can apply your talent in bold ways that matter. Job Description: 3M is establishing two industry-leading companies, creating value through the spin-off of its Health Care business, while 3M will continue to be a global material science leader, focusing our innovation to win in favorable global megatrends and attractive end markets. This new Health Care Company will be a leading global diversified health technology company with: Proven category leadership Exposure to attractive end-markets Innovation mindset driving improved patient outcomes Collaborative customer relationships Deep global regulatory experience Operational excellence and strong cash flow Strong sales growth and profitability with significant recurring sales We expect the creation of the two companies will be completed by the end of 2023. For now, we will continue to operate as one global company. This role is positioned to drive the success of the "New Health Care Company”. This position provides an opportunity to transition from other private, public, government or military experience to a 3M career. The Impact You’ll Make in this Role; As a(n) POS/CB Analyst for ANZ, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. Here, you will make an impact by: Data Acquisition Work independently with external vendor MarketSoft for acquisition of external channel partner POS. Ensure that data is delivered in the format required. Interact with channel partners as needed to facilitate smooth delivery of channel partner POS Data Cleansing On going responsibility for data Hygiene and cleaning removal of Duplicate entries etc . Work with MarketSoft & GSC to facilitate the cleansing of end user customer address & 3M product information respectively. Team collaboration Liaise with other members of the POS team and also within MSO and the business on an ongoing basis. Work closely with the channel partners to ensure timely and quality reporting of POS data. Work closely with the Business Groups to ensure expectations are aligned on POS and related topics. Data Analytics Develop POS reports and analysis to support the organization’s needs within 14 working days of request. Demonstrate knowledge & understanding of SAP Business Objects system. Create and/or modify BI Reports. Delivery of required metrics on time and in full as required. Be responsible for Data interrogation and exploration analysis prior to data loading. Process Design & Automation Develop process models to support the organization’s workflows. Implement changes & improvements as needed to align with business environment. Develop improvements to workflow on a risk-based assessment. Proceed with low risk changes independently. Proceed with moderate or high-risk changes with manager approval. Systems understanding Demonstrate knowledge & understand of all internal systems including COPS, CRM, Image Now, PBI, BO, GTMS & Lotus Notes. Your Skills and Expertise To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or higher (completed and verified prior to start) Three (3) years of experience in Large Data Manipulation and clean up in a private, public, government or military environment Strong analytical skills and the ability to understand complex systems. Competence in MS Office and Excel - able to work with Pivot Tables, V look ups etc Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include: Master's degree from an accredited institution. Tertiary qualifications in a Business or Unit related function preferred Experience with SAP Business Objects Strong project Management skills with the ability to meet deadlines. A knowledge of process improvement methodologies such as Six Sigma, Lean or Agile. For current employees, internal transfer restrictions may not apply. For more details, contact your local recruiter/HR team. Work location: Work Your Way Eligible (Employee choice to work remote, on site, or hybrid) This position does not require relocation. Employees from any of the following target locations may apply: Austrailia or New Zealand Travel: May include up to [10%][domestic/international] Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status). Supporting Your Well-being 3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope. Chat with Max For assistance with searching through our current job openings or for more information about all things 3M, visit Max, our virtual recruiting assistant on 3M.com/careers. Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com.au or on Twitter @3M or @3MNewsroom. Our approach to flexibility is called Work Your Way, which puts employees first and drives well-being in ways that enable 3M’s business and performance goals. You have flexibility in where and when work gets done. It all depends on where and when you can do your best work. Company Description Supporting millions of Aussies since 1988 with low fees and competitive long-term performance. Profits back to members, not shareholders Closing date: 27th October 2023. *  Job Description About Us Established in 1988, Rest is one of Australia’s largest profit-to-member superannuation funds. We support more than 1.9 million members, with around $70 billion of funds under management and are recognised as a responsible investment leader*. We believe when members understand and engage with their super, they’re more likely to get a better retirement outcome. Everything we do at Rest is underpinned by our values and behaviours, we want to Be Daring, Keep it Simple, Take Action and Have Grit. To put it simply we want our people to thrive and love the work they do. About the Job Rest’s Data, Technology and Delivery (DTD) business unit is accountable for planning and preparing the organisation for the future through strategic technology innovation, as well as charting our business strategy and executing for today and tomorrow. Situated in the Business Analysis Practice, the Senior Business Analyst - Data has three main priorities: Being the voice of the data team and assessing the impact to data across current initiatives Supporting the Product Owner/Business Owner/Sponsors to ensure that business needs and solutions options are understood Ensuring the product/platform/project team have a shared understanding of the requirements, through written and verbal communication. Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities Gathering and documenting requirements: Gather, review, analyse, validate, evaluate, and map business systems, processes and user needs and translate them into requirements/user stories with acceptance criteria Managing stakeholders: Engage, inform and negotiate with stakeholders to elicit and validate requirements and prioritise them Analysing and modelling: Analyse documents, programs, logic, process flows and specifications. Model the requirements using a range of techniques such as process mapping, story mapping, user stories and acceptance criteria, business rules Managing the requirements lifecycle: Ensure that requirements/user stories are prioritised based on their value, complexity, and feasibility, ensuring that the most critical items are delivered first Team communication and collaboration: Work closely with Engineers, Testers, Change Managers Third Party members within the product/platform/project team to ensure everyone understands business requirements to be able to develop a fit-for-purpose solution Risk and issue management: Identify risks and issues and develop effective mitigation/management strategies according to Rest’s risk framework, and communicate risk assessments and plans to the necessary stakeholders.  Qualifications About You: Degrees and/or certifications Bachelor's degree IIBA® or similar industry standard certification preferred. Experience: Extensive experience working on data projects Advanced SQL skills and knowledge of data warehousing principles Experience in developing a strategic picture of the data that is needed to support an initiative Ability to work on multiple initiatives concurrently Experience in Business Intelligence, Data warehousing or related function Business domain knowledge in superannuation or financial services Ability to understand business functionality, business complexity and interdependencies Ability to develop compelling business cases with accurate cost and effort estimations Highly developed strategic, analytical, problem solving, issues management and evaluation skills to deliver innovative solutions Understanding of modelling techniques, such as business process models and notation (BPMN), data flow diagrams and unified modelling language (UML®), SIPOC and value stream analysis etc Demonstrated experience in writing user stories and acceptance criteria Excellent communication, facilitation, consultation, negotiation and reporting/presentation skills, including the ability to influence people at all levels, and foster and maintain collaborative working relationships both within and outside the organization Ability to quickly troubleshoot problems that may arise in work products Proven ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines and priorities workloads. Additional Information Benefits Our benefits have been designed so you can tailor your experience with us and include: Personal and professional development opportunities Flexible, hybrid working – work to suit your lifestyle (must be based in Australia) Purchase leave scheme and gender neutral 16 weeks paid parental leave Super Contribution Continuation for 12 Months of parental leave Meeting free breaks (Rest Stops) Income Protection Insurance Rest Excellence awards (peer recognition awards based on Rest’s values and behaviours) If you share our values, believe you can help make a difference for our members and want to be part of a leading superannuation fund with a Super culture, please click Apply Now. Rest is committed to creating a flexible work environment and culture that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion - where people feel welcome, safe to be themselves and inspired to do their best. We value the different backgrounds, lived experiences and abilities our diverse team brings. We welcome and encourage applications from candidates of all ages, cultural backgrounds, faiths, gender identities, sexual orientations and thinking styles. This includes people with disability, neurodiverse individuals, Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander peoples and those with disrupted work history due to career or other breaks. Please note only people with the right to work in Australia will be considered.Funds under management as at 31 December 2022. Rest is recognised as a Responsible Investment Leader by the Responsible Investment Association Australia (RIAA) in its Responsible Investment Benchmark Report 2022. job_title: Senior Data Analyst, SBS On Demand
job_description: Senior Data Analyst, SBS On Demand At SBS, we embrace difference, and we welcome applications from people of all backgrounds. We also acknowledge the unique contribution that Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples make to our society and our workplace through their enduring and continued connection to land, sea, sky and community. About Us SBS is one of the world's most unique and innovative media organisations, producing trusted, meaningful and engaging content that exists for all Australians to inspire, support and celebrate the diversity of our multicultural society. Our purpose, for the last 40 years, has reflected and explored the evolving diversity of Australia, investing in initiatives to deepen its connections with communities, sharing their stories and giving a voice to those often unheard, with the aim of increasing understanding and respect of the differences that make up Australia. SBS is a truly distinctive network, showcasing multicultural, multilingual and First Nations stories otherwise untold in the Australian media. The Department SBS has now surpassed 13 million registered users of SBS On Demand. With premiere releases, boxset collections, live events, channel simulcasts and catch-up titles, there is more than 15,000 hours of programming available at any time, for free. We adopt human-centred design principles that let our audiences guide the product, curation and engagement strategies, as we help users navigate the breadth and depth of our diverse and evolving catalogue. Our product roadmap ensures SBS On Demand is stable and accessible, supporting scale with features that encourage content sampling, allowing for tactical user retention activities whilst meeting commercial objectives. The Role As the Senior Data Analyst, you will work with data to provide valuable insights, helping our team make better decisions and plan for the future. You'll be skilled at asking the right questions, finding important data, and using sophisticated methods to get useful information. Then, you'll explain it clearly to assist our team in solving complex problems. Your analysis will span our end-to-end user journeys, across multiple platforms, channels and the content they are consuming. Reporting into the Analytics Lead within our Engagement team this role will see you: Be a trusted adviser to the SBS On Demand product teams, helping them to identify key business questions and finding ways to answer those questions with data and statistical analysis where applicable. Define problems and scope solutions for your work, understanding the business context of the work as well as the broader strategic direction of the product and company. Partnering with cross-functional teams to set data standards and architecture, improving data infrastructure for organisation-wide access and utilisation. Produce metrics and models which enable stakeholders to enhance user onboarding, retention, and overall engagement on the SBS On Demand platform. Design and develop Tableau dashboards to provide reporting and insights to various stakeholders. Proactively seek opportunities to automate data and reporting to reduce human error and dependencies. It is a requirement of this role that incumbents are fully vaccinated with an approved Covid-19 vaccination in line with the ATAGI guidelines which include booster shots. We do however have a medical exemption process and we would be happy to discuss your application should this be applicable to you. You might want to consider what other opportunities this could lead to down the track. About you Strong analytical skills with the ability to effectively communicate findings, explain the analytical process, and provide practical demonstrations of past work. Expertise in analysis / reporting - including use and understanding of business intelligence tools, data warehousing and reporting. Strong SQL and Tableau skills In-depth knowledge and experience of Adobe Analytics and/or similar enterprise digital analytics tools, preferably in a media environment Proficiency in R or Python Experience handling multiple stakeholders Feel like you meet most, but perhaps not all the criteria listed? Then, send through your detail as whilst we have specific requirements in mind we can look at how we can bridge the gaps! Some of the reasons to consider working with us The people! a genuine sense of feeling included (we truly celebrate and welcome difference!) and being part of one of the most inclusive companies in Australia! The culture and the engagement of our workforce, we are proud to have an employee engagement score of 82% with low levels of employee turnover. A brand that is not only recognisable but trusted and established, we have been broadcasting for over 40 years and we’re not done yet! We offer a range of benefits from, health care checks, salary packaging, Employee Assistance Programme, flexible work arrangements and for our Sydney based employee’s free gym membership! We also love to promote from within! we have allocated funds to do just that and help with training gaps when moving from role to role. Want to learn more? Then hit apply and take the first step to applying for not just another job but a possible whole new career! Want to learn more? Then hit apply and take the first step to applying not just for another job but a possible whole new career in a purpose led organisation! Not quite the right role for you? No problem, how about popping your details into our talent pool? Email us at noreplytalentpool@sbs.com.au to let us know what roles would be of interest to you and we will keep you informed of when they arise! (If you no longer want to be listed in our talent pool, then just email us and let us know and we will remove your detail). For other opportunities within our organisation please visit our careers website SBS Careers - Working at SBS Reasonable adjustments SBS recognises that everyone is unique, and you might require some adjustments to ensure you have the best opportunity to apply and put your skills forward for consideration. If we can make some adjustments to the SBS recruitment/interview process to better enable you to shine, then please contact careers@sbs.com.au and let us know. Adjustments include but are not limited to; alternative application methods, interview setups, physical requirements, guidance for trans or gender diverse applicants, specific interview availability times and more. job_title: Network Optimisation Analyst, 3P Last Mile Transportation
job_description: 3+ years of relevant industry experience. Completed Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics. Mathematics, Economics, Business or similar field from an accredited University. Experience defining program requirements and using data and metrics to determine improvements. Proven experience working in a fast-paced, highly complex analytical environment preferably in Supply Chain, e-Commerce, Consulting or Finance. Knowledge of Excel (Pivot Tables, VLookUps) at an advanced level and SQL. Ability to prepare, report and interpret large sets of data. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written. Excellent inter-personal and relationship-building skills.  Are you obsessed with solving challenging problems? Do you think outside of the box and challenge the status quo? Are you constantly looking for ways to improve your skills and your organization? If so, we look forward to hearing from you!  As a Network Optimisation Analyst within 3P Transportation, you will have the opportunity to drive improvement for Amazon’s Delivery Services business in Australia. This role will help to ensure our delivery promises to our customers are fulfilled on time and that we continuously improve Amazon Australia’s delivery experience on behalf of our customers. You will be an integral part in creating and implementing strategic initiatives to drive delivery optimization, delivery speed, transportation cost, and quality – all with the goal of better serving our customers. There will rarely be a perfect solution, so it will be up to you to make data driven decisions and manage stakeholder relationships while planning and executing within an ever-changing environment.  The role demands strong analytical and mathematical capabilities as well as the ability to develop strong stakeholder relationships. The candidate will analyse various supply chain data and metrics to define configurations to optimize our first and last mile 3P transportation processes.  This role can be performed from either Sydney or Melbourne.  Responsibilities:  Analyze and review transportation metrics to bridge performance misses and identify/execute actions to improve performance. Working with delivery services teams and supply chain to identify opportunities to lower 3P fulfillment cost whilst improving customer experience. Conduct simulations to model the impact of new configurations prior to execution. Effectively communicate change and monitor post implementation to assess effectiveness and lower the risk of unforeseen outcomes. Own key input and output metrics for fulfillment cost and own a program of actions that drive improvement to deliver best in class operations. Dive deep into data using Amazon simulation tools to identify opportunities to improve 3P fulfillment strategy considering cost, speed, and network design. Effectively communicating, collaborating and influencing team members, working with other business groups, and presenting projects to senior leadership on a regular basis. Partner with the global teams on system feature/logic improvements, and with local team on process improvements. Initiate and support the implementation of process-improvements, both the business processes and the technical solutions.  Skills and Abilities  Ability to drive strong cross-functional engagement with both internal and external teams. Track-record of delivering end-to-end projects autonomously, working through many obstacles along the way. Capacity to write well-reasoned and data-driven proposals, performing own data analysis as necessary. Owns responsibility for organization’s success, thinking and acting beyond immediate team or area of focus.  We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:  Melbourne, VIC, AUS | Sydney, NSW, AUS   Experience in driving end to end delivery, and communicating results to senior leadership. Experience driving process improvements. Highly analytical and capable of communicating effectively with customers and senior management. Demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.  Acknowledgement of country: In the spirit of reconciliation Amazon acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of country throughout Australia and their connections to land, sea and community. We pay our respect to their elders past and present and extend that respect to all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples today.  IDE statement: Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected attributes.Show moreReport

Our people are innovators and visionaries and we have a long track record of building global solutions that are changing the world of logistics. More excellence, less vanilla Joining the Data Technology team as part of IT as the largest department at the Bank, you can focus on achieving great outcomes and performing at your best, knowing you are surrounded by capable, intelligent, and experienced people who are approachable and generous with their time. As the BI Implementation Specialist you will drive the planning, analysis, delivery, support and ownership of BAU and project initiatives to achieve the Bank's data management standards, strategies and business benefits. Working collaboratively across the organisation you will embed, influence and lead change created by BAU initiatives and projects that impact processes, people and systems in relation to BI and Data Management best practises. This role is a secondment until February 2025. Your background Experience in maintaining and influencing effective working relationships with IT and business stakeholders at all levels. Elicit, analyse, document, communicate, and manage business requirements. Prepare ongoing reviews and evaluation of business and technical processes, and develop optimisation strategies. Identify and manage risks and issues, developing plans to mitigate risk and implementing these in a timely manner, measuring effectiveness. Insights Analyst Permanent role Hybrid and flexible working environment Sydney (Norwest) office location About Woolworths   Woolworths Group is a food and everyday needs retailer united by the shared purpose of creating better experiences together for a better tomorrow. With more than 1,400 stores across its Woolworths Supermarkets, Countdown Supermarkets (New Zealand) and BIG W brands, and fast-growing eCommerce businesses, Woolworths Group is Australia and New Zealand’s largest retailer. A top 10 company on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX), Woolworths Group employs more than 180,000 team members and serves more than 20 million customers a week.   About the role   The Risk Analytics team helps the risk community across Woolworths Group use data to make risk-informed choices with confidence and helps them focus on what matters most. The team drives the organisation towards the effective use of data and analytics to support decision-making and early detection of issues across Woolworths Group.  We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Insights Analyst to join our dynamic team. As an Insights Analyst, you will play a crucial role in driving data-driven decision-making and delivering actionable insights to support Woolworths Group Risk strategic objectives. You will be responsible for analysing large datasets, identifying trends, and translating complex data into meaningful reports and recommendations. Responsibilities will include: Data Analysis: Utilise advanced analytical techniques to extract insights from complex datasets, identifying trends, patterns, and correlations to provide actionable recommendations. Strategic Insights : Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and translate them into data requirements, ensuring that insights align with overall organisational goals. Reporting and Visualization : Create compelling and visually engaging reports, dashboards, and presentations to effectively communicate insights to stakeholders at all levels of the organisation. Data Integrity and Quality : Ensure data accuracy and integrity by performing data validation, cleansing, and transforming processes to maintain high-quality datasets. Forecasting and Predictive Modelling : Develop and implement forecasting models and predictive analytics to support strategic planning and business forecasting initiatives. Risk Management : Understanding principles of risk management and be a thought partner across the business in identification, assessment, control, and monitoring of various material risks affecting the organisation Collaborative Relationships : Build strong relationships and collaborate with stakeholders across the organisation, including marketing, finance, operations, and product teams, to understand their needs and provide insights that drive informed decision-making. Continuous Improvement : Stay updated with industry best practices, emerging technologies, and data analysis techniques, and proactively identify opportunities to enhance analytical methodologies and processes  Who we are looking for We are looking for an experienced Insights Analyst, who has proficiency in technical skills for data analysis, alongside excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex data and technical concepts in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Requirements: Experience: Minimum of 3 years of experience as an Insights Analyst, Data Analyst, or a similar role, with a proven track record of delivering impactful insights and recommendations. Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with expertise in statistical analysis, data modelling, and data visualisation tools (e.g., Python, SQL, Tableau, Google Looker). Business Acumen: Ability to understand business objectives, translate them into analytical requirements, and provide actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making. Education : Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Actuarial, or a related field. A master's degree would be a plus Team Player : Strong collaboration and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and build relationships across the organisation. Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and consistency in data analysis and reporting. Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, manage multiple priorities, and adapt to changing business needs. We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. Australia’s largest privately owned Engineering Organisation Employee Benefits: Compressed work week, fitness subsidies, health care discounts, paid parental leave Highly Reputable organisation with support and mentorship. Our world is rapidly changing and the greatest challenge for our country, industry, and community is the transition to a low-carbon economy. Ampcontrol want to be at the forefront of this transition, create change and support our customers, all by tackling the challenges they will face so that they can remain competitive and prosper. To achieve our new vision, we are realistic that we also need to transform our business and the way we work. By doing so we will accelerate transformational activities so that Ampcontrol is positioned to support our customers in the global energy transition as rapidly as possible and at scale. ABOUT THE ROLE As part of our business transformation journey, we are rethinking the way we work. We are in the process of replacing both our Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, moving to an integrated Microsoft Dynamics solution. To support this implementation and ensure the long-term success of our data management efforts, we are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Master Data Management Lead to join the team. The Master Data Management Lead will have a unique opportunity to contribute to Ampcontrol’s success by establishing and leading the master data management function. This role will be pivotal in designing global standards, defining governance strategies and ensuring accuracy and integrity of master data across the business. Initially working as part of a project team, the successful candidate will gradually transition to a leadership position, taking charge of the master data function and driving strategic direction. This is an initial 12 month – full time position, with a possibility for extension. Functions the role will perform include: Collaborate with the project team and key stakeholders to define master data requirements for the CRM and ERP systems. This will include helping to define critical attributes across key master data pillars Develop and implement data governance policies, procedures and standards to establish a robust master data management framework Manage the ERP and CRM implementation teams with data cleansing and migration activities to enable a seamless transition Lead ongoing data cleansing and enrichment activities to support the continuous improvement of master data quality and accuracy Monitor and resolve data integrity issues once systems are live Establish data management best practices and provide training and guidance to end-users on master data processes Identify data domain experts within the business and enable them to support best practice data stewardship Support operational teams and system end users, providing mentorship and fostering a culture of continuous improvement Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies and evolving regulatory requirements, with a focus on information security related to master data management to ensure Ampcontrol continues to follow industry best practice in this space ABOUT YOU: Our ideal team member will possess a unique combination of technical expertise, strategic thinking and leadership skills. You will have a passion for data management and are excited about the opportunity to shape and lead the master data function at Ampcontrol. Some other key attributes might include: You are a highly motivated individual who enjoys working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment managing multiple stakeholder groups You get excited to identify and drive process improvements within the scope of master data management You are extremely organised, with strong communication skills You will demonstrate a successful track record in designing and implementing master data solutions and your experience includes setting up a master data function and leading a team Meticulousness, with a keen eye for detail are second nature for you. You recognise the importance of data integrity and accuracy and constantly strive for excellence in data management You are motivated by achieving results and driving organisational success. You will have strong analytical and problem-solving skills which enable you to identify data related issues, develop solutions and deliver measurable outcomes that positively impact business outcomes WHY AMPCONTROL? For over 50 years Ampcontrol has achieved and celebrated a growing workforce across the world. Amongst the technological firsts, awards, impressive growth and global reach, our focus on our customers and a philosophy of solving problems that others can’t, has meant our solutions redefine industry expectations. At Ampcontrol, we are united by the principles of safety, people, innovation, customer and performance. Our people and values make our business better and are at the heart of everything we do. We are committed to investing in our people and provide a supportive, healthy and safe working environment for all our employees. analytical capabilities, and result orientation Ability to draw actionable insights from data and communicate effectively across different teams Advanced communication and influencing skills, cross-teams collaboration skills and ability to manage multiple stakeholders Efficient time management and high adaptability to changing environment Ability to balance short to long term priorities About us  HammondCare is a not-for-profit, values-based organisation that is passionate about improving the quality of care for people in need. As one of Australia’s most innovative health and aged care providers, we aim to set the global standard of relationship-based care for people with complex needs. HammondCare provides care primarily through hospitals, residential care homes and home-based care as well as services for dementia support, community palliative care, rehabilitation, positive aging and older persons’ mental health.  About the role  This exciting role ensures HammondCare gets the best value from its investment in business systems. This role focuses on all data collected in our business systems, methods of collection, systems integration, data warehouse design and management, reporting and providing business teams the information from our business systems to assist with decision making.  As a pivotal advocate, you will champion the role of data and analytics in delivering value to HammondCare. This includes optimising investments in business systems, enhancing business and customer insights, and equipping management with the information necessary for efficient decision-making.  This role is a permanent full-time role based at St Leonards with working from home options.  Key Responsibilities include  Proactive Stakeholder Engagement: Identify reporting and analytics needs, and proactively collaborate with key stakeholders to understand strategic data and analytical objectives. Enable them to access critical decision-making insights through user-friendly and intuitive tools Data Transformation Expertise: Develop and implement methodologies, processes, and technologies that convert raw data into meaningful and actionable information. This includes historical, current, and predictive views of business operations Modeling for Insight: Employ descriptive and predictive models to extract valuable knowledge and insights, enabling data-driven recommendations and decision guidance. BI Stack Mastery: Serve as the technical and functional expert for HammondCare's BI stack, including SQL Scripting, SSIS, SSRS, and PowerBI. Bridge the gap between conceptual business ideas and the detailed execution required for success Data Integration Leadership: Extract, transform, and store data from various systems and sources, both on-premises and in the cloud. Analyse this data to generate valuable business insights. Provide expertise in designing, developing, and managing system integrations to support various business teams Support for Systems Administration: Collaborate with the Application Management Team by offering information for application support, data migration, data analysis, upgrades, and configuration changes Effective Communication and Collaboration: Maintain open and efficient communication with key IT team members to ensure the operational reliability of systems. Strategic Business Reporting: Implement a well-planned and technically superior strategy for managing business reporting and dashboard requirements  About You  Commitment to engage and align with HammondCare’s Christian Mission, Motivation and Mission in Action A bachelor’s degree in information systems or computing Science, complemented by hands-on practical experience A minimum of four years demonstrated expertise in the field of information systems, particularly in business systems, databases, and the development and implementation of data and Business Intelligence (BI) strategies Mandatory extensive proficiency in the MS SQL Server stack, notably in SQL scripting, SSIS and SSRS, with a strong preference for experience in Microsoft Data Factory. Power BI preferred Proven track record in unlocking business and customer value through the management of complex CRM and ERP systems A fervor for data analysis to drive informed business decisions and enhance operational efficiency Keen understanding of business dynamics Strong business analytics skills, including gathering user requirements, process mapping, and preparing comprehensive project documentation Expertise in data warehousing and data integration methodologies Proficiency in API implementation and coding Exceptional analytical capabilities and unwavering attention to detail Demonstrates initiative and maintains a service-oriented attitude Capable of working both independently and collaboratively within a team Possesses advanced communication and interpersonal skills Exceptional organisational abilities, with a talent for task prioritisation to meet deadlines Aged Care and/or Health industry experience preferred but not essential  Benefits  We care about your wellbeing at HammondCare and as a result offer a wide range of health and lifestyle benefits including:  Fitness Passports; Full facility access can include gyms, group classes and pools for yourself and your family. Discounts across a range of household names such as JB HI- FI Option to purchase up to 2 weeks additional annual leave 14 weeks Paid Parental Leave Learning and development opportunities  To Apply  If you are ready to make a difference with HammondCare, ! Let's talk about nib The nib Group has a mission and vision of people enjoying better health. Through our success, we aspire to more prosperous and sustainable communities, not only the creation of enterprise value. nib is a trusted health partner, helping members and travellers make more informed healthcare decisions, transact with healthcare systems and generally live healthier lives. We’re looking for people who share this passion and want to be a part of a team that has the appetite and ambition to be extraordinary. Extraordinary comes in different perspectives and experiences. We’re committed to an environment where everyone has the autonomy and freedom to be their authentic selves, every day. nib offers a hybrid work location model that is designed to support flexibility. Let's talk about this role Reporting to the Data Product Manager, as a Technical Business Analyst, you will be responsible for analysing business requirements and scoping the criteria for the development of appropriate data products to satisfy the business user’s requirements. Key to this role is managing the priorities within our squads and communicating with the business stakeholders. Other responsibilities of this role include: Proactive problem solving and strong attention to detail Maintain and prioritise the team backlog in collaboration with the product manager and other team members Act as a Technical Product Owner in the squad based delivery model. Facilitate agile ceremonies Formulate and maintain technical specifications and user stories including detailed acceptance criteria Let's talk about you With prior experience in a Technical Business Analyst role, you consider yourself someone who can take a high-level business concept and have the ability to scope the technical requirements for a data delivery team. To be effective, you will also have: Experience as a Technical Business Analyst in a delivery team High-level written and verbal communication skills to assist with effective stakeholder management A track record of taking ownership, through transparent communication, prioritisation, and ability to meet deadlines Excellent collaboration skills in cross functional teams with the ability to communicate to both technical and non-technical audiences Proven analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities A broad enterprise-wide view and understanding of business processes and drivers having significant work experience within large – medium size business corporations. Previous experience with SQL scripting is desirable Tertiary qualifications and/or relevant experience Industry specific knowledge and experience is desirable At nib, we recognise that some people may only apply when their education, skills and/or experiences are identical to what an employer is looking for in a candidate. We're always on the lookout for curious individuals who will add to the culture at nib Group - so if this role resonates with you, please apply! For more information about tech at nib, please take check out our tech careers page: https://www.nib.com.au/careers/tech Let's talk about working at nib  Our hybrid working approach means our employees work outside of the office for the majority of the time. Our hubs offer workspaces to connect and collaborate for events, meetings, or activities. To help our employees embrace working outside of the office, we provide financial support to set up and maintain their home workspace. nib's approach to flexibility is focused on personalisation and giving our employees choice - not only in where they work, but also when and how.  Other benefits to support you at work (and play) include: Generous discounts on nib health and travel insurance products including 50% discount on employee health insurance The opportunity to give back to the community through paid leave for volunteering through nib Foundation Support your better health - whatever that looks for you - through our nib Well Program and corporate fitness discounts Access to our employee share plans, short-term incentive program and life and salary continuance insurance benefits Benefits to support our diverse workforce with 18 weeks paid parental leave for all new parents regardless of carer status, 5 days paid cultural leave for First Nations peoples and 4 weeks paid gender affirmation leave for trans, gender diverse and intersex employees The fine print All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Successful applicants will be required to complete a background check (including criminal history and bankruptcy check) prior to commencement of employment. Overview Working as an integral part of the Configuration Analyst team, you will provide analysis of business requirements and where necessary production business requirements in order to develop configuration specifications for required system changes. Assist the business with clarifying requirements and identifying alternative solutions. Support the Business Analyst, Technical Analyst, Development and Test team members throughout the System Development Life Cycle (SDLC).  Key Accountabilities and main responsibilities Strategic Focus  Liaise with key Business Stakeholders and analyse Business Requirement Documents to identify configuration solutions considering all databases, applications and systems affected and provide expertise, and seek clarification on, Business Requirements where required. Build, test and document specifications for configurations system changes. Provide specialist expertise on configuration design criteria to Business, Technical Analysts, developers and test analysts for all supported Systems. Attend Business and Technical meetings, where required, to facilitate or understand configuration solution outcomes. Complete Business Requirements where necessary and produce Configuration Specifications. Ensure configuration solution design meets business requirements and solution is understood by Business, Technical Development and Test Teams. Perform peer review and sign off Configuration SDLC deliverables for other team members both before release and after production implementation. Accurate and regular time and task recording to ensure effort expended on tasks can be monitored and reported against. Assist with any of the SDLC testing phases to provide clarifications and respond to enquiries. Assist with escalated Production Support issues and conduct root cause analysis. Investigate and consult on pragmatic alternatives for short, medium, and long-term solutions to a problem. Be proactive in identifying and implementing improvements to processes and procedures within the team. Manage and balance client and stakeholder expectations and report and escalate where needed. Work and collaborate with third and/or vendor parties to deliver integrated system solutions. Logging and accessing configuration solutions within the JIRA database and thoroughly documenting the status of all client liaisons and communications. SQL query writing to support analysis and implementation tasks. The above list of key accountabilities is not an exhaustive list and may change from time to time based on business needs.  Experience & Personal Attributes 3 or more years BA / Administration experience in Superannuation and/or Insurance. Business and/or Business Analysis product knowledge in Superannuation, Pension, Defined Benefit and Redundancy Funds highly desirable. Knowledge of Link Group's core registry systems, web platform and other supporting applications is highly desirable. Knowledge of Link Group IT's software development life cycles. Experience in IT or a related area desirable. Working knowledge and application of SQL/Java/Oracle. Working knowledge of MS office products. Adaptability to working hours in order to meet business needs. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Sound understanding of IT application and system design best practice. Experience working in an outsourced or offshored environment. Demonstrated understanding of business drivers impacting IT systems. Tertiary qualifications or equivalent experience in IT or a related field. Link Group is a leading fund administration and share registry specialist. We are a market leading provider of technology-enabled administration solutions, continually developing our offerings to expand with our clients' needs. Since our inception, Link Group has been entrusted by clients to handle sensitive data in a secure and confidential manner. Our core businesses of fund administration and securities registration are complemented by our expertise in digital solutions and data analytics. Our Retirement & Superannuation Solutions division combines its proprietary technology, process and people to deliver a comprehensive financial data solution to its superannuation clients. We support clients across all superannuation fund sectors including government, industry, retail and corporate. By accompanying our core member and employer administration with a full range of value-added services, we offer the most comprehensive superannuation administration solution on the market. The scale, adaptability and ease of use of our proprietary systems, in conjunction with our integrated analytics offering, allow us to innovate and grow with the needs of our clients. Link Group is building a dynamic, client focused, caring and inclusive culture that is built on the foundations of an entrepreneurial spirit, effective risk management, empathy and trust, and underpinned by its core values. We are an inclusive employer whose people work collaboratively. We encourage, support and value the various talents and perspectives of our people and promote a flexible and blended work environment where our people can thrive and their wellbeing is supported. We know that diversity drives better client outcomes, continuous improvement, and growth. Be part of the Link Group journey and together we will achieve our full potential. We treat all individuals fairly and equitably and do not discriminate on the basis of diverse characteristics including, but not limited to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, ethnicity, cultural background, physical abilities/disabilities, religious or political belief, marital or family status or carers responsibilities. Candidates must have the relevant work rights to be considered for an opportunity at Link Group. Successful applicants will be required to complete background screening prior to commencement of employment.Show moreReport

job_title: Business Analyst - Global Asset Management Distribution
job_description: More time off for the things that matter - Up to 6 weeks’ leave Work where we work best - Hybrid office/work-from-home environment As a Business Analyst you will be working across global distribution teams in a multi-boutique asset manager in a team supporting the Chief Distribution Officer in executing on global and regional distribution strategies. With previous experience as a Business Analyst you have expertise in business transformation and possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills and are proficient in business analysis and continuous improvement methodologies, project management and delivery processes. About the role As a Business Analyst within Perpetual Global Asset Management Distribution, you will: Collate complex data from numerous global sources to deliver quality management reporting across global distribution. Deliver this, with insights, through professional Power Point presentations for Executive Committees and Board meetings Provision of data analytics - developing, collating, and maintaining detailed and sophisticated data sets in Excel from various global sources Analysing, interpreting, and presenting global distribution data in a meaningful way to better inform strategic decisions Research, source and interpret asset management information from industry databases, websites, and other vendors for inclusion in strategy and distribution business plans Implement best practices in reporting management information across global distribution and develop best in class capabilities and tools. Collaborating with global stakeholders across numerous time zones and affiliates. About you Relevant tertiary qualifications Minimum of 3 years business analysis experience within a global asset manager Solid understanding of investment products, funds management and asset classes Advanced Excel and PowerPoint essential and Power BI skills a plus ability to handle large and complex data sets using different applications as appropriate ability to present this in a simple visual way to drive actionable outcomes Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, working collaboratively in a team-oriented environment to deliver high-quality solutions that meet business requirements and user needs. How we work Our unique culture is underpinned by our three organisational behaviours, Stretch, Own it, Make an impact which drive our approach of day-to-day interactions with colleagues and clients; the way we approach decision-making to the questions we ask and the problems we solve. Employee benefits Work from anywhere in Australia for up to one month each year An annual allowance to empower you to prioritise your personal wellbeing Access to LinkedIn learning, study support and commitment to supporting professional development Lend your expertise and support Indigenous organisations to achieve their own development goals with a six weeks’ secondment with Jawun Diversity and inclusion WGEA Employer of Choice for gender equality since 2018 Strong commitment to all aspects of Diversity and Inclusion through a robust 7 pillar strategy A growing number of employee-led networks who work to raise awareness and drive continued change We support over 50 Indigenous communities through Native Title Trusts, helping to secure the communities future. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People. We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where diversity is celebrated and welcome applications from people from all backgrounds and communities. Our goal is to provide a work environment that enables you to thrive, whatever your circumstances.Show moreReport

At Nielsen, we believe that career growth is a partnership. You ultimately own, fuel and set the journey. By joining our team of nearly 14,000 associates, you will become part of a community that will help you to succeed. We champion you because when you succeed, we do too. Embark on a new initiative, explore a fresh approach, and take license to think big, so we can all continuously improve. We enable your best to power our future. ABOUT THIS JOB: To support the data delivery team and create insight reports based on stakeholder requirements. Provide support to senior analysts and liaise with other teams to maintain data integrity. This role involves the use of statistical knowledge, attention to detail and technical client servicing skills on a daily basis. The Service Integrity (SI) team is currently looking for an enthusiastic and professional Service Integrity Analyst. An important goal for the Service Integrity team is to maintain the statistical integrity standards of the Television Audience Panel in line with contractual KPIs and client commitments. Service Integrity Analyst will work closely with the Service Integrity Manager & the Executive team on issues relating to data delivery, data integrity, project data analysis and third party software suppliers. RESPONSIBILITIES Provide support to the data delivery team across departments to ensure we deliver dailydata according to contractual obligations (365 days a year) Perform on-going analysis and review of systems and procedures to identify key areas of improvement Compile specifications, document processes, procedures and methodologies Testing and checking changes to output after changes to data delivery systems Make contributions in the development of Test Plans and Test Scripts, and also perform test execution as required Provide ad-hoc statistical/technical support e.g. technical data queries from clients Maintain and develop Python and SAS programs of panel management reports – modify to accommodate changes or provide training to support staff and oversee such changes QUALIFICATIONS University graduate or equivalent experience Proficient in Python, SQL, SAS (desirable), R (desirable) and Tableau Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel Work confidently with large and complex data sets Highly analytical with proven ability to solve and turn data into meaningful insights Autonomous self-starter who works well in a fast-paced, dynamic environment Strong stakeholder engagement skills with the ability to present complex information simply and directly Strong communication skills, both written and verbal and an ability to speak confidently in front of large groups WHY WORK FOR NIELSEN?  At Nielsen, we believe that career growth is a partnership. You ultimately own, fuel and set the journey. Your manager and others within the Nielsen community are here to help support and invest in your continuous growth. Nielsen promotes work life balance by offering Flexible (Smart) working, a day off for your Birthday, a ‘No leave No life’ policy which rewards you with bonus annual leave days per year, volunteering leave, and paid parental leave for both carers.  Be a Learn-It-All. Nielsen invests in the growth and development of our team offering an Education assist program, a global mentoring program, and access to internal training and development resources via online platforms. Your wellbeing is our priority. We partner with Spring Health for our EAP offering counseling and support for our staff and their family. In addition we focus on holistic wellness with dedicated activities on physical, mental and financial wellbeing. Commitment to diversity and inclusion. Diversity, equity and inclusion are at the heart of everything we do — from our people to our products. We value diversity of thought, experiences, skills and backgrounds. We're focused on creating a culture of inclusion—where we value, encourage and promote the various thoughts, opinions and insights of our diverse workforce. All employees have an opportunity to contribute to the causes they are most passionate about via our Business Resource Groups.  ABOUT NIELSEN As the arbiter of truth, Nielsen Global Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. To discover what’s true, we measure across all channels and platforms—from podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are armed with the truth, they have a deeper understanding of their audiences and can accelerate growth.  Do you want to move the industry forward with Nielsen? Our people are the driving force. Your thoughts, ideas and expertise can propel us forward. Whether you have fresh thinking around maximizing a new technology or you see a gap in the market, we are here to listen and act. Our team is made strong by a diversity of thoughts, experiences, skills, and backgrounds. You’ll enjoy working with smart, fun, inquisitive colleagues, who are passionate about their work. Come be part of a team that motivates you to do your best work! #LI-LV1Show moreReport

At Dexus, every day we come to work ready to push past our personal comfort zones, secure in the knowledge that we will always be supported to try new things, to learn, to improve – to realise our full potential. As a Finance Analyst within the Transactions & Reporting team at Dexus, you’ll help to lead and develop the real assets that power our business. You’ll be encouraged to innovate as part of an ambitious team, sharing your vision for the future of business communities and rallying the people around you to achieve it. You’ll witness your ideas coming to life and play a vital role in the positive impact we have on our customers, all while having your own personal and professional potential supported through a range of employee benefits and programs. How you will make an impact As Finance Analyst, your responsibilities will be varied ranging from advising on appropriate application of financial reporting to specific transactions, deliver insightful Board reporting based on an in-depth knowledge of the Group’s activities and coordinating the half year and year end audits to ensure deadlines are met. The Transactions and Reporting team sits within the broader Finance team. This role will participate in building pro-active relationships with Finance, a variety of Dexus Business Units and external auditors. Other responsibilities will include but are not limited to: Deliver practical, relevant and commercial financial accounting solutions that enable Dexus to achieve strategic and financial objectives Technical research; assessing the impact of new accounting standards and assisting in their implementation for Dexus Preparation of Board papers, including communication of technical accounting matters, audit fees etc. About You We are looking for a highly driven, agile and motivated individual with a demonstrated understanding of statutory reporting and/or transaction experience ideally within a Big 4 / Chartered, Audit or ASX listed property environment. Your ability to explain complex matters clearly and succinctly to stakeholders at varying levels of seniority is highly valuable. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 1-2 years post-qualification experience in a reporting/technical finance role. Prior experience in report writing and exposure to Yardi or Workiva systems will be advantageous. In addition to strong problem-solving and communication skills, a natural curiosity, willingness to take initiative and learn will see you thrive in this role. We encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply for roles at Dexus, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, and people of all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application. We will partner with you to identify the best way to assist you through our recruitment process. Ready to help create the future? Apply now or visit dexus.com/careers We’re one of Australia’s leading real assets groups, actively managing a real estate and infrastructure portfolio valued at over $60 billion. From our leaders to our learners, we see real assets as our foundation of possibility, and embrace the positive impacts our work has on our investors, communities, and the futures we’re creating for them. At Dexus we value diversity and inclusion across our organisation and are proud to have our Workplace Gender Equality Accreditation, which recognises employers that are leaders in gender equality. We also provide a breadth of flexible work arrangements for all employees within our workplace and offer wellbeing support, professional development and great benefits to ensure that all of our people are engaged and feel empowered to realise their full potential. As an employee of Dexus, you will have access to and benefit from: Flexible working – such as a hybrid work model to enhance your work/life balance Benefits such as a Wellbeing Allowance, five additional annual leave ‘Dexus’ days and our Safe and Well program Professional development and memberships, as well as study assistance We value our employee’s experience with us and are proud to have: TRIBE, our established LGBTI+ Dexus network FLIP, our Future Leaders in Property program which provides exposure for young women to the property industry A partnership with Parents@Work, providing our parents and carers with coaching, education sessions and online learning Opportunities for our female leaders to attend Chief Executive Women (CEW) leaders’ program Join Dexus and have your potential realised.Show moreReport

A diverse company that leads from the front with inclusivity across Its organisation. This large organisation is currently looking for a Business Analyst to provide business analysis and process mapping.  You will work with various stakeholders to ensure improvement of business processes and capabilities are assessed as well as documenting testing cases, process mapping and creating future operating models.  About the Role:  Providing business analysis and intense process mapping Providing hands-on business analysis work to agile projects Identify relevant stakeholders and working with them to understand their needs, concerns and the environment in which they operate Working with Enterprise Architects to facilitate information gathering for solution design Planning and mapping future operating models Producing new and existing documents as required including, but not limited to, business requirements, traceability matrices, test plans and test cases, processes and procedures.   About You:  Understanding and experience of Business Analysis and Project Management bodies of knowledge Proven experience working to GDPR Must have experience working within large Data Privacy Projects Exposure to various project management frameworks including Agile, Waterfall etc. Strong analytical and problem-solving ability and ability to conceptualize and think creatively Ability to influence to achieve desired outcomes Strong written and verbal communications skills to ensure effective communication with all levels of the business, including the ability to convey complex information clearly and influentially Persuasive and patient with good interpersonal skills  Benefits:  Working for a leading organisation – Hybrid working opportunities to be discussed with your manager Be at the forefront of the Data Privacy Project Working with multiple technology solutions. Are you a driven Marketing Analyst who wants to be a key member of our team in Sydney?  We’re looking for an industry professional to help us continue our success, and that of our clients. THE ROLE This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of a rapidly growing team within the digital marketing industry. The Marketing Analyst will work within the data team at Sparro to implement internal reporting solutions for our teams. Objectives Drive client and business success through insightful dashboarding and maintenance of data hygiene. Create best-in-class database and dashboarding solutions. Champion the standardisation and build out of advanced reporting processes across the Sparro business Perform maintenance of existing databases and reports. Troubleshoot data collection and tracking issues and discrepancies across platforms. Supporting the education of industry development on available reporting and analytics APIs internally and for clients. Opportunity to lead, develop and productise new projects and offerings. Responsibilities Build and create live advanced marketing channel dashboards for agency-wide adoption Be involved in the build out of Sparro’s first data warehouse Extract data using SQL from relational data-warehouses, running queries to create tables ready for analysis and dashboarding Extract insights on performance variances using data Continually integrate skills, experience and working practices to improve problem solving, organisation and strategic thinking Supporting the data team, and client leads on daily ad-hoc tasks Promoting the Sparro values and culture YOU You live for results, drive change, and expect only the best. You move fast, but also and engage and empower the team around you to get stuff done. You’re also not afraid to dive right in and solve challenges by rolling up your sleeves.  You’ve worked with variety of clients and are looking to build successful senior stakeholder relationships.  Your contribution to the agency’s offering, direction, culture and knowledge will be invaluable, as will the solutions you produce and lead for our clients. Your skills 1-2 years of experience as an Analyst or in a similar role Understanding of digital marketing strategy and concepts Proven experience in data warehouse management and dashboard design Excel/Sheets & SQL Knowledge (BigQuery, SSMS, Azure, Amazon S3), Python/R is a plus Experience with Looker Studio (or alternatively Tableau and/or Power BI) Experience with Google Analytics 4 and/or Google Tag Manager a plus Strong written and verbal communication skills PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT The performance of the Marketing Analyst will be determined based on their ability to: Create advanced dashboards for Sparro and their clients. Identify opportunities by extraction of insightful data to aid in strategic client development Standardise and grow the adoption rate of new reporting processes. Improve efficiency of internal reporting tasks. Achieve fast market-readiness while managing multiple projects and priorities. Align projects with the overall Sparro strategy and market requirements. Contribute to the values and culture of Sparro. Highly commended, but not essential, self-start a project.Show moreReport

Company Description  Jobs for Humanity is dedicated to building an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Therefore, we have dedicated this job posting to individuals coming from the following communities: Refugee, Neurodivergent, Single Parent, Blind or Low Vision, Deaf or hard of hearding, Black, Hispanic, Asian, Military Veterans, the Elderly, the LGBTQ, and Justice Impacted individuals. If you identify with any of the following communities do not hesitate to register.   Company Name: Rokt  Job Description  About Rokt Rokt is the global leader in eCommerce technology, helping companies seize the full potential of every transaction moment to grow revenue and acquire new customers at scale. Live Nation, AMC Theatres, PayPal, Uber, Hulu, Staples, Lands’ End, and HelloFresh are among the more than 2,500 leading global businesses and advertisers that use Rokt's solutions to drive more value through every transaction by offering highly relevant messages to their customers at the moment they are most likely to convert. With our December 2022 secondary transaction, Rokt’s valuation increased to $2.4 Billion. We are expanding rapidly and globally – operating in 14 countries across North America, Europe and the Asia-Pacific region with the largest office in Sydney and a major R&D hub in NYC. With 50% annual growth and vibrant company culture, Rokt has been listed in ‘Great Places to Work’ in the US and Australia. Our award-winning culture is guided by our eight core values: smart with humility, own the outcomes, force for good, conquer new frontiers, enjoy the ride, raise the bar, communicate with impact, and disagree then commit. These values help us attract, engage, and develop the right talent around the globe and ensure we foster an environment that helps us all do our best work. Keen to join a fast-growing company and a vibrant culture? Learn more at rokt.com.  About the role Rokt is hiring a Senior Data Analyst to join our Product Development team in Sydney. We are a data-driven company, and data is at the heart of all of our decision-making. We are looking for someone who will help the business innovate and grow through comprehensive and actionable data-driven insights. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a key role in helping our Rokt Ecommerce and Relevancy/ML teams enhance the value they create for our partners and advertisers through deep-dive analyses, providing recommendations on improving products and features, building models and data products that can be actioned on by various teams, and influencing teams with your analyses, models and recommendations. You will be expected to leverage your business acumen, analytical skill, product sense, and communication to drive a variety of impactful initiatives across Product teams that you are embedded into. You will also be expected to own and develop new metrics, and measurement frameworks, track performance, define success for various features and investigate changes in their KPIs. An ideal candidate will develop data products that scale, produce accurate and statistically robust analyses, and communicate in a way that makes analyses and models easy to interpret by Product, Engineering, and GTM teams. Requirements Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Operations Research, Statistics or an equivalent quantitative field 4+ years of experience in Analytics or Data Science Deep SQL skills and proficiency in working with big data and ETL management Autonomous, detail-oriented, and comfortable with breaking down ambiguous problems into quantitative solutions Passion for extracting actionable insights that move the business forward Good business acumen and communication skills (written and verbal). Proficient in being able to distil complex findings and analyses into simple outputs. Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau Strong stakeholder management experience Team player who positively contributes to the culture of the Analytics team and Rokt Preferred Qualifications Master’s degree or higher in Statistics, Analytics, Data Science, or an equivalent quantitative field 5+ years of experience in Product Analytics 2+ years of experience analyzing ecommerce data Familiar with data mining and data engineering Python/R experience strongly preferred Experience communicating results and business impact of analytical deep dives to senior leadership Experience with statistical analyses and familiarity with basic machine learning Responsibilities Partner with Product and Engineering teams through analyses, reporting, modelling, and generate valuable insights to aid in decision making Conduct quantitative analyses on partner, advertiser, and customer behaviour to help Product Managers and Engineering refine their product strategy Provide product managers and engineering teams with recommendations that help them achieve business outcomes through by unearthing actionable insights across our product suite Create and maintain dashboards and reports to baseline and monitor Product usage and company-wide metrics Define measurement frameworks and analyze key metrics and to inform decision-making and measure success Offer thought partnership to stakeholders by deconstructing problem statements into quantitative hypotheses and proposing associated analyses Collaborate with the product team to set SMART goals for the organization and implement methods to track progress (i.e., supporting measurement of OKRs) Understand the drivers that impact our north star metric, and propose A/B testing roadmaps to influence various Product teams Benefits Work with the greatest talent in town. Our recruitment process is tough but diligent. We’re constantly aiming to implement our value of “raise the bar” and setting high standards for our Rokt’stars. This is essential in our high-performing, high-grow culture where we strive to bring in the brightest and best talent. Our teams thrive by challenging the status quo and we encourage all of our teams to unleash their desire to achieve something bigger. Join a community. At Rokt we’re a community of curious explorers. SafetyCulture is a customer and product led SaaS company with the purpose of helping frontline teams get better every day. We are building a mobile-first operations platform that gives workers a voice, and leaders visibility, to make better decisions in the workplace every day. Our mission is to unite teams to become a force for improvement in any organisation. Headquartered in Sydney, SafetyCulture has six offices around the world and over 70,000 customers. We are seeking an exceptional Vice President of Data Analytics with a passion for product development and a track record of turning data insights into successful products. The ideal candidate is someone who can use data to identify customer needs and preferences, and who can work collaboratively with data specialists, product managers and engineers to design, build, and launch innovative products that delight our customers and drive growth.   About you: You have significant experience as a data analytics leader, with a track record of successfully building and scaling data teams and turning data insights into successful products. You have exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, and can inspire and motivate teams to achieve ambitious goals. You have a passion for product development and are customer-focused, with a deep understanding of customer needs and preferences. You are a mentor and coach who is committed to developing talent and fostering a culture of learning and growth within the data team. You have sound business acumen and can use data to drive decision-making and improve business outcomes. You are a collaborative business partner who can work effectively with cross-functional teams, build strong relationships and drive alignment towards common goals. You are a problem solver who can navigate complex data challenges and drive solutions that deliver measurable business impact. You have experience working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment and are comfortable navigating ambiguity and driving results in high growth environments. How you will spend your time: Lead and oversee the overall vision, strategy, and execution of the data analytics team, ensuring alignment with organisational goals and objectives. Building, developing and rapidly scaling a team of data scientists, analysts, and engineers. Advocating and representing the data team at the Senior Leadership and Board level as a strategic decision-making arm for the business. Using data to drive decision-making, build excellent product features and improve business outcomes. Collaborate and work closely with other departments in the company such as product development, engineering, marketing, and customer support to ensure that data is being used effectively to drive results. Full responsibility for the completeness and integrity of SafetyCulture's data, ensuring that the company's data is accurate and reliable. This might involve data quality checks, monitoring data pipelines, maintenance and troubleshooting data issues. Delivering high impact projects that give measurable business outcomes. Identifying opportunities to productise data and leverage data assets to improve new and existing features that delight our customers. More than a job! Equity with high growth potential, and a competitive salary Flexible working arrangements, we encourage you to create the best work blend while working from your home and the local SafetyCulture office; Access to professional and personal training and development opportunities; Hackathons, Workshops, Lunch & Learns; We encourage involvement in the community, open source work, attending talks and events, and experimenting with new technologies. Office benefits: In-house Culinary Crew serving up daily breakfast, lunch and snacks Barista coffee machine, craft beer on tap, boutique wines and a range of non-alcoholic beverages Quarterly celebrations and team events, including the annual Shiplt global offsite Table tennis, board games, books library, and pet-friendly office We’re committed to building inclusive teams and cultivating a sense of belonging so our people can bring their whole authentic selves to work each day.
