About us  Evolution Mining was founded in late 2011 and has operations across Australia and in Ontario, Canada. We currently operate five wholly owned operations across NSW, QLD, WA and Canada with a leadership team that continually focuses on embedding a values driven culture aligned with our company vision to create a premier, global gold company.  Our Group operations are based in Liverpool St. (Sydney CBD) providing support across all sites in several key areas including IT, ensuring Evolution are positioned as a leader in effective optimisation of Information Technology.  About the role  We are currently recruiting a Senior Data Analyst to join our team on a 12-month fixed term contract. The Senior Data Analyst will lead the delivery of a program of high quality and timely data modelling, BI reporting, and advanced analytics (including AI/ML) for Evolution Mining, initially across the Asset Management (including maintenance) and Finance functions.  This role will involve significant stakeholder engagement, defining requirements, programme managing the implementation of fit-for-purpose analytics solutions, assisting and providing guidance and mentorship to members of the BI and advanced analytics teams, promoting a high performing and collaborative environment.  You will design and develop robust data models and supporting documentation and processes that support BI requirements to enable efficient data usage and analysis, informing stakeholders on patterns, trends and insights. Key to your success will be maintaining and utilising Power BI and other advanced analytics tools to create and maintain accurate visually appealing and interactive dashboards, reports, and data visualisations to enable data driven decisions.  This role will ideally be based in our Sydney Group office, however applicants with the ability to work in Brisbane will also be considered.  A bout you  To succeed in this role, you will have significant experience in leading reporting and advanced analytics work in Power BI, AI/ML technologies and tools, Power Query, Power Pivot, Power View, and Power Automate and have an in depth understanding of Microsoft Azure, within the mining industry and specifically in the fields of asset management (including maintenance) and ideally also finance.  You will be able to show evidence of the strong business benefits, improvement initiatives and outcomes that your work has delivered, such as significant financial impact/savings, large scale automation resulting in substantial time/cost savings in line with improving companies’ overall performance and increasing competitive advantage.  Key is that you are comfortable in demonstrating experience of building relationships with operational mining and asset management professionals is key; being able to scope, build and deliver BI and advanced analytics products that you are comfortable communicating, presenting, training/upskilling and continuously improving, able to translate complexity into user-friendly reporting.  This is very much a hands-on advanced analytics and reporting role where you will be leading your own projects, and outcomes, with clear KPIs and incentive based on performance within a supportive, structured team.  What we offer  Our Data and Analytics team is progressive and future focused, driving innovation within an organisation that is embracing a high-performing data team, utilising the latest tools, techniques and technologies in data and analytics. We are an outcome focussed team who lead projects that deliver real and large-scale value for the company, that is tracked and visible.  It’s an exciting time to be part of the Data and Analytics team at Evolution as we also lead a complex data governance programme, develop state of the art data lakehouse platform architectural framework, and further develop our data culture, change management and literacy programmes.  This role is offered on a fixed-term 12-month basis with a competitive salary, access to an incentive payment based on completion of project milestones, and a hybrid work environment. As this is a fixed-term contract you will accrue leave (annual and personal), superannuation and you will be eligible for up to three days wellness leave in accordance with our benefits.  We are an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to providing safe and inclusive work environments which allow our employees to be themselves. We support our employees' work-life integration and provide a stimulating environment to foster development and career growth.  To understand more on this role, please contact marie.stocker@evolutionmining.com  We encourage candidates from diverse backgrounds to apply.  As part of the application process, Evolution will be collecting your personal information to assess your suitability for the role.Show moreReport

Company Description Hi. We’re OFX, a global provider of online, international payment services. We solve the complexity of moving money and enable better decisions. Headquartered in Sydney with offices worldwide, we’re a customer-focused business that is all about inspiring customer confidence. At OFX, you’ll have the opportunity to reach beyond your role and function across disciplines. Make use of your diverse skill set at a business that values your expertise and turn your potential into reality.  Job Description Purpose of your role You will play a critical role on our marketing team to drive growth, with a focus on the optimisation of the entire customer journey, to ensure our marketing activity drives our customer and commercial targets. You will be pivotal in turning OFX’s client & behavioural data into insightful and actionable information, and ensure this information is acted upon by communicating effectively and proactively with stakeholders. This is an ideal opportunity for an Analyst with an FP&A background looking to transition into a marketing function where you will influence commercial decisions. As a bridge between the worlds of finance and marketing, your passion for providing insights and consulting the business will see you dig deep into data sets in order to effectively story tell, providing ‘why, how and clear recommendation of ‘what’s next’. What you do Identify opportunities to drive market share, profitability, growth, channel strategy and customer engagement through marketing and customer insights Provide a portfolio view and regular reporting of customer and marketing metrics to drive visibility of key marketing performance indicators as well as actual performance to target Work with key stakeholders in the marketing team to size opportunities and support in the development of business cases, including modelling the outcomes and developing the full P&L – this includes marketing, customer engagement, product, UX, digital, website, CRM and data science teams Work closely with the Finance team to business case marketing initiatives and impact of incremental investment Assist the CMO with board reporting Continue to refine and expand our channel strategy across all mediums: SEO, SEM, display, social, PR, content, email. Monitor, analyse, and report on KPIs to ensure marketing initiatives are driving profitable short-term and long-term results Understand and validate that ‘data source-to-report’ is reliable, understandable and consumable Develop a program of continuous improvement through structured and measurable experimentation – insight-to-productionisation, including segmentation, data modeling and predictive analysis Use web analytics and business intelligence tools such as Google Analytics or Data Studio to develop dashboards that understands our customers and exploit those insights in campaigns Ensure customer data is strictly used in accordance with OFX’s legal and regulatory requirements in the markets it operates in Think strategically, analytically and creatively about new ways to reach customers and increase relevance Provide pre and post campaign analysis to determine opportunities or realise uplifts.  Qualifications  Degree qualified in a Finance, Statistics, Mathematics or Business-related discipline highly desired. Knowledge, skills, experience 5+ years of commercial experience, working cross-functionally with a mix of experience in areas of data and analytics, product, marketing, sales and/or finance Excellent stakeholder management skills and ability to present findings and recommendations to all levels of the business, through verbal and written findings Experience in working with online marketing programs with CPC, CPA, and CPM cost models Deep understanding of performance marketing, content strategy, and analytics. A data-driven strategist who focuses on a rigorous LTV/CAC approach. Advanced experience in working with analytical tools such as Google Analytics Advanced experience in working with data visual BI tools such as Data Studio or Tableau Advanced skills with SQL, Excel and BigQuery All related products in Google Marketing Platform, Social Media, Google Ads, Salesforce Analytics (Marketing Cloud & Pardot) are desirable. G-Suite and Microsoft office products Thorough understanding of various online and offline marketing funnels Very data driven and should be curious about and tell stories using data Sensitivity to potential trade-offs between performance and branding Strong sense of ownership and determination to get things done Curiosity and eagerness to learn and grow Additional Information What it's like working at OFX We’re OFXers because we want to make a difference. We see challenges as opportunities and we’re not afraid to roll up our sleeves to get stuff done. We’re committed to making things easier for our clients, pushing boundaries and continuing to move with the times so that we can continue to inspire confidence every day and through every transaction. We operate as one team, cross-functionally and globally to drive outcomes that deliver excellence for our customers. We're curious self-starters who love learning and sharing our knowledge with others. We embrace change and use our initiative and resilience to overcome challenges. Always keep learning. We offer LinkedIn learning programs, which all OFXers have access to. We offer a variety of other learning programs and host an annual Open Day to encourage cross functional and soft skill learning Giving back, we encourage OFXers to give back to causes and communities that are important to them. We celebrate this with an annual volunteer day, that OFXers can use together or individually We promote an environment of reward and recognition, OFXers are encouraged to celebrate their peers’ effort, technical expertise or support through a range of channels and awards Our Good Vibes employee-led committees organize events to keep our employees engaged inside and outside the office. Whether it’s participating in our weekly yoga class (now also on Zoom), office happy hours, end of year celebrations. Our team wants you to feel welcome! At OFX, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive and accessible workplace where we value, respect, and encourage our people to be their authentic selves. With an employee base as diverse as the clients we serve, we know that fostering an inclusive workplace is fundamental to our continued success. If you require accommodation for any portion of the recruitment and hiring process, please email us at people.culture@ofx.com.  We encourage you to apply if this role aligns with your career aspirations.Show moreReport

Senior Cost Benefit Analysis (CBA) Analyst – Market and Economic Advisory Team, System Stewardship Directorate  Ongoing/temporary opportunity Grade 9/10 from $120,860 to $133,184 + superWe are based in Parramatta with offices across the state and offer flexible workingWe encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from diverse cultural backgrounds and people living with disability to apply  About the Department of Education The Department of Education is the largest provider of public education in Australia with responsibility for delivering high-quality public education to two-thirds of the NSW student population. For more information about the Department of Education, please visit NSW Department of Education   About the Early Childhood Outcomes Division  The Early Childhood Outcomes Division leads the delivery of the Early Childhood Education and Care reform program, including comprehensive investments in the critical first 5 years of life for every child – in child development and in early education and care, making investments that support families and the community now, as well as investing in long term reforms for the future. Key initiatives will include supporting families with young children to access the services they need to support their own prosperity and well-being; valuing and growing the early childhood education and care sector and investing in early childhood teachers and educators.  The Childcare and Economic Opportunity Fund (the Fund) is designed to provide supply-side interventions into the Early Childhood Education and Care Sector to reduce the barriers to workforce participation by improving the affordability and access to childcare.   About the Role  As the Senior CBA Analyst, you will lead the development, design, delivery and reporting of economic appraisals for programs and initiatives under the Fund alongside team members.  This role presents an exciting opportunity to be part of a team committed to delivering outcomes across a broad range of reform areas to improve the quality of early childhood education programs, build a sustainable workforce, and increase the affordability of early childhood education and care in NSW. The teams are focused on policy development, service design, and delivering programs, with a particular focus on data, information, and insights. We have a strong focus on engaging with families, communities, and the sector to support children to learn and grow in their early years and beyond. We are looking for innovative, outcomes-focused people who thrive in fast-paced, dynamic environments.   About You  We’re looking for passionate and driven team players from all walks of life from the private, public and not-for-profit sectors to join a forward-thinking team committed to delivering early childhood outcomes. It is critical that we build a team that is as diverse as the community we serve, and we encourage people with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from diverse cultural backgrounds, and people living with disability to apply.  If you are looking for a fulfilling career that will make a positive difference to communities across the state and help prepare young people for rewarding lives, then a role in our team is for you.  Please note – the team is based largely in Parramatta. While we are happy to consider flexible working options, we are looking for someone who can attend the Parramatta office on a weekly basis. Occasional travel will also be required to other sites for Board meetings and stakeholder engagement.   Key knowledge and experience  Knowledge of and commitment to implementing the Department’s Aboriginal Education Policy and upholding the Department’s Partnership Agreement with the NSW AECG and to ensure quality outcomes for Aboriginal people.   Essential requirements of the role A valid Working with Children Check for paid employmentTertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline, or demonstrated equivalent knowledge and/or experienceDemonstrated understanding of and commitment to the value of public education  Benefits 35-hour week with flexible/hybrid workingLeave entitlements and time in lieuAccess to fitness passport  How to apply When applying you will need to: Attach a resume (maximum 4 pages) and;A cover letter (maximum 2 pages) outlining how you meet the essential requirements and the focus capabilities of this role. Note: the selection process will include a range of assessment techniques to assist in determining your suitability for the role. Successful candidates will be required to undertake pre-employment screening for this role which includes a Working with Children Check and National Criminal History Check.  This is a child-related role As a condition of employment, you will be required to provide a Working with Children Check (WWCC) Clearance number and complete a National Criminal Record Check. Visit the website for more information.  Closing date: 27th November at 11:59pm.  Please note - applications for this recruitment process will be reviewed commencing mid-January 2024.  For recruitment related enquires, please write to ecorecruitment@det.nsw.edu.au  We welcome applications from all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups, the LGBTQIA+ community, veterans, refugees and people with disability. If we can make some adjustments to our recruitment/interview process to better enable you to shine, please contact the Diversity and Inclusion Team (dandi@det.nsw.edu.au) or visit NSW Department of Education Diversity and Inclusion.  A talent pool may be created through this recruitment process. A talent pool is a group of applicants who have been assessed and identified as suitable for this role, and who may be considered for a range of similar roles, including temporary, term or ongoing roles, over the next 18 months.Show moreReport

job_description: Senior Business Analyst - Fixed Term contract till 30/06/2025 Organisation/Entity: Transport For NSW Job category: Information & Communication Technology Job location: Sydney, NSW, AU, 2020 Job reference number: 90254 Employment type: Fixed Term Full-Time Salary range: $147865.0-$165608.0 You see the big picture, you’ve always worked on a grand scale, and now you’re ready to re-focus on grand impact.  Your innovative mindset is key to creating solutions to complex problems. Our systems drive our organisational success and underpin every journey our customers take. This is your opportunity to be part of an expert team who build and refine seamless technology experiences.  In this role, you'll:  Be working on massive digital and technology transformation program that will shape the future of how our customers plan, book, and pay for transport across NSW. Work with various stakeholders across our business and technical delivery functions to support the development of new products and systems which will serve our millions of customers every day.  Play a pivotal role in the analysis and integration of GTFS (General Transit Feed Specification) and SIRI (Service Interface for Real-time Information) feeds with our various customer channels. Have a detailed knowledge of trip planning and scheduling and have demonstrable experience implementing front end interfaces and backend systems.  Play a pivotal role in uncovering the needs of our key customers and stakeholders to assist the business in delivering the right solution outcomes for the trip planning capabilities we are incorporating across our customer channels. For more information on this position and business unit, view the role description.  About you  Expertise in GTFS and SIRI data standards to access, process, and analyse transit-related data Experience integrating data from GTFS and SIRI feeds with downstream systems, including implementation of real-time vehicle location tracking, arrival predictions and service alerts Experience gathering functional and non-functional requirements, writing use cases, user stories and acceptance criteria, and working in agile product delivery teams Strong experience in the application of business analysis methodologies, processes and techniques across the software delivery life cycle Exceptional written and verbal communication skills and ability to work collaboratively across varying levels of staff and disciplines Experience working with a wide range of stakeholders including Product Managers, engineers and service staff to refine systems and processes, and identify change impacts associated with new solution delivery Knowledge of the public transportation industry and its respective challenges is highly desirable This role is in a fast-paced domain, where you must be able to prioritise workload and manage this autonomously with minimal supervision Demonstrated experience working with both Agile and Waterfall methodologies in a BA capacity  Who we are  Transport for NSW provides a safe, integrated, and efficient transport system. We connect people, communities and industry every day. Join us Our workforce is as diverse as the community we serve. If you’d like further information on our inclusion and diversity initiatives, visit Transport careers.  We offer a wide range of employee benefits, like our award-winning flexible and hybrid work options.  This role is hybrid-friendly, meaning you can mix in-person days at your team’s home base location with remote days.  What are you waiting for…? Connect with us. Apply now!  Applications close: 11:59pm Friday 17th November 2023  For more information about this role, please contact MARY.NOROUZIFAR@TRANSPORT.NSW.GOV.AU. Company Description ALDI. Good Different. With roots dating back to 1913, ALDI is proud to make a real difference to people across the world by offering top quality products for low prices. ALDI first entered the Australian grocery market in 2001 and has since grown to have almost 600 stores and 8 distribution centres in 6 states. If you’ve ever shopped at ALDI you know we are not your average supermarket. We’re also not your average employer. ALDI is a place where you’ll find good people, good purpose and a good opportunities. So you can work with a great team, feel great for making a real difference for everyday Australians and have a rewarding career. It’s that simple. ALDI Good Different.  Job Description Exciting opportunities for 2 x Analysts have become available within the National IT department of ALDI stores, based in Minchinbury. These positions are for fixed-term contracts until 30 May 2025. As an Analyst you will be responsible for ongoing monitoring and analysis of new business processes within the AHEAD SAP Centric landscape across all departments. You will present key findings and recommendations to shape the development and delivery of process improvement projects and activities whilst engaging with various stakeholders and experts in a fast-paced retail environment. What does the role look like? Collaborate with stakeholders to scope, develop and implement products and applications to support business processes Support cross-department collaboration to align with process improvement experts from all business areas Architect, design and build robust and scalable solutions Drive optimisation, testing and tooling to improve the quality of SAP Systems Guide internal project teams to optimise technical solutions and outcomes Implement automated measures to ensure data quality issues / errors in applications are automatically prevented / detected and corrected  Qualifications What do we need from you? Demonstrated experience in data mining and database management solutions including design, development and administration Demonstrated experience engineering data pipelines and optimising solutions Experience working with data across sources including Celonis, SAP S/4 Hana and SQL High competency with reporting tools such as Tableau, Power BI or SSRS Project management or coordination experience highly regarded Exposure to business transformation projects highly regarded Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to engage non-technical stakeholders Prior experience in retail or FMCG advantageous Additional Information What’s in it for you? Transparent tiered salary range between - $129,300 - $147,500 including super 5 weeks paid annual leave Fixed-term contract until 30 May 2025 Structured training plan from day 1 Hybrid work options, working up to 2 days per week from home (WFH) Working with a retailer who has been recognised as an Employer of Choice (as voted in 2022, 2021, 2020, 2019 and 2018) Access to wellness programs such as discounted gym memberships, physiotherapy services, employee assistant programs and moreShow moreReport

Join our Enterprise Data Platform team as we build a highly efficient and scalable Big Data Platform for the organization, which enables the producer-consumer flow and makes it easy to store, find and share enterprise data.  At Macquarie, we are working to create lasting value for our communities, our clients and our people. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 54 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drive outcomes.  What role will you play?  As a PowerBI and Alteryx Admin Engineer, you will assist in optimization and governance of our data analytics and workflow management platforms. You will play a pivotal role in shaping one of our key technology initiatives, providing technical guidance and support to end-users, resolving issues and delivering training.  Working in collaboration with data engineers and analysts, you will integrate PowerBI and Alteryx for various sources and systems, while implementing monitoring tools and processes to proactively identify and address performance issues. You will be involved in automating processes to improve end-user experience and uplifting the platform, while raising support cases with vendors, following-up and owning tasks end-to-end.  What you offer  Platform expertise in Alteryx and/or Power BI, with a deep understanding of their capabilities, configurations and best practices – certification in Alteryx or PowerBI is highly beneficial Experience leading a team of administrators responsible for maintaining, upgrading and troubleshooting Power BI and/or Alteryx environments Experience with improving system performance, security and scalability along with ensuring optimal utilization of resources Hands-on experience with PowerShell and Power BI development.  We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.  Benefits  Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria and location, include:  Hybrid and flexible working arrangements Wellbeing and service bonus leave Up to 20 weeks paid parental leave as well as benefits to support you as you transition to life as a working parent Paid volunteer leave and donation matching  About the Corporate Operations Group  In our Corporate Operations Group, you will work at the heart of Macquarie. Join a collaborative team who accelerate digitalisation, sustainability and social impact for the benefit of our people, customers, shareholders and communities. Our teams include technology, digital transformation and data, operations, human resources, business services, corporate strategy and solutions and the Macquarie Group Foundation.  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for a role regardless of their identity, including gender, race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status, marital or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disabilities, or socio-economic background.  If you require adjustments to your working arrangements or the recruitment process, please let us know when applying.   About Macquarie A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future. Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment. Care from the heart. If this sounds like you, apply for a role with Calvary today. Position Description  Position title: Senior Business Analyst  Entity: Austroads  Division: Data & Technology  Job Type: Full – time (1.0 FTE)  Location: Austroads Sydney Offices  Reports to: Enterprise Solutions Manager  Responsible GM: Chief Data & Technology Officer  Direct reports: N/A  Date reviewed: 20 October 2023 Organisational Context  Austroads is the association of Australian and New Zealand transport agencies. We provide authoritative, practical and impartial advice, information, tools and services to help our  members to deliver safe, efficient and reliable mobility to their customers. We also deliver value to a range of other key stakeholders across government, industry and communities,  where there is a demonstrated societal benefit to do so. Austroads comprises several business activities, including the core Austroads work program, the National  Exchange of Vehicle and Driver Information System (NEVDIS), and Transport Certification Australia  (TCA). Our teams are located across Australia and New Zealand. We work in an integrated and collaborative  way, along with external consultancies and other partners, to ensure our products and services are  delivered successfully and maximise value. Austroads promotes a culture of professionalism, innovation, and integrity, with a commitment to  accountability, quality, and excellence in the delivery of all of our programs and services. We recognise the unique skills and abilities of each individual, who come from a wide range of disciplines  and backgrounds. We support our people through ongoing development and learning opportunities and  create a supportive team environment for all our staff. We strive to be an employer of choice. Austroads takes inclusion and diversity seriously. We embrace difference and diversity of identity,  experience and thought, and actively strive for inclusive behaviours across our company and our work. The Role Position Purpose This position provides support to the Enterprise Solutions Manager and the broader team to ensure  successful completion of information technology projects and tasks to support the realisation of  Austroads’ business focus and strategic plans. Major Responsibilities/ Accountabilities The role is responsible for: Working within a team to perform high-level business analysis and develop high-level solutions, business cases and data models. Conducting detailed business analysis in collaboration with the team and stakeholders, including developing detailed requirement specifications and ensuring alignment with existing systems and  strategies. Mentoring and providing guidance to other team members undertaking detailed business analysis. Providing effective testing services by creating test plans and test cases, conducting system testing, and resolving issues to ensure that all business and technical requirements are delivered.  Developing and maintaining strong relationships with peers, external stakeholders and outsourced service providers to facilitate implementation of systems and enhancements.  Providing project management services for applications development and operations (business-as-  usual) projects.  Ensuring quality assurance by applying procedures and analysing and resolving issues or gaps between business requirements and implemented solutions documentation in partnership with team  members. Providing subject matter expertise and third-level support to the team and stakeholders to explain systems, resolve complex data/application issues and conduct data quality audits to maintain data  integrity. Reviewing and providing input to projects, services, implementation plans, and strategy as required. Understanding, managing, and providing guidance in operations/applications configuration, data migration, change deployment and operational handovers.  Conducting other tasks as directed. Key stakeholder interfaces Internal Enterprise Solutions Manger Chief Data & Technology Officer All staff External Austroads approved developers and service providers Membership organisations Contractors and visitors The Person Qualifications, knowledge, and experience The Senior Business Analyst will possess: A minimum of 5 years’ experience in a senior business/system analysis role in ICT applications development. High-level analytical and problem-solving skills. Advanced ability to operate at strategic and operational levels, and proven ability to think at high-  level/big picture and detailed level.  Proven experience and highly developed skills in data, business, and functional analysis; data modelling; process mapping; and designing and writing business systems specifications.  Advanced ability and proven experience in requirements development; data modelling; design and business systems specifications to support changes; and the development and implementation of  business systems. Excellent practical experience with relational databases and understanding of SQL script writing. Sound knowledge of web services frameworks, messaging systems (e.g., MQ Series) and information technology issues.  Extensive knowledge and proven experience in business analysis, project management, development, testing, quality assurance, and deployment lifecycle methodologies and activities.  Excellent oral and written communication skills and proven ability to negotiate with people at all levels internally and externally.  Experience in liaising and managing stakeholders with state/territory and national entities. Ability to manage issues and tasks with a high degree of confidentiality, reliability, discretion and flexibility.  Excellent task and priority management skills. Organised and able to meet deadlines. Personal qualities The incumbent will need to present a professional image and build a strong relationships across the  enterprise. Specifically, the role requires: Commitment to service excellence and continuous improvement in relation to technology and data- based services. Commercial acumen, high emotional intelligence, diligence, and drive. Being a self-starter. Hands on leadership style. Culture of delivery and closure on issues. Astute risk management. Sound judgment and analytical/evaluative skills. Well-developed relationship management, communication, consultation, and negotiation skills. Comfort working in an environment which is constantly evolving.Show moreReport

Overview Working as a key contributor in the Insurance Solutions Team, you will provide hands on technical analysis of insurance (in Superannuation) member level data scenarios against business rules, requirements, and fund configuration to develop technical Oracle SQL (PL/SQL) scripts. Additionally, supporting the test team throughout the lifecycle to production implementation. As part of a project team, you will have key deliverables to ensure project success and a quality delivery. Multiple 12 months Fixed term contract and permanent opportunities Location Flexible: Based in Parramatta or Melbourne CBD Flexible working arrangements including WFH  Key Accountabilities and main responsibilities Strategic Focus Develop and test SQL, PL/SQL data rectification scripts to ensure data conforms correctly to requirements and fund business rules, and to update data that cannot be achieved through existing system functionality. Take end to end ownership of tasks and their resolution. Assist with first and second level Support and conduct root cause analysis of Insurance incidents. Provide support/assistance (where required) to the wider team. Lead the execution of change to improve the quality, reliability and efficiency. Ensuring agreed development methodologies, processes, standards, and strategies are adhered to. Build relationships with key Operational managers and leaders in the business. Work with business users (in conjunction with Business/Systems Analysts) to clarify requirements and resolve issues. Raise Service Now Incidents, JIRAs, Rollback Requests and approvals (where required) Provide timely reporting to manager. Experience & Personal Attributes 5+ Years of demonstrable competency as Technical Analyst or equivalent role (with Insurance in superannuation knowledge required). 7+ Years of demonstrable high competency as a Technical Analyst with advanced hands-on experience with Oracle SQL, PL/SQL (or like technology). Business and Technical Analysis experience and/or product knowledge in Superannuation, Insurance highly desirable. Working knowledge of MS office products. Adaptability to working hours to meet business needs. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong problem solving and organizational skills. Attention to detail and accuracy with a pragmatic approach. A quick learner. Tertiary Qualifications in IT or a related field highly desirable. Link Group is a leading fund administration and share registry specialist. We are a market leading provider of technology-enabled administration solutions, continually developing our offerings to expand with our clients' needs. Since our inception, Link Group has been entrusted by clients to handle sensitive data in a secure and confidential manner. Our core businesses of fund administration and securities registration are complemented by our expertise in digital solutions and data analytics. Our Retirement & Superannuation Solutions division combines its proprietary technology, process and people to deliver a comprehensive financial data solution to its superannuation clients. We support clients across all superannuation fund sectors including government, industry, retail and corporate. By accompanying our core member and employer administration with a full range of value-added services, we offer the most comprehensive superannuation administration solution on the market. The scale, adaptability and ease of use of our proprietary systems, in conjunction with our integrated analytics offering, allow us to innovate and grow with the needs of our clients. Link Group is building a dynamic, client focused, caring and inclusive culture that is built on the foundations of an entrepreneurial spirit, effective risk management, empathy and trust, and underpinned by its core values. We are an inclusive employer whose people work collaboratively. We encourage, support and value the various talents and perspectives of our people and promote a flexible and blended work environment where our people can thrive and their wellbeing is supported. We know that diversity drives better client outcomes, continuous improvement, and growth. Be part of the Link Group journey and together we will achieve our full potential. We treat all individuals fairly and equitably and do not discriminate on the basis of diverse characteristics including, but not limited to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, ethnicity, cultural background, physical abilities/disabilities, religious or political belief, marital or family status or carers responsibilities. Candidates must have the relevant work rights to be considered for an opportunity at Link Group. Successful applicants will be required to complete background screening prior to commencement of employment.Show moreReport

job_title: Senior Data Analyst - Risk and Controls
job_description: Senior Data Analyst – Risk and Control You are passionate about all things data related with a positive attitude We are a high performing team with a passion for innovation and continuous improvement. Together we can deliver an exemplary experience for our stakeholders and the Group See yourself in our team: Business Banking (BB) secures and enhances the financial wellbeing of people, businesses and communities. Business Banking (BB) offer a wide range of services and solutions to our small to medium, enterprise customers and our regional and agribusiness customers. We also take care of our personal and institutional online trading customers. The BB Governance, Framework and Risk Delivery (GFRD) team’s purpose is to support BB in achieving its strategy by providing a portfolio view of BB’s risk and compliance, ensuring consistent and effective deployment of risk frameworks and co-ordinating major risk projects. Do work that matters: Your primary contribution will be to support the Senior Manager, BB Risk & Controls Enablement (Insights) and proactively work with stakeholders from across BB (including Line 1 Op Risk, Line 2 Op Risk & Compliance, Product and Distribution teams) to assist with the following: Supporting ongoing improvements to BB’s Risk Management System RiskInSite (RiS) Data Quality Perform data extraction from various sources and cleaning to ensure data integrity with various internal stakeholders to help formulate and scope business problems. Collect and analyse data from multiple sources to identify trends and patterns and provide the business with actionable insights. Innovative insightful data driven reporting to provide transparency over policy implementation and risk framework adherence whilst driving consistency across BB Create visualisations and dashboards to help stakeholders understand data insights. Represent and advocate for BB in Group-wide Working Groups where appropriate (e.g. RiS Business Unit Administration, Data Analysis Risk Tool (DART)) Owning and designing continuous improvement initiatives Communicate complex analytical findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner We're interested in hearing from people who have: Experience with reporting automation, and medium proficiency in data analytics tools and platforms like SQL, Tableau, Tableau Prep, Teradata, Power Query and Alteryx is essential. Strong attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy whilst working to competing priorities. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, demonstrating flexibility and adaptability. High Level competency in Microsoft Office including, Outlook, Excel and Word Strong reporting and analytical skills Ability to think critically and use data driven insights to solve problems. Working with us: Whether you’re passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career with CommBank is for you. Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive, and flexible workplace with flexible work locations. One where we’re driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day. If this sounds like the role for you then we would love to hear from you. Apply today! If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest, x15ventures), you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We’re keen to support you with the next step in your career. We're aware of some accessibility issues on this site, particularly for screen reader users. We want to make finding your dream job as easy as possible, so if you require additional support please contact HR Direct on 1800 989 696. Advertising End Date: 17/11/2023Show moreReport

job_description: Data Analytics Engineer - Python, JavaScript, ML, Docker You are a curious and enthusiastic individual with a true passion for data and engineering We are a committed team responsible for delivering automation solutions for Business Bank Risk Together we can build state-of-the-art data solutions that enable effective risk management and strong outcomes for the Group Do work that matters: Here, you’ll turn your passion into reality. You will support the team by seeking opportunities, understanding business challenges, improving and designing automation solutions(including AI solutions), to overcome the key challenges. To us, data is everything. It is what powers our cutting-edge features and it is the reason we can provide seamless experiences for millions of customers from app to branch. We support our people with the flexibility to balance where work is done with at least half your time each month connecting in office. We also have many other flexible working options available including changing start and finish times, part-time arrangements and job share to name a few. We don’t expect you to know them all but having significant experience and exposure with some of these (or equivalents) will set you up for success in this team. Python, JavaScript, HTML, Machine / Deep Learning / Natural Language Processing. Software development frameworks and tools (e.g. Git, Jenkins, Docker, Unix Shell). Knowledge of database management systems (e.g., SQL, Spark, Hive), data analysis tools (R, Python) and data integration techniques. Knowledge of UX principles and best practices for creating user-friendly applications. Working with us: Whether you’re passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career with CommBank is for you. Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive, and flexible workplace with flexible work locations. One where we’re driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day. We’re hiring engineers from across all of Australia and have opened technology hubs in Melbourne and Perth. Lab49 (an ION company) is looking for a Business Analyst in Sydney to work in a consultant capacity to deliver solutions for our Financial Services clients most complex business and technical problems. You will interact closely with clients to ensure close alignment and communications as well as with internal resources for smooth and timely delivery. Lab49 is a global technology consultancy that designs and builds bespoke financial solutions for financial institutions globally. Our community of senior technologists think disruptively to deliver pragmatic solutions for our clients' most complex challenges in the financial services / capital markets domain.  We are curious minds who come together as collaborative and inclusive teams to push boundaries, be ourselves and deliver extraordinary impact through our culture and technology excellence.  We have offices in New York, Washington DC, London, Sydney, Budapest and Noida and we are focused on expanding our capabilities and geographic footprint globally to support our growing client base. Key Responsibilities Scope out strategic solutions to solve complex, technical and business problems Work individually and part of a team to identify, investigate and analyse problems across business functions, data, processes, procedures and work practices. Identify and evaluate inefficiencies, putting together business cases recommending optimal business practices, system functionality and behaviour. Create user/training documentation and provide ongoing support for customers' post implementation. Develop and present functional specifications/requirements for use by system developers. Use data and process modelling techniques to create clear system specifications for the design, development and delivery of system software. Act as a central reference and information source, coordinating and assisting system, project and business decision making. Prioritise effort on strategic outcomes for customers in alignment with scope, budget and forecasting for the work. Skills And Experience Undergraduate degree, ideally in Computing Science, Business Administration or related field. 3+ years’ experience working within a technical consulting / BA role. Analytical with strong documentation and presentation skills. Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication and stakeholder management skills with the ability to liaise between business and technology teams. A calm and professional approach in challenging situations. Strong organizational skills with attention to detail. Ability to multi-task with a focus on effective time management. Flexible and adaptive, can cope with changing priorities. Lab49/ION is committed to maintaining a supportive and inclusive environment for people with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We respect the varied identities, abilities, cultures, and traditions of the individuals who comprise our organization and recognize the value that different backgrounds and points of view bring to our business. Lab49/ION adheres to an equal employment opportunity policy that prohibits discriminatory practices or harassment against applicants or employees based on any legally impermissible factor.Show moreReport

Company Description Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive. When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement. Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.  Job Description About us Visa Managed Services (VMS) is the delivery arm of Visa Consulting and Analytics (VCA) team. We draw on our expertise in strategy, consulting, data analytics and industry experience to develop and implement fact-based recommendations to improve client performance. The VMS team specialise in recruiting the right talent to into our client’s businesses to make changes happen. About your role Embedded at the client’s office, you’ll enjoy working in a collaborative team alongside experts from product, analytics, and marketing. Together you’ll form a roadmap of strategic marketing activities and work with cross-functional teams to deliver impactful campaigns to customers. About you Our ideal candidate is a confident problem solver who’s an expert in data manipulation, has some knowledge of data warehousing and can synthesis key findings for the business. You have experience working with bank product teams and digital payments technologies and are energised by taking a task and developing and managing the pathway to the solution. If you are driven by results and are customer-obsessed, we want you! Things that should be familiar to you Delivering quality insights in a fast-paced, agile environment where you will build customer journeys in the form of Next Best Conversation customer decisioning and other digital channels Proficient in SAS / SQL / R Python, and Excel (PowerPoint experience beneficial) Extensive experience in using data driven analytics to develop dashboards, insights and recommendations Ability to understand complex problems and take a structured approach to find answers in the data Synthesising qualitative and quantitative data and facts from various sources to identify relationships and patterns. Arriving at logical conclusions, you will identify opportunities for improved customer outcomes and design and develop analytical solutions for our stakeholders You feel capable in managing multiple stakeholders in order to undercover, quantify and present key findings You’re a confident communicator and strong team player You’re not expected to have 100% of these skills. If you have most of the skills required and this role sounds exciting to you, we'd love to hear from you! Why Work with Us: Opportunity to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment Take advantage of working across two organisations Collaborative and supportive team culture Competitive salary and other perks including AUD1,000 well-being allowance and AUD4,000 study grant Professional development opportunities to grow your skills and career Opportunities to move internally to switch up your career Become a valuable member of our team and contribute to our thriving organisation. Apply now and show us what you’ve got! This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.  Qualifications Join our team as a Senior Insights Analyst (12-month Contract), and unlock your potential in a challenging, dynamic, and fast-paced environment.  With your experience working in an agile environment supporting the insights for marketing campaigns, you'll be an essential part of our team, taking on challenging projects, delivering results, and doing it all within a supportive and collaborative workspace.  Enjoy a competitive salary, wellbeing perks, and endless opportunities for professional development and internal mobility. Don't miss out on this chance to showcase your skills! Additional Information Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.Show moreReport

The Company Cover Genius is a Series D insurtech that protects the global customers of the world’s largest digital companies including Booking Holdings, owner of Priceline, Kayak and Booking.com, Intuit, Uber, Hopper, Ryanair, Turkish Airlines, Descartes ShipRush, Zip and SeatGeek. We’re also available at Amazon, Flipkart, eBay, Wayfair and SE Asia’s largest company, Shopee. We are currently looking for a BI Reporting Developer to join our Information Management team. About the role The Business Intelligence (BI) Reporting Developer focuses on understanding business data, analysing data and generating reports and dashboards, performing quality assurance testing to ensure the data presented is correct as well as providing technical support and assistance to the business users where required. The primary responsibility of the role is to support various reporting initiatives. You will analyse, design and implement quality reports and dashboards for the business. As the BI Reporting Developer, you are expected to not only be a capable analyst of raw data, but are able to derive meaning from the data, relate it back to the source and work with the business to derive valuable context required for daily tasks and make decisions. You are a champion for data innovation and can use your creativity to find solutions for teams at every level of their data journey. About the team You will be joining the Information Management Team that help deliver data analysis services to the business. The Information Management Team covers a wide area of data analysis and application code development and key application foundation services. What you'll be doing Data Reporting – Technical Create, update, and upgrade end user reports in Power BI. Create and update T-SQL queries, stored procedures and views using the Law Society code standard to obtain the data required for reports. Where data is not available from a database, extract data from a variety of sources and transform it for use with a Power BI data model. Create and update Power BI data models for use with both single reports and reports using shared datasets. Be competent in DAX and Power M to meet end user requirements. Determine a reporting structure to ensure that increased usability is available for reports shared between departments. Identify potential faults and optimization opportunities within the Reporting suite and other related reports and dashboards. Monitor availability and provide recommendations on performance, capacity, data integrity and quality for the BI reports. Ensure all report access is secured and audited. Highlight any data issues and work with the data architects to continue to develop the data warehouse as a source of truth in the business. Design aesthetically pleasing and functional reports that meet the LSNSW branding guidelines/ templates but where required able to use the guidelines to make appropriate design choices. Data Reporting – Non-Technical Develop/document high quality and well-written user guides, business rules, processes, data flows and other documentation for use by the Information Management team and business users. Provide feedback to the Information Management Data Architect on data requirements (historical snapshots, data requirements) for integration later. Involved in Project Team as a SME and key member on determining reporting needs and providing data requirements at the start of a project. Promote the Reporting function for operational as well as strategic needs. Develop and maintain reporting standards, policies and guidelines and ensure they applied to all reports developed. With the team develop policies and procedures for the collection and analysis of data. Populate User Acceptance forms and ensure all required approvals exist before deployment of the reports. Team Support Support a collaborative and progressive team environment. Standardise and highlight improvements to services. Provide and maintain troubleshooting support and knowledge sharing across IT. About you Significant and relevant experience in requirements gathering, research and analysis, solution discovery, training, and other general Business Analysis capability is required. Tertiary qualifications in Information Systems, Computing Science or similar. 5+ years’ experience as a BI Developer (Preferably Power BI). 5+ years’ experience with SQL/T-SQL. Strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Strong discovery, analytical and problem-solving skills. Desirable Tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or equivalent. Working knowledge of relational and non-relational databases. Familiarity with Data Warehouses and Data Lakes. Background in project management or business analysis. Competency in using Azure and other tools in the Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate). Competency in using Canva design software. More about you  Strong interpersonal skills for conduct in a client facing role, and ability to adapt to communicating with users from a variety of professional backgrounds and technical abilities. Willingness and ability to continuously learn and be able to pick up new technical skills as well as business knowledge on a regular basis. Keen attention to detail, both in testing and validation of data, and in design skills. Able to work independently, and can appropriately assess, analyse, and verify task requirements prior to actioning reporting tasks. Can cooperate and collaborate with a team to learn and share knowledge. A knowledge seeker who is able to challenge requirements, and utilise technical skills, internal understanding and practices as well as external understanding and experiences to continuously improve skills and reporting services provided. Demonstrates the tendency to contribute ideas and initiate new ways of working, shows enthusiasm for project work and special assignments. Proven consistency in making sound decisions. Ability to use information, knowledge, and experience to analyse and form judgements. Ability to comprehend the wider contexts, developments long term goals and determines strategies and actions required to achieve such goals. Company Description McDonald’s Australia is the largest quick service restaurant operation in the country. Fondly known as “Macca's”, we are a household name in Australia for over 50 years, we believe that our customers are the heart and soul of everything we do and make it our mission to make every moment count! As an employer of choice winner, working with us means taking pride and having fun along the way, while growing and developing your career in a dynamic and supportive environment. Not only do we offer flexible working arrangements and an attractive staff discount; but we provide an opportunity to work alongside other passionate and talented people every single day.  Job Description Could you be our next Business Analyst? At Macca’s, the Business Analyst is driving insightful decision-making, supporting financial management, and contributing to overall business growth for key stakeholders and the organisation at large. Your role is at the core of financial expertise, enhancing decision-making processes and fortifying financial management, all while nurturing the broader business. What can you expect on a day-to-day basis? Strategic Partnership: Collaborate closely with key stakeholders, providing expert advice and support on pertinent financial matters. Dynamic Reporting & Analysis: Deliver timely, accurate, and invaluable management reporting and analysis that enriches the organization and aligns with its needs and goals. This includes: Comprehensive Month/Quarter/Year End Reporting: Thorough G&A expenses analysis; Precise Month-end Profit & Loss (P&L) Statement variance analysis; Essential Support for Budgeting and Projection Processes, involving both building and analysis; Daily Cash Flow and Treasury Management for precise projection and system management and; Management of specific balance sheet accounts to mitigate potential organisational risks, such as Prepaid Accounts. Communication & Insight Generation: Translate financial data into actionable advice, analysis, and insights for stakeholders. Empower them to interpret and apply financial information to drive informed business decisions and reach set goals. Adaptable Problem-Solving: Manage ad hoc requests for financial information and business analysis, while actively identifying and seizing opportunities for process improvement both within the Finance Department and externally. Resource Development: Identify departmental needs and develop tools, templates, and resources, ensuring the department is well-equipped for effective financial management. Compliance & Accountability: Understand and uphold Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 (SOX) compliance requirements, supporting the annual statutory account reporting process. Precision and Diligence: Perform general accounting tasks with accuracy, alongside any ad hoc financial duties required to achieve the outlined responsibilities.  Qualifications Your keys to success: Bachelor’s degree in Commerce, Accounting or similar 1-3+ years of hands-on experience, ideally within large corporate environments, navigating complex organisational structures and diverse teams Demonstrated history of working seamlessly within collaborative settings, excelling in building effective partnerships and fostering strong relationships with stakeholders across various domains Proficient in prioritising tasks and projects, showcasing exceptional organisational abilities to manage workflows efficiently Known for an acute eye for Samsung Ads   For our client Samsung Ads, we're looking for a Data Analyst in Singapore (Full Time Role).   Samsung Ads, the advertising monetization arm of Samsung Electronics, leverages proprietary real-time TV viewing behavior and insights to promote relevant brands and content experiences to consumers. We partner with brands, agencies and content owners to deliver unique advertising opportunities on native placements within our Smart TV platform and programmatically with a cross device solution.  Samsung’s unique first party data help brands connect to their audience as they explore content across desktop, mobile, tablets and our Smart TVs. The Samsung Ad platform delivers high-quality audience targeting powered by three key components: first-party audience data at scale, world-class data science, and brand-safe cross-device ad inventory.   The opportunity   We’re looking for an innovative individual to support the Samsung Ads Analytics team. This full-time position will create reporting solutions from one of the richest TV viewership/media consumption databases in the industry today.  The candidate will build reporting solutions to guide strategy and ad sales powered by Samsung proprietary data using SQL, Python and leveraging other AWS tools such as EC2 and S3.  The candidate will explore data to find trends and identify new opportunities for the organization. Also, the candidate will help tune and improve current code base.  Candidate must be organized, detailed oriented, flexible and possess ability to establish priorities with minimal guidance in a fast paced environment – must be proactive, analytical problem solver and strategic thinker who is able to draw conclusions- not just report numbers  Candidates must have prior experience with SQL and Python and/or R.  This role will report to the APAC Analytics Lead.  Responsibilities  Data Analytics  Data quality and standards implementation Enhance open data collection to include information that is relevant for the business Maintain databases servicing the Insights Team to improve efficiency Develop and deploy automated solutions to facilitate the decision making process  Sales & Insights  Translate business requirements into SQL queries and Python scripts for Ad Hoc analysis and new reporting solutions Deliver innovative consumer insights solutions for pro-active engagements with agencies and clients Tune and optimize current reporting solutions Explore data to identify trends and anomalies, develop new analytical capabilities/solutions, and find new monetization opportunities Data-driven insights for briefs responses and marketing narrative Document business requirements  Team Support  Ability to translate technical analysis into a actionable insights for non-technical audience Develop working relationships and exchange best practices with other Samsung Ads entities such as North America and Europe   Qualifications  Degree in computer science/engineering or quantitative discipline (Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics). Masters Preferred. Strong statistical acumen 4+ years in a related engineering/analytics work/data mining Strong SQL skills – 3+ years using SQL Strong Python and/or R skills - 2+ years working with Python and/or R for data manipulation, cleansing and automation Strong BI Experience Experience with AWS tools such as EC2 and S3 Jira, Confluence, GitHub and other agile development tool experience   Bonus  Familiarity with media, TV measurement DOMO Experience Linux Experience Dash and/or Shiny or any other libraryShow moreReport

job_description: Work with leading edge API's and data projects Salary- 110,000-130,000 + super + benefits+ perks Flexible Diverse Supportive and Innovative  Technical/Digital Business Analyst   ScaleUP is partnering with a leading media tech company seeking a talented technical business analyst (tech BA) who wants to work for a supportive, exciting, and dynamic company with a culture of high performance & best practices. You will join a team of talented Software engineers, Designers, PMs, and Delivery Managers who will help you build and maintain bleeding-edge applications that are disputing and impacting the media and technology industry & worldwide.   Your Purpose  The purpose of Technical Business Analyst (or digital business analyst or Data Business Analyst) is to bridge the gap between Product requirements and technical solutions. You will ensure the Squad achieves desired outcomes to help the business thrive and deliver technical solutions.  We are seeking an experienced and highly motivated Technical Business Analyst with an understanding of API development and Data Engineering.  Every day you will work closely with the Solution Architect and cross-functional teams and will be pivotal in driving innovation. You'll have an Agile mindset and live and breathe Agile working methodologies.  Your role ensures the seamless alignment of business requirements with technical solutions in the dynamic fields of data integration and API development for all of their key flagship technical products. This role has loads to offer the right person in regard to growth potential for your career and exposure to modern bleeding-edge technology and application development.
