Senior Insights Analyst Permanent role Surry Hills office location, with WFH flexibility Work on a range of high impact projects with Woolworths Everyday Rewards team About us   Woolworths Group is an Australian food and everyday needs retailer employing 1900,000 team members across Asia Pacific, serving over 20 million customers across our brands every week. With more than 1,400 stores across Woolworths Supermarkets, Countdown Supermarkets (New Zealand) and BIG W brands, B2B business serving wholesale and export markets, and a range of fast-growing eCommerce businesses, Woolworths Group is Australia and New Zealand’s largest retailer.   We strive to create better experiences together for a better tomorrow for our customers and team, bringing the best of Woolworths Group and Quantium together to make data driven decisions. By partnering with Quantium, a world-class data science and advanced analytics business we’re excited about the future as we unlock the power of data to reimagine retail.   Through this partnership, we’ve created a new business called wiq who will harness the best of Woolworths Group and Quantium to reimagine retail by solving the most complex problems using data and analytics. As a team, we leverage Agile ways of working to help our team develop their skills while also making sure our team is focusing on solving the most complex problems for both our customers and team. About the role The Senior Analyst will lead the development of performance measurement frameworks for business level strategic objectives at the scale of large programmes (e.g. Rewards partnerships) as well as initiatives within those programmes (e.g. propositions, campaigns, digital assets features, etc.). This role sits within the Growth, Data, Performance & Optimisation Practice, Performance & Optimisation principal chapter. This role involves supporting WooliesX tribes as well as cross functional engagement and collaboration across the Group. A key part of this role will be performing deep dives and insights analyses to assess the efficiency and effectiveness of programs, initiatives, campaign streams, campaigns, offers, features beyond standard reporting with the aim to optimise future performance. Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: Develop bespoke measurement methodologies to measure the ongoing effectiveness of an intervention or to optimise performance of campaigns Develop metrics to be used to measure performance across the range of strategic objectives - driving customer awareness, acquisition, retention, reactivation, engagement; measurement digital product performance, targeting efficiency, personalisation efficiency etc. Establish alignment on the measurement between stakeholders - strategy, commercial, product, marketing etc., engaged in the delivery Formulate specific, measurable and testable hypothesis, using data analysis techniques Design an experiment, including sample sizing, selecting appropriate data sources, identifying key metrics and selecting appropriate statistical methods to analyse results, identify an appropriate duration of a test Identify and manage risks, e.g. would the test be impacted by other marketing events, would control/test be tainted by other activities Provide guidance for non-technical stakeholders on privacy and ethical implications of sourcing data, initiate engagement with the Privacy team on privacy matters and collaborate to ensure compliance. Guide junior chapter members and proactively share knowledge with other analysts and use Chapter time to keep learning new analytical techniques.  Who we are looking for We are looking for an experienced Senior Analyst with highly developed stakeholder management skills which will help use data to drive business decisions, underpinned by technical proficiency in SQL and Tableau, and other tools. Key accountabilities: Gather requirements, scope work, and work consultatively with the Squad Lead and Success Managers to plan and deliver measurement support for the team. Become a subject matter expert on relevant data sources, tables and reporting processes Represent the Data Practice in the tribe, sharing learnings and opportunities for further data capability building. Conduct data analysis using SQL and other tools.   Requirements: Excellent verbal and written communication skills Strong visual presentation skills 5+ years experience in data analysis with emphasis on campaign and customer data Experience working consultatively with non-technical stakeholders and managing workloads independently, preferably in an Agile organisation. Advanced SQL skills, skilled in writing complex SQL code. Experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Power BI and Google Data Studio. Experience driving insights from data and presenting the findings with recommendations to different sets of stakeholders. Ability to think clearly about the underlying business problems and to consultatively recommend data-driven approaches to solving them.   The role would suit you if: You thrive when given independence. You will be trusted to manage your own workload and relationship with stakeholders. You are excited to work with large datasets. You enjoy presenting technical topics to non-technical audiences, finding ways to adjust your presentation style. You have a growth mindset and are continually learning. You enjoy working with Google platforms. You write well and enjoy documenting your learnings. You are undaunted to work in a large organisation with complex interrelationships between teams. Grow with the Group  As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.  We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage. We are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion and as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency.  As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference.  We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.  We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences – for our customers and for each other.  We’d love to hear from You  If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. #work180 #LI #HybridReport

job_title: Senior Analyst, Data Delivery and Reporting
job_description: If you live in Australia or New Zealand, you’ve likely heard of AMP. But at a time when society is changing, we are too. We’re now a nimbler business with new leadership and thinking. For us, these are exciting times. There’s a real potential for big thinkers to help us redefine what financial services could be. And turn our legacy into something even more positive and powerful for the future. Help people create their tomorrow, while you create yours We help people with their banking, super, retirement and finances. Through upturns, downturns, recessions, and major life transitions. Every day, we help people see and make more of their financial potential, so that they can create their tomorrow. And we’ve been doing it for over 170 years. If we do our job well, we genuinely add to the prosperity of our country and its people. How you’ll make an impact The purpose of the role is to oversee and maintain integrity/currency of data entered and received from providers within the trading platform (Aladdin) and security mastering (Eagle Pace) applications, providing confidence from downstream business consumers, either systems or people, in usage, distribution and reporting of data. The role is responsible for the day-to-day processes that form the Start of Day and End of Day operating model. The role is expected to manage exceptions, engaging and informing impacted stakeholders until resolution. The role is responsible for ensuring the AMP Investment data meets regulatory and compliance obligations, both internally and externally (regulators). What you will bring to the team Abroad understanding of investment data management discipline and basic understanding of investment management, investment operations, product management and custodial services. Experienced understanding of Investment Management; and broad understanding of the overall Group (AU Wealth Management) and its competitive environment. Sets and achieves operational targets, objectives or service standards with a short to medium term focus, that directly impact the results of Investment Operations. Applies emerging technical capability within own operational area/department. Analyse both routine and varied issues of differing complexity and modifies working methods/processes in own job, sometimes without the benefit of defined procedures. Applies good problem-solving skills as scope of issues may be only vaguely defined or difficult. Identify areas to improve data automation and partner with colleagues to implement solutions. Ability to work cohesively with senior staff when dealing with complex issues or larger clients, prospects, projects, accounts, relationships. Experienced professional with 5+ years of operational experience in the fund management industry, with user knowledge of data integrity management, reconciliations, and asset pricing. Good knowledge of Australian & International securities/assets/derivatives. You’ll thrive here if… If you can adapt from BAU to the ambiguous with ease, you’ll do well here. Change is never easy, so bring your commitment, grit and growth mindset. Because we run lean, you’ll be expected to jump in and deliver across a variety of areas. Meaning, you’ll be closer to the action and executive decisions that influence where we go next. If you’re someone that can hold their own, you’ll find AMP quite liberating. Why we think you’ll love working at AMP Doing what we’ve always done is not an option, so your clever ideas will get airtime here. You’ll be encouraged to speak up and try new things. If they don’t work, we move on – better for it. We know there’s no one way of doing things. So, you won’t have to sacrifice who you are or how you work to fit in here. We’re inclusive and flexible in many of the ways you’d expect. And in some of the ways you wouldn’t. As long as your health and wellbeing come first - at home and at work. In fact, most of what makes AMP such a welcoming, enjoyable place to work are our people. Wherever you go, you’ll find moments to connect, feel valued and do meaningful work. Whether it’s through our first-class leaders who are invested in you and your success. Through year-round opportunities to volunteer, fundraise and give back to the community. Or in the everyday challenges you face as we work together to strengthen this great organisation. Challenges that will stretch you, amplify your potential and compound the impact you have.  We believe in the power of inclusion and diversity We’re dedicated to fostering inclusion, diversity, and a warm feeling of belonging at AMP. It sparks creativity, ignites innovation, and turns up the dial on the quality of our decisions and performance. This not only makes our workplace more engaged, but also leads to better connections with our customers. We're your allies in the search for the perfect fit - when you apply, let us know how we can support you to put your best self forward during our selection process. We're also committed to enhancing employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, so we enthusiastically encourage candidates from these backgrounds to apply and explore our Reconciliation Plan on our website> (insert link) Ready to create your tomorrow? If you’re someone who sees opportunity where others see challenge, come and work with us in smart, progressive ways as we transform an iconic Australian brand for the future. And, through a series of career-defining moments, create your own tomorrow. Don’t procrastinate! We review applications when we get them, and if we discover the ideal candidate, we may close the role earlier than the advertised close date. Looking forward to meeting you.Show moreReport

job_title: Engineering Data Administrator and Reporting Specialist
job_description: 8 Nov 2023 Sydney, NSW, AU Producing some of Australia’s favourite beverages, Tooheys is a New South Wales institution! We are currently seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Engineering Data Administrator and Reporting Specialist to join the team at our Brewery in Lidcombe on a permanent, full-time basis.  In this role you will play a crucial role in ensuring the accuracy and integrity of data in our Engineering and Operational systems. You will generate reports and provide valuable insights to drive operational efficiency, as well as maintain the site's equipment technical library, ensuring it is up to date and sustained to a high level. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of one of Australia's leading beverage companies.  Some of the things you’ll be doing in the role: Prepare reports to analyse and interpret EAM and downtime data for continuous improvement. Coach EAM users to ensure clean data entry into SAP for enhanced performance and outcomes. Maintain the equipment technical library to support engineering and trade teams. Update maintenance KPI data and support annual site maintenance planning. Collaborate with the central team to govern maintenance system rules. Capture and manage feedback and updates in the SAP system. Identify opportunities to improve the EAM system and trade tool efficiency. Manage the contractor management system to minimize administrative work. Support maintenance activity scheduling and resource management. Be at the forefront of the changing energy market, shaping its impact on Alinta’s customers Engage with stakeholders to drive national pricing strategy Hybrid working combining office-based and work from home  Want a better job? You’ll find it at Alinta Energy.  We’re making energy better for our more than 1.1 million customers – and we’re making work life better for our 1,000+ people too.  We believe in better  At Alinta Energy, we’re a friendly bunch working to be the best energy company. Our culture is collaborative, and our passion drives positive change for people and the planet.  Over the past decade, we’ve evolved from a Western Australian residential gas retailer to one of Australia’s largest energy retailers, generators, investors, and developers with infrastructure across Australia and New Zealand.  Australia’s energy system is undergoing the biggest transformation in its history and we’re right there with it.  Help us make energy better  This is a wonderful time to join our Retail Markets business, we are at a critical inflection point in terms of our growth ambitions and strategic choices to achieve these. Having built a business of scale (servicing over 1 million customers across the east and west coast of Australia) the focus now turns to driving profitable, sustainable growth through leveraging a digital-first, direct-to-consumer business model. Driving such growth requires a deliberate shift to focus efforts on acquiring, growing share-of-wallet and retaining the right customers, continually building customer knowledge and actionable insights to enable the Retail business to compete and win key segments.  About the role: Reporting to the Head of Pricing, our Senior Energy Pricing Analyst works as part of our Product team to deliver strategic pricing analysis and recommendations that focus on the development and management of profitable customer offerings that complement the changing energy market and meet the needs of our customers – existing and future.  Our customers are looking to be active participants in how we use and purchase energy in a changing energy environment, and this role would be directly involved in the pricing of emerging products such as VPPs, batteries and electric vehicles as well as managing the annual pricing variations of our existing customer base nationally. The pricing models you create will help grow our business by directly impacting the Retail strategy and how we satisfy our customers.  You will derive business insights surrounding competitor and customer behaviour, as well as cost drivers through data and research and by interfacing and effectively communicating with key stakeholders including senior management and external industry participants. The role also requires an in-depth knowledge of current market trends, including regulatory changes and legislation related to retail energy.  In this role, you’ll be:  Uncovering the strategic opportunities within the evolving retail energy market landscape Contributing to the commercial analysis and preparing of business cases for new and existing products and pricing constructs including analysing large data sets to support product development, pricing management and performance monitoring Creating clear, attractive and compelling pricing proposal presentations that consider all financial opportunities and risks Working with key stakeholders in testing and delivering new pricing propositions to the market Working closely with our Customer, Brand and Marketing teams to monitor our competitors’ offerings and performance  Ideally, you’ll bring to the role:  Tertiary qualification in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Actuarial Studies, Statistics, Econometrics, Engineering and Accounting Well developed analytical skills, strong problem solving and high numeric accuracy to aid the creation and interrogation of pricing methodologies Advanced knowledge and experience in Excel Comfort with handling and interrogating large data sets via a working knowledge of programming languages such as SQL, Python, or Matlab and/or data visualisation tools (such as Power BI, Tableau) would be advantageous but not essential Excellent presentation skills that encompass clear and compelling communications to key stakeholders, including General and Executive level management Ability to work independently to prioritise tasks and drive projects as well as mentor other team members with a meticulous attention to detail and a strong comprehension of the broader perspective you are working within Interest in and/or experience in Retail Energy l product and pricing would be well regarded  This role would be best suited to someone who is an exceptional analyst with experience building models and synthesising complex concepts into easily digestible information and who has a natural flair for building relationships with multiple stakeholders across the business and having a tangible impact on the business strategy.  Enjoy better benefits - check our website for the full list!  One of the best things about Alinta Energy is we discover better together. If you like the sound of that, and you’re a match for the role, we’d love to talk to you. Alinta Energy. That’s better.  Alinta Energy is a 2023 Circle Back Initiative employer. We commit to respond to every applicant.  If your application progresses, we will need to complete background and pre-employment checks, such as immigration checks, reference checks, criminal background checks, qualification checks, and additional checks for roles related to finance.  How to apply:  Click “APPLY” to submit your application.  #LI-FD1Show moreReport

Lively and inspiring team culture Analytical role where you can make a significant impact Prominent and reputable Consulting Group Location – Sydney CBD. Salary - $150,000 + Super Senior Business Analyst - Consulting Group - CBD Company Background  Our client is a well-known and successful consulting group with offices around Australia. This is a highly desirable business to work for and currently they are searching for a Senior Business Analyst to join their team in the Sydney CBD Office.  This is an organisation that is full of life with a very well organised and efficient finance function led by a highly talented CFO.  On offer is the chance to join a finance team with a great spirit and lively culture. With modern offices, a role offering heaps of variety, hybrid working (work from home 2 days per week), and supportive senior management, this role represents a unique opportunity to grow your skillset and career.  The Role  As Senior Business Analyst your position will be broad and varied. You will have the chance to play a pivotal role and will fast become a highly valued member of the organisation.  Your position will be directly involved in facilitating business decisions. Duties will include but not be limited to:  Delivery of monthly reporting for internal stakeholders Development of reporting tools and building dashboards Develop and maintain reports and visualisations that are presented in the most appropriate format to analyse strategic and operational initiatives Identify areas of improvement and design automated reports to increase productivity, efficiency, and accuracy Engage with key business stakeholders to understand and scope requirements Identify, consolidate, analyse, report, and provide insights into financial and operational performance across the business  This position will see you working in a highly visible, commercially flavoured, and business partnering role which will give great exposure across the company whilst allowing you to make a meaningful impact.  Your Background  To be considered for this Senior Business Analyst role you will meet the majority of the following criteria:  Be working in a similar analytical capacity with proven competence using a Business Intelligence tool (Tableau, Power BI, or equivalent) Ability to extract and manipulate large volumes of data Strong business acumen, communication, and interpersonal skills Impressive stakeholder management experience having established yourself as a trusted business partner previously  As the ideal candidate for this position, you will be excited to connect with all parts of the business and provide insights that ensure they align with strategic objectives. You will be enthusiastic to take on a role where you can add real value and have a direct impact on the business.  Those working in relatable roles with strong experience using a BI tool are welcome to apply, e.g. Senior Management Accountants, Finance Business Partners, and Senior Financial Analysts.  If you are keen to find out more about this Senior Business Analyst position, please contact Geoff Balmer at Richard Lloyd on 02 8324 5642, quoting reference 8252,  Please submit your CV in Word format and note that due to the high volume of responses we receive only suitable candidates will be contacted.Show moreReport

job_title: Quantitative Analyst | Commodities and Global Markets
job_description: Join our Quantitative Strategy team in Commodities and Global Markets and apply specialist methods from mathematics, science, and engineering as part of a global front office team aligned to revenue generation.  At Macquarie, we are working to create lasting value for our communities, our clients, and our people. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 54 years of unbroken profitability. You will be part of a supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drive outcomes.  What role will you play?  As a Quantitative Analyst, you will help formulate business ideas mathematically and deliver practical solutions. You will research and implement financial models for product valuation, risk analysis and trading, whilst building strong relationships across the business by providing quantitative expertise to traders, as well as our technology and compliance teams.  What you offer  PhD level qualifications in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, etc. Self-motivated with a sense of intellectual curiosity C++ or Python programming experience is advantageous Demonstrable interest in Finance  We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.  To apply, please submit a cover letter, resume, and academic transcripts as one Word or PDF-formatted document. To include your cover letter and transcripts, insert additional pages into the front or back of your resume and upload to your profile page. Unfortunately, applications without the required documentation attached will not be considered.  Benefits  Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria and location, include:  Hybrid and flexible working arrangements Wellbeing and service bonus leave Up to 20 weeks paid parental leave as well as benefits to support you as you transition to life as a working parent Paid volunteer leave and donation matching Range of benefits to support your physical, psychological, and financial wellbeing  About Commodities and Global Markets  In Commodities and Global Markets you will be part of a global business offering capital and financing, risk management, market access, physical execution and logistics solutions to its diverse client base.  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for a role regardless of their identity, including gender, race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status, marital or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disabilities, or socio-economic background.  If you require adjustments to your working arrangements or the recruitment process, please let us know when applying.   About Macquarie A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future. Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment. Job no: 495171 Work type: Full time Location: New South Wales Categories: Administration, Transport & Logistics  About us  Qube Ports is the major integrated port solutions provider in Australia, with services and facilities in over 28 Australian Ports, together with cargo storage, materials handling and distribution operations in all Australian states. This allows us to lead the market in providing purpose designed solutions for our customers handling containers, bulk, automotive and general cargo.  At Qube, we recognise that our people are our most important asset and are the engine that drives our organisation, playing a vital role in ensuring our business achieve our objectives and deliver on our commitments. We believe that attracting the right people, maximising their contribution, and rewarding performance is vital for success. By choosing to work at Qube, you will be choosing to work at Australia's largest integrated provider of import and export logistics services with a market capitalisation in excess of $4.8 billion as at 30 June 2022. We operate in over 142 locations across Australia, New Zealand and South East Asia with a workforce of over 8,200 employees.  The Role  As a key member of the Workforce Management Systems team, you will be responsible for providing business analyst support across a number of key workforce systems areas with a strong focus on EA interpretation, documentation of system enhancements and requirement gathering for implementations into the Workforce Management Systems (WFMS)  This role provides analytical and reporting support to the Labour Centre Manager and WFM Systems Manager working with the System Data Analyst to provide insightful labour reporting. The role will be critical to ensuring Workforce Management Systems are configured in a way that employee payments are timely, accurate and compliant with EA’s and awards.  Key Accountabilities  Provide accurate review and interpretation of EA’s, Awards and Letters of agreement (LOA’s) for configuration by the System Administrators in our Workforce Management Systems Ongoing review and audits of workforce management systems configuration to prevent incorrect payment or entitlement calculations Develop requirements for reporting and dashboarding to provide insights and trends in labour costs and labour management to Qube management and finance teams Support Industrial Relations GM’s with data and analysis leading up to and during EA negotiations Identify and document business requirements for enhancements to Workforce Management Systems Document use case scenarios of Workforce Management system functions Create user guides, system guidelines and documentation for Workforce Management Systems Perform requirement gathering for new site implementations into the Workforce Management Systems Work with National Labour Centre Manager and WFM Systems Manager to improve employee and management experience of the rostering processes such as allocation requirements, employee self-service, leave application and approval processes. Identify and champion business process improvement opportunities that reduce cost, improve employee experience and reduce compliance risk. Other BA support to the National Labour Centre Manager and WFM Systems Manager  Core Competencies  The following competencies have been identified as required to be successful. These competencies help define how we do our role and recognise the behaviours that we need to display daily. The required competencies for this role:  Strong analysis, interpretation and documentation skills Strong communication skills and the ability to work closely with a diverse range of stakeholders Broad experience and knowledge of workforce management & payroll systems Ability to work in a team Functional understanding and experience with ERP, BI and reporting tools Strong attention to detail and accuracy Proficiency in MS packages (MS Word, Excel)  Additional Skills and Knowledge Essential  Exemplary verbal and written communication skills Strong time management and organisational skills Respond to internal business user requests for assistance with issues related to application and functions Self-motivated and directed, with keen attention to detail  Desirable  Understanding of modern awards and industrial instruments Understanding of system processes to aid system administration of Workforce Management Systems Experience with system implementation and/or process improvements Experience with Microster, TMS, iChris, Jemini and/or Deputy  Why Qube?  Up to 50% off gyms, studios, active wear, healthy meals, supplements, recovery and more through the Qube Fit program. Discounted health insurance Special paid leave to participate in volunteering activities Unlimited access to employee assistance program delivered through Benestar Generous paid parental leave Access to Qube wellbeing program  Qube recognises the value of an inclusive and diverse work environment. We take pride in the diversity of our people and encourage applications from people of all genders, ages and backgrounds. Our recruitment decisions are based on the key inherent needs and requirements of each role, and candidates are selected on their unique strengths and characteristics. Are you looking for an opportunity to further your analytical skills & ability to communicate a compelling story and build great relationships? If so, this might be the ideal role for you! Be an advocate for the use of data insights Support the delivery of tailored stores through data-driven space management Work with a team that supports growth and career development    About Woolworths Group  Woolworths Group is a food and everyday needs retailer united by the shared purpose of creating better experiences together for a better tomorrow. With more than 1,400 stores across its Woolworths Supermarkets, Countdown Supermarkets (New Zealand) and BIG W brands, and fast-growing eCommerce businesses, Woolworths Group is Australia and New Zealand’s largest retailer. A top 10 company on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX), Woolworths Group employs more than 180,000 team members and serves more than 20 million customers a week.    About the Opportunity As a Macro Space Analyst, you will have the opportunity to work on a wide variety of high-impact strategic projects, analysing complex business problems to help deliver a differentiated offer for our customers and inform our range and space strategy.  You will; Collaborate with relevant commercial partner s (ie: Analysts, Leads, Category Managers) & key strategic stakeholders (ie: Head Of, Managers, etc) to derive data-led insights, providing recommendations to influence our range & space strategy Identify strategic opportunities through structured analysis and problem solving across different areas; with consideration for individual store requirements, customer behaviour, market trends, category performance, pricing & ranging dynamics Understand the advanced analytics of our space optimisation tools, ensuring that proposed space recommendations not only improve the customer experience, but enable the greatest commercial & strategic outcome Identify continuous improvement opportunities that will drive our customer experiences and deliver our commercial strategy through space optimisation Support our Macro Space Optimisation squad to enable the delivery of key outcomes & recommendations across strategic programs, where high range and space complexity exists Extract data to collate actionable insights across all relevant GCP databases (ie: SAP, Blue Yonder, Shopper Intelligence, Quantium, Buying Insight) to provide recommendations that influence key strategic pillars Be proactive in information gathering and driving strategic conversations. Formulate and inform opportunities which will support the commercial and macro space teams decisions   About You  As a Macro Space Analyst, you are; Passionate about creating a great customer experience Curious to understand customer behaviour and its links to commercial and space optimisation outcomes, with an ability to operate within ambiguity An analytical thinker, with capability of breaking information into component parts, patterns and relationships Capable of interpreting data to derive actionable insights for both short and long-term strategies Proactive in stakeholder management, with a track record of building relationships and networking A confident communicator and storyteller; with strong visualisation, verbal and written skills Able to attend regular store visits within Woolworths and competitor supermarkets (as well as broader market place) in conjunction with broader Macro Space team to understand market trends and opportunities   You have; A high attention to detail, with a results-oriented mindset A high level of proficiency in SQL (GCP), with an ability to extract data through basic queries An ability to manipulate data in SQL to derive insight (CASE statements, PARTITION BY statements etc) A proficient understanding of Google Sheets, with confidence in range of intermediate functions (eg: pivot tables, formulas, conditional formatting) to draw insight into potential recommendations Desire to learn more about data analysis tools including SQL to optimise and automate data outputs to drive better decision making Curiosity & self-sufficiency to dive into & understand agency datasets e.g. Quantium, Nielsen, Shopper Intelligence, IRI or equivalent datasets   If you meet a number of requirements (and not all), we encourage you to submit your application. The Tech Business Analyst plays a crucial role in bridging the gap between the technical teams and business stakeholders. This position involves understanding the business needs, analyzing processes, and identifying technology solutions to enhance efficiency and achieve business objectives. The Tech Business Analyst collaborates closely with various departments, including IT, development teams, project managers, and key business units, to ensure successful implementation of technology initiatives.  Relevant experience - 8 to 10 Years  Key Responsibilities:  Requirements Gathering and Analysis:  Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather and document detailed business requirements for technology projects.  Analyze and translate business needs into functional and technical specifications.  Conduct interviews, workshops, and surveys to elicit requirements from stakeholders.  Process Mapping and Improvement:  Document current business processes and workflows to identify areas for improvement.  Propose optimized and streamlined processes based on industry best practices and technology capabilities.  Analyze process data to identify bottlenecks and inefficiencies and suggest solutions.  Collaborate with project managers to create project plans, monitor progress, and ensure timely delivery of project milestones.  Data Analysis and Reporting:  Perform data analysis to extract insights and trends for informed decision-making.  Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and visualizations for business stakeholders.  Act as a liaison between technical teams and business stakeholders, ensuring clear and effective communication.  Present findings, project updates, and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and understandable manner.  Collaborate with testing teams to define test scenarios and validate deliverables against business requirements.  Participate in user acceptance testing (UAT) to ensure solutions meet business needs.  Qualifications and Skills:  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field.  Proven experience as a Business Analyst in the technology domain.  Solid understanding of software development lifecycles (SDLC) and project management methodologies.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and creatively.  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to interact with stakeholders at all levels.  Proficient in data analysis and reporting tools.  Familiarity with various business analysis techniques and methodologies.  Knowledge of Insurance industry-standard business analysis tools is a plus.  Adaptability and flexibility to handle multiple projects and changing priorities. Job Description KPMG is seeking a passionate, autonomous Data Analyst to support the marketing function of the firm. This role will be responsible for reporting on all facets of marketing performance and enabling data governance and best practice. Your Opportunity Forming part of the Marketing Operations team in Client Experience & Brand, this role will be key in delivering to the data strategy for Marketing. You will be responsible for marketing campaign & CRM reporting that happens across the team. You will work with SMEs in building & maintaining your understanding of the changes to the digital marketing eco system and will incorporate these into reporting. You will collaborate with the Services & Industry Marketing leads to deliver reporting needs by providing evidence to the conversations they have with KPMG Partners and other business leaders. You’ll work with the broader CX&B team to implement reporting best practises. How are you extraordinary? You are an expert in the Data & Analytics space and have a clear understanding of all data analytics principles including data quality, data governance, data integrations, data architecture, documentation, visualisation and mainly data driven decision making. You have studied Business Analytics or Data Analytics formally and have work experience in the digital marketing space. Your Experience At KPMG, we believe diversity of thought, background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients, and communities. To be considered for this opportunity, your qualifications, skills & experience could include the following: Report building (in Excel & Power BI) has been part of your previous work. Able to maintain a reporting cadence (monthly, quarterly, annually) and deliver to timelines. Expert in understanding the digital media landscape of an organisation. Demonstrated success in managing multiple stakeholders. Able to have conversations with both highly technical and non-technical stakeholders and show expertise in translating requirements between the two. Ability to take ownership of the data architecture of the team. Able to think and suggest creative solutions to data and reporting issues. Comfortable and motivated working in a collaborative matrix environment. Tertiary qualification in Business Analytics or Data Analytics preferred. Work experience in Marketing Analytics or Digital Marketing preferred. Experience working with Microsoft Dynamics CRM is an added advantage. Additional Information KPMG is a professional services firm with global outreach and deep sector experience. We work with clients across an array of industries to solve complex challenges, steer change and enable growth. Our people are what make KPMG the thriving workplace that it is and what sets us apart is that we know great minds think differently. Collaborate with a team of passionate, highly skilled professionals who’ve got your back. You’ll build relationships with unique and diverse colleagues who will provide you with the support you need to be your best and produce meaningful and impactful work in an inclusive, equitable culture. At KPMG, you’ll take control over how you work. We’re embracing a new way of working in many ways, from offering flexible hours and locations to generous paid parental leave and career breaks. Our people enjoy a variety of exciting perks, including retail discounts, health and wellbeing initiatives, learning and growth opportunities, salary packaging options and more. Diverse candidates have diverse needs. During your recruitment journey, information will be provided about adjustment requests. If you require additional support before submitting your application, please contact the Talent Support Team. At KPMG every career is different, and we look forward to seeing how you grow with us.Show moreReport

Role: IT Business Analyst Employment type: Full time Location: Sydney, Australia Company: InfoCentric $70,000 - $160,000 plus superannuation.  InfoCentric are currently hiring for a Business Analyst. As part of our team, you will be working with some of Australia's largest organisations to deliver industry leading data solutions. This role is full time and permanent, based out of Melbourne.  About the role  The IT Business Analyst plays a key role within the product development team, acting as the main conduit between the development team and the business by understanding and translating business needs into software requirements, ensuring that the requirements, designs and specifications are captured, defined and well understood by the development team, using agile practices.  Day to day activities Work with stakeholders to prioritise the product backlog and defects based on business value, ensuring the value of the work that the team performs. Work closely with the project team members to ensure that the product meets the agreed requirements and to ensure the product is of a high quality. Accurately describe the problem statement, business impact and client experience. Work with the business to clearly identify success criteria for each milestone the team are working on. Define the acceptance criteria for user stories and requirements to ensure clarity for the development team Assist with the definition of the testing strategy and test execution including participation in testing activities and release readiness assessments. May lead agile ceremonies (stand up, retro, showcases, workshops, inceptions etc.) through visualisation techniques Gain a thorough understanding of the clients' business and be able to gather, refine and articulate their needs Analyse user requirements and deliver artefacts to assist with understanding - including domain modelling, workflows, user stories and interface design, by liaising with a range of people including users & product managers, drawing together information needs from across the organisation.   Skills Required: Minimum 2 years experience working as an IT Business Analyst Solid experience in gathering requirements Strong knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle Strong SQL knowledge Agile values and principles: Agile SDLC, Teams, Roles, Ceremonies and Artefacts. Jira (working with multiple projects: Scrum and Kanban boards) Strong knowledge of testing and automation of testing Confluence, Slack, Google Suite, Excel. Presentations: project pitches, internal and external demos, feature reviews, design critiques. Nice to have experience with wireframes and design tools: Balsamiq/Adobe XD/InVision Nice to have experience working with cloud technologies    Who Are We?  InfoCentric is one of the largest specialist Cloud, Data and Analytics Consulting firms  Data is in our DNA – Harnessing the latest technology, delivering thought leading outcomes in AI, Machine Learning, API development and Cloud Platform delivery  We translate the best ideas into awesome outcomes that make a difference to Australia's largest organisations. Embrace diversity - We work to understand and celebrate differences to embrace diversity, drive smarter decisions, create new ideas and build a better culture Thrive together - We work together in innovative teams to share knowledge and help each other grow Realise opportunity - We offer opportunities to develop skills and leadership with paid certifications and team trainings while offering great career growth Empower clients - We strive to understand our clients to deliver hands-on solutions to Australia's largest companies across a diverse industries Think big picture - We act in fairness to look after our people, our clients and our community    What We Offer Hands on, onshore experience with Australia's largest organisations Paid trainings and certifications on the latest technologies including AWS, Azure and Snowflake Great on-site support to help you settle in and progress your career Regular social events and company parties. Previous events include private cinema screenings, bubble soccer, minigolf, bowling and social drinks  Due to the high number of applicants we receive, you will be contacted if you are successful. We thank you for your interest in InfoCentric and working with us. If you're unsuccessful for this role we will keep your details and reach out to you with any suitable roles in the future.Show moreReport

The International Institute of Data & Analytics (IDA) is a not-for-profit hi-tech organization with foci on data science and big data analytics innovation, education and training, and commercialization and services. IDA offers unique experiences and engagement models for bridging the gaps between academia and business, enabling industry and government `easy to do business with’ leading scientists and specialists in data & analytics, and building a platform for engagements and collaborations between outstanding researchers, practitioners and educators.  In data science and big data analytics, the IDA creates enablers for:  Leading the field of data science and analytics innovation, training and services by building think-tank and thought leadership, and next-generation of data scientists and professionals; transforming excellent research and innovation outcomes to actionable data science and analytics systems, tools, services and training for industry innovation and transformation; and building a flexible and engaging culture and platform to connect local, regional and global resources in data & analytics research and business towards developing world-class centre of excellence and research networks.  You shall find the IDA team very self-motivated, high standard and forward thinking focused, and highly hands-on.  Responsibilities  Collaborate with our clients and internal stakeholders to understand and document their business requirements, needs and objectives toward delivering project plans and business plans. Comprehensive understanding of data structures, and extract required data for analysis according to business requirements. Architect, develop and automate data analytics models and solutions. Develop analytics solutions, including data extraction, pre-processing, modeling, deployment, evaluation and maintenance. Iteratively prototype and productise analytical models and solutions per commercial standard and for production and commercialization. Make business recommendations in terms of cost-benefit, forecasting and impact analysis by effective presentations of data-driven findings to clients and stakeholders, and provide insights to clients. Document and communicate all relevant work and work outcomes. Lead and mentor junior data analysts/scientists in a closely collaborative data science project team.  Qualifications  Solid background, knowledge and capabilities in statistics, mathematics, computer science, informatics, computing, or closely relevant scientific field. At least three years of data-driven analytics hands-on experience with deep know-how of predictive modeling, machine learning and data mining, and relevant modeling approaches and algorithms. Demonstrated capabilities to prototype and productise statistical analysis and modeling algorithms and apply these algorithms for data-driven solutions to problems in new domains. Demonstrated advanced knowledge of SQL (data extraction and manipulation), expertise in SAS programming, and software development skills in one to several scripting languages (Python/R). Demonstrated capabilities to communicate and engage with and manage relationships across a range of stakeholder groups and technical project teams. Demonstrated capabilities to work effectively as a member and leader of a data science project team to provide the high level specifications, management and communications. Demonstrated experience for independent problem-solving and self-motivated innovation, education and services.  Contact: Jinjiu.Li@idawise.comShow moreReport

Senior Reporting Analyst High-profile team responsible for important decisions for one of Australia’s leading rail freight provider Work for a stable, leading organisation that is an essential service Permanent opportunity based in our North Sydney office About us Pacific National (PN) is the largest private provider of diversified rail freight services in Australia. We haul a variety of freight including coal, intermodal containers, steel, and a range of bulk commodities and materials that keep the region’s economy, businesses and households running. We are a company built on solid foundations and we are incredibly proud of the essential role we continue to play supporting Australia’s supply chain. At Pacific National, we take great pride in delivering our best every day and have a relentless focus on customer service and place safety above all else.  We operate nationally with approximately 3,500 staff in over 90+ sites across Australia. We respect and care for the communities in which we operate and continue to evolve our community engagement and strengthen relationships through partnerships and investment. We are focused on reducing the carbon emissions of our business, while also enabling the reduction of carbon emissions in the broader supply chain to support the National targets. About the role The Senior Reporting Analyst supports the preparation of Pacific National’s Finance reports including the monthly forecasts and monthly/quarterly performance reports to Executives and Shareholders. Other activities include supporting the delivery of the annual budget, ad-hoc analysis and reporting and contribution to the development, testing and maintenance of reporting systems. job_title: Governance Research Analyst (Open to New Graduates)
job_description: Let’s be #BrilliantTogether Overview: We are currently seeking a full-time Mandarin-speaking Governance Research Analyst. This position will be permanent and based in Sydney for the research and write-up of corporate governance and voting research for institutional shareholders of Chinese and Taiwanese companies publicly traded in the Greater China region and the United States. Founded in 1985, the Institutional Shareholder Services group of companies (“ISS”) empowers investors and companies to build for long-term and sustainable growth by providing high-quality data, analytics, and insight. With over 2,600 employees spread across 29 offices in 15 countries, ISS is today the world’s leading provider of corporate governance and responsible investment solutions, market intelligence and fund services, and events and editorial con tent for institutional investors and corporations, globally. ISS Governance offerings include objective governance research and recommendations, and end-to-end proxy voting and distribution solutions. Institutional clients have long turned to ISS to apply their corporate governance views, identify environmental, social, and governance risks, and manage their complete proxy voting needs on a global basis. ISS covers approximately 48,000 meetings in 115 markets yearly, delivering proxy research and vote recommendations while working closely with clients to execute more than 12.8 million ballots representing 5.4 trillion shares. Responsibilities: Analyze corporate governance and financial information to process data and write research reports on publicly traded companies in mainland China and Taiwan Issue proxy vote recommendations for shareholder meetings of the companies listed on stock exchanges in mainland China and Taiwan Develop market specific expertise in corporate governance, securities regulations, and proxy voting issues gathered through research and engagement with company executives, institutional investors, and government/regulatory/listing authorities Lead or participate in engagement meetings and calls with corporate executives, directors, and financial and legal advisors, as well as institutional investors, as part of research process on high profile or contentious shareholder meetings Develop market overviews and generate research notes on developing governance trends, emerging situations, and other governance-focused topics for internal and external clients Contribute to seasonal reviews, bulletin calls, and other client-focused governance research reports Answer internal/external client/corporate issuer queries on research reports and participate in discussions and development of ISS policy Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a related field such as finance, law, economics, business, accounting, political science, and international relations, or equivalent experience Master's degree in a related field or MBA or CFA qualifications or equivalent work experience preferred 3-5 years of experience in research and analysis or any related fields is preferred, but open to New Graduates Excellent oral and written communication skills in Chinese (both simplified and traditional) and English Experience in financial analysis and knowledge of corporate governance and proxy voting issues preferred Strong analytical ability, including financial statement literacy and attention to detail Goal-oriented and comfortable with ambiguity and able to prioritize, anticipate, and deliver multiple, sometimes competing objectives under tight deadlines Strong organization skills, teamwork, and ability to work independently Passion for corporate governance research Must have the proper work authorization in the country- please indicate work eligibility in resume #LI-CP11 #Associate #Research What you can expect from us Our people are the moving force behind ISS. We are dedicated to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry and empowering them with the resources and support to enhance their career, health, financial and personal well-being. We are committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity and inclusion. We are invested in our people and are working every day to ensure a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. Let’s empower, collaborate, and inspire one another. Let’s be #BrilliantTogether. About ISS ISS empowers investors and companies to build for long-term and sustainable growth by providing high-quality data, analytics, and insight. We are committed to positively impacting the environment and society through our market-leading solutions and leading by example. Visit our website: https://www.issgovernance.com View additional open roles: https://www.issgovernance.com/join-the-iss-team/ Institutional Shareholder Services (“ISS”) is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity and inclusion. It is our policy to prohibit discrimination or harassment against any applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, creed, religion, sex, age, height, weight, citizenship status, national origin, social origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression, pregnancy status, marital status, familial status, mental or physical disability, veteran status, military service or status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law (referred to as “protected status”). All activities including, but not limited to, recruiting and hiring, recruitment advertising, promotions, performance appraisals, training, job assignments, compensation, demotions, transfers, terminations (including layoffs), benefits, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment, are and will be administered on a non-discriminatory basis, consistent with all applicable federal, state, and local requirements.Show moreReport

job_description: Employment Type: Permanent Full Time Position Classification: Health Manager Level 3 Location: Station St Office, Penrith Remuneration: $119,348.00 - $136,057.00 per annum Hours Per Week: 38 Requisition ID: REQ427448 Applications Close: 10/09/2023  With CORE Values of Collaboration, Openness, Respect and Empowerment, working with us will ensure your professional life is provided every opportunity to succeed  and develop in your chosen career role.  What we can offer you (for eligible employees):  Accrued Day Off (ADO) (for full time employees)  Opportunity for extra tax savings through Salary Packaging  Novated Leasing  Great education opportunities through Education Training Service which offers over 110 courses each year  Access to our Employee Assistance Program (EAP) for staff and family members  Fitness Passport  What you will be doing: An exciting opportunity is available for a Senior Data Analyst to join the Analytics team at our Station St Office, Penrith. The Senior Data Analyst in Healthcare is responsible for providing data analysis and management support to enhance decision-making in healthcare. The role involves collecting, interpreting, and analysing complex data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that will inform strategic and operational planning within the district. This role will also be responsible for DBA admin tasks on HIE (until mid-2024), DBA admin tasks on EDWARD and BI report development.  This role will work collaboratively with stakeholders across the LHD and the broader NSW Health landscape to generate valuable insights, improve the quality of data analysis and ensure availability of accurate, consistent and useful reports and dashboards. An eligibility list may be created for future vacancies.  About us: Nepean Blue Mountains Local Health District (NBMLHD) is a wonderful place to expand your career and grow your skills and knowledge. As a recognised leader in the healthcare industry, we provide a range of public health services to the Nepean and Blue Mountains and Lithgow Region.  NBMLHD: is committed to achieving a diverse workforce. We strongly encourage and welcome applications from all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, refugees, people of diverse genders and sexuality, and people with disability.  All NSW Health workers are now required to have received 2 doses of an approved COVID-19 vaccine or have an approved medical contraindication certificate. You will be required to provide a record of your COVID-19 vaccination status if successful.  Employment of a temporary visa holder may only occur if no suitable permanent resident or citizen of Australia has been identified and must not exceed the duration or conditions associated with the current visa.  Selection Criteria to be Addressed:  Tertiary qualifications in data analytics, data science, ICT, health analytics or equivalent and/or relevant experience. Demonstrated experience developing and publishing PowerBI dashboards end-to-end – from gathering requirements, designing the front end, setting up the data model, testing and iterating on dashboards to publishing, training, and maintaining dashboards on an ongoing basis. Demonstrated experience in critically analysing, interpreting and reporting on data in the healthcare industry or related. Examples may include analysis impact on patient outcomes, KPI reporting, performance reporting, etc. Proficient in PowerBI, SSIS, SQL Server, C# (or any other programming language). Demonstrated high level experience or at a minimal understanding of DBA tasks and UNIX. Proven skills in effectively communicating and collaborating with both technical and non-technical stakeholders across a variety of specialisations and domains. Understanding of the health system and the relevant processes, systems, and regulatory requirements. Experience in R or Python not essential but well regarded.  Need more information?   1) Click here for the Position Description   2) Find out more about applying for this position For role related queries or questions contact Shilpa Shetty on shilpa.shetty@health.nsw.gov.auShow moreReport

DATE POSTED  13/10/2023  JOB REFERENCE ID  16405  LOCATION  Sydney, Australia  GENERAL JOB DESCRIPTION  This role offers a unique opportunity to investigate and mitigate potential cases of fraud, making a substantial impact on minimizing losses and maximizing recovery.  KEY FACTS  A 50/50 hybrid work arrangement promoting work-life balance and productivity. Positive and people-centric company culture, join a dynamic team! Play a pivotal role in the Insurance Sector.  FULL JOB DESCRIPTION  Our partner, a global insurance company, is seeking a full-time permanent Fraud Analyst to join their collaborative team.  THE ROLE: As an Insurance Fraud Analyst, you will be instrumental in uncovering potential fraud cases. You will conduct thorough investigations, collecting evidence and building compelling cases. Your insights will direct our enforcement team to minimize losses and optimize recovery.  RESPONSIBILITIES:  Conduct thorough interviews with insured parties to gather vital information related to suspected fraudulent claims. Gather and analyze evidence to establish the validity of a claim and construct a compelling case. Provide regular updates and progress reports to your supervisor, offering recommendations for further action. Manage cases from inception to resolution, ensuring all required records and documentation are meticulously maintained. Collaborate with various stakeholders, including civil authorities and insurance information bureaus, to build and support developing cases. Lead and assist in the development and delivery of fraud detection training and educational programs. Play a pivotal role in managing the case workflow for our Investigations team.   SKILLS/ABILITIES:  A fundamental understanding of human behavior and performance. Strong teamwork skills, able to collaborate effectively with others. Proficient in data analysis, with a keen eye for detail. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Demonstrates proficiency in investigative and analytical tasks. Applies lateral thinking to problem-solving, finding creative solutions. Possesses negotiation expertise to handle complex situations. Excels in time management, ensuring tasks are completed efficiently.  QUALIFICATIONS:  ﻿  Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Criminal Justice, Insurance, Business). Previous experience in insurance fraud analysis or investigative work is a plus. Knowledge of insurance regulations and fraud prevention techniques is beneficial.Show moreReport

You will join a project delivery team tasked with supporting the Credit Risk, Market Risk and Prudential Risk divisions to achieve their ambitious change agendas. Our persistent internal project team comprises project professionals with varied experience who focus on complex initiatives delivering significant change due to regulatory and / or internal drivers for change.  At Macquarie, we are working to create lasting value for our communities, our clients and our people. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 54 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drive outcomes.  What role will you play?  You will initially focus on delivering the Market Risk Transformation Program, playing a key role from initiation through the full project cycle. Our multi-year program aims to deliver a new single future-proof Market Risk platform that is aligned with overall Technology strategy and supports business growth, by design. It will provide our Market Risk analysts a single view for all key market risk capabilities and outstanding actions, with underlying streamlined processes reducing complex/manual touch points, allowing for higher value work.  You will leverage your great communication skills and interest in Financial Markets to deliver end to end change in one or more projects, ensuring requirements are met and benefits realised, driving key outcomes as agreed with your business stakeholders like project agenda, workshops, requirements gathering, etc.) and influencing stakeholders.  What you offer  Solid experience as a Risk Business Analyst, with a good understanding of work required in the financial risk domain, if not direct experience Proven ability to embrace change and adapt to the variable needs of our dynamic business. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with experience in establishing effective working relationships with key stakeholders and managing expectations Previous involvement in delivering large and complex projects through geographically dispersed teams and external resources is desirable Prior experience in front or middle office roles, including product control, projects & change and/or trading functions is desirable  We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.  Benefits  Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria and location, include:  Hybrid and flexible working arrangements Wellbeing and service bonus leave Up to 20 weeks paid parental leave as well as benefits to support you as you transition to life as a working parent Paid volunteer leave and donation matching Range of benefits to support your physical, psychological and financial wellbeing  About the Risk Management Group  In our Risk Management Group, you will be part of an independent, and centralised function, responsible for independent and objective review and challenge, oversight, monitoring and reporting in relation to Macquarie’s material risks. Our divisions include behavioural risk, compliance, credit, financial crime risk, internal audit, market risk, operational risk and governance, prudential risk, and Risk Management Group central.  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for a role regardless of their identity, including gender, race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status, marital or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disabilities, or socio-economic background.  If you require adjustments to your working arrangements or the recruitment process, please let us know when applying.   About Macquarie A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future. Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.  Job no: RMG-974382 Work type: Agency Worker, Maximum term Location: Sydney Category: Mid-senior, Projects, Improvements & Change, Risk Management Group: Risk Management Group Division: RMG Central Recruiter: Owen Fox Opening Date: 02/11/2023Show moreReport

We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 54 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drive outcomes.  What role will you play?  In this role, you will be analysing current data lineage, feeding data warehouses and reporting engines, and be responsible for designing change for our finance and risk systems, transforming our platform and processes and delivering trusted, timely data. Day to day you will, define and manage the backlog, work with stakeholders to understand and document desired outcomes, analyse data sources to map and source data inputs and build data models, and work with our teams to acquire, test and validate and transform new data and continuously identify opportunities to improve.  What you offer  Demonstrated experience working in a Senior Technical Business Analyst role, ideally with a development background Experience working in banking and financial services, including financial products Experience working with data focussed roles across data lineage, data analysis, data flows Experience with front to back system flows and product lifecycles Experience ensuring development meets business and functional requirements.  We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.  Benefits  Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria and location, include:  Hybrid and flexible working arrangements Wellbeing and service bonus leave Up to 20 weeks paid parental leave as well as benefits to support you as you transition to life as a working parent Paid volunteer leave and donation matching Range of benefits to support your physical, psychological and financial wellbeing  About the Corporate Operations Group  In our Corporate Operations Group, you will work at the heart of Macquarie. Join a collaborative team who accelerate digitalisation, sustainability and social impact for the benefit of our people, customers, shareholders and communities. Our teams include technology, digital transformation and data, operations, human resources, business services, corporate strategy and solutions and the Macquarie Group Foundation.  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for a role regardless of their identity, including gender, race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status, marital or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disabilities, or socio-economic background.  If you require adjustments to your working arrangements or the recruitment process, please let us know when applying.   About Macquarie A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future. Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.  Job no: COG-975113 Work type: Agency Worker Location: Sydney Category: Senior, Technology Group: Corporate Operations Group Division: Technology Recruiter: Kymberley Weir Opening Date: 05/11/2023Show moreReport

Deliver with impact, connect to what matters & live your way with flexible working options  Ongoing Full Time Location: Willing to consider candidates across all NSW locations. Preference will be given to candidates based regionally, with a focus on Queanbeyan, Armidale, Dubbo and Coffs Harbour Salary from $139,787 to $161,663.00p.a + super Create a legacy using your specialist skills  About the Role  As a Senior Technical Data Analyst in Local Land Services (LLS), you will play a pivotal role in spearheading the development, maintenance, and implementation of data integration resources essential for the seamless operation of our business. You will take charge of managing the connectivity between various LLS systems, as well as with external entities, including other NSW Government agencies.  Your responsibilities extend to overseeing the LLS Reporting Data Warehouse (RDW), which is instrumental in providing insights and data for LLS decision-makers and compliance with legislative reporting requirements. You will act as a liaison between LLS and other Departments to ensure the availability and administration of critical resources required for data integration and RDW operation.  Why Join LLS?  Make a strategic impact on the future of land management in New South Wales Collaborate with a diverse range of stakeholders, both within the Department and external vendors Work on challenging and rewarding projects that have a real-world impact Be part of a team of passionate and talented individuals who are committed to making a difference  Key Responsibilities  Develop, maintain, and implement data integration solutions Manage the connectivity between various LLS systems and external entities Oversee the LLS Reporting Data Warehouse (RDW) Act as a liaison between LLS and other Departments Ensure the availability and administration of critical resources required for data integration and RDW operation  Skills and Experience  You will possess a combination of technical skills and relevant experience such as:  Proficiency in several data analytics focused programming languages, such as Python, R, and SQL Experience with CI/CD solutions, such as Microsoft Azure DevOps or GitBe Experience in database and storage resource management. Azure resource management, including ADLS and Key Vault Experience in data integration, data warehousing, stakeholder engagement, enterprise architecture, and data analytics. Expertise in data governance and cybersecurity in data systems. Strong data analysis and problem-solving skills  For more information on the Senior Data Analyst role, please refer to the detailed role overview. You can also view the role description and contact Robyn Silk, Director ICT Local Land Services with any questions about the role. Robyn on 0421 610 315 or via email robyn.silk@lls.nsw.gov.au  How to Apply  If this role sounds ideal to you, please apply via our online portal by submitting your resume and a brief cover letter outlining how your skills and experience match what we are looking for.  Applications through email will not be accepted.  Applications Close: Thursday 16 November 2023 at 11:55 pm  Please make sure you are available for interviews on Monday 27 November 2023.  Diversity and inclusion are core values of the Department of Regional NSW. The Department of Regional NSW is a workplace where everyone is able to contribute and participate to their full potential, and we are proud to have a team that reflects the richness and complexity of the regional NSW communities we serve.  We work hard every day to support and grow thriving communities across regional NSW that will have a positive impact on generations to come. Our goal is always to be a trusted local partner and problem-solver working deeply in the community.  Diversity and inclusion are core values of the Department of Regional NSW.
