job_title: Finance Analyst, Financial Planning & Analysis (Expression of Interest)
job_description: "At CommBank we are proud to support flexibility, let's discuss what this means for you" Express your interest in joining CBA in an FP&A capacity!  Whilst this is an Expression of Interest, we strongly encourage you to still apply for other roles in our business. Now is the time to join a recognised leading Financial Services team in the financial services industry. Given CommBanks commitment to building a simpler, better bank, we have a number of opportunities at the Analyst level supporting our Retail Bank, Business Bank and Institutional Banking and Markets. Analyst roles within the CBA team work closely with senior management and staff across all divisions of the Group. Express your interest today for a role and begin your journey to joining the #commbanklife. Do work that matters Consolidation of monthly revenue and expense information Assist with month end processes and submission Provide in-depth analysis of various expense items Provide timely responses to ad-hoc business request Providing a strong control focus including DQ reconciliations Develop a strong understanding of your business unit Contribute to the budgeting and forecasting process, including liaising with offshore counterparts Develop and improve the format, structure and content of management information provided Understand and suggest improvements to the data collection and dissemination process We’re interested in hearing from people who have CA / CPA qualification or working towards Business related degree (commerce, economics, business, finance, accounting) Demonstrated experience in accounting and financial management (e.g. budgeting, forecasting, performance reporting and analysis) Well-developed numeracy and analytical skills: identifying key issues, trends and themes Strong data analytics, MS Excel and SQL knowledge, highly desirable Good commercial acumen and attention to detail Understands business drivers to provide genuine business valued output and analysis Actively builds relationships within and across business streams, functional areas and regions Risk Mindset – All CommBank employees are expected to proactively identify and understand, openly discuss and act on current and future risks. What’s next? Our team is looking to connect with Risk professionals who are interested in being part of a high performing, customer-focused and passionate culture to build a simpler, better bank. We welcome you to express your interest and learn more about Finance Analyst opportunities. We will be in contact with suitable candidates. We support our people with the flexibility to balance where work is done with at least half their time each month connecting in office. We also have many other flexible working options available including changing start and finish times, part-time arrangements and job share to name a few. Talk to us about how these arrangements might work in the role you are interested in. If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest, x15ventures), you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We’re keen to support you with the next step in your career. We're aware of some accessibility issues on this site, particularly for screen reader users. We want to make finding your dream job as easy as possible, so if you require additional support please contact HR Direct on 1800 989 696. Advertising End Date: 19/11/2023Show moreReport

Notes to applicants: Most roles at Dimensional will be part of our best-of-both hybrid working model. This includes working together in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays, and choosing to work where one works best on Mondays and Fridays. This maximizes in person collaboration and interaction while simultaneously providing flexibility. This broad universal approach applies to most roles globally with a few exceptions that require more or less time in the office. Please discuss with your Recruiter to confirm the details for this specific role. Resumes and portfolios (when applicable) are required as part of your application. When applying from a mobile device or tablet, you may not be able to attach a resume. If you cannot include an attachment at the time of your application, you will receive a follow up email asking you to attach your resume from a computer. Here at Dimensional, we strive to be an inclusive workplace for all. Even if you do not match every qualification listed, if you are interested in who we are, what we do, and why we do it, we suggest and encourage you to apply. Job Description: The Compliance Team Dimensional’s Compliance and Risk Management Department is charged with the development and oversight of the firm’s compliance internal controls, policies, and procedures, and risk management framework. Our global structure follows the sun, with compliance personnel established at each office to ensure compliance coverage around the clock. We have a consultative approach that embeds compliance and risk management staff within the groups they support wherever practical, encouraging communication among teams and improving efficiency with real-time guidance. Compliance teams coordinate the establishment and monitoring of processes and controls for compliance with applicable laws, rules, and regulatory standards; internal and client-directed guidelines; and contractual agreements. Team members with Risk in their title work with the business to integrate risk management practices across each department and at an enterprise level. The Opportunity The Compliance and Risk Analyst will primarily provide generalist compliance and risk support in the trading markets, internal controls and monitoring, and corporate compliance areas of the business. The role will also provide support within the Compliance and Risk team including maintenance and oversight of monthly monitoring tasks, preparation of compliance materials and supporting the new hire induction process. This role will offer broad exposure to a wide range of compliance and risk functions in a collaborative and supportive team where opportunities exist for members to contribute both to the firm’s success and to their own. Serve as a compliance and risk resource and point of contact for business partners (Portfolio Management, Trading, Product Management, Client Relations and Marketing). Extract investment guidelines from offer documents, investment management agreements, and other contractual portfolio constituent documents. Assist with the administration and maintenance of the Charles River Investment Management System (CRIMS), including daily mandate monitoring, rule creation, testing, new account set-up, and production enhancements. Assist with investigation and analysis for all trading and financial markets related incidents. Participate in the design, refinement, and execution of monitoring systems, internal controls and corporate compliance procedures, and any associated audits and/or risk assessments of said controls and/or systems. Assist to convey often complex regulatory and investment concepts to internal and external stakeholders. Assist the global compliance team with surveillance and forensic testing of the front office compliance program, as well as the review and maintenance of compliance policies and procedures. Assist the global risk management team with maintaining appropriate risk management systems. Assist the local Compliance and Risk team with the maintenance and oversight of the Code of Ethics, internal register reviews and monitoring programs, as well as assisting with the drafting of compliance papers and working group materials. Develop a commercial understanding of Chapter 5C (Managed Invest Schemes) and Chapter 7 (Financial Services and Markets) of the Corporations Act and associated ASIC Regulatory Guides as well as internal policies so as to assist the business in providing relevant compliance and regulatory advice. Requirements / Qualifications 1-3+ years’ experience with an investment manager, audit or financial risk/compliance consulting business. Working knowledge of equity products; fixed income and derivatives knowledge a plus. Well-developed computer skills: intermediate to expert use of MS office is essential. Familiarity with CRIMS or similar portfolio mandate monitoring system is highly desired; as is experience with Sharepoint and MS Power BI. Experience with object-oriented data base platforms and process automation a major plus (SQL, VBA, etc). Self-motivated individual who has high standards for accuracy and attention to detail who is capable of rapidly learning key elements of the business, working on multiple projects and meeting deadlines. Must work well independently, with local business partners, and as part of a global team. Excellent written and verbal communication skills and comfortable presenting to internal and external stakeholders. Strong work ethic and ability to demonstrate initiative and personal integrity and act as a fiduciary for the business. Ability to balance commercial considerations with reputational and legal/regulatory risk. Knowledge of ISO 31000 – Compliance Programs; and ISO 31000 – Risk Management. Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics or similar. Dimensional offers a variety of programs to help take care of you, your family, and your career, including comprehensive benefits, educational initiatives, and special celebrations of our history, culture, and growth. It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. The Company does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, ancestry, medical condition, marital status, covered veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, or any other protected status. This policy applies to all areas of employment including recruitment, hiring, training, job assignment, promotion, compensation, benefits, transfer, discipline, termination, and social and recreational programs.Show moreReport

We are seeking a talented HR/System Analyst to join our dynamic team at Green by Nature, where we are currently building our Group People & Safety function. This role will have a unique opportunity to help design and develop a new centralised payroll and HRIS system, manage the ongoing system support and drive key change initiatives across the business. Reporting to the Head of Remuneration, Systems & Reporting, this is a fantastic opportunity for an individual with a passion for data integrity, people analytics, process improvement and an interest in remuneration. You will play a vital role in developing and optimising our HR practices, as well as providing insights and analysis to support the broader business. Responsibilities Support the development of our new centralised payroll and HRIS for the group Establish data governance procedures and best-practice HR processes, leveraging technology Ongoing HRIS system and data management Analyse people data to identify trends, make recommendations, and provide insights to HR and senior management Prepare reports and dashboards on people metrics Assist with the development, implementation, and management of employee reward and recognition programs Support the annual performance and remuneration review processes About you Bachelor's degree in HR, Business, Statistics, or related field. Strong analytical skills with expertise in data manipulation, analysis, and visualisation Strong proficiency in Excel Previous experience with various HR Information Systems or advanced data analytics tools (eg. Tableau, PowerBI) an advantage Exceptional attention to detail and the ability to maintain confidentiality and discretion Strong organisational and project management skills, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with limited supervision Sound knowledge of compensation and benefits practices, market trends, and regulatory requirements Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal Familiarity with HR processes, policies, and performance management systems Our Team and Culture: As part of the Green by Nature group, we embrace and celebrate diversity, equity, and inclusion. If you're worried about not meeting all the requirements, don't be – we care more about your potential than checkboxes. So, go ahead and apply – don't let the confidence gap hold you back. To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you are the ideal candidate for this role.Show moreReport

Make a difference. As an Analyst, Peril Pricing you can make the world a safer place. Join the largest insurance group in Australia and New Zealand. We’re here for you. Are you ready?  Your Role As an Analyst, Peril Pricing you will be part of market leading team that is responsible for delivering peril pricing and reinsurance costs to the IAG business units across Australia and NZ. The current team members have expertise in actuarial sciences, engineering, GIS and catastrophe modelling. Your technical background will build on this knowledge to deliver analytical insights to the Group as well as contribute to the engines pioneered by the team. You will build close relationships with diverse professionals.  ABOUT YOU – You have a tertiary qualification in actuarial sciences, statistics, applied mathematics, engineering, econometrics or related disciplines. You’ll have a good understanding of data modelling techniques, statistical methods, tools/languages such as R, SAS, SQL, ArcGIS. Hands on data management and analytics experience is preferable, ideally gained from general insurance or financial services sector. You can work autonomously in a solution orientated and delivery focused manner. Experience working within a multi-disciplinary fast-paced team. Existing knowledge of some of the following will be looked upon favourably: Global Cat modelling software such as AIR, RMS, Imagery analytics/ computer vision. You’ll develop, implement, and maintain analytical tools to provide insights on natural perils risk, pricing, profitability and affordability. You will build analytical application designs and prototyping to test ideas and drive innovation on perils risk and climate risk solutions. You’ll conduct exploratory data analysis, methodological research and experiments to contribute to innovative analytics solutions. You will maintain natural perils cost allocations and pricing processes, and managing internal stakeholders across the business. Provide analytical support to the Pricing & Engineering team on perils including earthquake, flood, bushfire, cyclone, storm and hail. You’ll assist in the delivery of peril risk models for both reinsurance and risk-based pricing applications.  Applications close on Tuesday 21 November 2023. Please submit a cover letter with your application. Location - Sydney  ABOUT US IAG is not only the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand, underwriting over $AUD13 billion of premium per annum, we’re also a tech and research facility, a hub for climate change experts and a centre of resilience design. We chat over coffee with customers, advocate for them in the corridors of Parliament and back them up in the community when life’s moments hit hardest. You’ll know our brands – CGU, WFI, NRMA Insurance, AMI, NZI, and State Insurance to name a few. Together they turn our IAG purpose of making your world safer into action by helping, supporting ambitions and making insurance accessible. When you join IAG, you’re not joining one brand. You’re joining a large purpose-led, Trans-Tasman group dedicated to making your world a safer place.  We’re ready to grow your career, acknowledge every part of you, recognise your brilliance, lead you with purpose and help you live your own purpose through us.  At IAG you’ll experience the following: Flexibility and support so you can live life to the fullest. Work in a team who care about people and community. Receive meaningful recognition through an award-winning system. Access up to 50% off home, motor and small business insurance. Grow through dynamic Trans-Tasman secondments.  We’re ready for you. Apply today.Show moreReport

Become Part of Our Family An opportunity awaits in our vibrant, family-owned spirits company, nurtured by seven generations of the Bacardí family.  We come from humble beginnings in a small tin-roof distillery in Cuba, to a global company with more than 7,000 employees (affectionately known as Primos—Spanish for cousins) and many of the world’s best brands including Bacardí rum, Grey Goose vodka, Patrón tequila, Bombay Sapphire gin to name a few.  We at Bacardí are Fearless, have a Founder’s Mentality and are Family to the core!  Embark on your Next Move In our Financial Analyst position based in Sydney, you will join our Supply Chain & Logistics Team, reporting into the Senior Manager, Supply Chain Finance, and will business partner provide analytical support and drive financial reporting.  Responsibilities You will play a critical role in providing valuable analytical insights to the Australian Supply Chain and Commercial Leadership Teams. With our consumers at the heart, your key focus will include, but not be limited to: Performance Measurement & Reporting: Leading financial reporting activities (including periodic closure of books) Periodic review of working capital, close monitoring of slow-moving stocks, and ensuring adequacy of Inventory provisions Supporting reviews, highlighting variances vs budget Forecasting and highlighting risks & opportunities Supply Chain Projects: Support NPD/ Manufacturing and Strategic projects evaluation and delivery of Manufacturing/Supply/TRM projects Assess Cost of Goods for innovation projects & business cases Interact closely with all relevant stakeholders across functions to ensure commercial/Finance support for new projects, such as SAP readiness, master data setups and other activities as per project timelines Compliance: Compliance of all applicable SOX and internal controls & financial policies with respect to Capex, Opex, procurement, physical verification of stocks across all warehouses and other supply chain process controls. Ensuring green status in all Statutory or Internal audits. Skills and Experience Create your Legacy with your Founder’s Passion and Entrepreneurial Flair As our Financial Analyst, you will have: A proven track record of financial reporting and performance management across manufacturing operations; Strong numerical and analytical skills, strong commercial acumen Excellent written and verbal communication skills – English Strong business partnering skills; ability to influence market stakeholders and build trust with key stakeholders Experience of working in cross functional environment Advanced Excel skills, including financial model building Experience working with SAP and BI desirable As role model of the Bacari Family culture, you will embody this cultural pillar through: Belonging: You have a strong capacity to create a culture of ‘Belonging’, where people feel appreciated for who they are, what they do, and who they can become. You’re an authentic leader who acts with purpose and has an approachable, empathetic, open communication style. Embrace multicultural environment with diverse ways of working Mental Agility: You can think critically to penetrate complex problems and expand the possibilities by making fresh connections. You think strategically whilst being execution focused and bring creativity to the challenges you’re presented with. You will have an attitude of constant learning and improving. Inquisitiveness/ curiosity around new media, digital, technology and social trends and possessing an attitude to experiment or innovate in these areas. People Agility: You bring a deep ability to understand and relate to people and navigate through tough situations to harness and multiply collective performance. You create strong positive first impressions and build those into great relationships. Self-Awareness: You have high levels of self-awareness, are reflective and know yourself well, understanding both your own strengths and weaknesses and your impact on others. Results Agility: You demonstrate consistent delivery of results in first-time situations by inspiring teams, exhibiting a presence that builds confidence in yourself and others. You operate at pace, can multi-skill effectively and are at ease in leading projects. You will be highly performance driven, commercially and financially astute. Change Agility: You have a deep natural curiosity, desire to experiment and ability to effectively deal with the heat of change. You have a growth and learning mindset: ready to test, stumble, learn and apply from experience. Highly comfortable with change and ambiguity Your chance to be Fearless is here! Our talent search and interview process will be collaborative, fast-paced, and will push a few boundaries, so here’s your quick heads up if you make the shortlist— get ready to showcase what you're best at…  We’ll help you to Do What Moves You With family at our core, naturally we love to look after our Primos! Some of the great benefits you can expect to receive include: Product allowance Office Drinks & Events Flexi Work & Summer Hours Bacardí Assist In Spirit Day Career Development Founder’s Day Celebrations Belong at Bacardí At Bacardí you are appreciated for who you are. We mirror the rich diversity of our consumers by welcoming talented people from a variety of backgrounds, cultures, communities, and experiences to our Company. As a certified Great Place to Work, find out why bringing together different mindsets and perspectives powers our business. If you share our passion, you should consider joining our Family!  Our culture We share the passion and entrepreneurial flair of our founder and are guided by our three culture pillars - Fearless, Family and Founders, they inspire our Primos to be the best they can be and drive us forward in all we do. But what does this mean? Being Fearless; means adopting an agile mindset, being comfortable trying new things and taking risks. We are empowered to question, challenge and innovate. Family; We treat each other, and our communities, like Family. Always.  Founders; The spirit of entrepreneurship is at the heart of everything we do. We see the business as if it’s our own. We do the right thing for the business and we all take accountability for our work. When you join Bacardi, you become part of our family and gain more than just a job. Disclaimer: Bacardi is an equal opportunity employer that values workforce diversity. Diversity is core to our business: by embedding diversity into all aspects of our culture, we maximize the opportunity to achieve sustainable business success and growth. The duties and responsibilities described in the role profile might not be a comprehensive list. U.S. applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws.Show moreReport

Date: 11 Nov 2023  Location: Sydney, NSW, AU Brisbane, QLD, AU Melbourne, VIC, AU Perth, WA, AU  Department: Tax and Legal  Description: Job Requisition ID: 34819  Unique opportunity to join the Global Mobility Tax team in Australia  Exceptional career development in a supportive environment. Flexible work arrangements – work in a way that suits you best.  Incredible opportunity to make an impact that matters to some of the largest multinationals in the world.  What will your typical day look like?  You will work as part of the Deloitte Global Employer Services (GES) team to support and advise some of Australia’s and the world’s largest and most innovative companies. In this role, you will provide advice to international assignees about the Australian tax implications of their assignments, as well as helping them meet their Australian tax compliance obligations. You will also support and advise corporate clients with tax and policy issues arising from their global mobility programs.  Deloitte GES will provide continual on-the-job and formal technical training as well as a mixture of clients to work with, giving you exposure to a broad range of issues and opportunities to build client relationships. You will be part of a wider client service team, working together with our global network of mobility tax specialists to provide holistic solutions to your clients.  About the team The current global situation presents many challenges for companies - that’s where we come in. Deloitte GES helps multinational corporations navigate multifaceted tax laws and labour regulations. Combining tax research and data analytics, we give advice on global compensation, visa and work permits, employment taxes, personal tax compliance and policy design for many of the world’s largest companies and their employees.  Enough about us, let’s talk about you.  You are someone with: Experience in a previous Australian tax role in expatriate tax (preferred), personal income tax or employment tax Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, as you will be working directly with individual clients, corporate clients and tax revenue authorities (eg ATO) Ability to manage and prioritise tasks, working across numerous multinational clients and individual clients Strong foundational Australian tax knowledge in all areas impacting mobility tax, including tax residency, double tax agreements, capital gains tax, employee share schemes and Australian employment tax issues An eagerness and commitment to expand your focus and skillset to become a broader advisory professional across all areas of global mobility to better support your clients.  Why Deloitte?  At Deloitte, we focus our energy on interesting and impactful work. We’re always learning, innovating, and setting the standard; making a positive difference to our clients and our society. We put coaching at the heart of what we do, helping our people grow their careers in any direction – whether it be up, moving into something new, or even moving across the world.  We embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion. We have a diverse collection of people from different backgrounds, with different experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. What binds us together is a shared commitment to value everyone’s perspective and to cultivate inclusion; so that our work environment is a safe space we can all belong.  We prioritise flexibility and choice. At Deloitte, you get trust on Day 1. We know our people get their best work done when they’re in control of where and how they work, designing their work week around their client, team, and personal commitments.  We help you live and work well. To support your personal and professional life, we offer a range of perks and benefits, including retail discounts, wellbeing leave, paid volunteering days, twelve flexible working options, market-leading parental leave and return to work support package.Show moreReport

job_title: Business Analyst - Group Financial Planning & Analysis
job_description: About Woolworths Group Woolworths Group is a food and everyday needs retailer united by the shared purpose of creating better experiences together for a better tomorrow. With more than 1,400 stores across its Woolworths Supermarkets, Countdown Supermarkets (New Zealand) and BIG W brands, and fast-growing eCommerce businesses, Woolworths Group is Australia and New Zealand’s largest retailer. A top 10 company on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX), Woolworths Group employs more than 180,000 team members and serves more than 20 million customers a week. Varied and highly visible role Broad reach across different functions of the business and stakeholders Great collaborative team culture Fantastic career pathway Active involvement in the delivery of Finance Strategy  About the role Reporting to the SBA FP&A, this is an excellent opportunity to partner with senior leaders across the business, develop insights into performance across the group, and play a key role in the operating rhythms for finance including monthly board reporting and the Annual Plan. This is a highly matrixed role with a wide horizontal reach and exposure across the organisational structure, partnering with a number of FP&A teams in a permanent full time position. Key responsibilities Generate, analyse, and communicate insights on the trading performance of the Group, including underlying drivers and operating metrics, and preparing the monthly CFO and CEO reports to the Board Play a key role in the planning, coordination and presentation of the Group Annual Plan, ensuring clear communication with stakeholders and articulation of the Group Strategic and Financial Plan through high quality Board papers Collate, interpret and analyse our financial outlook and forecast across Sales, EBIT, Trade Working Capital and Cash Flow, to understand trends and identify opportunities Provide SME support and guidance on a wide range of topics including Ecosystem / Segment reporting, analysis of market consensus, and key operating metrics Build trusted relationships with leaders across the FP&A community, Group Strategy, External Reporting, Investor Relations, FSS and Treasury Assist in facilitate the Woolworths FP&A Chapter, creating a connected community to share insights and best practice Help land the Finance Strategy, including evolving the group planning, strengthening the process, data and system foundation and transforming our finance operating rhythm.  About you: In Finance we have an overarching capability framework that brings to life 5 key capabilities that shape who we are, what we do, and how we work together, these are; value co-creator, inspiring leader, trusted advisor, agile learner, and insights generator. We are looking forward to hearing how you may have demonstrated these capabilities while also bringing the following to the table: Finance-related degree CA/CPA qualified advantageous but not essentia Exposure to FP&A environments with a specific focus on executive reporting and performance tracking of key initiatives preferred but not essential Energetic, enthusiastic, and passionate about the business and understanding the drivers of performance Strong presentation and storyboarding skills Strong communication skills, stakeholder management and relationship-building skills Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to prioritise team efforts to support business requirements Experience using systems (BPC/SAP/GCP/IBM Planning Analytics) and advanced excel/modelling skills are advantageous  Grow with the Group  As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.  We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage. We are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion and as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency.  As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference.  We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.  We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences – for our customers and for each other. The Supply Chain Analyst will be responsible for conducting data analysis, generating reports, and providing insights and recommendations to support the optimization of the supply chain function. The role involves collaborating with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance service levels. Duties and Responsibilities • Collect and analyse data on supply chain processes, including inventory levels, demand forecasts, and supplier performance metrics. • Collect and analyse transport data from across the business • Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and other tools to track key performance indicators and identify areas for improvement. • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance service levels. • Provide analytical support for supply chain projects and initiatives, including product launches, network optimization, and process improvements. • Monitor industry trends and best practices to inform supply chain strategy and decision-making. • Communicate insights and recommendations to stakeholders across the organization, including senior leadership. • Other accountabilities/responsibilities as directed by the CEO. Qualifications • Experience in a manufacturing or distribution environment. • Knowledge of supply chain planning and execution systems such as NetSuite  • Advanced degree in supply chain management, business analytics, or a related field. • Strong analytical skills and proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, Adaptive etc • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. • Knowledge of supply chain concepts, including inventory management, demand forecasting, and logistics • Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. • High degree of proficiency with standard software applications e.g. MS Outlook, MS Word, MS Excel, SharePoint, MS PowerPoint, Smartsheet • Understanding of systems & reporting relevant to role.Show moreReport

job_title: ICT Business & System Analyst | Global IT consulting organisation | BI
job_description: About us  Passionate about integrity and excellence, Billigence, delivers market-leading Business Intelligence (Big Data, Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing), CRM and Digital Media solutions through a talented team of skilled professionals. Billigence's principal consultants are some of the most sought after experts in their respective disciplines. We deliver efficient and adaptive integrated solutions, consistently exceeding our clients' expectations as we focus on customer centricity throughout our delivery. Billigence’s agile approach enables fast paced delivery utilizing the key partners solutions.  Headquartered in Sydney, Australia, and with offices in London, Prague, Singapore, Billigence has a growing customer base of large corporations across a variety of industries.  Billigence partners with leading edge Business Intelligence and CRM vendors Tableau, Alteryx, Keboola, Snowflake, Cloudera and Salesforce, Collibra.  ICT Business & System Analyst  Reporting to the Senior Business & System Analyst, you will be part of our international and growing team who is specialising in Business Intelligence Tools. As the ICT Business & System Analyst, you are expected to be capable of performing a wide range of work under limited direction, including providing technical advice regarding more complex systems analysis, systems design or specialist activities. Leadership, excellent communication skills and skills sharing are expected.  Key responsibilities Provide advice and analysis support for IT systems and/or process design and identify and action change requests, defects, risks and issues Contribute to the production or review of systems documentation that clearly articulates the design intent, user experience, systems and business processes, issues and risks Initiate negotiations with stakeholders during the design, management and implementation of business change; understand system requirements and leverage expertise to resolve complex issues Recognise and develop system or process improvements and formulate recommendations for solutions that meet operational needs and deliver improvements Understand and comply with the Agency corporate project management and governance policies, the Agency design, systems development and maintenance methodologies and quality assure the work of others to meet these standards Work collaboratively and cooperatively with others, actively engage in knowledge transfer, share information, consult and train others to achieve the work area and team objectives   Key requirements 2 years demonstrated experience conducting systems analysis on multiple complex tasks with strict deadlines. Demonstrated ability to provide leadership and mentoring to analysts in the team. Recent knowledge/or experience in a complex ICT environment in large organisation. Demonstrated personal qualities - strong work ethic, integrity, honesty Excellent written and oral communications skills with the proven ability to author complex specifications Demonstrated high level skills as a systems analyst working on complex software applications.   Salary range: $85,000 - $120,000 per annum base  If you feel your skillset matches the above, we would love to hear from you. Billigence are an equal opportunities employer with a very diverse, global team. We are passionate about employee development and progression and would love to hear from individuals that share our values and ambitions!  If this sounds like something you are interested in, please apply with your most up-to-date CV and we will be in touch!  Please note: Only successful applicants will be contacted.Show moreReport

You are a passionate Analyst with a passion for Analytics and Visualisation We are a team of values-driven Risk Management professionals, striving to improve CBA’s overall risk posture Together we can lead the delivery of world-class data, analytics and risk management capabilities to ensure CBA is primed for success See yourself in our team: You will be a part of our Model Risk & Validation team, which sits under the wider Operational Risk umbrella within CBA. As one of our Model Risk Senior Analysts, you’ll work to uplift the management of model risk through the enhancement reporting tools and dashboards. Do work that matters: As part of the Risk Management function, Operational Risk ensures that the Group has appropriate strategies and frameworks in place to assess, manage and report on operational risks. The Risk Function works to establish frameworks to manage risks that are consistent with the Group’s business objectives. We work collaboratively with the Business Units to achieve the optimal risk and return outcomes for the Group within the risk appetite approved by the Board. On a day-to-day basis you will: Transform model risk reporting that is delivered to senior management and its committees to communicate model risks and strategic efforts across the Group. Operate BAU reporting processes, synthesizing inputs and analysis from multiple data sources into insights that support the organization in complying with model risk related requirements. Support other parts of the MRM function including governance, policy and risk & controls management, via ad hoc queries to drive a deeper understanding of model risk. Automation of assurance and controls in data processes and workflows to support the operation of internal controls. Drive automation initiatives across model management to drive continuous improvement in the management of models, through the register; leverage AI to support governance of models; drive process improvement in reporting. We’re open to working with the right candidate to fill any skill gaps during your journey at CommBank. Proven model risk governance experience. Experience in managing and reporting for model portfolios across multiple model types (Credit risk, market risk). Proficient in using R or Python, and one visualisation package or tool (ggplot2 for R, or Tableau) and preferably Atlassian products, viz. JIRA, Confluence. Programming skills excel VBA/SQL advantageous. A good understanding and application of effective Visualisation and reporting principles Demonstrated skills in written and verbal communication, including ability to interpret regulatory policy and internal model risk policy. Demonstrated experience in end-to-end delivery of projects; and sound communication and time management skills. If this sounds like you then apply today! About the Company TradeMax is a leading global multi-asset financial service provider. We provide clearing and broking services with more than 30,000 tradeable products such as Forex, CFDs, equities, and bonds. We strive to streamline and simplify our processes ensuring that all our clients' needs are met efficiently. Our vision is to build a financial ecosystem that allows every participant in the world to have a better trading experience. With a great event, we’ll be part of just behind the corner, this is your chance to join the fastest-growing CFD provider in Australia, make a significant contribution to its success, and enjoy being part of something special. This is also a great opportunity to gain knowledge and experience that is impossible to obtain in other industries. If you’re looking for a fast-paced environment and an exciting opportunity, then we are the company for you. Your Role We are seeking an experienced Financial Operations Analyst to join our dynamic team. Conduct financial investigations, analyze sales data, revenue trends, and key performance indicators (KPIs) to provide actionable insights to support decision-making and ensure financial compliance. Evaluate forex trading metrics, including revenue growth, conversion rates, and customer acquisition costs, and collaborate with the sales team to identify opportunities for revenue growth, cost optimization and risk management in the forex industry. Contribute to the development of financial policies specific to forex trading, ensuring alignment with the company’s sales team operations and sales goals while adhering to regulatory requirements. Develop accurate and data-driven sales forecasts, incorporating market trends, historical data, and business strategies. Provide financial expertise and advice to support the sales team in sales budgeting, and strategic financial planning to align sales goals with the company’s overall financial objectives. Contribute to the design and implementation of effective sales strategies, incentive programs, and pricing strategies. Assess the financial impact of various sales initiatives and recommend adjustments as needed. Analyse operating costs and income and expenditure specific to forex trading, ensuring financial efficiency and compliance with stringent ASIC and AUSTRAC requirements. Identify margin improvement opportunities and assist in cost control measures. Prepare financial reports, including performance-based financial statements, dashboards, and presentations to the board of directors, management, head of sales and other stakeholders. Provide financial and taxation advice on issues unique to forex traders and investors, adhering to the complex tax regulations and reporting requirements associated with foreign exchange transactions. Liaise with financial institutions and other remittance companies to ensure compliant funds remittance and funds management arrangements. Advise on tailoring, implementing and maintaining accounting systems customizes for business changing needs and this industry. Other ad-hoc tasks to act as a bridge between the sales and finance departments, facilitating effective communication and collaboration to align financial strategies with sales objectives. job_title: Manager, Data Analysis Reporting and Evaluation
job_description: Manager, Data Analysis, Reporting and Evaluation   Employment type: Full-Time, Ongoing 35 hour working week, in a hybrid working environment Conveniently located in St Leonards, close to public transport Join an organisation that is passionate about supporting our people to contribute to a world-class health system in NSW    About this role  Are you passionate about transforming raw data into strategic insights that drive impactful decisions? We are seeking a visionary Manager to propel us into the future of data-driven excellence.  As the Manager of Data Analysis, Reporting, and Evaluation, you will be the guiding force behind our analytical and research support for the Legal and Regulatory Services Branch’s units including: Corporate Governance and Risk Management, Legal, Pharmaceutical Services and Regulation and Compliance.   Your role will be more than just numbers – you will lead a small team and be our data guru, leveraging analytics, reporting, and information insights to empower policy development, compliance monitoring, and investigation functions. Your skills will support executives in fulfilling their data custodial responsibilities and will contribute to the measurement of program effectiveness.  Crown Clerk 11/12, salary from $134,411 - $155,445 plus Super and annual leave loading  For more information, read the full Role Description.  What you'll be doing  Develop and implement robust data governance strategies to support systems used throughout the LRS Branch, providing expert advice to senior executives on data governance policy, requirements and emerging issues. Analyse and interpret information, undertake research, review internal and external trends, identifying emerging issues and risks to provide advice, explanation in order to inform actions and solutions. Proactively identify trends and investigate root causes, establish appropriate metrics and compile reports that communicate points of intervention. Lead the development of analytics dashboards that demonstrate performance against key measures, and provide insights that will inform strategies, initiatives and work plans.    About you   We are seeking motivated and committed individuals with: The ability to build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders Excellent communication and interpersonal skills A growth mindset, and commitment to continuous learning and personal development The ability to work in a small dynamic team environment  How to apply  All applicants must review the role description and apply by submitting:  an up-to-date resume (up to 5 pages) cover letter (1-2 pages) a response to the following target question:  a. In your experience, what are the key qualities of a high performance team and how would you foster them. b. Provide a recent example where you successfully led the implementation of a data governance strategy or a complex data analytics or reporting task? How did you ensure alignment with organisational objectives and gain buy-in from senior executives?  Closing Date: 11:59pm, 12 September 2023  Working at The Ministry of Health   The position is located in St Leonards, in a modern, purpose-built building within an activity-based working environment. Close to public transport, cafés and local amenities.   Benefits  The Ministry of Health offers its employees challenging and rewarding work with opportunities for career progression, learning, development and work-life balance. To learn more about the Ministry and what benefits we offer, access our Employee Benefits Handbook.  For role related queries or questions contact Leanne O’Shannessy on Leanne.OShannessy@health.nsw.gov.au and quote REQ427753.  If you do require an adjustment during the recruitment process, contact Stephanie Nastevska on Stephanie.Nastevska@health.nsw.gov.au  Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion   At the Ministry of Health we are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible environment which reflects the community and customers we serve. We actively promote the employment of women, people with a disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, LGBTIQ+ community and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.  If you identify as Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander and would like assistance with your application or to obtain more information on how to apply please visit The Stepping Up Initiative.  To be eligible for employment in these roles you must be an Australian citizen, or a permanent resident, or a New Zealand citizen, or hold a valid visa with permission to work in Australia.  Additional information  This recruitment may be used to create a Talent Pool for similar future roles (ongoing or temporary) that may arise over the next 18 months. For more information on applying visit the Ministry of Health Career portal Please note the selection process will include a range of comparative assessment techniques to assist in determining your suitability for the role   Considering the significant risks posed by COVID-19, the Ministry of Health expects all workers to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, and you will be required to show proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status prior to securing this role.     Applications Close: 11:59pm, 12 September 2023Show moreReport

Primary Details  Time Type: Full time   Worker Type: Employee   Performing actuarial calculations to assist the relevant business units in obtaining and managing a profitable business by supporting the work of the senior actuaries   Senior Pricing Analyst Location: Flexible on location Type: 6 month Contract The opportunity   We have a 6 month contract position available for a Senior Pricing Analyst. In this role you'll perform actuarial and statistical modelling to aid various pricing initiatives. There will be opportunities to apply and learn both traditional actuarial techniques like GLMs as well as machine learning techniques. You'll be exposed to the full pricing process, across commercial lines products, from data preparation and modelling to implementation and providing advice to non-actuarial stakeholders   In this position, you will be responsible for: Knowing and applying actuarial and statistical pricing techniques Carrying out data analysis and responsibility for specific outputs Demonstrating ability to apply reasonableness checks and sound judgment to pricing outputs Assessing impact of pricing on key profit drivers and performance metrics Taking initiative to recommend changes to existing pricing processes Drafting pricing recommendations to be peer reviewed by more senior actuaries Developing relationships with internal stakeholders About you Proven general insurance pricing experience Experience with using SAS Problem solving and decision-making skills Ability to apply a range of statistical and actuarial techniques to solve technical pricing problems Ability to extract, analyse and interpret data from several sources and resolve complex issues Strong communication skills, including explaining complicated concepts in a simple way A desire to be in a senior capacity assisting the business to make crucial decisions A desire to mentor junior members of the team About QBE   We can never really predict what's around the corner, but at QBE we're asking the right questions to enable a more resilient future - helping those around us build strength and embrace change to their advantage.   We're an international insurer that's building momentum towards realising our vision of becoming the most consistent and innovative risk partner.   And our people will be at the centre of our success. We're proud to work together, and encourage each other enable resilience for our customers, our environment, our economies and our communities.   With more than more than 11,000 people working across 27 countries, we're big enough to make a real impact, but small enough to provide a friendly workplace, where people are down-to-earth, passionate and kind.   We believe this is our moment - what if it was yours too?   Benefits   We offer a range of benefits to help provide holistic support for your work life, whatever your circumstances. As a QBE employee you will have access to and benefit from: 'Hybrid Working' - a mix of working from home and in the office to enhance your work/life balance Our 'Thriving at our Best' wellbeing program, including free holistic wellbeing coaching, nutritional, confidential counselling, financial and legal advice 12 weeks' gender-equal flexible leave for all new parents, including paid super The ability to maximise retirement savings through voluntary super contributions and company matching Income protection insurance & reimbursed Death and Total Permanent Disability insurance premiums Additional leave and support through QBE's Family Domestic Violence First Responder Network Discounts on insurance products, car hire, hotels, goods and services including benefits through our various sports and arts sponsorship partners Rewards & Recognition   We value our employee's experience with us and are proud to have been recognised for the following awards: 2021 LinkedIn Top Employer & HRD Employer of Choice 2020 Best Workplace Diversity & Inclusion and Excellence Award for Best Health & Wellbeing at the Australian HR Awards Australian Workplace Equality Index (AWEI) Platinum Employer since 2022 - the definitive national LGBTIQ+ benchmark for workplace inclusion recognising employers achieving Gold status for 4 or more years Ranked 6th place in the AAGE Top Graduate Employers 2021 as voted by graduates Top 20 Workplaces for Dads in 2019 and 2020 (HBF Direct Advice for Dads) Family First accredited employer since 2021   Click APPLY to submit your application. Successful applicants will need to complete work rights, police and credit checks through our online provider as a condition of employment.   QBE recognise the value of diverse perspectives and experience. We are committed to an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected for who they are. If we can provide support with access requirements, alternative work arrangements or you would like to connect with one of our networks please contact us at recruitment@qbe.com   Application Close Date: 24/11/2023 11:59 PM   How to Apply:   To submit your application, click "Apply" and the step by step process. job_title: Product Data Scientist - TikTok Data Analysis - Australia
job_description: Responsibilities About TikTok TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.  Why Join Us Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.  About the Team The Product Data Analytics Team analyses a combination of product usage and product performance data to derive meaningful insights that would serve as a guide to better product and decision making for our business leaders. The team will work through different business scenarios including improving Live app Experiences, Host Operation, User experiences. In addition, it is important to manage the data life cycle to ensure problems are quantitatively measured to propose logical solutions.  Responsibilities:  Responsible for the data analytics work in international LIVE business, including but not limited to live gifts, host interaction, strategies, enhancing the live streaming revenue. Identify and analyse key factors driving the growth of international LIVE, and propose enhancement plans with logical data support Responsible for the design and analysis of A/B experiments, product iteration impact evaluation, marketing campaign analysis, key metrics trend analysis, etc Work with cross functional partners like Product Managers, Operations, R&D for product optimisation plans and boost business growth Perform market activity analysis and any other analytics that would help guide product and business in decision making.  Qualifications 1. Bachelor degree or above in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or other related majors; 2. At least 3 years of experiences and above; Experience in supporting analytical work of internet or large scale C2C products is preferred; 3. Proficient in SQL, skilled use of visualisation tools 4. Experience in data extraction, analysis and visualisation in a complex data environment, and have experiences in data landing to the business 5. Excellent communication skills with ability to communicate conclusions effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences, and good analysis report writing ability; 6. Strong learning ability and curiosity driven mindset, independent and possess collaborative problem solving skills  TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.  In the spirit of reconciliation, TikTok acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of country throughout Australia and their connections to land, sea and community. We pay our respect to their Elders past and present and extend that respect to all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples today.Show moreReport

job_title: Business Analyst - Customer's next best action
job_description: The Position:  Reporting to the BA Chapter Lead, you will play a vital role within a leading digital organisation to ensure business and customer outcomes are achieved. This particular role is for an experienced Business Analyst with strong communication skills and an ability to build relationships with varied groups of stakeholders. The role requires the BA always to take innovative and data-driven approaches to solving complex, exciting problems while putting the customer experience first. The purpose of this Position: This role is within the Traffic Orchestration tribe. A basic understanding of Google Cloud, data literacy and reading API contracts is highly desired, and it holds immense importance for the squad's audience extension effort. The squad's responsibilities encompass various outcomes, such as: Orchestrating audiences across multiple customer channels. Delivering customer audiences - Deciding the right offer for the right customer at the right time. Integrating offline attributes into online customer profiles and providing customer experiences on our front end.  Join us in enabling customers' next best actions throughout their journey. Your key responsibilities will include: Assisting the product team with building and maintaining the backlog, ensuring all requirements and user stories align with product strategy. Collaborating with key stakeholders and teams to find the right solutions to solve the most valuable and exciting problems. Translating requirements into high-quality user stories, including personas and acceptance criteria, ensures the stories can be tested functionally and non-functionally. Being able to formulate user stories for integration-based features with sufficient technical details. Supporting the squad members in project activities when necessary, demonstrating flexibility to jump roles to serve the team. This role is in a fast-paced domain. The BA must be able to prioritise workload and manage this accordingly. Ensuring that all collaborative decisions provide the targeted outcome for the customer, the business, the product and the tribe’s missions and ensuring the team continuously focuses on the right priorities.  About you:  Coming from a digital background, you will demonstrate business acumen, excellent communication and technical know-how that will help drive success. You’re as comfortable facilitating sessions with stakeholders as you are with breaking down bugs and getting into the technical nitty-gritty with the team. Most importantly, you should have a strategy and skills to take an idea from inception to delivery. Further to this, you will have; Demonstrated experience in delivering agile initiatives in high-performing teams as a business analyst in a digital environment. Demonstrated analysis experience delivering innovative initiatives. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. A data-driven approach, however, can make judgment calls when necessary. Experience in Jira/Confluence for managing boards and project documentation. Driven by delivery, delivering on time and to high standards Excellent written and verbal communication/presentation skills. Innovative thinking and demonstrated problem-solving skills.  Key Behaviours Demonstrated capability to think globally and strategically, understand business dynamics, and manage large amounts of data. Excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills. Ability to manage multiple complex initiatives with competing deadlines and through various stages of development and approval. Problem-solving – Identify and resolve problems promptly and report issues to the Product manager; demonstrate appropriate risk-taking and comfort with ambiguity.  Grow with the Group  As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.  We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage. We are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion and as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency.  As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference.  We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.  We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences – for our customers and for each other.  We’d love to hear from You  If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application.Show moreReport

As a Technical Analyst at Humanforce, you'll find yourself at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and meaningful impact. You'll collaborate with dynamic cross-functional teams, leveraging tools like Power BI, Amplitude, and Sugar Discover to unearth insights within vast and intricate datasets. Dive into data from backend systems like SugarCRM, Mavenlink, Chargify, Xero, and Zendesk, unraveling complexities and ensuring data quality. Your role isn't just about analysis; it's about crafting a narrative. You'll design, develop, and maintain reports and dashboards that breathe life into data trends, patterns, and insights. Sound good? Read on! About us Humanforce provides the market leading, employee-centred, intelligent and compliant HCM suite for frontline and flexible workforces, offering highly configurable, best-in-one WFM, HR and Payroll - without compromise. Our vision is to make work easier and life better by focusing on the employee experience (EX), and the efficiency and optimisation of businesses. We are on a mission to deliver an exceptional EX for workforces by offering a compelling employee value proposition and great work effectiveness through connection, development and wellbeing, while delivering intelligent manager automation to drive cost optimisation, increased productivity and growth, and enhance compliance confidence for businesses as they adapt to evolving challenges and objectives.  Humanforce has a strong 2300+ customer base and over 600,000 employees using the platform around the world. Our approach to flexible work We’re passionate about people making their own decisions about where and when they work. Our aim is to facilitate flexible working where possible to support our people to be effective, empowered and productive to achieve both their career and personal goals. Because we recognise working flexibility means different things to different people, we also know flexible working exists in many forms. Like flexibility to drop off kids? Or maybe early mornings just aren’t your thing! We’re all about that. We also recognise that everyone is a little different and sometimes you’ll need flexible arrangements that suit your situation. We’ll happily discuss your needs and if we can make it work we will! What you’ll do Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and understand business requirements for data analysis and reporting projects. Manage communication with stakeholders to ensure clear understanding of reporting requirements, project progress, and potential challenges. Work closely with stakeholders to define project scope, objectives, and deliverables, and ensure alignment with business goals. Design, develop, and maintain Power BI, Amplitude and Sugar Discover reports and dashboards, that effectively visualize data trends, patterns, and insights within large and intricate datasets. Work with data from backend business systems including SugarCRM, Mavenlink (Kantata), Chargify, Xero, and Zendesk. Analyse complex data structures to identify data quality issues, anomalies, and inconsistencies. Generate comprehensive supporting documentation for all reports, including data definitions, methodologies, and visualisations, to enhance data transparency and reproducibility. Potentially create and optimise Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) scripts on AWS Lambda and make low code IPaaS to ensure efficient data processing and integration. What you’ll need Proficiency in Power BI for report creation, data visualization, and dashboard development. Strong experience in data analysis, including data cleaning, transformation, and exploration with a solid understanding of DAX and SQL queries and data modelling concepts and techniques. Ability to interpret complex report requirements and work with various data to achieve desired outcomes. Deep understanding of data warehousing (Redshift or similar) concepts and methodologies. Proficiency in writing technical documentation and reporting documentation. Some experience with ETL processes, low code integration tools such as Zapier and Make and ELT scripting using AWS Lambda would be desirable but not essential.  What’s on offer A flexible working environment – work from the office, work from home, work from the local café – you’ll be able to manage your personal and professional commitments easily The opportunity to be part of a fast-growing tech company A focus on development with access to LinkedIn Learning Employee talent referral scheme (know great people, be rewarded) Paid parental leave and volunteering days A fun and friendly culture working with passionate and talented people A work environment where you can genuinely improve the world of work!  Humanforce is a diverse and dispersed organisation and are actively looking to grow our team with individuals from all diverse backgrounds. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds, cultures, ages, genders, neurodiversity, religions, sexual orientations and experiences to apply. We are a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer and commit to respond to every applicant. #LI-hybridShow moreReport

Link Group is a leading fund administration and share registry specialist. We are a market leading provider of technology-enabled administration solutions, continually developing our offerings to expand with our clients' needs. Since our inception, Link Group has been entrusted by clients to handle sensitive data in a secure and confidential manner. Our core businesses of fund administration and securities registration are complemented by our expertise in digital solutions and data analytics. Our Corporate Markets division provides clients with a comprehensive corporate market offering that connects issuers to their stakeholders. Our uniquely integrated range of corporate markets capabilities includes shareholder management and analytics, stakeholder engagement, share and unit registry, and employee share plans. We also offer company secretarial support, as well as various specialist offerings such as insolvency solutions.
