Location: Sydney, Brisbane, Melbourne  Contract Type: Permanent  MinterEllison is one of Australia’s largest law firms, with nearly 200 years of business history. We're known for our legal and consulting expertise - and for our inclusive and authentic character.  Our purpose is to create sustainable value with our clients, people and communities. That means we have a proud history of providing excellence to clients, nurturing our people and giving back to the communities in which we live and work.  We value excellence, curiosity and collaboration. Clients rely on us for our responsive, commercial approach. Our clients include government departments and agencies, private and publicly listed companies, and small and large businesses in Australia and overseas.  As a highly valued employee we will also provide you with a wide range of benefits. To view our benefits, please copy this link into your browser https://www.minterellison.com/-/media/Minter-Ellison/Files/Careers/Employee-Benefits-Brochure-2023.ashx  The Team  The national Business Development team at MinterEllison is a high performing and critical component of the law firm and essential to the Firm's success. The Business Development team supports the partnership by providing the full spectrum of business development and marketing services to ensure the firm develops and maintains strong relationships with new and existing clients. The role sits within the Clients and Markets Excellence team. This team is responsible for managing the creation and submission of the Firm's proposals, pricing, market research / insights and client engagement. The team also drives best practice business development processes across the firm.  Your Role  A permanent opportunity is currently available for an ambitious Senior Pricing Analyst who thrives in a collaborative, proactive, and client-focused team that plays a pivotal role in supporting the Firm's profitable growth. As a Senior Pricing Analyst, you will have the opportunity to develop valuable skills in pricing, business development, finance, and project management whilst leveraging your commercial acumen to support impactful business outcomes.  In this role you will have the opportunity to collaborate with bid / sales teams, client service teams, finance, other pricing team members and stakeholders to:  Provide valuable and actionable pricing insights and financial modelling to the business with a focus on proposals and price negotiations, and for input into pricing strategy decisions. Maintain and enhance the Firm's existing pricing performance reporting processes, including internal and market analysis. Evaluate the commerciality of client and matter engagements and make recommendations for optimising profitability and value delivery. Maintain and enhance pricing-related support information, including precedents, guidelines, benchmarks, standard commercial terms. Collaborate with Finance and Data teams to enhance the Firm's pricing analytics and tool suite to enhance effectiveness, frontline empowerment and useability, with guidance from other pricing team members. Contribute the latest thinking to ad-hoc projects, including the ongoing promotion of pricing best practice via Firm training and process innovation. More About You  Experience in a pricing and / or commercial role, preferably in professional services. Tertirary degree in Finance, Economics, Business, or other Management Accounting qualification. Passion for leveraging data and analytics to solve business challenges coupled with strong numeracy, analytical, and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Highly collaborative with a diverse array of individuals in different functions, demonstrating a commitment to delivering high-quality and responsive outcomes. Confident to thrive in a high-stakes, fast-paced, and collaborative environment. Advanced skills in MS Office suite, especially Excel, and capability to work with large data sets with strong attention to detail. Excellent time management skills and the ability to remain composed and focused under pressure. Not essential however considered highly desirable:  Experience with business intelligence and data visualisation tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, or Qlik Sense. SQL skills and relational database knowledge. Prior experience with Elite 3E and / or Jedox. Why MinterEllison  We offer flexible working options to encourage balance, wellbeing and support for sustainable ways of working and a range of social, financial and health benefits, including free gym membership - all with no minimum tenure.  We encourage applications from people of all ages, abilities, cultural backgrounds, genders (including trans or gender diverse), LGBTQ+ people and those with carer responsibilities. We particularly encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply.  How to Apply  We prefer to connect with people directly, so please submit your CV by clicking on the 'Apply' button. We encourage all applications, including if you do not meet the criteria listed for the role. Your application will also enable us to consider you for other opportunities that may be available at MinterEllison.  If you would like further information, require any adjustments throughout the recruitment process or for a confidential discussion, please contact Alexandra.Hussain@minterellison.com.Show moreReport

About us:  Endeavour Group operates Australia’s largest retail drinks network through Dan Murphy’s and BWS, and the nation’s largest portfolio of licensed hospitality venues (ALH hotels), with a market share of approximately 40% in retail liquor and approximately 9% in hotels. Endeavour Group also owns bottling facilities and wineries as part of its products and services capabilities.  United behind a common purpose of ‘Creating a more sociable future together’, we are a 28,000+ strong team with more than 1600 stores and 330 hotels nationally. About the Opportunity As a Senior Business Analyst (BA) within the Finance Reporting Squad, you will play a crucial role in facilitating the delivery of actionable trading & financial performance intelligence that answers both the 'what' and 'why', and increases speed to action for future planning & forecasting.  You will collaborate with stakeholders from various departments, including senior stakeholders from different tribes and/or finance, accounting, IT to understand their reporting requirements, analyze data, and identify process improvements.Your experience in business analysis, particularly in an agile delivery environment, combined with your knowledge of data and analytics will enable you to bridge the gap between business needs and technical solutions.  Your main objective is to improve the efficiency, accuracy, and effectiveness of financial reporting, particularly in situations involving data transformation.  This is an exciting opportunity for a Senior BA with a passion for business analysis to join the Finance Reporting Squad within Endeavour's 'Advanced Analytics tribe. A day in the life of a Senior Business Analyst Work with business stakeholders to understand problems and opportunities; impacts and outcomes Evaluate, analyse, and communicate business requirements on a continuing basis with clear documentation of current state and future state (optimised) business processes Assist the Product Manager and Delivery Lead with the build and formulation of the Squad Backlog Create and refine epics and stories aligned to customer and business problems Keeping the stories within the backlog up to date and as the detail expands and evolves Engagement with Subject Matter Experts and other Tribes/Squads who can support the Squad during solution delivery and facilitation of their involvement Liaising with the team to ensure they have access to the right information from the customer and stakeholders at the right time, in order to assist the development of the solution and know that it will achieve the outcome especially with the data transformation challenges. Provide ongoing support to end-users and ensure that solutions are operating efficiently and effectively.  What you’ll need to succeed Have over 6+ years of business analysis experience well regarded if within the finance or accounting domain Proficiency in data analysis and manipulation using tools like Google sheet, SQL, or Data visualisation software Familiarity with reporting tools and platforms (e.g., Tableau) Nice to have understanding of financial reporting concepts, accounting principles, and regulatory requirements Be somebody to ask WHY/HOW this is going to improve customer experience to help stakeholders drive product initiatives Excellent collaboration skills with an ability to see past problems to solutions Strong ability to present complex information in an easy-to-understand manner Strong verbal communication and facilitation skills Solid experience producing effective user stories and acceptance criteria Analytical mindset capable of breaking complex problems into smaller pieces Having a strong alignment with an agile mindset. Enthusiastic and positive team member with a self-directed and self-motivated attitude Excellent verbal and written communication and influencing skills Strong stakeholder management and relationship-building skills Capable of owning strategic business analysis responsibilities Ability to see the big picture Mentor associate BAs and guide them in their pathways to become Business Analysts  What's in it for you? Excellent remuneration package and flexible working in every sense. We value our people Everyday Rewards plus card - access exclusive employee discounts across Woolworths, BigW and Endeavour Group brands (BWS, Dan Murphy’s etc) and 50% off food at ALH venues. Our innovative ways of working include headspace mornings once a month (no meetings company-wide) Opportunity to partner alongside bright minds and genuine investment in leading technologies Career progression to help you realise your potential. As our business grows so do the opportunities for our people Work with an industry-leading team and be a part of one of the most exciting retail transformations in Australia  Grow with Endeavour Group  Bring your spark. Tap into our spirit. That’s the power of Endeavour.  If you want to experience the diverse spirit of drinks and hospitality businesses, here you can tap into Australia’s leading brands including Dan Murphy’s, BWS, ALH, Pinnacle Drinks, Endeavour X and more.  If you have a passion for connecting people with products they love, here you can join an industry that’s deeply embedded in the way Australians socialise, unwind and celebrate.  If you want access to a breadth of career opportunities, here you can enjoy a path that travels between diverse roles and businesses within the Group.  If you’re already asking ‘what’s next for me’ and our industry, here you’ll thrive.  If you want to bring your full self to doing fulfilling work, here you’ll find a culture that’s welcoming, inclusive and responsible.  If you are looking for flexibility, here we encourage our team members to work in ways that meets their work / life commitments and supports their wellbeing.  Come grow with Endeavour where we are passionate about our purpose of creating a more sociable future together, and leaving a positive imprint on our team members and the communities we serve. job_title: 2024 Sydney PhD Quantitative Researcher Graduate Program
job_description: Are you passionate about research and solving the unsolvable? Interested in how you can have a research career in industry? SIGSydney is on the lookout for passionate PhD researchers who are interested in the world around them to join our Graduate PhD Quantitative Research Program. SIG is one of the world’s largest market makers, with a unique approach to trading, technology, and research. While this background puts us at the top of our game, what really makes us successful is our quantitative approach to decision making and the collaboration between our employees. SIG’s Graduate PhD Quantitative Research Program  We teach our Graduate Quantitative Researchers to use their problem-solving skills and mathematical creativity to find solutions in competitive and constantly changing financial markets. Working along other researchers, traders, and technologists, you’ll use an academic research approach to transform our quantitative modeling into trading opportunities. You can expect to be working alongside a trading team and be part of the day-to-day collaboration that makes us successful. From the moment you join SIG, you’re be able to see the application and high impact of your work on the success of our trading strategies. You’ll learn: Option theory and option modeling in the classroom Cutting edge techniques in machine learning and advanced statistics Applications of optimisation and game theory to trading algorithms  What we're looking for  Graduating PhD’s or Postdoc’s with a passion for research and problem solving Research interests in quantitative fields such as Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or Economics Exceptional mathematical problem solving skills Strong programming skills, with emphasis on using computers to reliably and efficiently perform tasks Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment as part of a team Well-developed communication skills Finance experience is a plus, but not required Our Edge Academically rigorous research with real-world application Competitive salary Fully-stocked kitchen, including breakfast and daily catered lunch Casual dress code Authentic social community (basketball team, gaming) 360-degree view of Sydney’s Harbors (it really is Sydney’s best office view) Sustainable & environmentally friendly office Interview Process Apply -> Maths Assessment -> Recruiter Interview -> Quant Interviews -> Final On-site Interview -> Offer SIG does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or search firms. Any resume or referral submitted in the absence of a signed agreement will become the property of SIG and no fee will be paid. #efc-multiShow moreReport

Are you a Business Analyst looking to grow your career within the Supply Chain industry?   About the role:  FourPL would like to talk to you! FourPL is seeking a Business Analyst with strong experience in Coupa to join their Sydney team.   Key responsibilities:  The Business Analyst will be responsible for leading various tasks with respect to: Reviewing, analysing and evaluating business systems and user needs. As Business Analyst you will be required to document requirements, define scope and objectives and formulate systems to parallel overall business strategies.  The Business Analyst role will include the ability to support a range of engagements through the consulting lifecycle including:  Drive identification of requirements across business units and identify substandard systems processes through evaluation of real-time data Serve as thought leader for technical business processes, developing forward-thinking systems prototypes that promote increased efficiency and productivity on multiple levels Create and implement precise management plans for every project, with attention to transparent communication at all levels Perform, evaluate, and communicate thorough quality assurance at every stage of systems development Determine and develop user requirements for systems in production, to ensure maximum usability Partner with other stakeholder teams across business units (i.e., sales, finance, security, compliance) to develop necessary analysis and documentation in a collaborative way, communicating effectively and efficiently with production, managerial, and executive teams Evaluate, analyse, and communicate systems requirements on a continuing basis, and maintain systems processes, including the delivery of monthly status reports to all appropriate parties Author and update internal and external documentation, and formally initiate and deliver requirements and documentation Conduct daily systems analytics to maximize effectiveness and troubleshoot problems Develop meaningful and lasting relationships with partners for optimized systems integration, and respond to questions and concerns from managers and executives with supporting research and recommendations Recommend controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures Interpret, evaluate and interrelate research data and develop integrated business analyses and projections for incorporation into strategic decision-making Understand and communicate the financial and operational impact of any changes Suggest changes to senior management using analytics to support your recommendations. Actively participate in the implementation of approved changes   Essential Skills- What you bring to the role and FourPL?  A minimum of 3-5 years proven IT consultancy experience Experience in the supply-chain industry and understanding of best practices Experience in facilitation and the ability to work in different lines of businesses as required Knowledge of Logistics and Spend Management areas – preferable Knowledge in and experience with our partners IT systems. Experience working in procurement platform Implementations such as Coupa or as a System Administrator- desirable An understanding of the principles, practices, and methodologies of analysing, designing, planning and documenting ‘As is’ and ‘To be’ business processes. This includes the ability to drive change to adopt cloud based processes where appropriate. Effective communication skills both written and oral as demonstrated by successful outcomes in the areas of presentation, consultation, briefings, reports and complex submissions. Ability to manage conflicting priorities to produce quality work within specified time frames. Understanding of the principles of effective teamwork and a demonstrated ability to work in a team environment to achieve effective outcomes. Demonstrate effective stakeholder management: Working with multiple business areas to identify and document business processes; Collaborate with the business owners and project stakeholders to identify possible business process improvement opportunities; Ability to manage conflicting priorities to produce quality work on time. Ability to work in a small team across a range of competing solutions.   Nice to have skills:  An understanding of Ariba Purchasing Experience with enterprise systems such as Dynamics / SAP / Oracle is beneficial; Sound knowledge of Procurement and Sourcing operations and technology-based business solutions; An understanding of managing users and expectations in adopting standard cloud-based processes to meet requirements rather than requirements driving processes; Knowledge of the end-to-end management of roles and players in procurement processes; Experience with Project Management methodologies supporting cloud-based implementations; Experience with short timeframe template deployments using standard processes; Knowledge and experience with enterprise systems and related processes (e.g., finance, inventory) would be beneficial. A good understanding of the procurement systems market and the direction, strengths and weaknesses of the various solutions and implementation players. Sound research, analysis and problem-solving capabilities.   Additional Notes:  Must be willing to travel to client sites/locations and interstate when required. Must have driver’s licence All applicants must have right to work in Australia   Qualifications and Education Requirements:  Degree with specialisation in Supply Chain or Procurement CIPS or similar qualification Procurement Systems and especially Coupa certification is preferred.   Remuneration  We offer an excellent remuneration package dependent on experience and industry knowledge. We are committed to annual salary benchmarking and are market aware.   About FourPL:  FourPL is recognized through our awards as one of the leading Supply Chain and Procurement consultancies in Australia, working with many leading Blue Chip and public sector organisations. At FourPL, we differentiate through the quality of our engagements and services together with our pragmatic focus on excellence through from defining vision and strategy to practically supporting customers through implementation and realization. We take pride in our independence and recognize every customer engagement should be a reference.  We are an equal opportunities employer therefore all appointments and promotions are made on the basis of performance and ability. We hire the best people for our business and aim to make all our employees feel valued, included and empowered.   Why FourPL?  Personal Growth: We support your personal growth through a structured Career Plan, including regular reviews, 360-degree feedback supported by a training and development plan. Flexible Work Environment: We are dedicated to creating a flexible work environment that promotes work-life balance and productivity. With our hybrid working model, you will have the opportunity to work from home on some days and work in the office on others. Training & Development: We provide an annual allowance to all permanent employees for training, certifications, industry professional training, or attendance at relevant conferences. This allowance demonstrates our commitment to supporting your professional development and staying current in your field. Technical Training: We also provide access to a wide range of product training across functional and technical training and all modules through our subscriptions with our software partners. Employee Assistance Program: We understand the importance of physical and mental health and well-being. Upon successful completion of the probationary period, you will have access to our employee assistance program, which provides support and resources for maintaining your well-being if required, both at work and in your personal life. We actively support diversity in our business, the technology industry, and our community. We champion a diversity of ideas, perspectives, and experiences, and strive to create an inclusive and welcoming work environment where everyone can thrive. Salary Sacrificing: We also offer the opportunity for salary sacrifice, allowing you to customise your compensation package to suit your individual needs and preferences. Tools of the Trade: We will provide you with a phone allowance and an option for either a company or BYOD laptop. All relevant software required to perform your job is provided. Health and Wellbeing/Recognition: All staff can participate in the annual Flu Vaccination program and FourPL hosts a monthly award to recognise employees’ efforts and their contribution. Team Environment: We have a small supportive team and host regular team events to promote collaboration, team bonding and to have fun with your team. FourPL hosts a monthly award for employees’ efforts and their contribution is recognized as voted by their peers.   Sounds like you? Apply now by sending your CV and Cover letter to lisa.doufas@fourpl.com.auShow moreReport

Employment Type Permanent Closing Date 27 Nov 2023 11:59pm Job Title Finance Analyst Job Summary Job Description We are Australia's leading telecommunications and technology company. And with a global presence in more than 22 countries, we have a strong global footprint. Our purpose is to build a connected future so everyone can thrive. We are all about providing the best experience and delivering the best tech on the best network. This includes making Telstra the place you want to work. We fully support flexibility and choice at Telstra and what we offer is as unique as you. Will you choose to work from home, in a Telstra workspace, or on the go? A regional location or the CBD? We want you to work where, when, and how you are most engaged, safe, and productive. About the Role As a Finance Analyst you play a pivotal role by supporting your team with timely, accurate and insightful analysis to enable effective decision making by key stakeholders and business partners. You support the coordination and development of operating plans that underpin strategic business unit goals and apply your sound analytical skills to share insights and recommendations into financial status and performance. You have lots of initiative with a strong desire to help tackle strategic issues relating to its operational performance and estimated financial trajectory. You enjoy working independently as well as part of a team to stimulate behaviours that drive value and achieve strategic objectives. As a Finance Analyst you will develop, maintain and continuously improve assigned operational accounting activities. Work with members of the team and key stakeholders to support the achievement of business performance against commitments. Under limited supervision and in line with company policy and processes, you will provide on time accurate data, analysis, supporting assigned financial accounting including tax accounting. Key Responsibilities This is how you'll bring the purpose of your role to life, as a Finance Analyst you will: Support team members and senior management with financial analysis and modelling to develop short- and long-term strategies, as well as key performance indicators to achieve business initiatives and objectives. Leverage your technical expertise and critical thinking skills to generate meaningful insights and recommendations. Participate in sessions with interdepartmental stakeholders, contributing quality financial analysis and timely advice to various business groups aligned to strategic financial objectives. Take accountability for assigned work tasks, working independently when contributing to core activities such as key financial accounting activities associated with month end and year end closes, reconciliations, assurance and tax accounting across numerous legal entities and business areas. Continue to build your subject matter expertise through active thought leadership, to understand key drivers and trends impacting financial and operational performance. Leverage your analytical skills to undertake high-quality quantitative and qualitative analysis, to assist team members to test ideas/business hypotheses, understand issues and provide insights into key decisions. Apply a continuous improvement mindset when approaching tasks using best practice approaches. About you To be successful in the role of Finance Analyst, you will have: Tertiary qualifications in accounting and/or finance. Understand management and financial systems. Experience in financial accounting activities e.g. financial close, general ledger reconciliations and variance analysis. .Tax Accounting experience e.g. return preparation, tax effect accounting would be considered favourably. Demonstrated clear communication skills both written and oral to finance and non-finance audiences. Ability to work independently and take accountability. Analytical mindset with an ability to think broadly and to appropriately question and challenge current assumptions and to make improvements to finance processes and solutions. Experience in large Corporate Environments is required. If this opportunity sounds like a perfect fit for you, we'd encourage you to apply! We negotiate mortgages on property assets for investors and owner occupiers, through to arranging project funding for property developers. Our team of professional brokers work in partnership with property clients to deliver optimal financial solutions. Over the years we’ve built strong, long-term relationships with bank, non-bank and private funders. We have the team, tools and resources to provide you with a challenging and dynamic career in lending. You We are interested to hear from early career bankers, graduates, final year students or applicants who have a retail or administration background, strong attention to detail and excellent mathematics but may not have pursued university studies. Degree qualifications in business, commerce, land economics, or finance will be an advantage, Alternatively, you may be a junior banking associate with 1-2 years’ experience who is seeking a more hands-on role where you can cut through and be a direct, integral part of clients’ success stories. With a focus on building long term, professional relationships, you will enjoy data analysis and have an interest in building your customer relationship and sales skills. You will thrive on interacting with people and have a great sense of humour. You will show integrity, build and earn trust, and have an innate desire to follow a deal through to completion. You will need advanced Microsoft Excel skills along with the usual Office 365 suite and of course, exceptional mathematical capability. The Opportunities This is a long term, secure role in a buoyant market. We have a combined 60 years of experience in our Sydney and Brisbane directorship team combined. You will work directly with our senior specialists as you carve out your pathway in this thriving industry. Our team is driven, highly regarded and successful. job_title: Technical Business Analyst (BA) Data Warehouse-Data Engineering
job_description: Technical Business Analyst (BA) Data Warehouse-Data Engineering Contract Type: Full Time Location: Sydney Industry: IT & Telecomms Contact Name: Nivy Sahoo Contact Email: nivy@scaleuprecruitment.com.au Contact Phone: Date Published: 05-Nov-2023 Technical/Digital Business Analyst   ScaleUP is partnering with a leading media tech company seeking a talented technical business analyst (tech BA) who wants to work for a supportive, exciting, and dynamic company with a culture of high performance & best practices. The team consists of a diverse workforce that each brings something a little bit different to the team.  You will join a team of talented Software engineers, Designers, PMs, and Delivery Managers who will help you build and maintain bleeding-edge applications that are disputing and impacting the media and technology industry & worldwide.   Your Purpose  The purpose of Technical Business Analyst (or digital business analyst or Data Business Analyst) is to bridge the gap between Product requirements and technical solutions. You will ensure the Squad achieves desired outcomes to help the business thrive and deliver technical solutions.  We are seeking an experienced and highly motivated Technical Business Analyst with an understanding of API development and Data Engineering.  Every day you will work closely with the Solution Architect and cross-functional teams and will be pivotal in driving innovation. You'll have an Agile mindset and live and breathe Agile working methodologies.  Your role ensures the seamless alignment of business requirements with technical solutions in the dynamic fields of data integration and API development for all of their key flagship technical products.  What's needed to be successful in this role:  It's a mid-level role, we are looking for someone with 4 -5 years worth of experience working as a technical BA with a track record of contributing to the success of API and data engineering initiatives.  You'll have in-depth knowledge of how large-scale business technology teams operate from API development, data engineering, data modeling, ETL, data warehousing & analytics.  Agile. You'll live and breathe it. You love working with its methodologies and being a champion of its processes in your day-to-day.  Strong Communication skills are a must in this role. I don't need to write this, surely it's what you do on a day to day, but what I'm getting at is being able to communicate between stakeholders and speak their language, you'll need to speak dev talk to API engineers, data talk to data engineers, business talk to upper management, manage expectations, write up requirements, and work with the PM's and delivery leads to ensure delivery is running according to plan.  This role has loads to offer the right person in regard to growth potential for your career and exposure to modern bleeding-edge technology and application development. Plus you'll get to work with pretty awesome people at a company that thrives but doesn't take itself too seriously.   It's a hybrid role (3 days a week in the office) that's based in Sydney's CBD very close to public transport, providing a great mix of cultural integration and understanding. It's also a truly flexible working environment that has a mature understanding of what it's like and needed to be flexible. They are also a huge advocate for women in technology and foster an incredibly inclusive work force.  It's a permanent full time opportunity paying a salary up to $130,000 + super + loads of cool benefits. Open to people with full working rights and appropriate visas to work in Australia.  If you are keen please apply now or email nivy@scaleuprecruitment.com.auShow moreReport

We have a fantastic opportunity to join the Controlling Department (FP&A) at REMONDIS Australia as a Financial Analyst based in the Head Office in Sydney, NSW.  In this dynamic role, you’ll play a critical role in supporting the business, providing accurate and quality reporting and data analysis. You will contribute to the success through timely and accurate reporting of financial and operational results, from monthly P&Ls to coordinating the next year’s annual budget.  This position will maintain a comprehensive suite of financial and operational reports to ensure performance is accurately reported, easily interpreted, and empowers key business decisions. You will play a pivotal role in improving the business reporting processes and the ability to provide insightful data to business leaders.  We’re looking for an experienced accountant or Financial Analyst who wants to progress with their career into a role that encompasses reporting, planning and data analytics. You will be a forward thinker, eager to learn and desire to improve processes and become the SME of the team.  You’ll likely have developed your skills in a similar heavy industry sector such as logistics, waste, capital equipment, mining or resources. What’s crucial is that you can think strategically with an innovative and future-focused approach.  This career-defining role has enormous potential to build a long-term career with a high growth and dynamic organisation.  Who we are  REMONDIS is one of the world's largest recycling, service and water companies. We’re a privately-owned family company headquartered in Germany, with over 40,000 employees and operations on four continents. We’ve been here in Australia since 1982.  With over 1,100 employees and 39 business locations in Australia, we serve more than 24,000 commercial, industrial and municipal customers in meeting their sustainability goals through comprehensive waste collection, treatment, resource recovery and management solutions.  REMONDIS Australia has grown and diversified to become one of the largest waste and recycling companies in the country. Acclaimed for our focus on customer support and service excellence, we work collaboratively with our customers and local authorities to deliver innovative, safe and reliable solutions across all industry sectors.  Together, we believe we can achieve a more sustainable future; a future in which waste is a resource.   Reasons you’ll stay  Autonomy: you’ll have the empowerment you need to be successful and the independence and autonomy to thrive.  Flexibility: you’ll be given the freedom to prioritise your time and working preferences.  Work that matters: contribute to a more sustainable future. The solutions you’ll be representing will support businesses, the community and the environment.  Career opportunities: we are growing and with growth comes opportunity to own and grow the role by developing market competitiveness.  Who you are:  Bachelor’s degree in either Finance and/or Accounting. CPA/CA accreditation is highly desirable. Prior experience as a Financial Analyst in waste, capital equipment, mining or resources is a plus Demonstrated experience managing a P&L and very comfortable with financial detail and variance analysis. Experience delivering financial support to the operational business, budgeting, forecasting, and financial performance reporting. Comfortable building financial models to support ad hoc financial analysis for key company stakeholders. Keen desire to learn the “how to” and “why” of current processes to understand and optimise current business practices. Excellent communication skills with the ability to build relationships internally and externally. Natural inclination for accuracy and attention to detail. Be proactive in relation to continuous improvement lens. Ability to self-manage and work to deadlines. Deliver financial analysis and insights to the senior leadership team. Liaise and coordinate with other head office departments and operational branches. Confident in providing effective and proactive support to F&A Managers and Operational Managers  Are you with us? To apply:  You’ll need a copy of your current license and proof of entitlement to work in Australia.  You’ll undergo a police check and pre-employment medical, including a drug and alcohol test.  REMONDIS is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we invite you to be part of an organisation that fosters a diverse workplace. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are strongly encouraged to apply.Show moreReport

Be Part of Something Extraordinary! Become a Behaviour Analyst Intern with TMB Role Overview As a Behaviour Intern with us, you won’t just be gaining experience; you’ll be an integral part of our Behaviour Support and Therapy Team. This entry-level role is designed to help you build a strong foundation in applied behaviour analysis theory and practice while also honing your skills in collaboration. Reporting to the Behaviour Team Leader, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping the lives of our clients through evidence-based practices and collaborative efforts. Key Responsibilities Collaboration Influencer: Facilitate collaboration across the Behaviour Support and Therapy and Speech and Language Therapy teams. Hands-On Learning: Under the direct supervision of our Team Leaders and Clinical Director, engage in direct behaviour therapy sessions in home, clinic, and community settings. Skill Development: Participate in functional behaviour assessments, support plan development, caregiver training, data analysis, and reporting. Program Enhancement: Contribute to the development and implementation of individualised skill acquisition programs and behaviour support plans. Resource Creation: Develop resources and materials for program implementation, including data tracking sheets and communication records. Data-Driven Insights: Use our online data collection system to gather, collate, and analyse client data, contributing to program decision-making. Group Program Participation: Play a role in implementing group programs fostering a collaborative learning environment. Empowering Reporting: Assist in writing progress reports and exit summaries, ensuring clear communication of client achievements. Supportive Mentorship: Support Registered Behaviour Technicians through observations, feedback, and monthly sessions. Professional Development: Attend weekly team meetings, meet minimum supervision requirements, remain current with research, and actively contribute to the growth of our team. Candidates for our Behaviour Analyst Intern positions must either have completed a verified course sequence (VCS) or be enrolled in a VCS towards Certification. We want you to be "over the moon" to come to work! The right start Comprehensive induction training program to make sure you are confident in your role. A welcome pack of goodies. Plenty of opportunities to spend time with the team, including session overlaps, lunches and informal chats.  Loveable numbers Above award salary package plus superannuation and travel reimbursement. Generous quarterly bonuses to clinicians who exceed the expectations of their role. Mentorship magic Weekly meetings with your clinical supervisor for formal clinical supervision and mentoring. Group discipline meetings/case conferences once per month. Whole team meetings once per month. Unlimited peer supervision. A balanced life Access to an Employee Assistance Program for mental well-being support, webinars and counselling. Lower than industry standard minimum KPIs and flexible scheduling to ensure you maintain a work-life balance. Learning galore Generous professional development allowance and leave to complete PD. Top-notch internal training from our leadership team. Regular team-wide external training opportunities. A place to belong A warm, close-knit team of dynamic, creative and passionate clinicians. With us, you'll find team members who are always ready to lend a hand, an ear or an idea to each other.  Admin support Our admin team is always poised to support you deliver excellent services with integrity, ensuring your tasks flow with ease. Breezy session prep Access to subscriptions to Everyday Speech, Twinkl, Lessonpix, plus a huge bank of curated in-house resources. And just wait till you see our games and toys cupboards! Your schedule, your way We trust in our team's integrity and excellence, granting schedule flexibility to inspire and empower top-quality service delivery.  Does this sound like the role you have been searching for?  Curious but not quite ready? Feel free to reach out with any questions. We value connection and are here to guide and inform your decision. Our clinical director, Kristin, would be happy to answer any questions you have. kristin@tothemoonandback.net.auShow moreReport

job_title: Senior Data Business Analyst | Commodities and Global Markets
job_description: We are a dynamic data change team who works collaboratively within the team and with our stakeholders to implement the global data strategy of Macquarie’s markets business.  At Macquarie, we are working to create lasting value for our communities, our clients and our people. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 54 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drive outcomes.  What role will you play?  You will support the implementation of the global data strategy across various financial products and platforms. Engaging closely with business and technical stakeholders you will identify and document data requirements, and collaborate with business users to specify business rules to manage data quality and resolve issues according to agreed principles and governance frameworks.  What you offer  Prior experience in the financial services industry Domain knowledge of financial markets and products including front to back system flows and lifecycle events. Experience in the commodities space would be highly valued A keen interest in data and its use across the organisation Excellent analytical capacity supported by clear and concise written and verbal communication skills A focus on high quality and timely delivery, with the ability to manage multiple parallel tasks and deliverables Ability to work collaboratively within and across teams.  We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.  Benefits  Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria and location, include:  Hybrid and flexible working arrangements Wellbeing and service bonus leave Up to 20 weeks paid parental leave as well as benefits to support you as you transition to life as a working parent Paid volunteer leave and donation matching Range of benefits to support your physical, psychological and financial wellbeing  About Commodities and Global Markets  In Commodities and Global Markets you will be part of a global business offering capital and financing, risk management, market access, physical execution and logistics solutions to its diverse client base.  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion  The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.   About Macquarie A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future. Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.  Job no: CGM-975166 Work type: Permanent - Full time Location: Sydney Category: Senior, Mid-senior, Data & Analytics Group: Commodities and Global Markets Division: Central Recruiter: Badrul Alam Opening Date: 05/11/2023Show moreReport

Cost Benefit Analysis (CBA) Analyst – Market and Economic Advisory Team, System Stewardship Directorate  2 X full-time ongoing/temporary opportunity Grade 7/8 from $106,025 to $117,363 + superWe are based in Parramatta with offices across the state and offer flexible workingWe encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from diverse cultural backgrounds and people living with disability to apply  About the Department of Education The Department of Education is the largest provider of public education in Australia with responsibility for delivering high-quality public education to two-thirds of the NSW student population. For more information about the Department of Education, please visit NSW Department of Education   About the Early Childhood Outcomes Division  The Early Childhood Outcomes Division leads the delivery of the Early Childhood Education and Care reform program, including comprehensive investments in the critical first 5 years of life for every child – in child development and in early education and care, making investments that support families and the community now, as well as investing in long term reforms for the future. Key initiatives will include supporting families with young children to access the services they need to support their own prosperity and well-being; valuing and growing the early childhood education and care sector and investing in early childhood teachers and educators.  The Childcare and Economic Opportunity Fund (the Fund) is designed to provide supply-side interventions into the Early Childhood Education and Care Sector to reduce the barriers to workforce participation by improving the affordability and access to childcare.   About the Role  This role presents an exciting opportunity to be part of a team committed to delivering outcomes across a broad range of reform areas to improve the quality of early childhood education programs, build a sustainable workforce, and increase the affordability of early childhood education and care in NSW. The teams are focused on policy development, service design, and delivering programs, with a particular focus on data, information, and insights. We have a strong focus on engaging with families, communities, and the sector to support children to learn and grow in their early years and beyond. We are looking for innovative, outcomes-focused people who thrive in fast-paced, dynamic environments.   About You  We’re looking for passionate and driven team players from all walks of life from the private, public and not-for-profit sectors to join a forward-thinking team committed to delivering early childhood outcomes. It is critical that we build a team that is as diverse as the community we serve, and we encourage people with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from diverse cultural backgrounds, and people living with disability to apply.  If you are looking for a fulfilling career that will make a positive difference to communities across the state and help prepare young people for rewarding lives, then a role in our team is for you.  Please note – the team is based largely in Parramatta. While we are happy to consider flexible working options, we are looking for someone who can attend the Parramatta office on a weekly basis. Occasional travel will also be required to other sites for Board meetings and stakeholder engagement.   Key knowledge and experience  Knowledge of and commitment to implementing the Department’s Aboriginal Education Policy and upholding the Department’s Partnership Agreement with the NSW AECG and to ensure quality outcomes for Aboriginal people.   Essential requirements of the role A valid Working with Children Check for paid employmentTertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline, or demonstrated equivalent knowledge and/or experienceDemonstrated understanding of and commitment to the value of public education  Benefits 35-hour week with flexible/hybrid workingLeave entitlements and time in lieuAccess to fitness passport  How to apply When applying you will need to: Attach a resume (maximum 4 pages) and;A cover letter (maximum 2 pages) outlining how you meet the essential requirements and the focus capabilities of this role. Note: the selection process will include a range of assessment techniques to assist in determining your suitability for the role. Successful candidates will be required to undertake pre-employment screening for this role which includes a Working with Children Check and National Criminal History Check.  This is a child-related role As a condition of employment, you will be required to provide a Working with Children Check (WWCC) Clearance number and complete a National Criminal Record Check. Visit the website for more information.  Closing date: 27th November at 11:59pm.  Please note - applications for this recruitment process will be reviewed commencing mid-January 2024.  For recruitment related enquires, please write to ecorecruitment@det.nsw.edu.au  We welcome applications from all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups, the LGBTQIA+ community, veterans, refugees and people with disability. If we can make some adjustments to our recruitment/interview process to better enable you to shine, please contact the Diversity and Inclusion Team (dandi@det.nsw.edu.au) or visit NSW Department of Education Diversity and Inclusion.  A talent pool may be created through this recruitment process. A talent pool is a group of applicants who have been assessed and identified as suitable for this role, and who may be considered for a range of similar roles, including temporary, term or ongoing roles, over the next 18 months.Show moreReport

Anduril is a defence technology company, bringing Silicon Valley talent and funding to the defence sector. Our technology helps our customers solve their toughest challenges by enabling them to make better, more informed decisions in life-and-death situations. We’ve assembled a diverse team of experts in artificial intelligence, computer vision, sensor fusion, optics, and data analysis that are creating software and hardware solutions to radically evolve the capabilities of the Australia and our allies. If you are passionate about solving problems that have real impact, come join Anduril and build the future of defence. We are working on cutting edge complex systems that need to operate in the harshest of conditions. To support our development and deployments tasks we are building up an Operations Analysis team to guide business strategy and complement our Modeling and Simulation team. This new team will provide rigorous analytical products which will be used to guide product development and convince customers of our value advantage. You will be a operations analysis swiss-army knife who will interface with stakeholders including internal programs and external customers. You will carefully listen to stakeholder needs and then design rigorous math and physics analyses leading to clear and compelling value propositions. Modeling, Simulation, and Analysis (MS&A) will often complement demonstration events that together leave no doubt that Anduril offers real (not PowerPoint) warfighter capability. WHAT YOU'LL DO: Develop model-driven analysis (and often the models themselves). Develop a deep understanding of transformational value of Anduril platform, autonomy, simulation, and perception products. Use our advanced internal M&S capabilities to give our analyses and asymmetric advantage over competitors. Convey the value through life of AI-powered distributed systems over traditional industrial offerings. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: Active Secret security clearance. Military mission MS&A experience. For example, working knowledge of OCA/DCA, ISR, SEAD/DEAD or Electronic Attack. Platform MS&A experience. For example, value proposition analyses comparisons involving aero, fuel, and signature modeling. Payload MS&A experience. For example, physics-based trade-space analyses for radar, EOIR, communications, or weapons payloads. Outstanding communication skills to include visual presentation of complex data. Nominal proficiency with physics-math scripting of your choice (e.g., MATLAB, SIMULINK, Python+numpy, scipy) Minimum 5 years in relevant Science/Engineering or a related field. At Anduril Australia, we strive to make this a workplace where you can do the best work of your careers. We have a range of industry leading benefits such as: Equity package so that you are part of the Anduril success story.Comprehensive caregiver and wellness leave policy to support you and your family.Private healthcare for you and your dependents.Delicious snacks, drinks and catered lunch at our offices.Phone bill reimbursement.Professional development allowance. - Vacation bonus - we incentivize our employees to look after themselves by providing a yearly vacation bonus. Anduril is an equal-opportunity employer, and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you are someone passionate to work on problems that matter, we’d love to hear from you!Show moreReport

job_title: Senior Business Analyst (12 Months Fixed Term)
job_description: Please note, a number of opportunities are currently available. About the Business  Risk Management is responsible for developing and deploying the risk frameworks to allow the Group to take conscious exposures to credit, market, operational, compliance and insurance risks within a Board-approved appetite. As a critical function, we ensure the Group has appropriate strategies and frameworks in place to assess, manage and report on credit, market, operational, compliance and insurance risks. The Financial Risk Portfolio (FRP) team forms part of the Risk Management support unit, supporting the Group Chief Risk Officer to deliver against Risk Management’s strategic priorities in the most effective way. As a trusted business partner, we deliver simpler, better strategic risk investment outcomes within Risk Management. Do Work That Matters  As a Senior Business Analyst within Risk Management, you will uplift Risk Management capability by helping to define a way forward to deliver strategic change and benefits realisation. You will coordinate the definition of business and functional requirements and provide specialist support for projects and operations. Your immediate responsibilities will align to the delivery of the highest priority strategic initiatives underway across Risk Management, including: Identifying, quantify and make recommendations for opportunities and/or deficiencies in risk management policy and framework Gathering, organise and synthesise large amounts of information to effectively communicate analysis, insights and requirements for playback and validation with stakeholders; Developing and maintain Business Analysis collateral including business context diagrams, process maps, entity relationship diagrams, requirements documentation, target operating models, key reference materials, etc. Supporting FRP and initiative leads with prioritisation, planning and delivery decisions. Developing business requirements and target state definition with key stakeholders to inform business solution design. Maintaining oversight and traceability of requirements through to implementation. We are interested in hearing from people who have: Experience in complex analysis and structured problem-solving abilities The ability to synthesise business and technical requirements/concepts and present them in simple terms The ability to identify opportunities to strategically transform delivery of Risk services, with commercial acumen Experience in a banking and/or lending or credit background would be highly regarded, but not essential Knowledge of corporate customer hierarchies; APS221 and credit aggregation; KYC/AML regulations and complex entity onboarding (highly desirable) The ability to work well with dynamic technical teams, business stakeholders and 3rd party providers Experience in the analysis and interpretation of data to make and suggest informed business decisions. Your Development and Career Progression  If you live the values and demonstrate the people capabilities, we can offer great opportunities. Whether you want to move across the organisation or up into a leadership role, the way you live the values and demonstrate the people capabilities are key. Use the capabilities required for this role as a guide to the critical skills and behaviours you need for your next move. If this sounds like you then apply today! At CommBank, we advocate and facilitate a culture of inclusion and respect, celebrating all cultures, abilities, genders, expressions of gender and sexual orientation Read more about our commitment to inclusion and diversity . We believe in working for a place that works for you. We have many flexible working options within our team so talk to us about which arrangements would work best for you. If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest, x15ventures), you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We’re keen to support you with the next step in your career. We're aware of some accessibility issues on this site, particularly for screen reader users. Your expertise in electricity risk management is highly valued, and you have a comprehensive understanding of trading activities and knowledge of energy markets. job_title: Technology Governance, Risk and Compliance Analyst
job_description: Department: IT - ANZ Location: North Strathfield, AU, 2137 Job Function: IT - ANZ Employment Type: Full time At The Arnott’s Group, you’ll work with a diverse team who align with our values and are passionate and empowered to perform at pace and achieve big things. Alongside genuine people, you’ll enable the local production of quality products including Tim Tams, Campbells Soup, Shapes, V8 juice, Vita-Weat, Scotch Fingers and many, many more…. which you also get to enjoy. We are proud of our legacy, but we aren’t stopping here! Collaborators, innovators, and agile thinkers with a curious mind thrive here. Be part of a future which is full of delicious moments created locally, by you!   The Opportunity Our Technology Governance, Risk and Compliance (“TGRC”) Analyst sits within our Cyber Security and Technology Risk Team and is responsible for managing Arnott's technology governance and policy frameworks, risk and issues management processes and compliance initiatives to ensure Arnott's technology infrastructure aligns with regulatory and legal requirements.  The accountabilities Help manage and mature Arnott’s technology governance framework, risk management processes and compliance initiatives. Collaborate with cross functional teams to identify and analyse risks, develop risk mitigation strategies, and implement risk management processes. Work with the business to ensure that policies and initiatives align with business objectives. Monitor IT compliance with IT governance policies and procedures, regulatory requirements, and internal controls. Manage Arnott’s technology assurance and compliance activities, including the development of assurance plans and the review of assurance or other audit findings, and the development and tracking of remediation plans. Define and document technology and cyber controls - including design and operating effectiveness; monitor controls by conducting regular controls testing and manage Arnott’s controls assurance process, including reporting and developing remediation plans.  The ingredients for success Just like you can’t make a Tim Tam without chocolate, there are a few essential ingredients we need for this role: 3+ years’ experience in enterprise risk management, internal audit, compliance, or a related field (a background in professional services, consulting or a highly regulated environment will be highly regarded). Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data and identify patterns and trends. Experience developing and recommending process improvements. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate with diverse stakeholders. A very high attention to detail and strong time management skills.  Culture and Perks We stand for high performance with integrity and find moments of pride and celebrate the wins gained from our collective effort. These are part of our culture and the cornerstones of The Arnott’s Way. When you join our team, you can expect to experience a real sense of belonging, be empowered with accountability, be recognised for your contribution, collaborate with great people and enjoy the following perks: Prioritise your physical, mental and financial wellbeing with discounted Health Insurance, home loans, gym memberships and access to our employee assistance program. Free parking for all employees, easily accessible to the office by public transport, onsite showers and secure bike parking. From the sustainability strategy to our Inclusion & Belonging work, there are ways to make a difference to people and the planet.  To Apply If this sounds like your next opportunity, please follow the link and apply. The Arnott’s Group unites a collection of leading consumer brands connected by our purpose, to create delicious moments. We recognise that creating delicious moments for a diverse range of consumers is only possible if our workforce reflects the consumers we serve. We are an equal opportunity employer – because it’s right for our consumers, our business, and our people. *We do not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies*Show moreReport

job_description: Company Description ALDI. Good Different. ALDI is a place where you’ll find good people, good purpose and a good opportunities. job_title: Quoting and Pricing Operations Analyst - Mobile Telecommunications Project
job_description: Cyient is a global engineering and technology solutions company. As a Design, Build, and Maintain partner for leading organizations worldwide, we take solution ownership across the value chain to help clients focus on their core, innovate, and stay ahead of the curve. We leverage digital technologies, advanced analytics capabilities, and our domain knowledge and technical expertise, to solve complex business problems. With over 15,000 employees globally, we partner with clients to operate as part of their extended team in ways that best suit their organization’s culture and requirements. Our industry focus includes aerospace and defence, healthcare, telecommunications, rail transportation, semiconductor, geospatial, industrial, and energy. Job Description Job Description: Quoting and Pricing Operations Analyst - Mobile Telecommunications Project Position Overview: We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Quoting and Pricing Operations Analyst to join our Mobile Telecommunications Project team. In this role, you will be responsible for managing pricing strategies, commercial processes, and data analysis within the project. A background in RAN (Radio Access Network) engineering would be beneficial as it will enhance your understanding of the technical aspects related to pricing and quoting in the mobile telecommunications industry. Your primary objective will be to ensure accurate and efficient pricing administration, quote tracking, and analysis of pricing trends and performance. Reporting to the Operations Manager, you will play a crucial role in optimizing pricing and quoting practices to drive profitability and success in the mobile telecommunications project. Responsibilities: Develop and maintain pricing databases, ensuring accuracy and consistency of pricing information. Analyze market trends, competitor pricing, and customer demands to support the development of pricing strategies. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather relevant pricing and cost data for accurate quote creation. Conduct regular data entry tasks, ensuring timely and accurate input of pricing and project-related information into relevant systems and databases. Monitor and track all quotes, analyzing win-loss ratios, and identifying trends and opportunities for improvement. Generate reports and analysis on pricing, sales performance, and profitability, providing insights to the project team. Support the review and approval process for pricing adjustments, discounts, and special deals. Ensure compliance with pricing policies, procedures, and guidelines within the project. Assist in commercial operations tasks, such as contract management, vendor coordination, and customer support. Collaborate with the finance team to ensure accurate pricing and profitability calculations. Utilize your background in RAN engineering to understand the technical aspects of pricing and quoting in the mobile telecommunications industry. Support ad-hoc projects and assignments related to pricing, commercial operations, and data analysis, as assigned by the Operations Manager. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience). Proven experience in pricing administration, commercial operations, or similar roles. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, analyze, and interpret data effectively. Proficiency in data entry and database management. Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in handling numerical and financial information. Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities. Proficient in using MS Excel, PowerPoint, and other relevant software for data analysis and reporting. Knowledge of pricing strategies and market dynamics. Background in RAN engineering, with a solid understanding of the technical aspects related to mobile telecommunications projects. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and adapt to changing priorities. Join our team and contribute to the success of our Mobile Telecommunications Project by effectively managing pricing strategies, commercial operations, and data analysis. Your background in RAN engineering, coupled with your attention to detail, analytical mindset, and strong organizational skills, will play a critical role in driving profitability and achieving project objectives. Skills & Experience Finance, Management Reporting, Price Management, Price Quotes, Pricing Strategies, Profitability, Project Management Cyient is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Cyient recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable law. We are proud to be a diverse and inclusive company where our people can focus their whole self on solving problems that matter.Show moreReport

We are EssilorLuxottica, a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of ophthalmic lenses, frames and sunglasses. Formed in 2018 by the combination of Essilor and Luxottica, our Company combines two centuries of innovation and human endeavour to elevate vision care and the consumer experience around it. We are home to the most loved and widely-recognized vision care and eyewear brands in the world. Our proprietary eyewear brands include Ray-Ban, Oakley, Costa, Vogue Eyewear, Persol and Oliver Peoples, complemented by over 20 prestigious licensed brands.
