job_title: Business Intelligence and Data Analytics Principal / Specialist
job_description: Careers That Change Lives  Be a part of a company that thinks differently to solve problems to deliver meaningful innovations. We have an opportunity for a talented Business Intelligence and Data Analytics Principal / Specialist to join our Australia & New Zealand (ANZ) Commercial Excellence team in a role to provide the key connections to IT, Global Data teams and our commercial Operating Units.  A Day in the Life  Reporting into the Director, Business Development and Strategy, this is an exciting and newly created opportunity, providing the mechanisms to enable all ANZ commercial Operating Unit teams to implement data driven decision making and resource allocation.  This successful individual will be the liaison to the Asia Pacific, Business Intelligence and Data team and will enable key initiatives identified by the ANZ and APAC Commercial Excellence team. He/she will be a business partner providing a point of contact for all commercial Operating Units to initiate, design, co-create and deliver Business Intelligence initiatives that support growth & efficiencies and increase customer satisfaction.  Key responsibilities include: Providing business partnership between all commercial teams, functional teams and the BI and Data team Driving ANZ design input to create reliable, easy to use system, BI and/or analytical tools to sales reporting, market analytics and inventory health analysis Executing analysis through presenting to ANZ / APAC / Global stakeholders Standardizing and simplifying Sales Reporting delivering comprehensive value and a consistent high-quality user experience Developing and maintaining a central repository of data, insights, tools and expertise to enable Operating Units, i.e. OUs (independent of scope and scale of OU) to make data driven decisions (sample) Resource allocation Segmentation SFE Contract KPIs tracking / ROI analysis Market economics Contract and ROI analysis Training and coaching commercial stakeholders on how to leverage BI tools, reports and insights and how to leverage in meaningful review processes Finding / developing / building / maintaining local data sources to capture key market and customer trends (incl. consistent and timely market share metric). Maintaining reporting system, verifying the accuracy of the data, and acting as liaison with information technology in identifying and resolving problems Understanding complex business challenges, develop hypotheses, integrate internal and external data sources, analyze them using cutting edge machine learning and statistical modelling techniques to uncover causality and synthesizing insights. Assisting CRM enablement and commercial capabilities through developing measurement scheme and its execution for their SFE initiatives. Supporting IT system or technologies launch and replacement with BI requirements delivery. Providing administrative support to the sales function such as preparing sales and/or expense forecasts, budgets, and quotas; coordinating sales meetings; etc. Conducting statistical analysis on sales data and information to ensure optimal sales execution and attainment of growth objectives. Analyzing market competition, e.g. NPI / GTM Translating and visualizing local customer and market insights into actionable insights, e.g. segmentation, profiling and targeting Coaching tools, & reviewing processes to stakeholders in OUs – integrating into commercial capabilities training Closely working with PMO to ensure that all BI initiatives are appropriately entered into the PMO, prioritized and resourced.   Must Have Bachelor’s degree (or related) in Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistic, Engineering or Science and a minimum of 7 years relevant experience Preferably 3+ years of relevant work experience in BI and Advanced Analytics area. Data analysis skills with ability to understand complex models and business processes. Hands on experience Visualization Tools such as Tableau or Power BI.   Good to Have Salesforce.com Administrator/Advanced Administrator experience and knowledge of Medtronic systems (e.g. SAP) Experiences on Excel, R/Python, Alteryx, SharePoint, etc… Ability to work effectively in a matrix organization Experience in working in large complex BI projects and/or IT system launch project Data science, statistical analysis, ad-hoc advanced analytics, Machine/Deep Learning, AI Experience on data processing tools such as Excel (Pivot), R, Python, Alteryx Experience on SalesForceDotCom (SFDC), Snowflake, SQL basics Strong business acumen and can recognize problems, opportunities and provide value-added business solutions Able to work independently and manage multiple task assignments Communicate various stakeholders effectively with respect to achieve the goals. Fluent in English for business communication / presentation / reporting Experience on biomedical systems or working for medical / pharmaceutical companies Superior sales or marketing experience   Our Offer:  In our 5th Tenet of our Mission, we recognize the personal worth of employees by providing an employment framework that allows personal satisfaction in work accomplished, security, advancement opportunity, and means to share in the company's success.  We believe in rewarding our staff with a complete package of benefits designed to support them at every career and life stage. As a result, our employees have access to the following benefits, to name a few: Range of on-demand online health and wellness training resources, apps, videos, and communities We invest in professional training and development for employees at all levels. Our Employee Resource Groups (ERG)- foster awareness and inclusion in the workplace. Various insurance benefits include life and disability, salary continuances and salary sacrifice We have generous employee referral programs, corporate discount programs, leave benefits, and more!   About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We can accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations – but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.Show moreReport

BE THE DIFFERENCE  At AIA we don’t simply believe in being ‘the best’. We believe in better – because there’s no limit to how far ‘better’ can take us. Everything we do is driven by our purpose to make a difference by helping people embrace Healthier, Longer, Better Lives. And every one of our people has an important part role to play. If you want to make a difference by helping shape a healthier, better-protected Australia, read on. The Opportunity: We are currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Technical Delivery lead – BI and Analytics to join our Technology team. As the Technical Delivery lead – BI and Analytics you will be responsible for leading the data migration from legacy BI and analytics applications to a Power BI and Azure Databricks solutions. The primary responsibilities of this role will include stakeholder engagement, helping define requirements, driving design, development and implementation of a fit-for-purpose BI and analytics solutions, also taking ownership of BI and analytics platform to ensuring availability and stability. The Technical Delivery lead – BI and Analytics will also be responsible for leading and mentoring team members (both onshore and offshore) while promoting a high performing and collaborative environment. This role reports into the Head of Data Platforms and Analytics can be based in either Sydney or Melbourne. The successful candidate would be responsible for: Partnering closely with Business stakeholders and BI and analytics teams within business and provide input to define comprehensive BI and analytics solutions, that offer actionable insights to all levels of the organization, ensuring alignment of business intelligence efforts with business priorities Designing and lead development of BI and analytics solutions and underlying data reporting layer Taking full responsibility for delivery of fit-for-purpose BI and analytics solutions, by working closely with Project Managers – providing inputs on technical tasks required, estimations and overseeing release management processes to ensure successful project implementation Establishing templates, standards, and guidelines for report developers in both IT and business units Drive consistency in reporting practices and enable data democratisation through self-service BI for business users Taking responsibility for the maintenance and stability of the reporting and analytics environment. Lead the resolution of operational issues and ensure the platform's reliability Partner with fellow IT stakeholders like Technical Delivery Lead – Data, Data Engineering Lead and Architecture team for development of BI and analytics solution Leading and mentoring a team of Business Intelligence Analysts (on-shore and offshore) in development of best practice in business intelligence and analytics To be successful in this position, you will have: Extensive previous experience managing delivery and operation of BI and analytics platforms and services, preferably in insurance or financial industry Proven experience with translating business questions into appropriate business intelligence applications that yield actionable results Deep understanding of BI tools like Power BI and Tableau, Data visualization practices, and underlying data engineering and modelling to support reporting data layer preferably in Databricks or similar Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders Strong leadership skills, including the ability to mentor, coach, and develop a high-performing Business intelligence team Migration experience from Cognos and Tableau to Power BI will be highly regarded Why choose AIA: At AIA, we’ve made a promise to help people live healthier, longer, better lives. And it starts with our own people AIA Australia is part of the larger regional Asia AIA Group, which is the largest public listed life insurance company in the Asia-Pacific region Access our training and development to build on your current skills Career development through internal mobility opportunities Work for a business helping millions of Australians and make a difference to someone’s life everyday Access additional leave days a year to recharge and refresh yourself Enjoy wonderful Health and Wellbeing initiatives that support you Work with supportive and inclusive working environment Flexible working arrangement At AIA Australia, we’re proud to help guide, support and protect the wellbeing of over 3.5 million Australians. Through life and health insurance, financial wellbeing and our total wellbeing ecosystem that includes AIA Vitality – the world’s leading science-backed wellbeing programme – we’ve started a movement to make Australia the healthiest, best protected nation in the world. As part of the AIA Group - the largest independent publicly listed pan-Asian life insurance group with a presence in 18 markets in Asia-Pacific – it is our ambition to engage one billion people to live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives by 2030. Lots of companies like to say they’re different. What makes us truly different at AIA, is the difference we make in people’s lives. AIA is different. Are you? If you want to be part of an organisation that helps people live better every single day, apply via the link.Show moreReport

Join our Model Risk team in Sydney who have global responsibility for ensuring the appropriateness and integrity of Capital, Provisioning and Stress Testing models across Macquarie.  At Macquarie, we are working to create lasting value for our communities, our clients and our people. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 54 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drive outcomes.  What role will you play?  As a Senior Analyst/Manager, you will play an active role in reviewing models that are used for Capital calculations (including both Market Risk and Credit Risk), Economic Capital, Stress Testing and Credit Provisioning (IFRS9/AASB9). This includes performing validation for models that are designed to comply with new standards such as FRTB and updates to APS117 (IRRBB) and APS113 (Credit). In addition, the team has global reach, performing validations for Finance and Group Treasury models as well as models used to meet the local regulatory requirements of Macquarie’s entities around the world. You will also use theoretical analysis and mathematical research for benchmarking /best practices to meet business needs and documentation of reviews.  What you offer  Relevant qualification is a quantitative discipline Good understanding of financial markets and key risk factors for financial products Prior experience in a quantitative role with exposure to modelling and implementation Strong written and verbal communication skills with great attention to detail Interest in mathematics and coding and prior experience with Market Risk models will be advantageous.  We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.  Benefits  Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria and location, include:  Hybrid and flexible working arrangements Wellbeing and service bonus leave Up to 20 weeks paid parental leave as well as benefits to support you as you transition to life as a working parent Paid volunteer leave and donation matching Range of benefits to support your physical, psychological and financial wellbeing  About the Risk Management Group  In our Risk Management Group, you will be part of an independent, and centralised function, responsible for independent and objective review and challenge, oversight, monitoring and reporting in relation to Macquarie’s material risks. Our divisions include behavioural risk, compliance, credit, financial crime risk, internal audit, market risk, operational risk and governance, prudential risk, and Risk Management Group central.  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for a role regardless of their identity, including gender, race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status, marital or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disabilities, or socio-economic background.  If you require adjustments to your working arrangements or the recruitment process, please let us know when applying.   About Macquarie A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future. Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.  Job no: RMG-975187 Work type: Permanent - Full time Location: Sydney Category: Mid-level, Risk Management Group: Risk Management Group Division: Prudential Risk Recruiter: Owen Fox Opening Date: 12/11/2023Show moreReport

job_title: Security Governance, Risk and Compliance Analyst
job_description: Join an iconic Wesfarmers business, leaders in Industrial & Safety supplies A newly created role to work across multiple bands within our division Outstanding benefits, onsite parking and flexible work environment OUR STORY Wesfarmers Industrial and Safety (WIS) is a leading supplier of industrial, safety and workwear products and services to a wide range of customers, including Australia and New Zealand’s largest corporate and government entities. As a fast-growing division of Wesfarmers, our business has a proud history and includes iconic Australian businesses such as Blackwoods, Bullivants, Cm3, Coregas and WorkWear Group. YOUR OPPORTUNITY Wesfarmers Industrial Safety is looking to uplift the Security Governance, Risk Management, and Compliance capability across the division. As such, a newly created role to work across multiple business units has become available. The successful candidate will join a small, supportive and dedicated Cyber Security & Risk team on a permanent basis and will report to the Head of Cyber Security & Risk with a dotted line to the Cyber Security & Risk Program Manager for all GRC related projects. Your key responsibilities will be to: Run our Cyber security risk management function across WIS and Blackwoods Advocate WIS and Blackwoods security posture to business units Manage Cyber Awareness initiatives and reporting across WIS Manage the risks of third-party customers and suppliers Update and maintain policy documentation across the WIS Business Units Assurance of controls and development of controls as required To be successful, you will have: 5-7 years’ experience in security related fields and experience in Third Party Risk Management Minimum 2 years of experience in Cyber Security Risk, Governance and Compliance Practical experience in developing Cyber controls and assurance of controls Strong communication at all levels of organisation and self-motivation to own and drive this function Understanding of risk frameworks (NIST; ACSC; ISO27001; PCI; ASD Essential Eight; SOCI) CULTURE & BENEFITS A career with WIS will offer you rewarding experiences and opportunities for growth and development. We have a diverse, inclusive, and safe workplace where our team members care about each other and enjoy building meaningful connections. We know that diversity fosters greater innovation and better customer connection, so we strive to create and inclusive and diverse work environment. This means promoting the development of our people and fostering a sense of belonging irrespective of gender, ethnicity, generation, flexible work status, family circumstances, sexual orientation, or disability. To ensure our employees feel valued, supported, and celebrated, we provide a range of employee benefits including: Flexible and hybrid work arrangements Competitive salaries and incentive A range of diversity and well-being initiatives Team events, celebrations and development opportunities Team member discounts on Wesfarmers products Discounted offers from over 300 corporate partners Onsite parking and novated leasing options Generous Wesfarmers annual share plans Attractive parental leave policy and more NEXT STEPS If you meet most of the criteria listed above and would like to be considered for this opportunity, please send your application today. We strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people. We will be contacting suitable candidates as we receive them. As part of our recruitment process and commitment to safety, you may be required to undertake background checks (which may include a police check, a pre-employment medical assessment; and/or drug & alcohol testing) as part of your application process. WIS also promotes diversity and inclusion across our workplaces and encourages applications from all backgrounds, including people from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities, the LGBTI+ community and people with disabilities. About us:  Endeavour Group was created in 2020 through the restructure and merger of the Woolworths Group drinks and hospitality businesses. United behind a common purpose of ‘Creating a more sociable future together’, we are a 28,000+ strong team with more than 1600 stores and 330 hotels nationally, including leading brands such as Dan Murphy’s, BWS and ALH Hotels.  Endeavour Group is expected to separate from Woolworths during calendar year 2021 and will be well-positioned as an ASX Top 50 Company. Join the team at an exciting time in their evolution  Endeavour Group was created in 2020 through the restructure and merger of the Woolworths Group drinks and hospitality businesses. With a strong track record of growth, combined these businesses form the leading customer franchise in drinks and hospitality in Australia.  United behind a common purpose of ‘Creating a more sociable future together’, we are a 28,000+ strong team with more than 1600 stores and 350 hotels nationally, including leading brands such as Dan Murphy’s, BWS and ALH Hotels.  Endeavour Group has separated from Woolworths during the calendar year 2021 and is well-positioned as an ASX Top 50 Company. Join the team at an exciting time in their evolution! Endeavour Group demerged from Woolworths in 2021 and as part of the transition we are taking the opportunity to transform how we operate as an independent business and establish supporting technology. As the Business Analyst for Asset Protection, you will be responsible for establishing the business and technical systems requirements for a distinct group of aligned projects/workstreams, which will establish Endeavours Asset Protection capabilities including Alarm Monitoring, CCTVs and Incident Management systems and processes.  You will have the opportunity to work with business, IT and One Endeavour Transformation stakeholders and external vendors across multiple streams of work. What you'll need to suceed You’re someone who thrives in ensuring business outcomes are delivered. You enjoy the challenge of understanding business needs and ensuring systems and process solutions meet those needs. You’re curious, authentic and seek to understand different perspectives with a pragmatic and flexible approach; with a customer centric and innovative mindset.  You’ll also have: Facilitation skills with small groups of stakeholders Systems analysis skills Ability to build relationships, work with and manage small groups of stakeholders across business and IT Experience in working with external vendors Experience working in a matrix environment and with ambiguity Experience in supporting RFPs and selection process for desired technologies. Worked on Transformation programs An understanding of Asset Protection technologies  What's in it for you? Excellent remuneration package and flexible working in every sense. As our business grows so do the opportunities for our people Access to our Endeavour Group Employee Share Scheme! Wine education: Bronze, Silver & Gold certifications Work with an industry-leading team and be a part of one of the most exciting retail transformations in Australia , Facebook, Instagram or via www.wowcareers.com.au Grow with Endeavour Group  Bring your spark. Tap into our spirit. That’s the power of Endeavour.  If you want to experience the diverse spirit of drinks and hospitality businesses, here you can tap into Australia’s leading brands including Dan Murphy’s, BWS, ALH, Pinnacle Drinks, Endeavour X and more.  If you have a passion for connecting people with products they love, here you can join an industry that’s deeply embedded in the way Australians socialise, unwind and celebrate. JOB DESCRIPTION About Team Global Express/TGE (formerly TOLL):  Providing superior customer experiences and operational excellence, Team Global Express is Australia’s largest intermodal logistics provider.  An Australian owned business (established in 1888), we employ over 10,000 employees across over 150 locations. We build unique, innovative and tailored solutions across road, rail, air and sea; providing transport, logistics, and business solutions to customers throughout Australia and New Zealand.  It’s a really exciting time to be joining TGE, investment in our business is currently unprecedented as we continue to expand our portfolios.  What you’ll do as a Business Analyst:  As a Business Analyst , you’ll be responsible for supporting international operations, improving operational excellence and customer satisfaction. You will analyse and assess the effectiveness of end-to-business EDI integration operations, transport management systems (TMS), and partner/ customer systems. This includes analysing and identifying trends and opportunities within the air freight network, you’ll also help to improve operating strategic objectives for our international air freight business.  What are we looking for in a Business Analyst? What’s important?  3+ years experience working within a business analysis position Expertise in complex data mining requests, typically leveraging data from multiple disparate systems Understanding and experience with IT EDI business systems integration Bachelor’s degree in supply chain, business, finance, economics, or related field Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, multi-task, and manage multiple priorities  Extra points for the following (not essential though):  Knowledge and/or experience of air freight operations, including air transportation Knowledge of e-commerce operations industry  Why TGE?  • Recognised by LinkedIn as being one of the top 10 Australian companies to grow your career (2023)  Competitive salaries, 82% of our employees considered salaries competitive/high (Seek) Up to 14 weeks paid primary carers parental leave Superannuation for unpaid parental leave up to 12 months (additional 6 months for extended care) Uncompromising dedication to the safety of all our employees Staff discounts via the likes of Coles Express, G’Day Rewards, Officeworks & Hertz etc. Onsite/End of Trip Amenities (Parking/bike racks, showers, breakout rooms, change rooms, lockers etc.) Excellent career development/advancement opportunities Learning & Development, currently implementing our very own training academy Employee Recognition & Rewards Programs We offer our staff an employee assistance program, encouraging well-being & mental health Nominated ‘Best Carrier’ (NORA Solution Partner Awards) Official logistics provider for FIFA’s Women’s World Cup Supported by Allegro Funds (Australia’s largest transformation private equity firm) Our sector is very secure, much sought after, growing, and worth over $115 billion AUD every year Awarded ‘Leader within Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG)’, by the Australian Logistics Council Strong Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) business model  Seeing responsibilities and competencies laid out on paper can be sometimes confronting, imposter syndrome can creep in and mess with your confidence. Who are we? Humanforce provides the market-leading, employee-centred, intelligent, and compliant HCM suite for frontline and flexible workforces, offering highly configurable, best-in-one WFM, HR and Payroll - without compromise. Humanforce was founded in 2002 and has built strong foundations with our 2300-strong customer base and over 600,000 users across a wide range of industries, including aged care, childcare, hospitality, retail, local government and more. Today, we have offices across Australia, New Zealand, and the United Kingdom. Our vision is to make work easier and life better by focusing on the needs and fulfilment of frontline workers, and the efficiency and optimisation of businesses. Humanforce solutions are designed to help clients drive engagement and productivity for their frontline workforce, with an intelligent, cloud-based platform for employers and managers, and a user-friendly mobile app, specifically designed for employees in their flow of work. We are on a mission to deliver an exceptional employee experience for workforces by offering a compelling employee value proposition and great work effectiveness through connection, development and wellbeing while delivering intelligent manager automation to drive cost optimisation, increased productivity, and growth, and enhance compliance confidence for businesses as they adapt to evolving challenges and objectives.  The Team Humanforce is growing and is on the hunt for an exceptional Data Analytics Manager who will be responsible for leading the data analytics team which is made up of data scientists, data engineers and software engineers. The focus is on driving data architecture, product delivery, roadmap, scale, security and performance. You'll work cross-functionally with product managers and other key stakeholders across the business to align on the vision of our customer data products.  Who you are? The Data Analytics domain at Humanforce is a customer-facing product, that includes all analytics-type reporting that is used to extract actionable insights from data, inform data-driven decision-making, and drive the customer's business success. This is offered as a product to our customers across all HF platforms (Humanforce, IntelliHR, Ento and Thrive Wellbeing) This role will work with the product to help them define the data analytics roadmap and deliver the strategic roadmap for our data products. What you will do? Continue to build, develop and lead our team of software engineers, data engineers and data scientists. Ensure they have clear goals and expectations in place and provide coaching and mentorship to help team members grow and excel in their roles. Encourage a culture of continuous learning and development within the team. Work closely with R&D management to develop and implement a roadmap for achieving the data analytics strategy and objectives, including data architecture, processing, analysis, and reporting. Oversee the collection, cleaning, and analysis of data to identify trends, patterns, and insights by building tools for our customers to visualise this. Use statistical and machine learning techniques to extract actionable insights and recommendations. Create and communicate clear and compelling data visualisations and reports that convey insights to our customers. Utilise data visualisation tools and platforms to present information in a digestible format for non-technical team members. Implement and maintain data quality standards and procedures to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data used for analysis. Keep up to date with the latest developments in data analytics, machine learning, Gen AI and data science and understand where Humanforce has an opportunity to explore from a product perspective. Collaborate with cyber security, legal and compliance teams to ensure data-related practices are in line with relevant laws and regulations. Implement process improvements and best practices to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the data analytics function. Effectively communicate complex data insights and findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Requirements Relevant tertiary qualification in a Data, IT or business-related degree or experience and training in relevant previous roles 3+ years of experience in analysing/manipulating data and building statistical models in the position of analyst or data scientist. At least 3 years of experience, officially leading and developing a data team. Proficiency in SQL, experience using statistical languages (e.g., R, Python) to manipulate data and draw insights. Experience with data visualisation tools including embedded reporting/visualisations in SaaS software (e.g., Tableau) Experience building machine learning models. Experience working in data warehouse design, methodologies extraction, transformation and loading, data analysis, data migration, data preparation, graphical presentation, statistical analysis, reporting, validation and documentation. Exposure to OLAP, OLTP, data warehouse development, data lake and lake house architectures Worked extensively on ETL processes. Extensive experience in working with data visualisation tools and embedded reporting. Experience in troubleshooting, performance tuning and resolving issues. Used agile methodology and/or scrum processes. Some ‘nice to have’s:  Experience with Gen AI methodology Benefits Our values We are bold We are all in We are customer-obsessed We do what we say We are good humans Our approach to flexibility We are passionate about people making their own decisions about where and when they work. Our aim is to facilitate hybrid working (mix of in the office and from home) where possible to support our people to be effective, empowered, and productive to achieve both their career and personal goals. Because we recognise that working flexibly means different things to different people, flexible working exists in many forms. Benefits A flexible working environment The opportunity to be part of a fast-growing tech company A focus on development with access to LinkedIn Learning Paid parental leave and Quarterly Wellbeing Days Employee talent referral scheme (know great people, be rewarded) A fun and friendly culture working with passionate and talented people A work environment where you can genuinely improve the world of work!  We are a diverse and dispersed organisation and are actively looking to grow our team with individuals from all diverse backgrounds. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds, cultures, ages, genders, neurodiversity, religions, sexual orientations, and experiences to apply.   We are a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer and commit to respond to every applicant.Show moreReport

job_title: Product Portfolio Strategy Analyst - Product Operations
job_description: Job description Some career choices have more impact than others. At HSBC we exist with the purpose of Opening up a World of Opportunity. We use our unique expertise, capabilities, breadth and perspectives to provide opportunities for our customers and colleagues through global connectivity. We bring together the people, ideas and capital that nurture progress and growth, helping to create a better world – for our customers, our people, our investors, our communities and the planet we all share. As an HSBC employee in Australia, you’ll have access to tailored professional development opportunities, competitive pay, an embedded flexible working culture and a range of employee benefits. These include market-leading subsidised private health cover, enhanced parental pay and support when returning to work, subsidised banking products and services, bonus leave days and wellness programmes including discounted gym memberships. In this role, you will support the development of the strategy planning and decision-making process for Retail Product to ensure there is strong engagement and acts as an enabler for investment decisions across Wealth and Personal Banking (WPB), entity and across the region. This role supports the Head of Product Operations, WPB. Your main responsibilities will include: Provide high-quality analytical work for a wide range of projects, including strategic plans, ad hoc strategic reviews, major capital expenditure projects, competitor benchmarking; Support in the development of HSBC’s Wealth & Personal Banking strategy and business plans in Australia, in line with Group Strategy; Help define business problems, developing a clear hypothesis that challenges the way we think and supports process improvement and redesign of end to end processes as part of the firms strategic transformation programs Work closely with the Global Businesses and Functions to monitor the implementation of strategic initiatives, transformation initiatives and operational performance; Assist in the preparation of key documentation such as reporting to AUH and Region, governance forums including Executive Committee and Board. Support on large scale business transformation programs across HSBC Requirements To be successful in this role, you will need: University Degree with relevant experience in strategy or product strategy function in banking and financial services, preference for retail bank. Strong ability to use numerical data to develop tactical plans within the broad context of strategic plans and change them as guided by results. Good knowledge of the external environment (risk, regulatory, political, competitors etc.) and project management experience is desirable. Good communication skills and proven stakeholder-facing experience, ideally with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Good problem-solving, and analytical, skills. Highly structured with strong attention to details. Preference will be given to candidates who hold Australian PR/Citizenship or New Zealand Citizenship, or who can demonstrate current unrestricted work rights in Australia without limitations. We value different perspectives, we succeed together, collaborating across boundaries, we take responsibility, holding ourselves accountable to get things done. Through these values, HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are appreciated and respected and where opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow in an inclusive environment. Applications from First Nations peoples are encouraged. Learn more about careers at HSBC Australia – https://www.hsbc.com/careers/where-we-hire/australia Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website. Issued by HSBC Bank Australia Limited. Please note that HSBC will we never communicate to applicants via non HSBC channels such as SMS, WhatsApp or Facebook so please be careful if anyone attempts to contact you via these channels.#LI-HSBCJHEShow moreReport

We value every employee’s unique perspective, and we work hard to make sure everyone is appreciated for who they are. Why Tritusa: Tritusa (try-tu-sha) is a consulting company that specializes in SAP, Software Testing, Digital consulting, and services. We were founded in 2011, and we’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote culture, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal, and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive. We’re a company that values diversity and inclusion, and we want to make sure everyone feels included. We believe that this is one of the biggest factors in creating an environment where people can thrive, innovate and be their best selves. If you’re looking for a great place to work and grow, you might be the perfect fit for our team. job_title: Senior Analyst | Net Zero and Climate Risk
job_description: Join our Net Zero and Climate Risk Program team and help with meeting Macquarie’s strategy, data, reporting, and analytical needs relating to our net zero commitments.  At Macquarie, we are working to create lasting value for our communities, our clients and our people. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 54 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drive outcomes.  What role will you play?  As a Senior Analyst, you will work closely with all operating and support groups in implementing Macquarie’s net zero strategy focusing on carbon emissions associated with on-balance sheet financing activities. You will research and document evolving industry guidance and peer reporting, assist with facilitating regular working groups with business and central stakeholders to track progress and proactively manage and coordinate delivery of data and documentation, collaborating with the broader central team to aggregate and analyse this data.  As part of this role, you will also document Macquarie’s internal methodology for financed emissions, provide input in drafting Macquarie’s Net Zero and Climate Risk report and track and report to the program management team on progress of key deliverables.  What you offer  Prior experience in a climate change related field in a corporate, government or consulting context; or a strong interest in climate with prior experience in Finance, Economics, Accounting or Audit Familiarity with emissions reporting frameworks such as NGER, PCAF and TCFD Exceptional written and verbal communication skills and strong attention to detail Great numerical and data analysis skills and strong attention to detail Working knowledge of banking products and services Excellent and proactive stakeholder engagement skills, with prior experience having worked on complex initiatives.  We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.  Benefits  Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria and location, include:  Hybrid and flexible working arrangements Wellbeing and service bonus leave Up to 20 weeks paid parental leave as well as benefits to support you as you transition to life as a working parent Paid volunteer leave and donation matching Range of benefits to support your physical, psychological and financial wellbeing  About the Risk Management Group  In our Risk Management Group, you will be part of an independent, and centralised function, responsible for independent and objective review and challenge, oversight, monitoring and reporting in relation to Macquarie’s material risks. Our divisions include behavioural risk, compliance, credit, financial crime risk, internal audit, market risk, operational risk and governance, prudential risk, and Risk Management Group central.  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for a role regardless of their identity, including gender, race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status, marital or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disabilities, or socio-economic background.  If you require adjustments to your working arrangements or the recruitment process, please let us know when applying.   About Macquarie A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future. Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment. 27th October, 2023 Who are we?  Standards Australia is the peak standards development organisation in Australia and we’ve recently turned 100 years old! We are going through a massive transformational growth stage. In the last two years we’ve doubled in size and now have over 300 employees contributing to Australia’s future and our mission of empowering communities.  We bring together experts to develop national and international standards, which provide guidelines for products and services that promote the net benefit to the Australian community. We also publish these standards, so they are accessible to all businesses and individuals.  It’s our vision to be a global leader in trusted solutions that improve life – today and tomorrow. Join our team and be a part of this exciting time in Standards Australia’s journey!  About the role  You will work with Project Managers, business unit leaders and cross-functional team members to ensure that business and functional requirements for technology projects are agreed, documented, and delivered through all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle.  You will join a dynamic IT Program Delivery team, delivering digital transformational projects in support of our corporate vision, all with the benefit of strong executive and business support. Our highly collaborative IT team works across multiple technologies including Salesforce, MarkLogic, Azure, and bespoke applications. And we are progressing on our agile delivery journey, with a focus on continuous improvement and shared learning.  What you'll do Work closely with the project managers and IT team to facilitate discussions with a diverse range of Standards Australia business units, to understand business needs, gather information and analyse requirements Research and recommend best practices for business processes and application of technology Develop Business Requirements within agreed policies and standards and obtain sign off from the appropriate stakeholders Develop the Functional Requirements Specification that provides a detailed description of the business requirements Perform gap analysis by comparing the product offering to the agreed requirements Plan and facilitate business process workshops Develop business process maps within agreed policies and standards Identify issues and risks, ensuring they are appropriately captured, raised and actioned Active participation in testing and implementation activities to ensure a quality product is delivered Co-ordinate and effectively communicate with business stakeholders, clients and senior management, and vendors / technology partners as required About you Tertiary qualified, related to the area of Business Analysis, or relevant applied industry experience Technical understanding of API specifications and XML data formats Aptitude for understanding business objectives and processes and translating them into business and functional design specifications and user stories that can be delivered by the IT development team Experience in creating business requirements documents, functional design specifications, user stories and test plans Experience working in an Agile and DevOps environment Culture & Benefits  We at Standards Australia are proud to have been awarded the prestigious Employer of Choice Award 2023! This recognition highlights our commitment to creating an exceptional workplace and fostering a culture of excellence. Our iCARE values form the basis of all we do - Integrity, Courage, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence.  Our success is measured not only by outcomes, but on the path we took to get there. Standards Australia offers many benefits such as flexibility with working from home, regular team events, additional personal/carer’s leave, regular awards, and on-going training. Our award-winning People Perks program includes the following great benefits: Nine-day fortnight – enjoy every second Friday off! Parental and secondary carer leave benefits – supporting you and your family during the most important times in your life Workiversary rewards – your commitment and loyalty won’t go unrecognised! International working arrangement – do you have working rights in another country? Enjoy a few weeks of international working every year Early access to long service leave – why wait 10 years for long service leave? 5 years sounds a lot better! What's next?  If Standards Australia sounds like the place for you, please submit your CV outlining your experience and suitability to this role. Eligible applicants must be Australian Citizens, Permanent Residents or have legal rights to work in Australia. Shortlisted applicants will be contacted within 15 business days of their application.Show moreReport

job_description: Be at the heart of our business as we innovate and invest for a better future.  In Group Treasury, you will work in the financial centre of Macquarie, driving real change for our businesses. You will be part of a rapidly evolving function that is curious and not afraid to ask, ‘how can we do better?’ A team that is bold, always challenging the status quo, seeing solutions where others see obstacles. Join a team that is generous with its skills, knowledge, and expertise, so that we can achieve great things together.  We are passionate about diversity and inclusion and empower our staff to aim for excellence in everything we do. We believe that flexibility is a key driver to our people’s success and welcome the opportunity to discuss what flexibility means to you which can include part time.  Group Treasury Transformation  This is an opportunity to make an impact on a long-term, business-critical project, crucial to maintaining Macquarie’s strong, conservative balance sheet. Supported by new data architecture and technology, the program is tasked with transforming the end-to-end capital and liquidity process from the operating model and system-landscape to the relevant calculation and reporting frameworks.  Help transform our Group Treasury function and evolve the future of finance at Macquarie.  What impact will you have?  Facilitates and participates in workshops with Group Treasury SMEs to understand, assess business processes and reporting requirements and document business requirements. Documents scope as Epics, User Stories & Tasks with relevant Acceptance Criteria. Conducts gap analysis of project current state vs future state. Engage stakeholders to identify and agree bilateral expectations. Ability to understand business processes and scenarios, their impacts, and effects on data Ability to work closely with business and technical stakeholders at all levels Business analysis experience; specifically in the financial or regulatory reporting space Strong product knowledge; derivative and commodity knowledge preferable but not essential Strong problem solving and analytical skills, with good attention to detail Excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to work well in a team Able to coordinate multiple assignments and work independently Able to meet project milestones & deadlines 'Can do’ proactive attitude, with a proven record of delivering project outcomes   About Macquarie A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future. Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment. company: NSW Government -Hunter New England Local Health District4.1 ★
job_description: Employment Type: Temporary Full Time until November 2024 Position Classification: Analyst Remuneration: $90,582 - $105,637 per annum + 11% super + salary packaging Hours Per Week: 38 Requisition ID: REQ440608 Applications Close: Sunday 26th November 2023   Analyst - FluTracking Wallsend Campus / Awabakal Country   In the event there are no suitable Aboriginal applicants then applications from non-Aboriginal applicants will be considered.  About us: Based in the Health Protection Team in Hunter New England Population Health, you will work along-side world-class health professionals who are leaders in their chosen fields. Population Health monitors health threats and diseases, responds to environmental and communicable disease threats, and promotes policies, environments, and behaviours that improve health.  Population Health is located on the historic Wallsend Campus where you can enjoy free parking, daily coffee truck, outdoor seating and is closely located to the Hunter Expressway.  Hunter New England Local Health District (HNELHD) is a great place to expand your career and grow your skills and knowledge. As a recognised leader in the healthcare industry, we provide a range of public health services to the Hunter, New England and Lower Mid North Coast. Being the largest employer in the region we can offer salary packaging options, educational opportunities and support from a broad network of health professionals. With CORE Values of Collaboration, Openness, Respect and Empowerment your professional life is provided every opportunity to succeed and develop in your chosen profession.   About the role:  The position will provide expert surveillance, data analysis and information management in FluTracking. Your role will be to analyse the onset, burden and transmission patterns of COVID-19 and influenza across Australia. FluTracking is one of the largest online COVID-19 and Influenza-like illness surveillance system in the world! FluTracking.net tracks over 100,000 people each week in Australia, New Zealand, Hong Kong and Argentina and generates over 3 million records per year creating the opportunity for a 'big data' approach to these analyses. FluTracking will be expanding to Fiji in 2023-24. You will be supported by a manager, public health physician, and other analytical staff within the team. There will be on-the-job training and opportunities for professional development through work with Australian and international influenza and participatory surveillance experts. Population Health provides a culturally safe and supportive workplace. You will receive both face to face and mandatory online training.  Benefits: Superannuation contributions 11%. Role Snapshot: Highly visible and commercial Lead / Head of BI & Data role for rapidly growing global FMCG market leader in Western Sydney. Hybrid working options available and supported (typically 2 days in the office per week);  Inclusive, diverse and friendly culture in a progressive sector enabled by technology;  Lead BI and data modernisation for this company, reporting to a Head of Technology who will develop and mentor you;  2 direct reports;  Mix of strategic and hands on technical transformation work (i.e., BI platform move from on-premise to cloud, build of new data warehouse in Azure, new business data models and operational reporting);  Heavy business engagement and stakeholder facing role driving analytical reporting and insights that support executive decision making. You'll sit at the table with key business stakeholders and help them unpick their problems through data;  Over time, drive the company's journey to AI / machine learning and other emerging technologies; and  Salary: c. $180,000 + superannuation.  Your New Employer: u&u. Recruitment Partners has been retained by an instantly recognisable global market leader based near Blacktown to recruit a Head of BI on a permanent basis. The company has an innovative and entrepreneurial culture, underpinned by values-driven leaders who care a lot about empathy, humility and wellbeing. This company boasts over 2,000 employees across Australia and New Zealand and has a turnover of c. $900M. They are a proud employer of a diverse range of people. They are committed to reflecting our diverse community and creating an inclusive and respectful workplace for all employees, where difference is embraced, contributions are valued, and everyone has a sense of connection and belonging. Furthermore, they are extremely generous on staff development and invest heavily in career planning and training programs. They also care a lot about employee wellness, so work from home options or flexible hours are highly supported for this role.  Your New Role: You'll be responsible for leading and overseeing all aspects of the organization's business intelligence functions. Partnering closely across various group companies, you'll own the continued development and evolution of business intelligence, reporting, analytics and the supporting technologies and platforms to support the organisation's needs. This includes data analysis, reporting, data warehousing, and ensuring data-driven decision-making processes are in place. The role will encompass the development, execution and support of the technology platforms and analytical reporting to deliver a comprehensive and functional suite of BI and reporting. You'll continue to advance and transition the organisation to modern cloud-based solutions consistent with the broader IT strategy.  You'll be accountable for: Collaborating on, establishing and executing a comprehensive BI, data & reporting strategy, in partnership with key business stakeholders;  Developing data analysis, interpretation, and the creation of meaningful reports and dashboards;  Collaborating with various businesses and departments to understand data and reporting requirements;  Identifying, recommending, and implementing BI & reporting tools, technologies, and data management solutions, including transitioning from on-premise to cloud-based solutions;  Ensuring data security and compliance with relevant regulations and controls;  Driving continuous improvement in BI & reporting processes, methodologies, and data quality;  Overseeing the delivery of user training and enablement to ensure effective and appropriate use of the BI and reporting systems;  Leading and managing the BI & data team, developing their skillsets, fostering innovation and continuous improvement;  Gathering requirements, acceptance criteria and scoping new projects, building and articulating business cases and presenting these for review and approval;  Engaging with new and existing vendors to find suitable solutions and / or resourcing, managing the vendor relationships, their resources and delivery accordingly; and  Leading and managing projects to deliver approved solutions, seeing these through to business integration and handover where relevant.  About You: Strong business acumen, stakeholder management and communication skills. These are the most important attributes of this role;  Proven experience and business exposure in a similar role across Data Leadership, or a Senior Data Engineer / Data Architect role where you feel you're ready for that next step in your career;  Experience leading or mentoring small teams;  Strong experience creating dashboards and using ETL capabilities to shape data;  Experience in the Azure data stack (e.g. Synapse) and Azure data warehousing;  Experience with Qliksense advantageous however not essential;  Experience working in an agile environment; and  Friendly, dynamic personality with a growth mindset for continuous learning and improvement. A key personality trait of helping others and your organisation through data enabled decision making.  How to Apply  For more information, please call Steven Fulop at u&u Greater Western Sydney on 0418 994 446 quoting reference number 33999. Alternatively, to submit an application, please click below. We look forward to receiving your application and assisting you with your job search.  Please submit your resume in Word format only.  Steven Fulop.  DIRECTOR, GWS  Get in touch steven.fulop@uandu.com Call me on 02 8825 6602 Visit me at the Greater Western Sydney offices Connect with me on LinkedInShow moreReport

Employment Type Permanent Closing Date 16 Nov 2023 11:59pm Job Title Security Analysis - Analyst Job Summary As a Security Analysis - Analyst, you play a critical role in ensuring that Telstra provides an industry leading secure ecosystem for employees and customers. You draw on your expertise and experience in cyber security and technology and use leading-edge practices to identify, anticipate, respond to and resolve security threats. Working in a specialised team you use your subject matter expertise to be a collaborative partner and trusted advisor to our employees, partners and customers. The work you do underpins Telstra’s competitive advantage and ability to provide a superior customer experience. Job Description As a Security Analysis - Analyst, you play a critical role in ensuring that Telstra provides an industry leading secure ecosystem for employees and customers. You draw on your expertise and experience in cyber security and technology and use leading-edge practices to identify, anticipate, respond to and resolve security threats. Working in a specialised team you use your subject matter expertise to be a collaborative partner and trusted advisor to our employees, partners and customers. The work you do underpins Telstra’s competitive advantage and ability to provide a superior customer experience. The role supports Telstra’s compliance with telecommunications security legislative obligations. The role will provide triage, risk assessment and business engagement focused on identifying proposed changes to Telstra’s core networks and facilities and briefing relevant government agencies on these changes where appropriate. Key Responsibilities Include: Analyse and triage business-wide proposed changes to Telstra’s core networks and facilities that may fall within TSSR scope. Undertake national security impact risk assessments of proposed changes in line with Telstra’s framework and government guidance. Work with Telstra project managers and subject matter technical experts across the business to assess materiality. Prepare formal TSSR Notifications for submission to the Department of Home Affairs Critical Infrastructure Centre, ensuring accuracy and quality of information provided. Support ongoing relationship with Critical Infrastructure Centre and other relevant Government agencies to maintain effective information exchange. Identify and action opportunities within the team to refine and automate processes and increase effectiveness of business engagement. Provide briefing and awareness sessions to key business units across Telstra. HSE Responsibility: Take reasonable care for your own safety and the safety of others, comply with and implement any reasonable Telstra HSE instruction, policy, standard, minimum requirement or procedure, and support Telstra to meet its duties under the relevant safety and environmental legislation. Additional information: Ability and willingness to obtain a minimum baseline Australian government security clearance is essential for this role. Key Skills and Experience: Gathers real time data on security threats and maintains data integrity Identifies the appropriate data analysis approach for the security scenario Proactively explores and experiments with data, applying critical thinking and curiosity to further investigate a security event/risk Identifies and interprets key trends in security data Presents and articulates security messages clearly Gathers information on security best practice and legal requirements Contributes to risk assessments by identifying business assets, vulnerabilities to those assets and security impacts from new technologies Builds awareness of security concerns for new technologies Translates complex security concepts into non technical language Drafts, communicates and updates security policies, standards and procedures Ability to communicate with wide range of stakeholders from technical expert to senior manager level Presentation, briefing and report writing experience. Ability to balance competing priorities and deadlines. Ability to develop understanding of cyber security control frameworks e.g. Essential 8, NIST framework, ISO27001 If you are looking to take the next step in your career, we want to hear from you!  -  We encourage applications from people of all abilities and backgrounds - including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, the LGBQTI+ community, linguistically diverse, and people living with disability. When you apply, you can choose to note the pronouns you use and /or any reasonable adjustments needed to take part equitably during the interview process.  www.telstra.com.au/careers/diversity-and-inclusion or email us at noting your preferred method of contact.Show moreReport

At SBS, we embrace difference, and we welcome applications from people of all backgrounds. We also acknowledge the unique contribution that Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples make to our society and our workplace through their enduring and continued connection to land, sea, sky and community. About Us SBS is one of the world's most unique and innovative media organisations, producing trusted, meaningful and engaging content that exists for all Australians to inspire, support and celebrate the diversity of our multicultural society. Our purpose, for the last 40 years, has reflected and explored the evolving diversity of Australia, investing in initiatives to deepen its connections with communities, sharing their stories and giving a voice to those often unheard, with the aim of increasing understanding and respect of the differences that make up Australia. SBS is a truly distinctive network, showcasing multicultural, multilingual and First Nations stories otherwise untold in the Australian media. The Department Work with Tv & Online Content business units to elicit requirements and capture business needs. The Role Reporting into our Content Operations Lead, within our TVOC team, this role will see you Work with Tv & Online Content business units to elicit requirements and capture business needs. These requirements will be gathered through interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis and task / workflow Design and manage the process to document the current state, business requirements, future state, business problems, pain points and gaps. Facilitate process mapping sessions for complex, multi-functional business operations using Miro or similar. Support change management and communication activities associated with transformation outcomes. Support user acceptance testing activities including the development and review of test scripts as required. Support end user training activities including the development and review of training material as required. It is a requirement of this role that incumbent has had two vaccinations with an approved Covid-19 vaccination in line with the ATAGI guidelines. Careers that Change Lives  Play an integral role as Commercial Analyst and support in executing Medtronic’s Strategic Accounts strategy. Bring your talent for providing Commercial Insights, business partnering and problem-solving to an innovative medical technology company and healthcare solutions leader. Our size, scope and market leadership gives you the chance to explore career opportunities – and grow as we grow!  A Day in the Life  This position supports Medtronic’s commercial programs executed by the Corporate Account Manager and Strategic Account Managers (‘The SAM Team’), by leading best practice analytics, the development of best-in-class operating procedures, assisting the SAM team by developing models to analyse commercial offers for our most critical and strategic customers, leading the development of tools to monitor contract KPIs for key Strategic and Corporate agreements, improving the market share reporting for SAM and sales stakeholders, and assisting with the analysis of data to provide insight into the financial performance of Corporate and Strategic Accounts. In this role you will report into the Senior Commercial Manager and will be based in our Macquarie Park office in Sydney. This is a full time permanent position.  Key Responsibilities: Supporting the Senior Commercial Manager of Strategic Accounts to execute the Strategic Accounts commercial strategy by: Leading the development of compelling financial modelling and pricing templates to drive ease of financial analysis and provide greater insight into the deal metrics, profitability and viability. Supporting the Senior Commercial Manager, Strategic Accounts ANZ in the management of the Shared Services Rebates Team (currently based in Shanghai) by checking and reporting on rebate discrepancies to reduce risk to the ANZ business of under-accrual, or overpayment of rebate. Leading the development of market share reporting & the analysis of the data to ensure it is being used to understand the market, identify incremental revenue opportunities and drive contract performance. Using MS excel, Power BI, SAP and GSR platforms to: Support and continuously improve the reporting and dashboards to allow Strategic Account Managers and Corporate Accounts Managers to access timely and accurate results to measure deal effectiveness. These dashboards also support sales leaders across the organization in monitoring deals and contracts. Continue to support best practice rebate accrual and reporting processes by providing coaching and development to the offshore Rebates team based in Shanghai and running workshops to develop and upskill the local team. Set up monthly, quarterly and annual contract performance reporting, including forecasts of business potential for major Strategic Customer contracts. Building the strategy deck for business reviews internal and external customers in collaboration with the Strategic Accounts team including the Senior Strategic Accounts Director. The decks contain financial performance (showing graphs, trends), insights, challenges and opportunities to drive business growth. Leading workstreams across various departments including Finance, Customer Service and Sales Teams to respond to urgent requests and investigate matters which have an impact on Corporate and Strategic Account contracts and sales performance. Implementing continual process improvement and task standardisation to your day-to-day work & supporting ad hoc reporting requests in a responsive manner. Reduce the complexity for the Strategic Account and Corporate Account Managers by providing excel templates, dashboards and reporting to enable fast decision making. Develop and improve ANZ business performance reporting and analytics, including: Team Scorecards Contract Analysis & KPIs Rebate Performance Trackers Quarterly Business Review decks Participation in strategy and planning meetings with the Operating Units and Strategic Account Team   Must Have Complete Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Accounting or Marketing Advance Proficiency in Excel, Tableau and PowerBI   Your Profile Significant experience as a commercial analyst Strategic mindset with demonstrated experience in devising and implementing process improvement projects Advance proficiency in MS Excel and intermediate level in PowerPoint   Our Offer:  In our 5th Tenet of our Mission, we recognize the personal worth of employees by providing an employment framework that allows personal satisfaction in work accomplished, security, advancement opportunity, and means to share in the company's success.  We believe in rewarding our staff with a complete package of benefits designed to support them at every career and life stage. As a result, our employees have access to the following benefits, to name a few: Health and Wellness allowance to contribute to your general wellbeing. Range of on-demand online health and wellness training resources, apps, videos, and communities We invest in professional training and development for employees at all levels. Our Employee Resource Groups (ERG)- foster awareness and inclusion in the workplace. Various insurance benefits include life and disability, salary continuances, salary sacrifice and Superannuation. We have generous employee referral programs, corporate discount programs, leave benefits, and more!   About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology can do to help alleviate pain, restore health, and extend Life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. You will be part of a market-leading team that is responsible for delivering natural peril pricing and insights across the IAG Group.  Key Responsibilities: Accountability 1 – to assist with technical development of natural peril (especially meteorological perils) risk models for reinsurance, capital, pricing and claims purposes that address critical gaps in understanding. Please submit a cover letter with your application. We chat over coffee with customers, advocate for them in the corridors of Parliament and back them up in the community when life’s moments hit hardest. You’ll know our brands – CGU, WFI, NRMA Insurance, AMI, NZI, and State Insurance to name a few. Together they turn our IAG purpose of making your world safer into action by helping, supporting ambitions and making insurance accessible. When you join IAG, you’re not joining one brand. You’re joining a large purpose-led, Trans-Tasman group dedicated to making your world a safer place.  We’re ready to grow your career, acknowledge every part of you, recognise your brilliance, lead you with purpose and help you live your own purpose through us.  At IAG you’ll experience the following: Flexibility and support so you can live life to the full. Hybrid working. Work in a team who care about people and community. 12month contract, starting ASAP Global B2B Fintech  As the Marketing Analyst based in Sydney, you will lead the collection, analysis, and interpretation of omni-channel media data which will serve to track the success of cross-functional digital advertising campaigns and initiatives. This role will work closely with the Performance Marketing, Mar-Tech Automation, and DevOps teams to develop a holistic reporting infrastructure, conduct deep-dive analysis on key campaign metrics, and provide recommendations to optimise future digital advertising performance to exceed business KPIs. Identify areas for improved effectiveness and efficiency, while providing prescriptive recommendations that deliver long-term business objectives. Leverage advanced measurement to analyse MER, nCAC, and MROI, with the ability to simplify and explain the impact marketing has on these key business metrics. Map customer journey touchpoints into a holistic report view to better understand the path to conversion, while leveraging advanced attribution models to show the value each channel plays in the marketing mix. Experience with server-side integration is a plus. Previous client experience in the financial services/accounting/B2B vertical is a plus. Bachelor’s degree or above (ideal areas of study: Business Analytics and Management, Data Science, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, and/or Marketing) Deep understanding of data analytics and attribution models across multiple marketing channels and the role they play in driving business outcomes for cross-functional teams. Expertise in omnichannel campaign tracking with a deep understanding of how online platform metrics influence offline business KPIs Proven experience in website analytics, preferably in e-commerce or digital marketing environments, with expertise in driving customer acquisition and revenue growth. Experience in multiple media platforms, ad-serving, and web analytics tools (GA4, BigQuery, GMP, Google CM360, Google Ads, SA 360, Adobe Analytics, marketing/media tagging tools, etc.). Knowledge of BI/Data visualisation tools (Looker, Tableau, etc). Working knowledge of SQL and Python is a plus. Understanding of Media Mix Modelling (MMM) and how it’s used to optimise strategic planning of marketing investment down to the media channel level. Innovative thinker who solves problems brings ideas and strategies to life, and drives business solutions. Has a passion for getting results through data-driven decisions. Ability to use data to tell stories through reporting and explain the ‘what’ and the ‘why’ to key stakeholders and leadership. Strong interpersonal skills, stakeholder management, and collaborative mindset, possessing the ability to work and communicate with all levels of the organisation. Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and as a team member Marketing Analyst – Apply now!  This is an initial 12-month contract, with a genuine view to extend.
